original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: agre bṛhann uṣasām ūrdhvo asthān nirjaganvān tamaso jyotiṣāgāt /🔽agnir bhānunā ruśatā svaṅga ā jāto viśvā sadmāny aprāḥ //
analyzed: agre bṛhan uṣasām ūrdhvaḥ asthāt nirjaganvān tamasaḥ jyotiṣā āgāt  agniḥ bhānunā ruśatā su aṅgaḥ ā jātaḥ viśvā sadmāni aprāḥ
translated: He, the great one, has risen above the dawns, having come forth from the darkness, he has come to the light.🔽Agni, with his ruddy splendor, his own, having been born, has filled all the abodes.

original: sa jāto garbho asi rodasyor agne cārur vibhṛta oṣadhīṣu /
analyzed: sa jātaḥ garbhaḥ asi rodasyoḥ agne cāruḥ vibhṛtaḥ oṣadhīṣu
translated: You, born, are the child of the two worlds, O Agni, the beautiful one, placed in the plants.

original: citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsy aktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhi kanikradad gāḥ //
analyzed: citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsi aktūn pra mātṛbhyaḥ adhi kanikradat gāḥ
translated: The wondrous child, having shaken off the dark coverings, has bellowed over the cows, his mothers.

original: viṣṇur itthā paramam asya vidvāñ jāto bṛhann abhi pāti tṛtīyam /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ itthā paramam asya vidvān jātaḥ bṛhan abhi pāti tṛtīyam
translated: Viṣṇu, knowing this highest (truth), having been born, the great one, protects the third (part of the night).

original: āsā yad asya payo akrata svaṃ sacetaso abhy arcanty atra //
analyzed: āsā yat asya payaḥ akrata svam sacetasaḥ abhī arcanti atra
translated: When his milk has been produced here, his own, the thoughtful ones praise him here.

original: ata u tvā pitubhṛto janitrīr annāvṛdham prati caranty annaiḥ /
analyzed: atas u tvā pitu bhṛtaḥ janitrīḥ annāvṛdham prati caranti annaiḥ
translated: From there the mothers, who support the father, come to you again with food, to increase your food.

original: tā īm praty eṣi punar anyarūpā asi tvaṃ vikṣu mānuṣīṣu hotā //
analyzed: tāḥ īm prati eṣi punar anya rūpā asi tvam vikṣu mānuṣīṣu hotā
translated: To them you return again, of a different form. You are the Hotar in the human families.

original: hotāraṃ citraratham adhvarasya yajñasyayajñasya ketuṃ ruśantam /🔽pratyardhiṃ devasyadevasya mahnā śriyā tv agnim atithiṃ janānām //
analyzed: hotāram citra ratham adhvarasya yajñasya yajñasya ketum ruśantam  pratyardhim devasya devasya mahnā śriyā tu agnim atithim janānām
translated: The Hotar, with the variegated chariot of the sacrifice, the banner of the sacrifice, the shining one,🔽The responder by the greatness of each god, by the glory of each god, Agni, the guest of men.

original: sa tu vastrāṇy adha peśanāni vasāno agnir nābhā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: sa tu vastrāṇi adha peśanāni vasānaḥ agniḥ nābhā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He, Agni, wearing the garments with the fringes, clothed, is in the middle of the earth.

original: aruṣo jātaḥ pada iḷāyāḥ purohito rājan yakṣīha devān //
analyzed: aruṣaḥ jātaḥ pade iḷāyāḥ purohitaḥ rājan yakṣi iha devān
translated: The red one, born in the place of Iḷā, the priest, O king, here worship the gods.

original: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī agna ubhe sadā putro na mātarā tatantha /
analyzed: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī agne ubhe sadā putraḥ na mātarā tatantha
translated: O Agni, you have always extended to the two, heaven and earth, O son, like to two mothers.

original: pra yāhy acchośato yaviṣṭhāthā vaha sahasyeha devān //
analyzed: pra yāhi acchā uśataḥ yaviṣṭha athā vaha sahasya iha devān
translated: Go, O youngest one, to the hundred sacrifices, and then bring the gods here, O you who have power.

original: piprīhi devāṃ uśato yaviṣṭha vidvāṃ ṛtūṃr ṛtupate yajeha /
analyzed: piprīhi devān uśataḥ yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūṃr ṛtu pate yaja iha
translated: Delight the eager gods, O youngest one, knowing the seasons, O lord of the seasons, worship here.

original: ye daivyā ṛtvijas tebhir agne tvaṃ hotṝṇām asy āyajiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: ye daivyāḥ ṛtvijaḥ tebhiḥ agne tvam hotṝṇām asi āyajiṣṭhaḥ
translated: You who are the divine priests, by them, O Agni, you are the best sacrificer of these priests.

original: veṣi hotram uta potraṃ janānām mandhātāsi draviṇodā ṛtāvā /
analyzed: veṣi hotram uta potram janānām mandhātā asi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: You attain the office of the Hotar and Potri of the people. You are the truthful giver of wealth, the thinker.

original: svāhā vayaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devo devān yajatv agnir arhan //
analyzed: svāhā vayam kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devaḥ devān yajatu agniḥ arhan
translated: We will offer oblations, O Agni, may the god, the worthy one, worship the gods.

original: ā devānām api panthām aganma yac chaknavāma tad anu pravoḷhum /
analyzed: ā devānām api panthām aganma yat śaknavāma tat anu pravoḷhum
translated: We have gone along the path of the gods, we will carry out what we are able to do.

original: agnir vidvān sa yajāt sed u hotā so adhvarān sa ṛtūn kalpayāti //
analyzed: agniḥ vidvān sa yajāt sa id u hotā saḥ adhvarān saḥ ṛtūn kalpayāti
translated: Let the wise Agni, the priest, sacrifice, he arranges the sacrifices and the seasons.

original: yad vo vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣāṃ devā aviduṣṭarāsaḥ /
analyzed: yat vaḥ vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣām devāḥ a viduṣṭarāsaḥ
translated: If we, O wise gods, have transgressed your ordinances, we who are less wise than you,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvam ā pṛṇāti vidvān yebhir devāṃ ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti //
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśvam ā pṛṇāti vidvān yebhiḥ devān ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti
translated: Agni, the wise one, makes up all that, by which he arranges the gods with the seasons.

original: yat pākatrā manasā dīnadakṣā na yajñasya manvate martyāsaḥ /
analyzed: yat pākatrā manasā dīna dakṣāḥ na yajñasya manvate martyāsaḥ
translated: When the mortal men, with a mind that is slow and weak, do not think of the sacrifice with their mind,

original: agniṣ ṭad dhotā kratuvid vijānan yajiṣṭho devāṃ ṛtuśo yajāti //🔽viśveṣāṃ hy adhvarāṇām anīkaṃ citraṃ ketuṃ janitā tvā jajāna /
analyzed: agniḥ tat hotā kratu vid vijānan yajiṣṭhaḥ devān ṛtuśas yajāti  viśveṣām hi adhvarāṇām anīkam citram ketum janitā tvā jajāna
translated: Agni, the priest who knows the rite, knowing that, best sacrificer, offers to the gods in due season.🔽For the face of all sacrifices, the wondrous sign, the father has begotten thee.

original: sa ā yajasva nṛvatīr anu kṣā spārhā iṣaḥ kṣumatīr viśvajanyāḥ //
analyzed: saḥ ā yajasva nṛvatīḥ anu kṣā spārhāḥ iṣaḥ kṣumatīḥ viśvajanyāḥ
translated: Do thou worship the wide-ruling, desirable food, nourishing, common to all men.

original: yaṃ tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yaṃ tvāpas tvaṣṭā yaṃ tvā sujanimā jajāna /
analyzed: yam tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yam tvā apaḥ tvaṣṭā yam tvā su janimā jajāna
translated: Whom the sky and earth, whom the waters, whom Tvastr, who has well begotten thee, has begotten.

original: panthām anu pravidvān pitṛyāṇaṃ dyumad agne samidhāno vi bhāhi //🔽ino rājann aratiḥ samiddho raudro dakṣāya suṣumāṃ adarśi /
analyzed: panthām anu pravidvān pitṛyāṇam dyumat agne samidhānaḥ vi bhāhi  inaḥ rājan aratiḥ samiddhaḥ raudraḥ dakṣāya suṣumān adarśi
translated: Knowing the path that leads to the fathers, O Agni, being enkindled, shine forth with splendour.🔽The ruddy one, O king, the envoy, enkindled, terrible, has appeared to Daksha for his delight.

original: cikid vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatāsiknīm eti ruśatīm apājan //
analyzed: cikit vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatā asiknīm eti ruśatīm apājan
translated: He shines with his great light, he goes to the ruddy one, driving away the dark one.

original: kṛṣṇāṃ yad enīm abhi varpasā bhūj janayan yoṣām bṛhataḥ pitur jām /
analyzed: kṛṣṇām yat enīm abhi varpasā bhūt janayan yoṣām bṛhataḥ pituḥ jām
translated: When he, becoming black and tawny, by his form, begets the woman, the daughter of the great father,

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ sūryasya stabhāyan divo vasubhir aratir vi bhāti //
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum sūryasya stabhāyan divaḥ vasubhiḥ aratiḥ vi bhāti
translated: Supporting the upward light of the sun, the envoy shines with the wealth of the sky.

original: bhadro bhadrayā sacamāna āgāt svasāraṃ jāro abhy eti paścāt /
analyzed: bhadraḥ bhadrayā sacamānaḥ āgāt svasāram jāraḥ abhī eti paścāt
translated: The fortunate one, accompanied by the fortunate one, has come; the lover approaches his sister from behind.

original: supraketair dyubhir agnir vitiṣṭhan ruśadbhir varṇair abhi rāmam asthāt //🔽asya yāmāso bṛhato na vagnūn indhānā agneḥ sakhyuḥ śivasya /
analyzed: su praketaiḥ dyubhiḥ agniḥ vitiṣṭhan ruśadbhiḥ varṇaiḥ abhi rāmam asthāt  asya yāmāsaḥ bṛhataḥ na vagnūn indhānāḥ agneḥ sakhyuḥ śivasya
translated: Agni, shining with his well-known lights, hath stood forth with his ruddy forms to meet the ruddy one.🔽The worshippers of this great one, the kindler of Agni, the friend who is to be worshipped,

original: īḍyasya vṛṣṇo bṛhataḥ svāso bhāmāso yāmann aktavaś cikitre //🔽svanā na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥ sudivaḥ /
analyzed: īḍyasya vṛṣṇaḥ bṛhataḥ svāsaḥ bhāmāsaḥ yāman aktavaḥ cikitre  svanāḥ na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥ sudivaḥ
translated: The beautiful rays of the lofty and good one, the rays of the swift one, are to be seen on his way.🔽The rays of him who is to be praised, who is to be praised, whose rays are purified, of the lofty one, of the one with good days,

original: jyeṣṭhebhir yas tejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḷumadbhir varṣiṣṭhebhir bhānubhir nakṣati dyām //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhebhiḥ yaḥ tejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḍumadbhiḥ varṣiṣṭhebhiḥ bhānubhiḥ nakṣati dyām
translated: He who is to shine with the most excellent, the most radiant, the most delightful rays, with the highest rays, is to shine on the sky.

original: asya śuṣmāso dadṛśānapaver jehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ /
analyzed: asya śuṣmāsaḥ dadṛśāna paveḥ jehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ
translated: The impetuous ones of this one are seen, the roaring ones, with his forces,

original: pratnebhir yo ruśadbhir devatamo vi rebhadbhir aratir bhāti vibhvā //🔽sa ā vakṣi mahi na ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyor aratir yuvatyoḥ /
analyzed: pratnebhiḥ yaḥ ruśadbhiḥ devatamaḥ vi rebhadbhiḥ aratiḥ bhāti vibhvā  saḥ ā vakṣi mahi naḥ ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyoḥ aratiḥ yuvatyoḥ
translated: The one who is to be worshipped with the ancient ruddy ones, the one who is to be worshipped with the singing ones, the all-pervading one shines.🔽Come to us, sit down with us, O Agni, the one to be worshipped of the two young maidens, heaven and earth.

original: agniḥ sutukaḥ sutukebhir aśvai rabhasvadbhī rabhasvāṃ eha gamyāḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ su tukaḥ su tukebhiḥ aśvaiḥ rabhasvadbhiḥ rabhasvān ā iha gamyāḥ
translated: O Agni, the good one, with your good horses, the strong ones, come here, O strong one.

original: pra te yakṣi pra ta iyarmi manma bhuvo yathā vandyo no haveṣu /
analyzed: pra te yakṣi pra te iyarmi manma bhuvaḥ yathā vandyaḥ naḥ haveṣu
translated: I will serve you, I will urge my thought, that you may be praised by us in our invocations.

original: dhanvann iva prapā asi tvam agna iyakṣave pūrave pratna rājan //
analyzed: dhanvan iva prapāḥ asi tvam agne iyakṣave pūrave pratna rājan
translated: As a watering-place on a desert, thou art, O Agni, for the worshipper, for Pûru, O ancient King.

original: yaṃ tvā janāso abhi saṃcaranti gāva uṣṇam iva vrajaṃ yaviṣṭha /
analyzed: yam tvā janāsaḥ abhi saṃcaranti gāvaḥ uṣṇam iva vrajam yaviṣṭha
translated: Thee whom the people frequent like a herd of cattle a watering-place, O thou Most Youthful.

original: dūto devānām asi martyānām antar mahāṃś carasi rocanena //
analyzed: dūtaḥ devānām asi martyānām antar mahān carasi rocanena
translated: Thou art the messenger of Gods and of men: thou goest great in the midst with thy radiance.

original: śiśuṃ na tvā jenyaṃ vardhayantī mātā bibharti sacanasyamānā /
analyzed: śiśum na tvā jenyam vardhayantī mātā bibharti sacanasyamānā
translated: Thy mother, as a young man of noble race, nourishes thee, longing to embrace thee.

original: dhanor adhi pravatā yāsi haryañ jigīṣase paśur ivāvasṛṣṭaḥ //
analyzed: dhanoḥ adhi pravatā yāsi haryam jigīṣase paśuḥ iva avasṛṣṭaḥ
translated: From the house thou goest along the paths, tawny-hued, as if let loose, thou seekest to win.

original: mūrā amūra na vayaṃ cikitvo mahitvam agne tvam aṅga vitse /🔽śaye vavriś carati jihvayādan rerihyate yuvatiṃ viśpatiḥ san //
analyzed: mūrāḥ amūra na vayam cikitvaḥ mahi tvam agne tvam aṅga vitse  śaye vavriḥ carati jihvayā adan rerihyate yuvatim viśpatiḥ san
translated: We are foolish, O thou Wise One, we are not wise: thou, O Agni, knowest the greatness of thine own.🔽The youngling, with his tongue lolling, moves about, eating, the lord of the people, licking the young woman.

original: kūcij jāyate sanayāsu navyo vane tasthau palito dhūmaketuḥ /
analyzed: kūcid jāyate sanayāsu navyaḥ vane tasthau palitaḥ dhūma ketuḥ
translated: One is born again, new, in the births: the hoary one, with smoke for a banner, hath stood in the wood.

original: asnātāpo vṛṣabho na pra veti sacetaso yam praṇayanta martāḥ //
analyzed: a snāta apaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na pra veti sacetasaḥ yam praṇayanta martāḥ
translated: The bull goeth not forth to the waters unanointed, whom mortal men lead forth, with their minds intent.

original: tanūtyajeva taskarā vanargū raśanābhir daśabhir abhy adhītām /
analyzed: tanūtyajā iva taskarāḥ vanargūḥ raśanābhiḥ daśabhiḥ abhī adhītām
translated: Like a thief, a forest-rover, casting off his body, he is bound with ten fetters.

original: iyaṃ te agne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā rathaṃ na śucayadbhir aṅgaiḥ //
analyzed: iyam te agne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā ratham na śucayadbhiḥ aṅgaiḥ
translated: This newest hymn of thine, O Agni, is for thee: yoke thy car with its parts made pure.

original: brahma ca te jātavedo namaś ceyaṃ ca gīḥ sadam id vardhanī bhūt /
analyzed: brahma ca te jātavedaḥ namaḥ ca iyam ca gīḥ sadam id vardhanī bhūt
translated: And to thee, O all-knower, be reverence, and this hymn shall ever be a means of increase.

original: rakṣā ṇo agne tanayāni tokā rakṣota nas tanvo aprayucchan //
analyzed: rakṣa naḥ agne tanayāni tokā rakṣa uta naḥ tanvaḥ aprayucchan
translated: Protect our children, O Agni, protect our offspring, and guard thou our bodies, O thou that art never careless.

original: ekaḥ samudro dharuṇo rayīṇām asmad dhṛdo bhūrijanmā vi caṣṭe /
analyzed: ekaḥ samudraḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām asmat dhṛdaḥ bhūri janmā vi caṣṭe
translated: Alone, the ocean, the supporter of riches, the much-born one looks forth from our heart.

original: siṣakty ūdhar niṇyor upastha utsasya madhye nihitam padaṃ veḥ //
analyzed: siṣakti ūdhar niṇyoḥ upasthe utsasya madhye nihitam padam veḥ
translated: He is fastened to the udder, in the lap of the two bowls. The foot of the bird is placed in the middle of the altar.

original: samānaṃ nīḷaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasānāḥ saṃ jagmire mahiṣā arvatībhiḥ /🔽ṛtasya padaṃ kavayo ni pānti guhā nāmāni dadhire parāṇi //
analyzed: samānam nīḍam vṛṣaṇaḥ vasānāḥ sam jagmire mahiṣāḥ arvatībhiḥ  ṛtasya padam kavayaḥ ni pānti guhā nāmāni dadhire parāṇi
translated: The bulls, clothed in the same skin, have gone together, the mighty ones with the swift mares.🔽The wise ones guard the place of truth, they have hidden the highest names.

original: ṛtāyinī māyinī saṃ dadhāte mitvā śiśuṃ jajñatur vardhayantī /
analyzed: ṛtāyinī māyinī sam dadhāte mitvā śiśum jajñatuḥ vardhayantī
translated: The truthful one, the wise one, they join together. Having measured, they have brought forth the child, they who increase.

original: viśvasya nābhiṃ carato dhruvasya kaveś cit tantum manasā viyantaḥ //
analyzed: viśvasya nābhim carataḥ dhruvasya kaveḥ cit tantum manasā viyantaḥ
translated: They move about the navel of the universe, the firm one. The wise ones, with their mind, spread out the thread of the creator.

original: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ sujātam iṣo vājāya pradivaḥ sacante /
analyzed: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ su jātam iṣaḥ vājāya pradivaḥ sacante
translated: For the paths of truth follow the well-born one. The days attend on food and strength for the sacrifice.

original: adhīvāsaṃ rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtair annair vāvṛdhāte madhūnām //
analyzed: adhīvāsam rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtaiḥ annaiḥ vāvṛdhāte madhūnām
translated: The two worlds, with the sky as their roof, have grown great with the oblations of ghee and the sweet food.

original: sapta svasṝr aruṣīr vāvaśāno vidvān madhva uj jabhārā dṛśe kam /
analyzed: sapta svasṝḥ aruṣīḥ vāvaśānaḥ vidvān madhvaḥ ud jabhārā dṛśe kam
translated: The wise one, longing for the seven ruddy sisters, has brought up the sweet one for the sight of all.

original: antar yeme antarikṣe purājā icchan vavrim avidat pūṣaṇasya //
analyzed: antar yeme antarikṣe purājāḥ icchan vavrim avidat pūṣaṇasya
translated: The ancient ones have entered within the atmosphere, desiring the covering of Pūṣan, he has found it.

original: sapta maryādāḥ kavayas tatakṣus tāsām ekām id abhy aṃhuro gāt /
analyzed: sapta maryādāḥ kavayaḥ tatakṣuḥ tāsām ekām id abhī aṃhuraḥ gāt
translated: The sages have fashioned seven boundaries, one of them the swift one has passed over.

original: āyor ha skambha upamasya nīḷe pathāṃ visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau //
analyzed: āyoḥ ha skambhaḥ upamasya nīḍe pathām visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau
translated: In the lap of the supporting pillar of Āyu, the son of Upamā, he has stood in the starting-points of the paths.

original: asac ca sac ca parame vyoman dakṣasya janmann aditer upasthe /🔽agnir ha naḥ prathamajā ṛtasya pūrva āyuni vṛṣabhaś ca dhenuḥ //
analyzed: asat ca sat ca parame vyoman dakṣasya janman aditeḥ upasthe  agniḥ ha naḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya pūrve āyuni vṛṣabhaḥ ca dhenuḥ
translated: The existent and the non-existent in the highest heaven, in the womb of Aditi, the birthplace of Dakṣa.🔽Agni is our firstborn of eternal law, the bull and the cow were his in the beginning.

original: ayaṃ sa yasya śarmann avobhir agner edhate jaritābhiṣṭau /
analyzed: ayam sa yasya śarman avobhiḥ agneḥ edhate jaritā abhiṣṭau
translated: He is the one whose protection, O Agni, the singer increases by his praises.

original: jyeṣṭhebhir yo bhānubhir ṛṣūṇām paryeti parivīto vibhāvā //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhebhiḥ yaḥ bhānubhiḥ ṛṣūṇām paryeti parivītaḥ vibhāvā
translated: He who with the most excellent rays of the Ṛṣis moves around, surrounded, shining.

original: yo bhānubhir vibhāvā vibhāty agnir devebhir ṛtāvājasraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ bhānubhiḥ vibhāvā vibhāti agniḥ devebhiḥ ṛtāvā ajasraḥ
translated: Agni, who shines with his rays, shining, with the gods, true, ever-flowing,

original: ā yo vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyo 'parihvṛto atyo na saptiḥ //
analyzed: ā yaḥ vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyaḥ parihvṛtaḥ atyaḥ na saptiḥ
translated: He who, for the sake of friends, is to be chosen by friends, unhindered, like a swift horse.

original: īśe yo viśvasyā devavīter īśe viśvāyur uṣaso vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: īśe yaḥ viśvasyāḥ deva vīteḥ īśe viśvāyuḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: He who is the lord of all the feast of the gods, he is the lord of all life at the rising of the dawns.

original: ā yasmin manā havīṃṣy agnāv ariṣṭaratha skabhnāti śūṣaiḥ //
analyzed: ā yasmin manā havīṃṣi agnau ariṣṭa ratha skabhnāti śūṣaiḥ
translated: In whom, in Agni, the mind and the oblations are firmly established by his strength, O you whose chariot is unimpeded.

original: śūṣebhir vṛdho juṣāṇo arkair devāṃ acchā raghupatvā jigāti /🔽mandro hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślo agnir ā jigharti devān //
analyzed: śūṣebhiḥ vṛdhaḥ juṣāṇaḥ arkaiḥ devān acchā raghu patvā jigāti  mandraḥ hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślaḥ agniḥ ā jigharti devān
translated: With his flames, growing, accepting the hymns, he goes to the gods, to the Raghus, to be worshipped.🔽The delightful priest, most worthy of sacrifice, well-anointed, Agni, longs for the gods.

original: tam usrām indraṃ na rejamānam agniṃ gīrbhir namobhir ā kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: tam usrām indram na rejamānam agnim gīrbhiḥ namobhiḥ ā kṛṇudhvam
translated: To that Indra, to that Agni, who is not to be shaken, win him over with your songs and salutations.

original: ā yaṃ viprāso matibhir gṛṇanti jātavedasaṃ juhvaṃ sahānām //
analyzed: ā yam viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ gṛṇanti jātavedasam juhvam sahānām
translated: To whom the sages sing with their thoughts, to the all-knowing one, to be worshipped by us all.

original: saṃ yasmin viśvā vasūni jagmur vāje nāśvāḥ saptīvanta evaiḥ /
analyzed: sam yasmin viśvā vasūni jagmuḥ vāje na aśvāḥ saptīvantaḥ evaiḥ
translated: In whom all treasures have come together, like horses in a race with swift chariots.

original: asme ūtīr indravātatamā arvācīnā agna ā kṛṇuṣva //
analyzed: asme ūtīḥ indra vātatamāḥ arvācīnāḥ agne ā kṛṇuṣva
translated: Bring to us the most helpful aids, O Agni, from the west, O Agni, make them come.

original: adhā hy agne mahnā niṣadyā sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūtha /
analyzed: adhā hi agne mahnā niṣadyā sadyas jajñānaḥ havyaḥ babhūtha
translated: For now, O Agni, by your greatness, sitting down, as soon as born, you have become worthy of offering.

original: taṃ te devāso anu ketam āyann adhāvardhanta prathamāsa ūmāḥ //
analyzed: tam te devāsaḥ anu ketam āyan adha avardhanta prathamāsaḥ ūmāḥ
translated: The gods have followed your banner; the earliest, most powerful ones have increased.

original: svasti no divo agne pṛthivyā viśvāyur dhehi yajathāya deva /
analyzed: svasti naḥ divaḥ agne pṛthivyāḥ viśvāyuḥ dhehi yajathāya deva
translated: Grant us well-being from heaven, O Agni, from the earth, for all life, O god, for the sacrifice.

original: sacemahi tava dasma praketair uruṣyā ṇa urubhir deva śaṃsaiḥ //
analyzed: sacemahi tava dasma praketaiḥ uruṣya naḥ urubhiḥ deva śaṃsaiḥ
translated: May we be united with your wondrous signs; protect us with your far-reaching divine aids.

original: imā agne matayas tubhyaṃ jātā gobhir aśvair abhi gṛṇanti rādhaḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ agne matayaḥ tubhyam jātāḥ gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ abhi gṛṇanti rādhaḥ
translated: These prayers, O Agni, are born for you; with cattle and horses they praise your bounty.

original: yadā te marto anu bhogam ānaḍ vaso dadhāno matibhiḥ sujāta //
analyzed: yadā te martaḥ anu bhogam ānaṭ vaso dadhānaḥ matibhiḥ su jāta
translated: When the mortal man has attained to thy enjoyment, O Vasu, bearing with his thoughts, O nobly born one.

original: agnim manye pitaram agnim āpim agnim bhrātaraṃ sadam it sakhāyam /
analyzed: agnim manye pitaram agnim āpim agnim bhrātaram sadam id sakhāyam
translated: I think of Agni as my father, of Agni as my brother, always as my friend.

original: agner anīkam bṛhataḥ saparyaṃ divi śukraṃ yajataṃ sūryasya //🔽sidhrā agne dhiyo asme sanutrīr yaṃ trāyase dama ā nityahotā /
analyzed: agneḥ anīkam bṛhataḥ saparyam divi śukram yajatam sūryasya  sidhrāḥ agne dhiyaḥ asme sanutrīḥ yam trāyase dame ā nitya hotā
translated: The face of Agni, to be worshipped, vast, pure in the sky, the priest of Surya.🔽O Agni, may our wishes be successful, to be gained, whom thou protectest in the house, O eternal priest.

original: ṛtāvā sa rohidaśvaḥ purukṣur dyubhir asmā ahabhir vāmam astu //
analyzed: ṛtāvā sa rohit aśvaḥ purukṣuḥ dyubhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ vāmam astu
translated: May he, the truthful one, the possessor of red horses, the rich in food, be prosperous through our days and nights.

original: dyubhir hitam mitram iva prayogam pratnam ṛtvijam adhvarasya jāram /
analyzed: dyubhiḥ hitam mitram iva prayogam pratnam ṛtvijam adhvarasya jāram
translated: The prosperous one, like a friend in the preparation, the ancient priest of the sacrifice, the lover.

original: bāhubhyām agnim āyavo 'jananta vikṣu hotāraṃ ny asādayanta //🔽svayaṃ yajasva divi deva devān kiṃ te pākaḥ kṛṇavad apracetāḥ /
analyzed: bāhubhyām agnim āyavaḥ jananta vikṣu hotāram ni asādayanta  svayam yajasva divi deva devān kim te pākaḥ kṛṇavat apracetāḥ
translated: The living ones have produced Agni with their arms, and have placed him as the Hotar in the people.🔽Yourself worship the gods in heaven, O god. What will the foolish Paka do for you?

original: yathāyaja ṛtubhir deva devān evā yajasva tanvaṃ sujāta //
analyzed: yathā ayajaḥ ṛtubhiḥ deva devān evā yajasva tanvam su jāta
translated: As you have worshipped the gods with the seasons, O god, thus worship your own body, O nobly born one.

original: bhavā no agne 'vitota gopā bhavā vayaskṛd uta no vayodhāḥ /
analyzed: bhava naḥ agne vitā uta gopāḥ bhava vayaskṛt uta naḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: Be our protector and guardian, O Agni, be our strength-giver and strength-bestower.

original: rāsvā ca naḥ sumaho havyadātiṃ trāsvota nas tanvo aprayucchan //
analyzed: rāsvā ca naḥ su mahas havya dātim trāsvā uta naḥ tanvaḥ aprayucchan
translated: And grant us the offering, O great one, and protect our bodies, O watchful one.

original: pra ketunā bṛhatā yāty agnir ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti /
analyzed: pra ketunā bṛhatā yāti agniḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: With his great flame Agni goes forth, the bull roars to the two world-halves.

original: divaś cid antāṃ upamāṃ ud ānaḷ apām upasthe mahiṣo vavardha //
analyzed: divaḥ cit antām upamām ud ānaṭ apām upasthe mahiṣaḥ vavardha
translated: Even to the ends of the sky he has lifted up his likeness; in the waters' lap the mighty one has grown.

original: mumoda garbho vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmān asremā vatsaḥ śimīvāṃ arāvīt /
analyzed: mumoda garbhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmān asremā vatsaḥ śimīvān arāvīt
translated: The bull, the humped one, the embryo has rejoiced; the suckling, swift to move, has bellowed.

original: sa devatāty udyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣu prathamo jigāti //
analyzed: sa devatātī udyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣu prathamaḥ jigāti
translated: He, the god, performing the uplifted rites, goes forth first to his own resting-places.

original: ā yo mūrdhānam pitror arabdha ny adhvare dadhire sūro arṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā yaḥ mūrdhānam pitroḥ arabdha ni adhvare dadhire sūraḥ arṇaḥ
translated: He who has grasped the head of the two parents, in the sacrifice they have placed the ruddy water.

original: asya patmann aruṣīr aśvabudhnā ṛtasya yonau tanvo juṣanta //
analyzed: asya patman aruṣīḥ aśva budhnāḥ ṛtasya yonau tanvaḥ juṣanta
translated: On his path the ruddy mares, swift as horses, delight their bodies in the womb of truth.

original: uṣauṣo hi vaso agram eṣi tvaṃ yamayor abhavo vibhāvā /
analyzed: uṣā oṣaḥ hi vaso agram eṣi tvam yamayoḥ abhavaḥ vibhāvā
translated: Dawn after dawn, O good one, thou goest forth to the front; thou hast become the illuminator of the two Yamas.

original: ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitraṃ tanve svāyai //
analyzed: ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitram tanve svāyai
translated: For truth thou settest seven steps, begetting Mitra for thine own body.

original: bhuvaś cakṣur maha ṛtasya gopā bhuvo varuṇo yad ṛtāya veṣi /🔽bhuvo apāṃ napāj jātavedo bhuvo dūto yasya havyaṃ jujoṣaḥ //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ cakṣuḥ mahaḥ ṛtasya gopāḥ bhuvaḥ varuṇaḥ yat ṛtāya veṣi  bhuvaḥ apām napāt jātavedaḥ bhuvaḥ dūtaḥ yasya havyam jujoṣaḥ
translated: Thou art the great eye of being, the guardian of truth; thou art Varuna, when thou goest forth to truth.🔽Thou art the son of the waters, O all-knower; thou art the messenger of him whose offering thou acceptest.

original: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaś ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ /
analyzed: bhuvaḥ yajñasya rajasaḥ ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ
translated: Thou art the leader of the sacrifice and of the realm, where thou rejoicest with thy auspicious bonds.

original: divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvām agne cakṛṣe havyavāham //🔽asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antar icchan dhītim pitur evaiḥ parasya /
analyzed: divi mūrdhānam dadhiṣe svarṣām jihvām agne cakṛṣe havya vāham  asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antar icchan dhītim pituḥ evaiḥ parasya
translated: Thou hast set thy head in the sky, O self-shining one; thou hast made thy tongue, O Agni, the bearer of oblations.🔽Trita chose him by his will, in his father's highest abode,

original: sacasyamānaḥ pitror upasthe jāmi bruvāṇa āyudhāni veti //
analyzed: sacasyamānaḥ pitroḥ upasthe jāmi bruvāṇaḥ āyudhāni veti
translated: Desiring the thought of the father, being born in the lap of the parents, speaking as a brother, he goes to the weapons.

original: sa pitryāṇy āyudhāni vidvān indreṣita āptyo abhy ayudhyat /
analyzed: sa pitryāṇi āyudhāni vidvān indra iṣitaḥ āptyaḥ abhī ayudhyat
translated: Knowing the weapons of the father, sent by Indra, he fought against the Aptya.

original: triśīrṣāṇaṃ saptaraśmiṃ jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cin niḥ sasṛje trito gāḥ //
analyzed: tri śīrṣāṇam sapta raśmim jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cit niḥ sasṛje tritaḥ gāḥ
translated: The one with three heads and seven rays, the lame one, Trita let loose the cows of Tvastr, the one with all forms.

original: bhūrīd indra udinakṣantam ojo 'vābhinat satpatir manyamānam /
analyzed: bhūri id indraḥ udinakṣantam ojaḥ vā abhinat satpatiḥ manyamānam
translated: Indra, the lord of the true, struck down the one who was striving to win strength, the one who was thinking highly of himself.

original: tvāṣṭrasya cid viśvarūpasya gonām ācakrāṇas trīṇi śīrṣā parā vark //
analyzed: tvāṣṭrasya cit viśva rūpasya gonām ācakrāṇaḥ trīṇi śīrṣā parā vark
translated: Having let loose the cows of Tvastr, the one with all forms, he cut off three heads of his, the one who was going away.

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana /
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana
translated: The waters are indeed the givers of bliss; for strength do ye set them for us.

original: mahe raṇāya cakṣase //
analyzed: mahe raṇāya cakṣase
translated: For the great joy of beholding.

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ
translated: Of you, the most auspicious essence, do ye grant us here.

original: uśatīr iva mātaraḥ //
analyzed: uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: Like eager mothers.

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha /🔽āpo janayathā ca naḥ //
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha  āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ
translated: To him we go for favour, for whose enjoyment ye quicken.🔽O waters, do ye also beget us.

original: śaṃ no devīr abhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye /
analyzed: śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye
translated: May the waters be auspicious to us for help and for drinking.

original: śaṃ yor abhi sravantu naḥ //
analyzed: śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ
translated: May they flow to us for welfare.

original: īśānā vāryāṇāṃ kṣayantīś carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: īśānāḥ vāryāṇām kṣayantīḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: The rulers of precious things, the sustainers of men,

original: apo yācāmi bheṣajam //
analyzed: apaḥ yācāmi bheṣajam
translated: I ask the waters for healing.

original: apsu me somo abravīd antar viśvāni bheṣajā /
analyzed: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā
translated: In the waters, Soma has told me, within are all the medicines,

original: agniṃ ca viśvaśambhuvam //
analyzed: agnim ca viśva śambhuvam
translated: And Agni who is auspicious to all.

original: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama /
analyzed: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajam varūtham tanve mama
translated: O waters, provide healing and protection for my body,

original: jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe //🔽idam āpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritam mayi /
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe  idam āpaḥ pra vahata yat kim ca duritam mayi
translated: And may I long behold the sun.🔽O waters, carry away whatever evil there is in me,

original: yad vāham abhidudroha yad vā śepa utānṛtam //🔽āpo adyānv acāriṣaṃ rasena sam agasmahi /
analyzed: yat vā aham abhidudroha yat vā śepe uta anṛtam  āpaḥ adya anu acāriṣam rasena sam agasmahi
translated: Whatever I have rushed against, whatever I have said in anger or falsely.🔽Today I have moved along with the waters, I have united with their sap.

original: payasvān agna ā gahi tam mā saṃ sṛja varcasā //
analyzed: payasvān agne ā gahi tam mā sam sṛja varcasā
translated: O Agni, come with milk; unite me with radiance.

original: o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ purū cid arṇavaṃ jaganvān /
analyzed: ā u cit sakhāyam sakhyā vavṛtyām tiras purū cit arṇavam jaganvān
translated: Even though I have turned away my friend with friendship, having gone over many barriers,

original: pitur napātam ā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣami prataraṃ dīdhyānaḥ //
analyzed: pituḥ napātam ā dadhīta vedhāḥ adhi kṣami prataram dīdhyānaḥ
translated: The creator should place me in the grandson's place, reflecting on the bridge over the earth.

original: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭy etat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpā bhavāti /
analyzed: na te sakhā sakhyam vaṣṭi etat salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti
translated: This friendship of yours does not please me, friend, that you should be of various forms.

original: mahas putrāso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāra urviyā pari khyan //
analyzed: mahaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ divaḥ dhartāraḥ urviyā pari khyan
translated: The great sons, the heroes of the Asura, the supporters of heaven, are to be praised on all sides.

original: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etad ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya /
analyzed: uśanti gha te amṛtāsaḥ etat ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya
translated: The immortal ones praise this of thine, the destruction of even one mortal.

original: ni te mano manasi dhāyy asme janyuḥ patis tanvam ā viviśyāḥ //
analyzed: ni te manaḥ manasi dhāyi asme janyuḥ patiḥ tanvam ā viviśyāḥ
translated: Let thy mind be in thy mind with us, let the husband enter his wife's body.

original: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnam ṛtā vadanto anṛtaṃ rapema /🔽gandharvo apsv apyā ca yoṣā sā no nābhiḥ paramaṃ jāmi tan nau //
analyzed: na yat purā cakṛma kad ha nūnam ṛtā vadantaḥ anṛtam rapema  gandharvaḥ apsu apyā ca yoṣā sā naḥ nābhiḥ paramam jāmi tat nau
translated: What we have not done before, now that we speak the truth, let us not utter falsehood.🔽The Gandharva is in the waters, and the woman, that is our common bond, that is our highest kinship.

original: garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kar devas tvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ /
analyzed: garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kaḥ devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ
translated: In the womb our begetter makes us a couple, the god Tvastr, Savitar, of all forms.

original: nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nāv asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nau asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: None transgresses his ordinances, neither earth nor sky knows them.

original: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pra vocat /
analyzed: kaḥ asya veda prathamasya ahnaḥ kaḥ īm dadarśa kaḥ iha pra vocat
translated: Who knows this first day? Who has seen it? Who here will declare it?

original: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u brava āhano vīcyā nṝn //🔽yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya /
analyzed: bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u bravaḥ āhano vīcyā nṝn  yamasya mā yamyam kāmaḥ āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya
translated: The lofty abode of Mitra and Varuna, what shall I say to you, O men, to delight you?🔽I have come to Yama's desire for my own self, to lie together in the common birthplace.

original: jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā //
analyzed: jāyā iva patye tanvam riricyām vi cit vṛheva rathyā iva cakrā
translated: Let me shrink my body from the husband as a wife, let us two be separated as a chariot from its wheels.

original: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanty ete devānāṃ spaśa iha ye caranti /
analyzed: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanti ete devānām spaśaḥ iha ye caranti
translated: These, the messengers of the gods who move here, do not stand or blink.

original: anyena mad āhano yāhi tūyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyeva cakrā //🔽rātrībhir asmā ahabhir daśasyet sūryasya cakṣur muhur un mimīyāt /
analyzed: anyena mat āhanaḥ yāhi tūyam tena vi vṛha rathyā iva cakrā  rātrībhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ daśasyet sūryasya cakṣuḥ muhur ud mimīyāt
translated: Go to him with another, O my mind, go to him, drive him away as on a chariot with its wheels.🔽With nights and days let him be prosperous, let him often open the eye of the sun.

original: divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīr yamasya bibhṛyād ajāmi //
analyzed: divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya bibhṛyāt ajāmi
translated: With the day and the earth let him have a pair, a companion, let him bear the sister of Yama, not a barren one.

original: ā ghā tā gacchān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavann ajāmi /
analyzed: ā gha tā gacchān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavan ajāmi
translated: To those higher pairs of years let us go, where the sisters have made a non-barren one.

original: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam icchasva subhage patim mat //
analyzed: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam icchasva subhage patim mat
translated: Stroke the arm for the bull, O fortunate one, seek another husband than me.

original: kim bhrātāsad yad anātham bhavāti kim u svasā yan nirṛtir nigacchāt /
analyzed: kim bhrātā asat yat anātham bhavāti kim u svasā yat nirṛtiḥ nigacchāt
translated: What is a brother, if he is helpless? What is a sister, if she goes to misfortune?

original: kāmamūtā bahv etad rapāmi tanvā me tanvaṃ sam pipṛgdhi //
analyzed: kāma mūtā bahu etat rapāmi tanvāḥ me tanvam sam pipṛgdhi
translated: I speak much of this, O you who are called by love, embrace my body with your body.

original: na vā u te tanvā tanvaṃ sam papṛcyām pāpam āhur yaḥ svasāraṃ nigacchāt /
analyzed: na vai u te tanvā tanvam sam papṛcyām pāpam āhuḥ yaḥ svasāram nigacchāt
translated: I would not embrace your body with my body, they call it a sin if one goes to his sister.

original: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭy etat //
analyzed: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭi etat
translated: Make your pleasure with another than me, O fortunate one, your brother does not approve of this.

original: bato batāsi yama naiva te mano hṛdayaṃ cāvidāma /
analyzed: bataḥ bata asi yama na eva te manaḥ hṛdayam ca avidāma
translated: You are indeed a child, O Yama, we do not know your mind or heart.

original: anyā kila tvāṃ kakṣyeva yuktam pari ṣvajāte libujeva vṛkṣam //
analyzed: anyā kila tvām kakṣyā iva yuktam pari svajāte libujā iva vṛkṣam
translated: Another, it seems, has embraced you, as a rope binds one fastened to it, as a creeper embraces a tree.

original: anyam ū ṣu tvaṃ yamy anya u tvām pari ṣvajāte libujeva vṛkṣam /
analyzed: anyam u su tvam yami anyaḥ u tvām pari svajāte libujā iva vṛkṣam
translated: Thou art to be yoked to another, another to thee: ye embrace each other like two trees of the Libudja.

original: tasya vā tvam mana icchā sa vā tavādhā kṛṇuṣva saṃvidaṃ subhadrām //
analyzed: tasya vā tvam manaḥ iccha sa vā tava adha kṛṇuṣva saṃvidam su bhadrām
translated: Do thou desire his mind, and he desire thine: make ye a very fair agreement between you.

original: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditer adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvaḥ aditeḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The Bull hath milked for the Bull the milk of heaven, the young, the unassailable, of Aditi.

original: viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyo yajatu yajñiyāṃ ṛtūn //
analyzed: viśvam sa veda varuṇaḥ yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyaḥ yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn
translated: He knows all this as Varuna knows it by his wisdom: let him, meet for worship, worship the seasons meet for worship.

original: rapad gandharvīr apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu me manaḥ /
analyzed: rapat gandharvīḥ apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu me manaḥ
translated: Let the Gandharva's wife, the matron, come to me, and let my mind be guarded in the sound of song.

original: iṣṭasya madhye aditir ni dhātu no bhrātā no jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati //
analyzed: iṣṭasya madhye aditiḥ ni dhātu naḥ bhrātā naḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamaḥ vi vocati
translated: In the midst of the sacrifice may Aditi place us: our eldest brother, our firstborn, shall proclaim us.

original: so cin nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvaty uṣā uvāsa manave svarvatī /
analyzed: sā u cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatī uṣāḥ uvāsa manave svarvatī
translated: She, too, the blessed, the prosperous, the famous Dawn hath risen for Manu, rich in light.

original: yad īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agniṃ hotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan //🔽adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ vir ābharad iṣitaḥ śyeno adhvare /
analyzed: yat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan  adha tyam drapsam vibhvam vicakṣaṇam viḥ ābharat iṣitaḥ śyenaḥ adhvare
translated: When they have generated Agni, the Hotar, who is to be desired, who is to be longed for, according to the will of him who longs, for the sacrifice.🔽Then hath the active falcon brought hither that all-knowing drop, that all-observing one, to the sacrifice.

original: yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmam āryā agniṃ hotāram adha dhīr ajāyata //
analyzed: yadi viśaḥ vṛṇate dasmam āryāḥ agnim hotāram adha dhīḥ ajāyata
translated: When the Aryan people choose the wondrous one, Agni, as Hotar, then the thought was born.

original: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhir agne manuṣaḥ svadhvaraḥ /
analyzed: sadā asi raṇvaḥ yavasā iva puṣyate hotrābhiḥ agne manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ
translated: Thou art ever dear, like grass in the pasture, O Agni, by the oblations of the pious man.

original: viprasya vā yac chaśamāna ukthyaṃ vājaṃ sasavāṃ upayāsi bhūribhiḥ //🔽ud īraya pitarā jāra ā bhagam iyakṣati haryato hṛtta iṣyati /
analyzed: viprasya vā yat śaśamānaḥ ukthyam vājam sasavān upayāsi bhūribhiḥ  ud īraya pitarā jāraḥ ā bhagam iyakṣati haryataḥ hṛttas iṣyati
translated: Or when thou, O bountiful one, with many (gifts) approachest the praiseworthy strength of the pious man.🔽Lift up the parents, O brother, to prosperity; he longs for the worshipful one, he desires to go.

original: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhas taviṣyate asuro vepate matī //
analyzed: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhaḥ taviṣyate asuraḥ vepate matī
translated: The priest is delighted, the sacrifice is pleased; the Asura is glorified, the thought trembles.

original: yas te agne sumatim marto akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve /
analyzed: yaḥ te agne sumatim martaḥ akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve
translated: O Agni, the man who has gained thy favour, O son of strength, he is exalted above (others).

original: iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvair ā sa dyumāṃ amavān bhūṣati dyūn //
analyzed: iṣam dadhānaḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ ā sa dyumān amavān bhūṣati dyūn
translated: Bearing food, borne by horses, he, the immortal one, adorns the days with splendour.

original: yad agna eṣā samitir bhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra /
analyzed: yat agne eṣā samitiḥ bhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra
translated: O Agni, when this assembly becomes such, O god, among the gods who offer sacrifices, O worthy of sacrifice,

original: ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāgaṃ no atra vasumantaṃ vītāt //
analyzed: ratnā ca yat vibhajāsi svadhāvas bhāgam naḥ atra vasumantam vītāt
translated: And when thou, O self-existent one, distributest the treasures, give us a share rich in goods.

original: śrudhī no agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ratham amṛtasya dravitnum /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣva ratham amṛtasya dravitnum
translated: Listen to us, O Agni, in the abode of the righteous; yoke the chariot of the swift immortal one.

original: ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākir devānām apa bhūr iha syāḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apa bhūḥ iha syāḥ
translated: Bring us the two worlds, O son of the gods; let there be no absence of the gods here for us.

original: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtenābhiśrāve bhavataḥ satyavācā /
analyzed: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtena abhiśrāve bhavataḥ satya vācā
translated: The heaven and earth, O Agni, are the first to proclaim thee by eternal law with true speech.

original: devo yan martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdad dhotā pratyaṅ svam asuṃ yan //
analyzed: devaḥ yat martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdat hotā pratyaṅ svam asum yan
translated: When the god, making mortals to worship, sits down as the Hotar, turning to his own abode.

original: devo devān paribhūr ṛtena vahā no havyam prathamaś cikitvān /
analyzed: devaḥ devān paribhūḥ ṛtena vaha naḥ havyam prathamaḥ cikitvān
translated: The god, the overlord by law, carry our oblation, the first, the wise one.

original: dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīko mandro hotā nityo vācā yajīyān //
analyzed: dhūma ketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīkaḥ mandraḥ hotā nityaḥ vācā yajīyān
translated: The smoke-bannered, radiant with the kindling-stick, the delightful Hotar, ever present, most worthy of worship with speech.

original: svāvṛg devasyāmṛtaṃ yadī gor ato jātāso dhārayanta urvī /
analyzed: svāvṛj devasya amṛtam yadi goḥ atas jātāsaḥ dhārayante urvī
translated: The immortal food of the god is the cow's own milk. From this are born those who support the wide earth.

original: viśve devā anu tat te yajur gur duhe yad enī divyaṃ ghṛtaṃ vāḥ //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat te yajuḥ guḥ duhe yat enī divyam ghṛtam vār
translated: All the gods have followed that sacrificial formula of yours. The tawny one yields the heavenly ghee and water.

original: arcāmi vāṃ vardhāyāpo ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutaṃ rodasī me /
analyzed: arcāmi vām vardhāya apaḥ ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutam rodasī me
translated: I praise you, O waters, rich in ghee, for prosperity. O heaven and earth, hear me, O you two wide worlds.

original: ahā yad dyāvo 'sunītim ayan madhvā no atra pitarā śiśītām //
analyzed: ahā yat dyāvaḥ sunītim ayan madhvā naḥ atra pitarā śiśītām
translated: When the days have brought down the false law of heaven, may the two fathers there sharpen us with sweetness.

original: kiṃ svin no rājā jagṛhe kad asyāti vrataṃ cakṛmā ko vi veda /
analyzed: kim svid naḥ rājā jagṛhe kad asya ati vratam cakṛma kaḥ vi veda
translated: What has the king taken from us? What have we transgressed of his law? Who knows?

original: mitraś cid dhi ṣmā juhurāṇo devāñ chloko na yātām api vājo asti //
analyzed: mitraḥ cit hi sma juhurāṇaḥ devām ślokaḥ na yātām api vājaḥ asti
translated: Even Mitra, when angry with the gods, has not gone the way of the hymn. There is still strength.

original: durmantv atrāmṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yad viṣurūpā bhavāti /
analyzed: durmantu atra amṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti
translated: The name of the immortal one is hard to understand here. When it becomes multi-formed, having the same mark,

original: yamasya yo manavate sumantv agne tam ṛṣva pāhy aprayucchan //
analyzed: yamasya yaḥ manavate sumantu agne tam ṛṣva pāhi aprayucchan
translated: O Agni, protect him who thinks of Yama's good name, O lofty one, without winking.

original: yasmin devā vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante
translated: In whom the gods rejoice in the sacrificial session, in the seat of Vivasvat they uphold.

original: sūrye jyotir adadhur māsy aktūn pari dyotaniṃ carato ajasrā //
analyzed: sūrye jyotiḥ adadhuḥ māsi aktūn pari dyotanim carataḥ ajasrā
translated: In the sun they have placed the light, in the moon the stars; they move around the shining one unceasingly.

original: yasmin devā manmani saṃcaranty apīcye na vayam asya vidma /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ manmani saṃcaranti apīcye na vayam asya vidma
translated: In whose thought the gods move, in the mysterious one, we do not know this one.

original: mitro no atrāditir anāgān savitā devo varuṇāya vocat //
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra aditiḥ anāgān savitā devaḥ varuṇāya vocat
translated: May Mitra, Aditi, and Savitar the god proclaim you to Varuṇa.

original: śrudhī no agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ratham amṛtasya dravitnum /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣva ratham amṛtasya dravitnum
translated: Listen to us, O Agni, in the seat of the assembly; yoke the chariot of the immortal one, the swift one.

original: ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākir devānām apa bhūr iha syāḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apa bhūḥ iha syāḥ
translated: Bring us the two worlds, O son of the gods; be not thou absent here from the company of the gods.

original: yuje vām brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhir vi śloka etu pathyeva sūreḥ /
analyzed: yuje vām brahma pūrvyam namobhiḥ vi ślokaḥ etu pathyā iva sūreḥ
translated: I yoke you two with ancient homage; may the hymn go forth like a chariot on the path.

original: śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrāḥ ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ
translated: May all the sons of the immortal one listen, who have taken their places in the heavenly abodes.

original: yame iva yatamāne yad aitam pra vām bharan mānuṣā devayantaḥ /
analyzed: yame iva yatamāne yat aitam pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ
translated: As you two have come to this one who is striving like Yama, the men who delight in the gods have brought you.

original: ā sīdataṃ svam u lokaṃ vidāne svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ //
analyzed: ā sīdatam svam u lokam vidāne svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ
translated: Sit in your own world, which I bestow; be ye two easy to find for us, O you who are to be found.

original: pañca padāni rupo anv arohaṃ catuṣpadīm anv emi vratena /
analyzed: pañca padāni rupaḥ anu aroham catuṣpadīm anu emi vratena
translated: I have ascended five steps after the form; I follow the four-footed one by the vow.

original: akṣareṇa prati mima etām ṛtasya nābhāv adhi sam punāmi //
analyzed: akṣareṇa prati mime etām ṛtasya nābhau adhi sam punāmi
translated: With the imperishable I gather this, I purify it upon the two seats of holy order.

original: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kam amṛtaṃ nāvṛṇīta /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kam amṛtam na avṛṇīta
translated: For the gods he chose death, for offspring he chose immortality.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ yajñam akṛṇvata ṛṣim priyāṃ yamas tanvam prārirecīt //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim yajñam akṛṇvata ṛṣim priyām yamaḥ tanvam prārirecīt
translated: They made Brhaspati the priest, the sage, Yama sent forth his dear body.

original: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāso apy avīvatann ṛtam /
analyzed: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāsaḥ api avīvatan ṛtam
translated: The sons of the Maruts, seven, flow to the child; to the father they have come, they have fulfilled the truth.

original: ubhe id asyobhayasya rājata ubhe yatete ubhayasya puṣyataḥ //
analyzed: ubhe id asya ubhayasya rājataḥ ubhe yatete ubhayasya puṣyataḥ
translated: He rules over both, over both he is king; both are subject to him, both he supports.

original: pareyivāṃsam pravato mahīr anu bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānam /
analyzed: pareyivāṃsam pravataḥ mahīḥ anu bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānam
translated: Him who goes afar, along the great paths, looking along the way for many,

original: vaivasvataṃ saṃgamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃ rājānaṃ haviṣā duvasya //
analyzed: vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā duvasya
translated: Vaiśvānara, the gathering-place of men, serve with oblation King Yama.

original: yamo no gātum prathamo viveda naiṣā gavyūtir apabhartavā u /
analyzed: yamaḥ naḥ gātum prathamaḥ viveda na eṣā gavyūtiḥ apabhartavai u
translated: Yama first discovered our path; he has not taken away this our pasture.

original: yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyur enā jajñānāḥ pathyā anu svāḥ //
analyzed: yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyuḥ enāḥ jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ
translated: Where our fathers and grandfathers have gone before, knowing these paths of ours.

original: mātalī kavyair yamo aṅgirobhir bṛhaspatir ṛkvabhir vāvṛdhānaḥ /
analyzed: mātalī kavyaiḥ yamaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: With the Kavyas, with the Aṅgiras, Yama, with the Ṛkvas, Brhaspati, grown great,

original: yāṃś ca devā vāvṛdhur ye ca devān svāhānye svadhayānye madanti //
analyzed: yān ca devāḥ vāvṛdhuḥ ye ca devān svāhā anye svadhayā anye madanti
translated: Whom the gods have made to grow, and those who are gods, some rejoice in Svāhā, some in Svadha.

original: imaṃ yama prastaram ā hi sīdāṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ /
analyzed: imam yama prastaram ā hi sīda aṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ
translated: Sit on this strew, O Yama, in accord with the Angirases and the Fathers.

original: ā tvā mantrāḥ kaviśastā vahantv enā rājan haviṣā mādayasva //
analyzed: ā tvā mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ vahantu enā rājan haviṣā mādayasva
translated: Let the hymns, well-ordered by the wise, bring thee hither. Rejoice, O King, with this oblation.

original: aṅgirobhir ā gahi yajñiyebhir yama vairūpair iha mādayasva /
analyzed: aṅgirobhiḥ ā gahi yajñiyebhiḥ yama vairūpaiḥ iha mādayasva
translated: Come with the Angirases, the worthy of sacrifice. Rejoice here, O Yama, with the Vaivasvata Angirases.

original: vivasvantaṃ huve yaḥ pitā te 'smin yajñe barhiṣy ā niṣadya //
analyzed: vivasvantam huve yaḥ pitā te smin yajñe barhiṣi ā niṣadya
translated: I invoke Vivasvan, who is thy father, sitting on the sacrificial grass at this sacrifice.

original: aṅgiraso naḥ pitaro navagvā atharvāṇo bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ
translated: Our fathers are the Angirases, the Navagvas, the Atharvans, the Bhrigus, the friends of Soma.

original: teṣāṃ vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma //
analyzed: teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we be in the favour, in the good grace, in the happy favour of those worthy of sacrifice.

original: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūrvyebhir yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyuḥ /
analyzed: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūrvyebhiḥ yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyuḥ
translated: Go, go on the ancient paths, where our ancient fathers have gone before us.

original: ubhā rājānā svadhayā madantā yamam paśyāsi varuṇaṃ ca devam //
analyzed: ubhā rājānā svadhayā madantā yamam paśyāsi varuṇam ca devam
translated: The two Kings rejoice in their own nature. Thou shalt see Yama and the God Varuna.

original: saṃ gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ saṃ yameneṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman /
analyzed: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena iṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman
translated: Go to the Fathers, go to Yama, with the sacrifice and the fulfilment of sacrifice, in the highest heaven.

original: hitvāyāvadyam punar astam ehi saṃ gacchasva tanvā suvarcāḥ //
analyzed: hitvā ayāvadyam punar astam ehi sam gacchasva tanvā su varcāḥ
translated: Having left the blameworthy, come back again to the abode. Go to thy body with good light.

original: apeta vīta vi ca sarpatāto 'smā etam pitaro lokam akran /
analyzed: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas sma etam pitaraḥ lokam akran
translated: Go away, go away, and creep away from here. The Fathers have made this world for these (men).

original: ahobhir adbhir aktubhir vyaktaṃ yamo dadāty avasānam asmai //
analyzed: ahobhiḥ adbhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadāti avasānam asmai
translated: With days, with waters, with the rays of light, Yama gives him a resting-place.

original: ati drava sārameyau śvānau caturakṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā /
analyzed: ati drava sārameyau śvānau catur akṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā
translated: Pass by the two dogs, the mongrels, the four-eyed, the speckled, by the good path.

original: athā pitṝn suvidatrāṃ upehi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti //
analyzed: athā pitṝn suvidatrām upehi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti
translated: Then go to the Pitrs who are very bountiful, with whom Yama rejoices in the feast.

original: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau caturakṣau pathirakṣī nṛcakṣasau /
analyzed: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau catur akṣau pathirakṣī nṛ cakṣasau
translated: The two dogs, O Yama, who are thy guardians, the four-eyed, the path-guardians, who look on men,

original: tābhyām enam pari dehi rājan svasti cāsmā anamīvaṃ ca dhehi //
analyzed: tābhyām enam pari dehi rājan svasti ca asmai anamīvam ca dhehi
translated: To them, O king, deliver him, and give him welfare and freedom from disease.

original: urūṇasāv asutṛpā udumbalau yamasya dūtau carato janāṃ anu /
analyzed: uru nasau asu tṛpau udumbalau yamasya dūtau carataḥ janān anu
translated: The two with broad hips, not satiated, the two udumbara trees, Yama's messengers, move along among the people.

original: tāv asmabhyaṃ dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adyeha bhadram //
analyzed: tau asmabhyam dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adyā iha bhadram
translated: To us may they give back to-day the life-breath for the sight of the sun, and good fortune.

original: yamāya somaṃ sunuta yamāya juhutā haviḥ /🔽yamaṃ ha yajño gacchaty agnidūto araṅkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: yamāya somam sunuta yamāya juhuta haviḥ  yamam ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṅkṛtaḥ
translated: Press out the Soma for Yama, offer the oblation to Yama.🔽For Yama goes the sacrifice, with Agni as its messenger, well-prepared.

original: yamāya ghṛtavad dhavir juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata /
analyzed: yamāya ghṛtavat haviḥ juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
translated: To Yama offer the ghee-filled oblation, and step forward.

original: sa no deveṣv ā yamad dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase //
analyzed: sa naḥ deveṣu ā yamat dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase
translated: May he allot to us among the gods a long life for the sake of living.

original: yamāya madhumattamaṃ rājñe havyaṃ juhotana /
analyzed: yamāya madhumattamam rājñe havyam juhotana
translated: To Yama, the king, offer the oblation most rich in honey.

original: idaṃ nama ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ //
analyzed: idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrva jebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
translated: This homage to the Rishis, the ancient ones, the creators of the path for the former ones.

original: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaḷ urvīr ekam id bṛhat /
analyzed: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaḍ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat
translated: It falls with the Trikadrukas, the six vast ones, and the one great one.

original: triṣṭub gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yama āhitā //
analyzed: triṣṭubh gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yame āhitā
translated: The Tristubh, the Gayatri, all the meters are offered to Yama.

original: ud īratām avara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ /
analyzed: ud īratām avare ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ
translated: Let the lower, the higher, and the middle fathers who are worthy of Soma rise up.

original: asuṃ ya īyur avṛkā ṛtajñās te no 'vantu pitaro haveṣu //
analyzed: asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ vantu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: Those who have gone to the world of the righteous, who are free from enmity and know the truth, may those fathers protect us in our invocations.

original: idam pitṛbhyo namo astv adya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ /
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye uparāsaḥ īyuḥ
translated: Today let there be homage to the fathers, to those who have gone before and those who have come after,

original: ye pārthive rajasy ā niṣattā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsu vikṣu //
analyzed: ye pārthive rajasi ā niṣattāḥ ye vā nūnam su vṛjanāsu vikṣu
translated: to those who are seated in the earthly realm, and to those who are now in the good gatherings of the people.

original: āham pitṝn suvidatrāṃ avitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ ca viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: ā aham pitṝn suvidatrām avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ
translated: I have found the very generous fathers, the son of the fallen and the stride of Vishnu.

original: barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvas ta ihāgamiṣṭhāḥ //🔽barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūty arvāg imā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam /
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te iha āgamiṣṭhāḥ  barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūtī arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam
translated: Those who sit on the sacrificial grass and enjoy the oblation with their own nature, they are the most worthy to come here.🔽O fathers who sit on the sacrificial grass, come hitherward. We have prepared these offerings for you. Accept them.

original: ta ā gatāvasā śantamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yor arapo dadhāta //
analyzed: te ā gata avasā śantamena athā naḥ śam yos arapaḥ dadhāta
translated: Come to us with the most auspicious favor, and grant us peace and freedom from disease.

original: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu
translated: The fathers who are worthy of Soma are invoked in the dear abodes on the sacrificial grass.

original: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantv adhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān //
analyzed: te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te vantu asmān
translated: May they come hither, may they listen here, may they approve of this (sacrifice), may they help us.

original: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve /
analyzed: ācya jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya imam yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve
translated: Sitting down on the right side, bending your knees, praise this sacrifice, O All-gods.

original: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma //
analyzed: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: Do not injure us, O Fathers, in any way, for any sin we have committed against you.

original: āsīnāso aruṇīnām upasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: Seated on the lap of the red (cows), bestow wealth on the mortal who offers.

original: putrebhyaḥ pitaras tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata ta ihorjaṃ dadhāta //
analyzed: putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjam dadhāta
translated: O Fathers, grant to your sons a portion of that wealth, and bestow strength upon him here.

original: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso 'nūhire somapīthaṃ vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ nūhire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Those most excellent Fathers of ours who have gone to the drinking of the Soma, who have gone to the drinking of the Soma,

original: tebhir yamaḥ saṃrarāṇo havīṃṣy uśann uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu //
analyzed: tebhiḥ yamaḥ saṃrarāṇaḥ havīṃṣi uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu
translated: with them may Yama, rejoicing, eat the oblations, he who delights in those who delight in him.

original: ye tātṛṣur devatrā jehamānā hotrāvida stomataṣṭāso arkaiḥ /
analyzed: ye tātṛṣuḥ devatrā jehamānāḥ hotrā vidaḥ stoma taṣṭāsaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: Those who have thirsted, striving to reach the gods, the finders of the priestly office, the makers of the hymn with their hymns,

original: āgne yāhi suvidatrebhir arvāṅ satyaiḥ kavyaiḥ pitṛbhir gharmasadbhiḥ //
analyzed: ā agne yāhi suvidatrebhiḥ arvāṅ satyaiḥ kavyaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, with the very bountiful, with the true, with the Fathers who sit in the heat, with the Kavyas.

original: ye satyāso havirado haviṣpā indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: ye satyāsaḥ haviḥ adaḥ haviṣpāḥ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham dadhānāḥ
translated: Those who are true, who eat the oblation, who eat the sacrificial food, who have yoked Indra with the gods in the chariot,

original: āgne yāhi sahasraṃ devavandaiḥ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ pitṛbhir gharmasadbhiḥ //
analyzed: ā agne yāhi sahasram deva vandaiḥ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, with a thousand, with the divine worshippers, with the Fathers who sit in the heat, with the former ones.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha gacchata sadaḥsadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ /
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥ sadaḥ sadata su praṇītayaḥ
translated: O Fathers who have the fire as your world, come hither, well-guided, sit in the seat of the pious.

original: attā havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣy athā rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ dadhātana //
analyzed: atta havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣi athā rayim sarva vīram dadhātana
translated: Accept the offered oblations on the sacred grass, and then bestow upon us wealth with brave sons.

original: tvam agna īḷito jātavedo 'vāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī /
analyzed: tvam agne īḍitaḥ jātavedaḥ vār havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī
translated: You, O Agni, being invoked, O all-knower, having made the sacrificial dishes fragrant,

original: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣann addhi tvaṃ deva prayatā havīṃṣi //
analyzed: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi
translated: Have given them to the Fathers, they have eaten them with their own portion. Eat, O God, the offered oblations.

original: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yāṃś ca vidma yāṃ u ca na pravidma /
analyzed: ye ca iha pitaraḥ ye ca na iha yān ca vidma yān u ca na pravidma
translated: Those Fathers who are here, and those who are not here, whom we know, and whom we do not know,

original: tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhir yajñaṃ sukṛtaṃ juṣasva //
analyzed: tvam vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiḥ yajñam su kṛtam juṣasva
translated: You know them, O all-knower. Accept with your own portion this well-performed sacrifice.

original: ye agnidagdhā ye anagnidagdhā madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante /
analyzed: ye agni dagdhāḥ ye an agni dagdhāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante
translated: Those who are burnt by fire, and those who are not burnt by fire, who rejoice in their own portion in the middle of the sky,

original: tebhiḥ svarāḷ asunītim etāṃ yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ kalpayasva //
analyzed: tebhiḥ svarāj asu nītim etām yathāvaśam tanvam kalpayasva
translated: With them, O all-knower, arrange this funeral rite according to your own will.

original: mainam agne vi daho mābhi śoco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo mā śarīram /🔽yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo 'them enam pra hiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ //
analyzed: mā enam agne vi dahaḥ mā abhi śocaḥ mā asya tvacam cikṣipaḥ mā śarīram  yadā śṛtam kṛṇavaḥ jātavedaḥ thā īm enam pra hiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: Do not burn him, O Agni, do not scorch him, do not tear his skin, do not his body.🔽When you have made him ready, O all-knower, then send him forth to the Fathers.

original: śṛtaṃ yadā karasi jātavedo 'them enam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: śṛtam yadā karasi jātavedaḥ thā īm enam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: When you have made him ready, O all-knower, then give him to the Fathers.

original: yadā gacchāty asunītim etām athā devānāṃ vaśanīr bhavāti //
analyzed: yadā gacchāti asunītim etām athā devānām vaśanīḥ bhavāti
translated: When it goes to this evil way, then it becomes subject to the control of the gods.

original: sūryaṃ cakṣur gacchatu vātam ātmā dyāṃ ca gaccha pṛthivīṃ ca dharmaṇā /
analyzed: sūryam cakṣuḥ gacchatu vātam ātmā dyām ca gaccha pṛthivīm ca dharmaṇā
translated: Let your eye go to the sun, let your breath go to the wind, and go to heaven and earth by law.

original: apo vā gaccha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ vā gaccha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ
translated: Go to the waters, if that is good for you there, stand firm in the plants with your bodies.

original: ajo bhāgas tapasā taṃ tapasva taṃ te śocis tapatu taṃ te arciḥ /
analyzed: ajaḥ bhāgaḥ tapasā tam tapasva tam te śociḥ tapatu tam te arciḥ
translated: The goat is your share, burn him with penance, let your flame burn him, let your radiance burn him.

original: yās te śivās tanvo jātavedas tābhir vahainaṃ sukṛtām u lokam //🔽ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyo yas ta āhutaś carati svadhābhiḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ jātavedaḥ tābhiḥ vaha enam su kṛtām u lokam  ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyaḥ yaḥ te āhutaḥ carati svadhābhiḥ
translated: O all-knowing one, with your auspicious forms, carry him to the world of the virtuous.🔽Release him again, O Agni, for the ancestors, he who moves here, offered with the svadhā calls.

original: āyur vasāna upa vetu śeṣaḥ saṃ gacchatāṃ tanvā jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: āyuḥ vasānaḥ upa vetu śeṣaḥ sam gacchatām tanvā jātavedaḥ
translated: May he return with life remaining, may he unite with his body, O all-knowing one.

original: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpa uta vā śvāpadaḥ /
analyzed: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpaḥ uta vā śvāpadaḥ
translated: If the black bird pecked at you, if the ant, the snake, or the beast of prey did,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvād agadaṃ kṛṇotu somaś ca yo brāhmaṇāṃ āviveśa //
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśvāt agadam kṛṇotu somaḥ ca yaḥ brāhmaṇān āviveśa
translated: may Agni, the all-consumer, make that harmless for you, and Soma, who has entered the Brahmins.

original: agner varma pari gobhir vyayasva sam prorṇuṣva pīvasā medasā ca /
analyzed: agneḥ varma pari gobhiḥ vyayasva sam pra ūrṇuṣva pīvasā medasā ca
translated: O Agni, clothe yourself with the armor of the cows, anoint yourself with fat and marrow.

original: net tvā dhṛṣṇur harasā jarhṛṣāṇo dadhṛg vidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte //
analyzed: na id tvā dhṛṣṇuḥ harasā jarhṛṣāṇaḥ dadhṛṣ vidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte
translated: Lest the daring one, burning with heat, should burn thee up, O kindled one.

original: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyo devānām uta somyānām /
analyzed: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyaḥ devānām uta somyānām
translated: Do not, O Agni, be confused about this cup, dear to the gods and to the Soma-drinkers.

original: eṣa yaś camaso devapānas tasmin devā amṛtā mādayante //
analyzed: eṣa yaḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ tasmin devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayante
translated: This is the cup which the gods drink, in which the immortal gods rejoice.

original: kravyādam agnim pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājño gacchatu ripravāhaḥ /
analyzed: kravya adam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājñaḥ gacchatu ripra vāhaḥ
translated: I send away Agni the flesh-eater to a distance; may he, the carrier of impurity, go to the king Yama.

original: ihaivāyam itaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan //
analyzed: iha eva ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan
translated: Here may this other Jâtavedas, well knowing, carry the offering to the gods.

original: yo agniḥ kravyāt praviveśa vo gṛham imam paśyann itaraṃ jātavedasam /
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kravyād praviveśa vaḥ gṛham imam paśyan itaram jātavedasam
translated: That Agni who has entered your house as a flesh-eater, seeing this other Jâtavedas,

original: taṃ harāmi pitṛyajñāya devaṃ sa gharmam invāt parame sadhasthe //
analyzed: tam harāmi pitṛ yajñāya devam sa gharmam invāt parame sadhasthe
translated: I carry him away as a god to the sacrifice to the fathers. Let him impel the hot drink in the highest abode.

original: yo agniḥ kravyavāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kravya vāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣat ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: That Agni who carries the flesh, who shall serve the fathers who strengthen the truth,

original: pred u havyāni vocati devebhyaś ca pitṛbhya ā //
analyzed: pra id u havyāni vocati devebhyaḥ ca pitṛbhyaḥ ā
translated: He shall announce the offerings to the gods and to the fathers.

original: uśantas tvā ni dhīmahy uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi /
analyzed: uśantaḥ tvā ni dhīmahi uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi
translated: We lay thee down, O Agni, being eager; we kindle thee, being eager.

original: uśann uśata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave //
analyzed: uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
translated: Eager, bring the eager fathers to eat the oblation.

original: yaṃ tvam agne samadahas tam u nir vāpayā punaḥ /
analyzed: yam tvam agne samadahaḥ tam u niḥ vāpaya punar
translated: Whom thou hast burnt, O Agni, restore him again.

original: kiyāmbv atra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā //
analyzed: kiyāmbu atra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā
translated: Let the Pākadūrvā grow here in the water, let the Vyalka grow.

original: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati /
analyzed: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati
translated: In the cool one, in the cool-possessing one, in the refreshing one, in the refreshing-possessing one,

original: maṇḍūkyā su saṃ gama imaṃ sv agniṃ harṣaya //
analyzed: maṇḍūkyā su sam gamaḥ imam su agnim harṣaya
translated: in the frog, may this fire be well-kindled and delighted.

original: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇotītīdaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ sam eti /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum kṛṇoti iti idam viśvam bhuvanam sam eti
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ fashions a vehicle for his daughter, and this entire world comes together.

original: yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvato nanāśa //
analyzed: yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā mahaḥ jāyā vivasvataḥ nanāśa
translated: Yama's mother, being carried around, the great wife of Vivasvat, disappeared.

original: apāgūhann amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇām adadur vivasvate /
analyzed: apāgūhan amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇām adaduḥ vivasvate
translated: They concealed the immortal one from mortals, having made her of the same color, they gave her to Vivasvat.

original: utāśvināv abharad yat tad āsīd ajahād u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ //
analyzed: uta aśvinau abharat yat tat āsīt ajahāt u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ
translated: And the two Aśvins took what was there, and the two pairs were lost, and Saranyū.

original: pūṣā tvetaś cyāvayatu pra vidvān anaṣṭapaśur bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: pūṣā tvā itas cyāvayatu pra vidvān a naṣṭa paśuḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: May Pūṣan, the wise one, lead you from here, the protector of the world with undiminished cattle.

original: sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo 'gnir devebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: sa tvā etebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyaḥ gniḥ devebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ
translated: He, giving you over to these fathers, Agni to the gods, to the very generous ones.

original: āyur viśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt /
analyzed: āyuḥ viśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt
translated: Life, the life of all, surrounds you. May Pūṣan protect you on the path in front.

original: yatrāsate sukṛto yatra te yayus tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu //
analyzed: yatra āsate su kṛtaḥ yatra te yayuḥ tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu
translated: Where the well-doers dwell, where they have gone, there may the god Savitr place you.

original: pūṣemā āśā anu veda sarvāḥ so asmāṃ abhayatamena neṣat /
analyzed: pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmām abhayatamena neṣat
translated: Pūṣan knows all these regions. May he lead us by the safest way.

original: svastidā āghṛṇiḥ sarvavīro 'prayucchan pura etu prajānan //
analyzed: svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ prayucchan puras etu prajānan
translated: The giver of welfare, the compassionate one, the hero of all, the one who does not abandon, may he go in front, knowing.

original: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Pūṣan was born on the crossroads of paths, on the crossroads of heaven and the crossroads of earth.

original: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan //
analyzed: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan
translated: To both most beloved abodes he goes and returns, knowing.

original: sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne /
analyzed: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne
translated: They invoke Sarasvatī, the god-adoring one, Sarasvatī, when the sacrifice is being performed.

original: sarasvatīṃ sukṛto ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt //
analyzed: sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt
translated: The well-performing ones call to Sarasvatī. May Sarasvatī grant the offerer a share of the sacrificial food.

original: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayātha svadhābhir devi pitṛbhir madantī /
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī
translated: O Sarasvatī, whom you have approached with your own chariot, O goddess, rejoicing with the fathers,

original: āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayasvānamīvā iṣa ā dhehy asme //
analyzed: āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayasva anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme
translated: Having sat down on this sacrificial grass, rejoice. Bring us food free from disease.

original: sarasvatīṃ yām pitaro havante dakṣiṇā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarasvatīm yām pitaraḥ havante dakṣiṇā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Sarasvatī, whom the fathers invoke, going to the right, taking the sacrifice,

original: sahasrārgham iḷo atra bhāgaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhehi //
analyzed: sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamāneṣu dhehi
translated: Give them a share worth a thousand here, and bestow increase of wealth on the sacrificers.

original: āpo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu /
analyzed: āpaḥ asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena naḥ ghṛta pvaḥ punantu
translated: May the waters, the mothers, purify us. May they, rich in ghee, purify us with ghee.

original: viśvaṃ hi ripram pravahanti devīr ud id ābhyaḥ śucir ā pūta emi //
analyzed: viśvam hi ripram pravahanti devīḥ ud id ābhyaḥ śuciḥ ā pūtaḥ emi
translated: For they, the goddesses, carry away all impurity. Pure and cleansed, I rise up from them.

original: drapsaś caskanda prathamāṃ anu dyūn imaṃ ca yonim anu yaś ca pūrvaḥ /
analyzed: drapsaḥ caskanda prathamām anu dyūn imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ
translated: The drop hath fallen on the first days, on this place of birth and on the former one.

original: samānaṃ yonim anu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomy anu sapta hotrāḥ //
analyzed: samānam yonim anu saṃcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ
translated: I offer the drop that moves along the common place of birth, along the seven priests.

original: yas te drapsa skandati yas te aṃśur bāhucyuto dhiṣaṇāyā upasthāt /
analyzed: yaḥ te drapsaḥ skandati yaḥ te aṃśuḥ bāhu cyutaḥ dhiṣaṇāyāḥ upasthāt
translated: The drop that falls from thee, the juice that slips from thy hand, when thou hast raised the vessel,

original: adhvaryor vā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt taṃ te juhomi manasā vaṣaṭkṛtam //
analyzed: adhvaryoḥ vā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt tam te juhomi manasā vaṣaṭkṛtam
translated: or from the Adhvaryu's strainer, I offer that to thee, with the mental Vashat.

original: yas te drapsa skanno yas te aṃśur avaś ca yaḥ paraḥ srucā /
analyzed: yaḥ te drapsaḥ skannaḥ yaḥ te aṃśuḥ avas ca yaḥ paras srucā
translated: The drop that falls from thee, the juice that slips from thy hand, and what is left behind the ladle,

original: ayaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ saṃ taṃ siñcatu rādhase //
analyzed: ayam devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ sam tam siñcatu rādhase
translated: may this god Brihaspati pour that for thee for prosperity.

original: payasvatīr oṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam vacaḥ
translated: The plants are full of sap, my speech is full of sap.

original: apām payasvad it payas tena mā saha śundhata //
analyzed: apām payasvat id payaḥ tena mā saha śundhata
translated: The sap of the waters is full of sap; with that purify me together.

original: param mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yas te sva itaro devayānāt /
analyzed: param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te svaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt
translated: Go, O Death, along the path that is thine own, other than that which the gods go along.

original: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajāṃ rīriṣo mota vīrān //
analyzed: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajām rīriṣaḥ mā uta vīrān
translated: I speak to thee, O thou that hast eyes and hearest, harm not our children nor our heroes.

original: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanto yad aita drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ padam yopayantaḥ yat aita drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: When ye came hither seeking the place of death, bestowing a longer life, a refuge,

original: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥ pūtā bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ //
analyzed: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: Being refreshed with offspring and wealth, be ye pure, cleansed, and fit for sacrifice.

original: ime jīvā vi mṛtair āvavṛtrann abhūd bhadrā devahūtir no adya /
analyzed: ime jīvāḥ vi mṛtaiḥ āvavṛtran abhūt bhadrā deva hūtiḥ naḥ adya
translated: These living ones have turned away from the dead; today our invocation of the gods has been auspicious.

original: prāñco agāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ //
analyzed: prāñcaḥ agāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: Facing the east, we have gone for the dance and laughter, bestowing a longer life and a safe passage.

original: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu gād aparo artham etam /
analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparaḥ artham etam
translated: I set this boundary for the living; let none of them go away to that other world.

original: śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīr antar mṛtyuṃ dadhatām parvatena //
analyzed: śatam jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīḥ antar mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena
