translated: Let them live a hundred long years; let them place death within the mountain.

original: yathāhāny anupūrvam bhavanti yatha ṛtava ṛtubhir yanti sādhu /
analyzed: yathā ahāni anupūrvam bhavanti yathā ṛtavaḥ ṛtubhiḥ yanti sādhu
translated: As the days follow one another in order, as the seasons go well with the seasons,

original: yathā na pūrvam aparo jahāty evā dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām //🔽ā rohatāyur jarasaṃ vṛṇānā anupūrvaṃ yatamānā yati ṣṭha /
analyzed: yathā na pūrvam aparaḥ jahāti eva dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpaya eṣām  ā rohata āyuḥ jarasam vṛṇānāḥ anupūrvam yatamānāḥ yati stha
translated: As the later one does not abandon the former, O Creator, arrange their life-spans in this way.🔽Ascend, seeking life and old age, striving in order, stand firm.

original: iha tvaṣṭā sujanimā sajoṣā dīrgham āyuḥ karati jīvase vaḥ //🔽imā nārīr avidhavāḥ supatnīr āñjanena sarpiṣā saṃ viśantu /
analyzed: iha tvaṣṭā su janimā sajoṣāḥ dīrgham āyuḥ karati jīvase vaḥ  imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam viśantu
translated: Here Tvastr, well-born, of one mind, makes your life long for you to live.🔽Let these women, not widows, good wives, enter with ointment and ghee.

original: anaśravo 'namīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayo yonim agre //
analyzed: anaśravaḥ namīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre
translated: Without grief, without sickness, with good treasures, let the husbands first ascend to the womb.

original: ud īrṣva nāry abhi jīvalokaṃ gatāsum etam upa śeṣa ehi /
analyzed: ud īrṣva nāri abhi jīva lokam gatāsum etam upa śeṣe ehi
translated: Rise up, O woman, to the world of the living. Come to this dead man as his portion.

original: hastagrābhasya didhiṣos tavedam patyur janitvam abhi sam babhūtha //
analyzed: hasta grābhasya didhiṣoḥ tava idam patyuḥ janitvam abhi sam babhūtha
translated: Thou hast come to the fatherhood of this husband, the fatherhood of the one who held thy hand.

original: dhanur hastād ādadāno mṛtasyāsme kṣatrāya varcase balāya /
analyzed: dhanuḥ hastāt ādadānaḥ mṛtasya asme kṣatrāya varcase balāya
translated: Taking the bow from the dead man's hand, for the sake of his Kshatriya power, his glory, and strength,

original: atraiva tvam iha vayaṃ suvīrā viśvā spṛdho abhimātīr jayema //
analyzed: atra eva tvam iha vayam su vīrāḥ viśvāḥ spṛdhaḥ abhimātīḥ jayema
translated: Here mayst thou be, and we here with good heroes, may we conquer all our enemies and hostilities.

original: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uruvyacasam pṛthivīṃ suśevām /🔽ūrṇamradā yuvatir dakṣiṇāvata eṣā tvā pātu nirṛter upasthāt //
analyzed: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uru vyacasam pṛthivīm su śevām  ūrṇamradā yuvatiḥ dakṣiṇāvataḥ eṣā tvā pātu nirṛteḥ upasthāt
translated: Approach this mother, the earth, wide-ruling, the earth that is kind to all.🔽May this young maiden, whose breasts are like balls of wool, protect thee from the presence of Nirriti.

original: uc chvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ sūpāyanāsmai bhava sūpavañcanā /
analyzed: ud śvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ su upāyanā asmai bhava su upavañcanā
translated: O earth, stretch upwards, do not press him down. Be easy of access to him, easy to step on.

original: mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhy enam bhūma ūrṇuhi //
analyzed: mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: As a mother covers her son with her garment, so cover him, O earth.

original: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mita upa hi śrayantām /
analyzed: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mitaḥ upa hi śrayantām
translated: May the earth, as she stretches upwards, stand firm. May a thousand layers be laid down upon her.

original: te gṛhāso ghṛtaścuto bhavantu viśvāhāsmai śaraṇāḥ santv atra //
analyzed: te gṛhāsaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ bhavantu viśvāhā asmai śaraṇāḥ santu atra
translated: May those houses of yours be full of ghee. May they be for him a shelter for all time.

original: ut te stabhnāmi pṛthivīṃ tvat parīmaṃ logaṃ nidadhan mo ahaṃ riṣam /
analyzed: ud te stabhnāmi pṛthivīm tvat pari imam logam nidadhan mā u aham riṣam
translated: I raise thee up, O earth, as I lay down this altar on thee. Let me not be injured.

original: etāṃ sthūṇām pitaro dhārayantu te 'trā yamaḥ sādanā te minotu //🔽pratīcīne mām ahanīṣvāḥ parṇam ivā dadhuḥ /
analyzed: etām sthūṇām pitaraḥ dhārayantu te trāḥ yamaḥ sādanā te minotu  pratīcīne mām ahanīṣvāḥ parṇam iva ā dadhuḥ
translated: Let the Fathers support this pillar of yours; let Yama here set up your resting-place.🔽The days and nights have placed me in the west, as if I were a leaf.

original: pratīcīṃ jagrabhā vācam aśvaṃ raśanayā yathā //🔽ni vartadhvam mānu gātāsmān siṣakta revatīḥ /
analyzed: pratīcīm jagrabhāḥ vācam aśvam raśanayā yathā  ni vartadhvam mā anu gāta asmān siṣakta revatīḥ
translated: I have seized the speech that goes to the west, as one seizes a horse with a bridle.🔽Turn back, come to us, O ye rich ones, unite with us.

original: agnīṣomā punarvasū asme dhārayataṃ rayim //
analyzed: agnīṣomā punarvasū asme dhārayatam rayim
translated: O Agni and Soma, bringers of wealth, bestow upon us riches.

original: punar enā ni vartaya punar enā ny ā kuru /
analyzed: punar enāḥ ni vartaya punar enāḥ ni ā kuru
translated: Turn them back again, bring them back again.

original: indra eṇā ni yacchatv agnir enā upājatu //
analyzed: indraḥ eṇā ni yacchatu agniḥ enāḥ upājatu
translated: Let Indra keep the sheep, let Agni guard them.

original: punar etā ni vartantām asmin puṣyantu gopatau /
analyzed: punar etāḥ ni vartantām asmin puṣyantu gopatau
translated: Let them turn back again, let them grow in this shepherd.

original: ihaivāgne ni dhārayeha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ //🔽yan niyānaṃ nyayanaṃ saṃjñānaṃ yat parāyaṇam /🔽āvartanaṃ nivartanaṃ yo gopā api taṃ huve //
analyzed: iha eva agne ni dhāraya iha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ  yat niyānam nyayanam saṃjñānam yat parāyaṇam  āvartanam nivartanam yaḥ gopāḥ api tam huve
translated: Here, O Agni, do thou support; here let wealth abide.🔽The going out, the returning, the meeting, the going away,🔽The turning back, the turning round, I invoke him who is the guardian of these.

original: ya udānaḍ vyayanaṃ ya udānaṭ parāyaṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ udānaṭ vyayanam yaḥ udānaṭ parāyaṇam
translated: He who has gone out, who has gone away, who has gone for a long time,

original: āvartanaṃ nivartanam api gopā ni vartatām //
analyzed: āvartanam nivartanam api gopāḥ ni vartatām
translated: The turning back, the turning round, let the guardian turn back again.

original: ā nivarta ni vartaya punar na indra gā dehi /
analyzed: ā nivarta ni vartaya punar naḥ indra gāḥ dehi
translated: Come back, turn back, O Indra, give us our cattle again.

original: jīvābhir bhunajāmahai //
analyzed: jīvābhiḥ bhunajāmahai
translated: Let us enjoy them with our living ones.

original: pari vo viśvato dadha ūrjā ghṛtena payasā /
analyzed: pari vaḥ viśvatas dadhe ūrjā ghṛtena payasā
translated: From every side I place you around with strength, ghee, and milk.

original: ye devāḥ ke ca yajñiyās te rayyā saṃ sṛjantu naḥ //
analyzed: ye devāḥ ke ca yajñiyāḥ te rayyā sam sṛjantu naḥ
translated: May the gods who are worthy of sacrifice unite us with wealth.

original: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya /
analyzed: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya
translated: Turn back, O turning back, turn back, O turning back.

original: bhūmyāś catasraḥ pradiśas tābhya enā ni vartaya //
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ tābhyaḥ enāḥ ni vartaya
translated: From the four quarters of the earth, from them turn back.

original: bhadraṃ no api vātaya manaḥ //
analyzed: bhadram naḥ api vātaya manaḥ
translated: Turn our mind towards good fortune.

original: agnim īḷe bhujāṃ yaviṣṭhaṃ śāsā mitraṃ durdharītum /🔽yasya dharman svar enīḥ saparyanti mātur ūdhaḥ //
analyzed: agnim īḍe bhujām yaviṣṭham śāsā mitram durdharītum  yasya dharman svar enīḥ saparyanti mātuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: I praise Agni, the youngest of the strong, I rule Mitra, who is hard to resist,🔽Whose law the tawny-colored ones honor, the breast of the mother.

original: yam āsā kṛpanīḷam bhāsāketuṃ vardhayanti /
analyzed: yam āsā kṛpa nīḍam bhāsā ketum vardhayanti
translated: Whom they, the helpful ones, increase, the banner of light,

original: bhrājate śreṇidan //
analyzed: bhrājate śreṇidan
translated: He shines, with rows of teeth.

original: aryo viśāṃ gātur eti pra yad ānaḍ divo antān /
analyzed: aryaḥ viśām gātuḥ eti pra yat ānaṭ divaḥ antān
translated: The noble one goes as the path of the people, when he has drawn the ends of the sky,

original: kavir abhraṃ dīdyānaḥ //
analyzed: kaviḥ abhram dīdyānaḥ
translated: The sage, shining, the cloud.

original: juṣad dhavyā mānuṣasyordhvas tasthāv ṛbhvā yajñe /
analyzed: juṣat havyā mānuṣasya ūrdhvaḥ tasthau ṛbhvāḥ yajñe
translated: May he enjoy the offerings of man, standing high, the mighty one at the sacrifice,

original: minvan sadma pura eti //
analyzed: minvan sadma puras eti
translated: Shaping the abode, he goes in front.

original: sa hi kṣemo havir yajñaḥ śruṣṭīd asya gātur eti /
analyzed: sa hi kṣemaḥ haviḥ yajñaḥ śruṣṭī id asya gātuḥ eti
translated: For he is the safe oblation, the sacrifice, his going is heard,

original: agniṃ devā vāśīmantam //
analyzed: agnim devāḥ vāśīmantam
translated: The gods Agni, the powerful one.

original: yajñāsāhaṃ duva iṣe 'gnim pūrvasya śevasya /
analyzed: yajñāsāham duvaḥ iṣe gnim pūrvasya śevasya
translated: For the sake of worship and food, I invoke Agni, the son of the ancient one,

original: adreḥ sūnum āyum āhuḥ //
analyzed: adreḥ sūnum āyum āhuḥ
translated: The son of the mountain, they call him Āyu.

original: naro ye ke cāsmad ā viśvet te vāma ā syuḥ /
analyzed: naraḥ ye ke ca asmat ā viśvā id te vāme ā syuḥ
translated: May all men, whatever they be, be on our side,

original: agniṃ haviṣā vardhantaḥ //
analyzed: agnim haviṣā vardhantaḥ
translated: Increasing Agni with oblations.

original: kṛṣṇaḥ śveto 'ruṣo yāmo asya bradhna ṛjra uta śoṇo yaśasvān /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ śvetaḥ ruṣaḥ yāmaḥ asya bradhnaḥ ṛjraḥ uta śoṇaḥ yaśasvān
translated: Black, white, red is his path, brown and ruddy, glorious,

original: hiraṇyarūpaṃ janitā jajāna //
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpam janitā jajāna
translated: The golden-hued one the creator has created.

original: evā te agne vimado manīṣām ūrjo napād amṛtebhiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: eva te agne vimadaḥ manīṣām ūrjaḥ napāt amṛtebhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Thus, O Agni, thy pure thought, in accord with the immortal ones, with the foot of strength,

original: gira ā vakṣat sumatīr iyāna iṣam ūrjaṃ sukṣitiṃ viśvam ābhāḥ //
analyzed: giraḥ ā vakṣat sumatīḥ iyānaḥ iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim viśvam ābhāḥ
translated: May it bring the praises, going with good thoughts, thou shinest over all the food, strength, and good abode.

original: āgniṃ na svavṛktibhir hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: ā agnim na svavṛktibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose thee, O Agni, as Hotar with our own oblations,

original: yajñāya stīrṇabarhiṣe vi vo made śīram pāvakaśociṣaṃ vivakṣase //🔽tvām u te svābhuvaḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ /
analyzed: yajñāya stīrṇa barhiṣe vi vaḥ made śīram pāvaka śociṣam vivakṣase  tvām u te su ābhuvaḥ śumbhanti aśva rādhasaḥ
translated: For the sacrifice with strewn grass, in your joy, the pure one with flaming radiance, thou expandest.🔽The prosperous ones, O Agni, adorn thee, those who delight in horses as their best gift,

original: veti tvām upasecanī vi vo mada ṛjītir agna āhutir vivakṣase //
analyzed: vā iti tvām upasecanī vi vaḥ madaḥ ṛjītiḥ agne āhutiḥ vivakṣase
translated: The sprinkling (cow) approaches thee. In your joy, the ruddy one, the oblation, O Agni, thou expandest.

original: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīr iva /
analyzed: tve dharmāṇaḥ āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīḥ iva
translated: In thee, O Agni, the laws sit, as if sprinkling with ladles,

original: kṛṣṇā rūpāṇy arjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣe vivakṣase //
analyzed: kṛṣṇā rūpāṇi arjunā vi vaḥ made viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ dhiṣe vivakṣase
translated: The dark and ruddy forms. In your joy, thou placest all the glories. Thou expandest.

original: yam agne manyase rayiṃ sahasāvann amartya /
analyzed: yam agne manyase rayim sahasāvan amartya
translated: That wealth, O Agni, which thou thinkest, O thou who art to be invoked, O immortal one,

original: tam ā no vājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citram ā bharā vivakṣase //
analyzed: tam ā naḥ vājasātaye vi vaḥ made yajñeṣu citram ā bhara vivakṣase
translated: Bring that to us for the winning of booty, at your glad carouse, bring to our sacrifices the wondrous [1] one, thou expandest.

original: agnir jāto atharvaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā /
analyzed: agniḥ jātaḥ atharvaṇā vidat viśvāni kāvyā
translated: Agni, born by Atharvan, hath discovered all the treasures of the wise.

original: bhuvad dūto vivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase //
analyzed: bhuvat dūtaḥ vivasvataḥ vi vaḥ made priyaḥ yamasya kāmyaḥ vivakṣase
translated: He hath become the messenger of Vivasvan, at your glad carouse, dear to Yama, to be longed for, thou expandest.

original: tvāṃ yajñeṣv īḷate 'gne prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: tvām yajñeṣu īḍate gne prayati adhvare
translated: In sacrifices they invite thee, O Agni, when the rite is begun.

original: tvaṃ vasūni kāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase //
analyzed: tvam vasūni kāmyā vi vaḥ made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase
translated: Thou, O desirable one, at your glad carouse, bestowest on the worshipper all treasures, thou expandest.

original: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṃ cārum agne ni ṣedire /
analyzed: tvām yajñeṣu ṛtvijam cārum agne ni sedire
translated: In sacrifices they have placed thee, O Agni, as a lovely priest.

original: ghṛtapratīkam manuṣo vi vo made śukraṃ cetiṣṭham akṣabhir vivakṣase //
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkam manuṣaḥ vi vaḥ made śukram cetiṣṭham akṣabhiḥ vivakṣase
translated: The man with the face of ghee, at your glad carouse, most radiant with the rays, thou expandest.

original: agne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat /
analyzed: agne śukreṇa śociṣā uru prathayase bṛhat
translated: O Agni, with thy bright flame thou spreadest thee out wide.

original: abhikrandan vṛṣāyase vi vo made garbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase //
analyzed: abhikrandan vṛṣāyase vi vaḥ made garbham dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase
translated: Thou bellowest, thou swellest as a bull, at your glad carouse, thou placest seed in the maidens, thou expandest.

original: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminn adya jane mitro na śrūyate /
analyzed: kuha śrutaḥ indraḥ kasmin adya jane mitraḥ na śrūyate
translated: Where is Indra heard of, where this day is Mitra heard of among the people,

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ vā yaḥ kṣaye guhā vā carkṛṣe girā //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām vā yaḥ kṣaye guhā vā carkṛṣe girā
translated: He who in the abode of the Rsis or in the cave [2] is praised with the hymn?

original: iha śruta indro asme adya stave vajry ṛcīṣamaḥ /
analyzed: iha śrutaḥ indraḥ asme adya stave vajrī ṛcīṣamaḥ
translated: Here is Indra heard of, here to-day is the wielder of the thunderbolt, the eager one, to be praised by me,

original: mitro na yo janeṣv ā yaśaś cakre asāmy ā //
analyzed: mitraḥ na yaḥ janeṣu ā yaśaḥ cakre asāmi ā
translated: Who among the people hath made his glory like Mitra, unequalled.

original: maho yas patiḥ śavaso asāmy ā maho nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ /
analyzed: mahaḥ yaḥ patiḥ śavasaḥ asāmi ā mahaḥ nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ
translated: He who is the great lord of strength, who is great in the impulse of manly power,

original: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putram iva priyam //
analyzed: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putram iva priyam
translated: The supporter of the bold thunderbolt, like a father his dear son.

original: yujāno aśvā vātasya dhunī devo devasya vajrivaḥ /
analyzed: yujānaḥ aśvā vātasya dhunī devaḥ devasya vajrivas
translated: Yoking the horses of the wind, the god of the god with the thunderbolt,

original: syantā pathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣy adhvanaḥ //
analyzed: syantā pathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣi adhvanaḥ
translated: The two who go by the path of the sky, I will praise as they are sent forth on their way.

original: tvaṃ tyā cid vātasyāśvāgā ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai /🔽yayor devo na martyo yantā nakir vidāyyaḥ //
analyzed: tvam tyā cit vātasya aśvāgāḥ ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai  yayoḥ devaḥ na martyaḥ yantā nakir vidāyyaḥ
translated: You two, even those swift horses of the wind, are borne by your own impulse,

original: adha gmantośanā pṛcchate vāṃ kadarthā na ā gṛham /
analyzed: adha gmantā uśanā pṛcchate vām kadarthāḥ naḥ ā gṛham
translated: Of which neither a god nor a mortal is the charioteer, nor is there any one to be found who can guide them.🔽Now, having come, O Toṣana, to the questioner, for what purpose have you come to our house?

original: ā jagmathuḥ parākād divaś ca gmaś ca martyam //🔽ā na indra pṛkṣase 'smākam brahmodyatam /
analyzed: ā jagmathuḥ parākāt divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca martyam  ā naḥ indra pṛkṣase smākam brahma udyatam
translated: You two have come from afar, from heaven and earth to the mortal world.🔽O Indra, you are the one who bestows food. Our prayer is raised up to you.

original: tat tvā yācāmahe 'vaḥ śuṣṇaṃ yad dhann amānuṣam //
analyzed: tat tvā yācāmahe vaḥ śuṣṇam yat han amānuṣam
translated: We ask you for that favor, that you slay the evil-minded demon.

original: akarmā dasyur abhi no amantur anyavrato amānuṣaḥ /
analyzed: akarmā dasyuḥ abhi naḥ amantuḥ anya vrataḥ amānuṣaḥ
translated: The Dasyu, who has no work, who is hostile to us, who has a different vow, who is inhuman,

original: tvaṃ tasyāmitrahan vadhar dāsasya dambhaya //🔽tvaṃ na indra śūra śūrair uta tvotāso barhaṇā /
analyzed: tvam tasya amitra han vadhar dāsasya dambhaya  tvam naḥ indra śūra śūraiḥ uta tvotāsaḥ barhaṇā
translated: You, O slayer of enemies, destroy the weapon of that Dāsa.🔽O Indra, the hero, you are to be praised by heroes, and by us who are invoked with reverence,

original: purutrā te vi pūrtayo navanta kṣoṇayo yathā //
analyzed: purutrā te vi pūrtayaḥ navanta kṣoṇayaḥ yathā
translated: Your many deeds are praised, like the fields in the autumn.

original: tvaṃ tān vṛtrahatye codayo nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ /
analyzed: tvam tān vṛtra hatye codayaḥ nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivas
translated: You urged those men to the slaying of Vritra, O hero, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battle with the sword.

original: guhā yadī kavīnāṃ viśāṃ nakṣatraśavasām //
analyzed: guhā yadī kavīnām viśām nakṣatra śavasām
translated: When the abodes of the wise, of the people with the splendor of the stars,

original: makṣū tā ta indra dānāpnasa ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ /
analyzed: makṣū tā te indra dānā apnasaḥ ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivas
translated: Those bountiful gifts of yours, O Indra, O hero, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battle, O Indra, O hero, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battle,

original: yad dha śuṣṇasya dambhayo jātaṃ viśvaṃ sayāvabhiḥ //🔽mākudhryag indra śūra vasvīr asme bhūvann abhiṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: yat ha śuṣṇasya dambhayaḥ jātam viśvam sa yāvabhiḥ  mākudhryak indra śūra vasvīḥ asme bhūvan abhiṣṭayaḥ
translated: When you crushed the entire race of Shushṇa with the all-conquering (forces),🔽Let not, O Indra, O hero, the blessings be far away from us, the protections.

original: vayaṃvayaṃ ta āsāṃ sumne syāma vajrivaḥ //🔽asme tā ta indra santu satyāhiṃsantīr upaspṛśaḥ /🔽vidyāma yāsām bhujo dhenūnāṃ na vajrivaḥ //
analyzed: vayam vayam te āsām sumne syāma vajrivas  asme tā te indra santu satyā a hiṃsantīḥ upaspṛśaḥ  vidyāma yāsām bhujaḥ dhenūnām na vajrivas
translated: May we, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, be in the favor of those (blessings).🔽Let those (blessings) of yours, O Indra, be true for us, the harmless, the refreshing.🔽May we know the sources of those (blessings), O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, like the milch cows.

original: ahastā yad apadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhir vedyānām /
analyzed: a hastā yat a padī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhiḥ vedyānām
translated: When the formless, footless (universe) grows by the powers of the altars,

original: śuṣṇam pari pradakṣiṇid viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ //
analyzed: śuṣṇam pari pradakṣiṇit viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ
translated: You have crushed Shushṇa around for Vishvâkîvîn.

original: pibāpibed indra śūra somam mā riṣaṇyo vasavāna vasuḥ san /
analyzed: piba a piba id indra śūra somam mā riṣaṇyaḥ vasavāna vasuḥ san
translated: Drink, drink, O Indra, O hero, the Soma, be not insatiable, O wealthy one, being rich.

original: uta trāyasva gṛṇato maghono mahaś ca rāyo revatas kṛdhī naḥ //
analyzed: uta trāyasva gṛṇataḥ maghonaḥ mahaḥ ca rāyaḥ revataḥ kṛdhī naḥ
translated: And protect the praisers, the wealthy ones; make great riches flow to us, O prosperous one.

original: yajāmaha indraṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ harīṇāṃ rathyaṃ vivratānām /
analyzed: yajāmahe indram vajra dakṣiṇam harīṇām rathyam vivratānām
translated: We worship Indra, whose right hand wields the thunderbolt, the charioteer of the two bay horses, the independent one.

original: pra śmaśru dodhuvad ūrdhvathā bhūd vi senābhir dayamāno vi rādhasā //
analyzed: pra śmaśru dodhuvat ūrdhvathā bhūt vi senābhiḥ dayamānaḥ vi rādhasā
translated: He has shaken his beard upwards, he has been separated from his armies, he has been separated from his bounty.

original: harī nv asya yā vane vide vasv indro maghair maghavā vṛtrahā bhuvat /
analyzed: harī nu asya yā vane vide vasū indraḥ maghaiḥ maghavā vṛtrahā bhuvat
translated: The two bay horses of him who knows the forest, Indra, the bountiful, the wealthy, the Vrtra-slayer, has become (great) through his riches.

original: ṛbhur vāja ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavo 'va kṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit //
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vājaḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavaḥ vaḥ kṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit
translated: The strong, the powerful, the one who desires strength, rules over power. I crush even the name of the Dāsa.

original: yadā vajraṃ hiraṇyam id athā rathaṃ harī yam asya vahato vi sūribhiḥ /🔽ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśruta indro vājasya dīrghaśravasas patiḥ //
analyzed: yadā vajram hiraṇyam id athā ratham harī yam asya vahataḥ vi sūribhiḥ  ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sana śrutaḥ indraḥ vājasya dīrgha śravasaḥ patiḥ
translated: When he takes the thunderbolt, the golden one, then the chariot which his two bay horses draw along with the nobles,🔽Then the bountiful one, famous in assemblies, Indra, becomes the lord of strength of long fame.

original: so cin nu vṛṣṭir yūthyā svā sacāṃ indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritābhi pruṣṇute /
analyzed: sā u cit nu vṛṣṭiḥ yūthyā svā sacā indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritā abhi pruṣṇute
translated: He, indeed, is the rain-cloud with his own companions. Indra moistens his tawny beard-locks.

original: ava veti sukṣayaṃ sute madhūd id dhūnoti vāto yathā vanam //
analyzed: ava veti su kṣayam sute madhu ud id dhūnoti vātaḥ yathā vanam
translated: He goes down to the good abode, to the pressed (Soma) which brings honey. The wind shakes him as (it does) a tree.

original: yo vācā vivāco mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrāśivā jaghāna /🔽tattad id asya pauṃsyaṃ gṛṇīmasi piteva yas taviṣīṃ vāvṛdhe śavaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vācā vivācaḥ mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrā aśivā jaghāna  tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi pitā iva yaḥ taviṣīm vāvṛdhe śavaḥ
translated: He who with his voice, with his discordant, spiteful voice, has slain many thousands, being victorious,🔽That manly deed of his we extol, he who, like a father, has increased his own strength.

original: stomaṃ ta indra vimadā ajījanann apūrvyam purutamaṃ sudānave /
analyzed: stomam te indra vimadāḥ ajījanan apūrvyam purutamam sudānave
translated: The sober ones have produced for thee, O Indra, the most ancient, most plentiful praise, O bountiful one.

original: vidmā hy asya bhojanam inasya yad ā paśuṃ na gopāḥ karāmahe //
analyzed: vidma hi asya bhojanam inasya yat ā paśum na gopāḥ karāmahe
translated: For we know his food, O Indra, when we make him like a cowherd of cattle.

original: mākir na enā sakhyā vi yauṣus tava cendra vimadasya ca ṛṣeḥ /
analyzed: mākir naḥ enā sakhyā vi yauṣuḥ tava ca indra vimadasya ca ṛṣeḥ
translated: Let not our friendship with you be broken, O Indra, nor with the sage Vimada.

original: vidmā hi te pramatiṃ deva jāmivad asme te santu sakhyā śivāni //
analyzed: vidma hi te pramatim deva jāmi vat asme te santu sakhyā śivāni
translated: For we know thy favour, O God, as if it were our own kinsman. Let thy friendships with us be auspicious.

original: indra somam imam piba madhumantaṃ camū sutam /
analyzed: indra somam imam piba madhumantam camū sutam
translated: O Indra, drink this Soma, rich in sweetness, pressed in the wooden trough.

original: asme rayiṃ ni dhāraya vi vo made sahasriṇam purūvaso vivakṣase //🔽tvāṃ yajñebhir ukthair upa havyebhir īmahe /
analyzed: asme rayim ni dhāraya vi vaḥ made sahasriṇam purūvaso vivakṣase  tvām yajñebhiḥ ukthaiḥ upa havyebhiḥ īmahe
translated: Bestow upon us wealth, in your joy, O you of abundant wealth, in a thousand forms. You are about to expand.🔽We invoke you with sacrifices, hymns, and offerings.

original: śacīpate śacīnāṃ vi vo made śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryaṃ vivakṣase //
analyzed: śacīpate śacīnām vi vaḥ made śreṣṭham naḥ dhehi vāryam vivakṣase
translated: O lord of power, of powers, in your joy, bestow upon us the best of boons. You are about to expand.

original: yas patir vāryāṇām asi radhrasya coditā /
analyzed: yaḥ patiḥ vāryāṇām asi radhrasya coditā
translated: You are the lord of valuable things, the impeller of the poor.

original: indra stotṝṇām avitā vi vo made dviṣo naḥ pāhy aṃhaso vivakṣase //
analyzed: indra stotṝṇām avitā vi vaḥ made dviṣaḥ naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ vivakṣase
translated: O Indra, the helper of the praisers, in your joy, protect us from hatred and affliction. You are about to expand.

original: yuvaṃ śakrā māyāvinā samīcī nir amanthatam /
analyzed: yuvam śakrā māyāvinā samīcī niḥ amanthatam
translated: You two, Shakra and the deceitful one, have churned each other out.

original: vimadena yad īḷitā nāsatyā niramanthatam //🔽viśve devā akṛpanta samīcyor niṣpatantyoḥ /
analyzed: vimadena yat īḍitā nāsatyā niramanthatam  viśve devāḥ akṛpanta samīcyoḥ niṣpatantyoḥ
translated: When you were delighted by the intoxicating drink, O Nâsatyas, you churned each other out.🔽All the gods were alarmed at the two coming together and falling out.

original: nāsatyāv abruvan devāḥ punar ā vahatād iti //
analyzed: nāsatyau abruvan devāḥ punar ā vahatāt iti
translated: The gods said to the Nâsatyas: Bring her back again.

original: madhuman me parāyaṇam madhumat punar āyanam /
analyzed: madhumat me parāyaṇam madhumat punar āyanam
translated: Sweet is my going forth, sweet is my coming in again.

original: tā no devā devatayā yuvam madhumatas kṛtam //
analyzed: tā naḥ devā devatayā yuvam madhumataḥ kṛtam
translated: Do ye, O Gods, make that for us sweet with your godhead.

original: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣam uta kratum /
analyzed: bhadram naḥ api vātaya manaḥ dakṣam uta kratum
translated: Send us good fortune, O Vayu, and mind, and skill, and thought.

original: adhā te sakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇan gāvo na yavase vivakṣase //
analyzed: adhā te sakhye andhasaḥ vi vaḥ made raṇan gāvaḥ na yavase vivakṣase
translated: Then in your joy, O ye of sweet juice, in the banquet of your friendship, let our songs resound like milch-kine lowing in the stable.

original: hṛdispṛśas ta āsate viśveṣu soma dhāmasu /
analyzed: hṛdispṛśaḥ te āsate viśveṣu soma dhāmasu
translated: They sit in the heart's chamber, in all the stations, O Soma.

original: adhā kāmā ime mama vi vo made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavo vivakṣase //
analyzed: adhā kāmāḥ ime mama vi vaḥ made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavaḥ vivakṣase
translated: Then these my wishes, O ye of sweet juice, in your joy, are scattered abroad, seeking for wealth.

original: uta vratāni soma te prāham mināmi pākyā /
analyzed: uta vratāni soma te pra aham mināmi pākyā
translated: And I, O Soma, transgress thy statutes, O thou who art to be invoked in sacrifices.

original: adhā piteva sūnave vi vo made mṛḷā no abhi cid vadhād vivakṣase //
analyzed: adhā pitā iva sūnave vi vaḥ made mṛḍa naḥ abhi cit vadhāt vivakṣase
translated: Then, O Father, as a father to his son, be gracious unto us, O thou of sweet juice, even from slaughter.

original: sam u pra yanti dhītayaḥ sargāso 'vatāṃ iva /
analyzed: sam u pra yanti dhītayaḥ sargāsaḥ vatām iva
translated: The thoughts go forth together, like the rays of the rising sun.

original: kratuṃ naḥ soma jīvase vi vo made dhārayā camasāṃ iva vivakṣase //
analyzed: kratum naḥ soma jīvase vi vaḥ made dhārayā camasān iva vivakṣase
translated: Give us, O Soma, wisdom for life, and fill the bowls as 'twere with juice, O thou of sweet juice.

original: tava tye soma śaktibhir nikāmāso vy ṛṇvire /
analyzed: tava tye soma śaktibhiḥ nikāmāsaḥ vi ṛṇvire
translated: These, O Soma, thy willing ones, have been set free by thy powers.

original: gṛtsasya dhīrās tavaso vi vo made vrajaṃ gomantam aśvinaṃ vivakṣase //
analyzed: gṛtsasya dhīrāḥ tavasaḥ vi vaḥ made vrajam gomantam aśvinam vivakṣase
translated: The wise ones of the bountiful one, O thou of sweet juice, have scattered abroad the stall filled with cattle and horses.

original: paśuṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi purutrā viṣṭhitaṃ jagat /
analyzed: paśum naḥ soma rakṣasi purutrā viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Thou, O Soma, protectest our cattle, the world that standeth in many a place.

original: samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vo made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanā vivakṣase //
analyzed: samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vaḥ made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanā vivakṣase
translated: Thou dost unite them for life. Looking on all the worlds at your glad carouse, thou dost expand.

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato gopā adābhyo bhava /
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma viśvatas gopāḥ adābhyaḥ bhava
translated: Be thou, O Soma, our protector on every side, O thou whom none deceiveth.

original: sedha rājann apa sridho vi vo made mā no duḥśaṃsa īśatā vivakṣase //
analyzed: sedha rājan apa sridhaḥ vi vaḥ made mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśatā vivakṣase
translated: Drive away, O king, our enemies. At your glad carouse, let not the wicked one rule over us. Thou dost expand.

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma sukratur vayodheyāya jāgṛhi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma su kratuḥ vayodheyāya jāgṛhi
translated: Be thou, O Soma, our wise protector, for the man who longs for life.

original: kṣetravittaro manuṣo vi vo made druho naḥ pāhy aṃhaso vivakṣase //
analyzed: kṣetra vittaraḥ manuṣaḥ vi vaḥ made druhaḥ naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ vivakṣase
translated: More skilled in the field of men. At your glad carouse, protect us from the foe's distress. Thou dost expand.

original: tvaṃ no vṛtrahantamendrasyendo śivaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: tvam naḥ vṛtra hantama indrasya indo śivaḥ sakhā
translated: Thou, O Indu, art the most excellent friend of Indra, the slayer of Vr̥itra,

original: yat sīṃ havante samithe vi vo made yudhyamānās tokasātau vivakṣase //
analyzed: yat sīm havante samithe vi vaḥ made yudhyamānāḥ toka sātau vivakṣase
translated: When they call thee to the fight. At your glad carouse, when contending in the conflict for offspring. Thou dost expand.

original: ayaṃ gha sa turo mada indrasya vardhata priyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam gha sa turaḥ madaḥ indrasya vardhata priyaḥ
translated: This is the strong exhilarating drink which exalts Indra, and is dear to him.

original: ayaṃ kakṣīvato maho vi vo made matiṃ viprasya vardhayad vivakṣase //
analyzed: ayam kakṣīvataḥ mahaḥ vi vaḥ made matim viprasya vardhayat vivakṣase
translated: This is Kakshîvân's great delight. At your glad carouse, thou hast exalted the sage's thought. Thou dost expand.

original: ayaṃ viprāya dāśuṣe vājāṃ iyarti gomataḥ /
analyzed: ayam viprāya dāśuṣe vājān iyarti gomataḥ
translated: This sends forth strength to the singer who presents oblations.

original: ayaṃ saptabhya ā varaṃ vi vo made prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ ca tāriṣad vivakṣase //
analyzed: ayam saptabhyaḥ ā varam vi vaḥ made pra andham śroṇam ca tāriṣat vivakṣase
translated: This shall bring to the seven a better gift. At your glad carouse, thou hast delivered the blind and lame. Thou dost expand.

original: pra hy acchā manīṣā spārhā yanti niyutaḥ /
analyzed: pra hi acchā manīṣā spārhāḥ yanti niyutaḥ
translated: These my desires, these longed-for teams, go forth.

original: pra dasrā niyudrathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ //
analyzed: pra dasrā niyut rathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
translated: The wondrous one, the charioteer of the strong car, Pūṣan, the mighty one, has sung.

original: yasya tyan mahitvaṃ vātāpyam ayaṃ janaḥ /
analyzed: yasya tyad mahi tvam vātāpyam ayam janaḥ
translated: Whose greatness, like that of the wind, this people here (praises).

original: vipra ā vaṃsad dhītibhiś ciketa suṣṭutīnām //
analyzed: vipraḥ ā vaṃsat dhītibhiḥ ciketa suṣṭutīnām
translated: The sage shall speak with praises, with the thoughts of the wise, of the most excellent praises.

original: sa veda suṣṭutīnām indur na pūṣā vṛṣā /
analyzed: sa veda suṣṭutīnām induḥ na pūṣā vṛṣā
translated: He knows the most excellent praises, like the bull Pūṣan, the moon.

original: abhi psuraḥ pruṣāyati vrajaṃ na ā pruṣāyati //
analyzed: abhi psuraḥ pruṣāyati vrajam naḥ ā pruṣāyati
translated: The swift one causes rain, he causes rain to the pen, to us.

original: maṃsīmahi tvā vayam asmākaṃ deva pūṣan /
analyzed: maṃsīmahi tvā vayam asmākam deva pūṣan
translated: We shall think of you, O god Pūṣan, for us.

original: matīnāṃ ca sādhanaṃ viprāṇāṃ cādhavam //
analyzed: matīnām ca sādhanam viprāṇām ca ādhavam
translated: And the fulfiller of thoughts, and the leader of the sages.

original: pratyardhir yajñānām aśvahayo rathānām /🔽ṛṣiḥ sa yo manurhito viprasya yāvayatsakhaḥ //
analyzed: pratyardhiḥ yajñānām aśva hayaḥ rathānām  ṛṣiḥ sa yaḥ manuḥ hitaḥ viprasya yāvayat sakhaḥ
translated: The returner of sacrifices, the horse-lover of chariots,🔽The sage who is the friend of Manu, who leads the friend of the sage.

original: ādhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāś ca śucasya ca /
analyzed: ādhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāḥ ca śucasya ca
translated: The lord of the one who is thinking, and of the grief of the sorrowful,

original: vāsovāyo 'vīnām ā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat //🔽ino vājānām patir inaḥ puṣṭīnāṃ sakhā /
analyzed: vāsovāyo vīnām ā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat  inaḥ vājānām patiḥ inaḥ puṣṭīnām sakhā
translated: The garment of the wind, the garments of the sheep, he has cleansed.🔽The lord of the treasures, the friend of the increase,

original: pra śmaśru haryato dūdhod vi vṛthā yo adābhyaḥ //
analyzed: pra śmaśru haryataḥ dūdhot vi vṛthā yaḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The one who has shaken the beard of the cheerful one, who is unassailable,

original: ā te rathasya pūṣann ajā dhuraṃ vavṛtyuḥ /
analyzed: ā te rathasya pūṣan ajāḥ dhuram vavṛtyuḥ
translated: The goats have turned the yoke of your chariot, O Pūṣan,

original: viśvasyārthinaḥ sakhā sanojā anapacyutaḥ //
analyzed: viśvasya arthinaḥ sakhā sanaḥ jāḥ an apacyutaḥ
translated: The friend of all who seek, the one born in the morning, the one who does not fall away.

original: asmākam ūrjā ratham pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam ūrjā ratham pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
translated: Pūṣan, the mighty one, has sung for our chariot, for our strength,

original: bhuvad vājānāṃ vṛdha imaṃ naḥ śṛṇavad dhavam //🔽asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivego yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣam /
analyzed: bhuvat vājānām vṛdhaḥ imam naḥ śṛṇavat dhavam  asat su me jaritar sa abhivegaḥ yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣam
translated: He is the increaser of strength. May he listen to this call of ours.🔽I am ready, O worshipper, to help the sacrificer who presses out the Soma, to crush the wicked who does not give his blessing.

original: anāśīrdām aham asmi prahantā satyadhvṛtaṃ vṛjināyantam ābhum //
analyzed: an āśīḥ dām aham asmi prahantā satya dhvṛtam vṛjināyantam ābhum
translated: I am the destroyer of the wicked who breaks his promise, who is bent on evil.

original: yadīd ahaṃ yudhaye saṃnayāny adevayūn tanvā śūśujānān /
analyzed: yadi id aham yudhaye saṃnayāni adevayūn tanvā śūśujānān
translated: When I go forth to battle against the godless, who are eager to fight with their bodies,

original: amā te tumraṃ vṛṣabham pacāni tīvraṃ sutam pañcadaśaṃ ni ṣiñcam //
analyzed: amā te tumram vṛṣabham pacāni tīvram sutam pañcadaśam ni siñcam
translated: I will cook for thee a tender bull, and pour out the strong Soma juice fifteen times.

original: nāhaṃ taṃ veda ya iti bravīty adevayūn samaraṇe jaghanvān /
analyzed: na aham tam veda yaḥ iti bravīti adevayūn samaraṇe jaghanvān
translated: I know not him who says this, who is bent on slaying the godless in battle.

original: yadāvākhyat samaraṇam ṛghāvad ād id dha me vṛṣabhā pra bruvanti //
analyzed: yadā avākhyat samaraṇam ṛghāvat āt id ha me vṛṣabhā pra bruvanti
translated: When he has uttered the terrible cry of battle, then indeed do my bulls speak to me.

original: yad ajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣv āsaṃ viśve sato maghavāno ma āsan /
analyzed: yat ajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣu āsam viśve sataḥ maghavānaḥ me āsan
translated: When I was among the unknown Vr̥ijanas, all the wealthy ones were on my side.

original: jināmi vet kṣema ā santam ābhum pra taṃ kṣiṇām parvate pādagṛhya //
analyzed: jināmi vet kṣeme ā santam ābhum pra tam kṣiṇām parvate pādagṛhya
translated: I conquer the wicked who is at home. I will crush him, seizing him by the foot on the mountain.

original: na vā u māṃ vṛjane vārayante na parvatāso yad aham manasye /
analyzed: na vai u mām vṛjane vārayante na parvatāsaḥ yat aham manasye
translated: Neither the Vr̥ijanas nor the mountains hinder me when I think of (attacking) them.

original: mama svanāt kṛdhukarṇo bhayāta eved anu dyūn kiraṇaḥ sam ejāt //
analyzed: mama svanāt kṛdhu karṇaḥ bhayāt eva id anu dyūn kiraṇaḥ sam ejāt
translated: Let the deaf man be afraid at the sound of me. Let the sun rise after me day by day.

original: darśan nv atra śṛtapāṃ anindrān bāhukṣadaḥ śarave patyamānān /
analyzed: darśan nu atra śṛta pām an indrān bāhukṣadaḥ śarave patyamānān
translated: Seeing here the un-Indran, the un-cooked, the un-powerful, the un-victorious,

original: ghṛṣuṃ vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyam adhy ū nv eṣu pavayo vavṛtyuḥ //
analyzed: ghṛṣum vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyam adhi u nu eṣu pavayaḥ vavṛtyuḥ
translated: Or those who have reviled the joyous friend, the purifying streams have turned away from them.

original: abhūr v aukṣīr vy u āyur ānaḍ darṣan nu pūrvo aparo nu darṣat /
analyzed: abhūḥ u aukṣīḥ vi u āyuḥ ānaṭ darṣat nu pūrvaḥ aparaḥ nu darṣat
translated: Thou hast been, thou hast waxed great, thou hast extended thy life; thou hast seen the former, thou hast seen the later.

original: dve pavaste pari taṃ na bhūto yo asya pāre rajaso viveṣa //🔽gāvo yavam prayutā aryo akṣan tā apaśyaṃ sahagopāś carantīḥ /
analyzed: dve pavaste pari tam na bhūtaḥ yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ viveṣa  gāvaḥ yavam prayutāḥ aryaḥ akṣan tāḥ apaśyam saha gopāḥ carantīḥ
translated: Thou hast two sheaths; he who hath gone beyond thy boundary in the world of thought,🔽The cows have eaten the barley, the dear ones; I have seen them grazing together with their herdsmen.

original: havā id aryo abhitaḥ sam āyan kiyad āsu svapatiś chandayāte //
analyzed: havāḥ id aryaḥ abhitas sam āyan kiyat āsu sva patiḥ chandayāte
translated: The dear ones have come hither on all sides; how much will the lord of the house favour them?

original: saṃ yad vayaṃ yavasādo janānām ahaṃ yavāda urvajre antaḥ /🔽atrā yukto 'vasātāram icchād atho ayuktaṃ yunajad vavanvān //
analyzed: sam yat vayam yavasādaḥ janānām aham yava ādaḥ urvajre antar  atrā yuktaḥ vasātāram icchāt atha u a yuktam yunajat vavanvān
translated: When we, the eaters of the people's barley, I, the eater of barley, in the wide space,🔽Here, yoked, I seek the unyoked; and, unyoked, I would yoke the yoked, rejoicing.

original: atred u me maṃsase satyam uktaṃ dvipāc ca yac catuṣpāt saṃsṛjāni /🔽strībhir yo atra vṛṣaṇam pṛtanyād ayuddho asya vi bhajāni vedaḥ //
analyzed: atrā id u me maṃsase satyam uktam dvipād ca yat catuṣpād saṃsṛjāni  strībhiḥ yaḥ atra vṛṣaṇam pṛtanyāt ayuddhaḥ asya vi bhajāni vedaḥ
translated: Here I think of thee, of the true word, and of the mingling of the two-footed and four-footed.🔽He who would fight with a woman here for the male, without fighting I would divide his wealth.🔽Whose daughter, though born blind, hath been,

original: yasyānakṣā duhitā jātv āsa kas tāṃ vidvāṃ abhi manyāte andhām /
analyzed: yasya anakṣā duhitā jātu āsa kaḥ tām vidvān abhi manyāte andhām
translated: Who would think of that blind one, the wise one?

original: kataro menim prati tam mucāte ya īṃ vahāte ya īṃ vā vareyāt //
analyzed: kataraḥ menim prati tam mucāte yaḥ īm vahāte yaḥ īm vā vareyāt
translated: Which of you two will release him whom you carry, or whom you would choose?

original: kiyatī yoṣā maryato vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasā vāryeṇa /
analyzed: kiyatī yoṣā maryataḥ vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasā vāryeṇa
translated: How many are the wives of the mortal man, well-pleased with the bride's gifts and with the treasure?

original: bhadrā vadhūr bhavati yat supeśāḥ svayaṃ sā mitraṃ vanute jane cit //
analyzed: bhadrā vadhūḥ bhavati yat supeśāḥ svayam sā mitram vanute jane cit
translated: She is a blessed bride when she is well-adorned; she herself chooses a friend even from among the people.

original: patto jagāra pratyañcam atti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhau varūtham /
analyzed: pattas jagāra pratyañcam atti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhau varūtham
translated: The son has eaten, he eats the one who faces him; with his head he has placed his head as a protection.

original: āsīna ūrdhvām upasi kṣiṇāti nyaṅṅ uttānām anv eti bhūmim //
analyzed: āsīnaḥ ūrdhvām upasi kṣiṇāti nyaṅ uttānām anu eti bhūmim
translated: Sitting he strikes the upright one with his foot; he follows the prone one down to the ground.

original: bṛhann acchāyo apalāśo arvā tasthau mātā viṣito atti garbhaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhan acchāyaḥ apalāśaḥ arvā tasthau mātā viṣitaḥ atti garbhaḥ
translated: The great one, without shade, without leaves, the young one, stands; the mother, stretched out, eats the son.

original: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenur ūdhaḥ //
analyzed: anyasyāḥ vatsam rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: Licking the calf of another, she, the milch cow, has settled down with what portion?

original: sapta vīrāso adharād ud āyann aṣṭottarāttāt sam ajagmiran te /
analyzed: sapta vīrāsaḥ adharāt ud āyan aṣṭa uttarāttāt sam ajagmiran te
translated: Seven heroes have come up from below; eight have come together from above.

original: nava paścātāt sthivimanta āyan daśa prāk sānu vi tiranty aśnaḥ //
analyzed: nava paścātāt sthivimantaḥ āyan daśa prāk sānu vi tiranti aśnaḥ
translated: Nine have come from the west with the stable; ten, with the ridge, have extended the food in front.

original: daśānām ekaṃ kapilaṃ samānaṃ taṃ hinvanti kratave pāryāya /
analyzed: daśānām ekam kapilam samānam tam hinvanti kratave pāryāya
translated: The tawny one, the common one of the ten, them they urge on to the fulfilment of their purpose.

original: garbham mātā sudhitaṃ vakṣaṇāsv avenantaṃ tuṣayantī bibharti //
analyzed: garbham mātā sudhitam vakṣaṇāsu a venantam tuṣayantī bibharti
translated: The mother bears the well-formed embryo in her womb, nourishing it, causing it to grow.

original: pīvānam meṣam apacanta vīrā nyuptā akṣā anu dīva āsan /
analyzed: pīvānam meṣam apacanta vīrāḥ nyuptāḥ akṣāḥ anu dīvaḥ āsan
translated: The heroes cooked the fatted ram; the dice were cast; the gambling took place.

original: dvā dhanum bṛhatīm apsv antaḥ pavitravantā carataḥ punantā //
analyzed: dvā dhanum bṛhatīm apsu antar pavitravantā carataḥ punantā
translated: Two bows, the great one, in the waters, moving, purifying, with a strainer.

original: vi krośanāso viṣvañca āyan pacāti nemo nahi pakṣad ardhaḥ /
analyzed: vi krośanāsaḥ viṣvañcaḥ āyan pacāti nemaḥ nahi pakṣat ardhaḥ
translated: The far-reaching ones went out in all directions. The one without a joint cooks, not the one with a joint.

original: ayam me devaḥ savitā tad āha drvanna id vanavat sarpirannaḥ //
analyzed: ayam me devaḥ savitā tat āha dru annaḥ id vanavat sarpiḥ annaḥ
translated: This god Savitar says that to me. He who eats food eats clarified butter.

original: apaśyaṃ grāmaṃ vahamānam ārād acakrayā svadhayā vartamānam /
analyzed: apaśyam grāmam vahamānam ārāt acakrayā svadhayā vartamānam
translated: I saw the village being carried away from afar, moving by its own unchanging law.

original: siṣakty aryaḥ pra yugā janānāṃ sadyaḥ śiśnā pramināno navīyān //
analyzed: siṣakti aryaḥ pra yugā janānām sadyas śiśnā praminānaḥ navīyān
translated: The noble one yokes the teams of men, the new one, measuring with his penis, quickly.

original: etau me gāvau pramarasya yuktau mo ṣu pra sedhīr muhur in mamandhi /
analyzed: etau me gāvau pramarasya yuktau mā u su pra sedhīḥ muhur id mamandhi
translated: These two oxen of mine are yoked for the swift one. Do not be slow, but cook quickly.

original: āpaś cid asya vi naśanty arthaṃ sūraś ca marka uparo babhūvān //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asya vi naśanti artham sūraḥ ca markaḥ uparaḥ babhūvān
translated: Even the waters destroy his purpose. The sun and the monkey have become his superiors.

original: ayaṃ yo vajraḥ purudhā vivṛtto 'vaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥ purīṣāt /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ vajraḥ purudhā vivṛttaḥ vaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥ purīṣāt
translated: This thunderbolt, which has been split in many places, is from the great light of the sun.

original: śrava id enā paro anyad asti tad avyathī jarimāṇas taranti //
analyzed: śravaḥ id enā paras anyat asti tat avyathī jarimāṇaḥ taranti
translated: There is fame beyond this. There is something else. They cross it, not decaying, in their old age.

original: vṛkṣevṛkṣe niyatā mīmayad gaus tato vayaḥ pra patān pūruṣādaḥ /
analyzed: vṛkṣevṛkṣe niyatā mīmayat gauḥ tatas vayaḥ pra patān pūruṣādaḥ
translated: The cow, fixed on every tree, is made to low. From there the bird, the man-eater, flies away.

original: athedaṃ viśvam bhuvanam bhayāta indrāya sunvad ṛṣaye ca śikṣat //
analyzed: athā idam viśvam bhuvanam bhayāt indrāya sunvat ṛṣaye ca śikṣat
translated: Then this whole world, in fear, submitted to Indra and to the Ṛṣi.

original: devānām māne prathamā atiṣṭhan kṛntatrād eṣām uparā ud āyan /
analyzed: devānām māne prathamāḥ atiṣṭhan kṛntatrāt eṣām uparāḥ ud āyan
translated: They stood in the highest honour of the gods, from their cutting, these have arisen.

original: trayas tapanti pṛthivīm anūpā dvā bṛbūkaṃ vahataḥ purīṣam //
analyzed: trayaḥ tapanti pṛthivīm anūpāḥ dvā bṛbūkam vahataḥ purīṣam
translated: Three burn the earth with heat, two carry the dust of the Bṛbūka.

original: sā te jīvātur uta tasya viddhi mā smaitādṛg apa gūhaḥ samarye /
analyzed: sā te jīvātuḥ uta tasya viddhi mā smā etādṛś apa gūhaḥ samarye
translated: That is thy life, and know thou that of him; hide not such a one in the battle.

original: āviḥ svaḥ kṛṇute gūhate busaṃ sa pādur asya nirṇijo na mucyate //
analyzed: āvis svar kṛṇute gūhate busam sa pāduḥ asya nirṇijaḥ na mucyate
translated: He makes the light manifest, he conceals the bush; he is not freed from his cleansing.

original: viśvo hy anyo arir ājagāma mamed aha śvaśuro nā jagāma /
analyzed: viśvaḥ hi anyaḥ ariḥ ājagāma mama id aha śvaśuraḥ nā jagāma
translated: For every other foe hath come, but this my father-in-law hath not come.

original: jakṣīyād dhānā uta somam papīyāt svāśitaḥ punar astaṃ jagāyāt //
analyzed: jakṣīyāt dhānāḥ uta somam papīyāt su āśitaḥ punar astam jagāyāt
translated: He should eat barley, and drink Soma, well-fed, he should go back again to his home.

original: sa roruvad vṛṣabhas tigmaśṛṅgo varṣman tasthau varimann ā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: sa roruvat vṛṣabhaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ varṣman tasthau variman ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He hath roared, the bull with sharp horns, he hath stood in the breadth of the earth's wide expanse.

original: viśveṣv enaṃ vṛjaneṣu pāmi yo me kukṣī sutasomaḥ pṛṇāti //🔽adriṇā te mandina indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvam eṣām /
analyzed: viśveṣu enam vṛjaneṣu pāmi yaḥ me kukṣī suta somaḥ pṛṇāti  adriṇā te mandinaḥ indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvam eṣām
translated: I spare him in all the contests, who fills my flanks, the Soma-presser.🔽With the stone, O thou who art to be praised, O Indra, they press for thee the Soma juices; thou drinkest of them.

original: pacanti te vṛṣabhāṃ atsi teṣām pṛkṣeṇa yan maghavan hūyamānaḥ //
analyzed: pacanti te vṛṣabhān atsi teṣām pṛkṣeṇa yat maghavan hūyamānaḥ
translated: They cook the bull for thee, thou eatest of them, when, O bountiful one, thou art invoked with the oblation.

original: idaṃ su me jaritar ā cikiddhi pratīpaṃ śāpaṃ nadyo vahanti /
analyzed: idam su me jaritar ā cikiddhi pratīpam śāpam nadyaḥ vahanti
translated: Mark this for me, O singer, how the rivers bear away the curse that turns upon ourselves.

original: lopāśaḥ siṃham pratyañcam atsāḥ kroṣṭā varāhaṃ nir atakta kakṣāt //🔽kathā ta etad aham ā ciketaṃ gṛtsasya pākas tavaso manīṣām /
analyzed: lopāśaḥ siṃham pratyañcam atsāḥ kroṣṭā varāham niḥ atakta kakṣāt  kathā te etat aham ā ciketam gṛtsasya pākaḥ tavasaḥ manīṣām
translated: The wolf hath torn the lion, the jackal the boar from the hollow.🔽How have I come to know this, the thought of the active, the wise?

original: tvaṃ no vidvāṃ ṛtuthā vi voco yam ardhaṃ te maghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ //
analyzed: tvam naḥ vidvān ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ yam ardham te maghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ
translated: Thou, O wise one, declare to us in due season, O bountiful one, that half of thine which is to be desired.

original: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ vardhayanti divaś cin me bṛhata uttarā dhūḥ /
analyzed: eva hi mām tavasam vardhayanti divaḥ cit me bṛhataḥ uttarā dhūḥ
translated: For thus they strengthen me, the active one: my highest thought is even from the lofty heaven.

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākam aśatruṃ hi mā janitā jajāna //
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākam aśatrum hi mā janitā jajāna
translated: I slay many thousands at once: for I was born by my father to be without an enemy.

original: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ jajñur ugraṃ karmankarman vṛṣaṇam indra devāḥ /
analyzed: eva hi mām tavasam jajñuḥ ugram karman karman vṛṣaṇam indra devāḥ
translated: For thus the gods, O Indra, have known me, the active, the strong, the mighty in every deed.

original: vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasāno 'pa vrajam mahinā dāśuṣe vam //
analyzed: vadhīm vṛtram vajreṇa mandasānaḥ pa vrajam mahinā dāśuṣe vam
translated: I have slain Vritra with the bolt, rejoicing, and for the worshipper have opened the stall with might.

original: devāsa āyan paraśūṃr abibhran vanā vṛścanto abhi viḍbhir āyan /
analyzed: devāsaḥ āyan paraśūṃr abibhran vanā vṛścantaḥ abhi viḍbhiḥ āyan
translated: The gods have come, bearing their axes, cutting down the woods, coming with the people.

original: ni sudrvaṃ dadhato vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭam anu tad dahanti //
analyzed: ni su drvam dadhataḥ vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭam anu tat dahanti
translated: They have laid the well-fashioned (wood) in their laps, where they burn the charcoal.

original: śaśaḥ kṣuram pratyañcaṃ jagārādriṃ logena vy abhedam ārāt /
analyzed: śaśaḥ kṣuram pratyañcam jagāra adrim logena vi abhedam ārāt
translated: The hare hath swallowed the sharp-edged (razor), the stone hath been cleft in twain by the wedge.

original: bṛhantaṃ cid ṛhate randhayāni vayad vatso vṛṣabhaṃ śūśuvānaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhantam cit ṛhate randhayāni vayat vatsaḥ vṛṣabham śūśuvānaḥ
translated: I would win even the mighty one to my aid, as the young calf, eager to suck, wins the bull.

original: suparṇa itthā nakham ā siṣāyāvaruddhaḥ paripadaṃ na siṃhaḥ /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ itthā nakham ā siṣāya avaruddhaḥ paripadam na siṃhaḥ
translated: Like a bird here he has seized the nail; like a lion he is held fast in the foot-fetter.

original: niruddhaś cin mahiṣas tarṣyāvān godhā tasmā ayathaṃ karṣad etat //
analyzed: niruddhaḥ cit mahiṣaḥ tarṣyāvān godhā tasmai ayatham karṣat etat
translated: Even the mighty buffalo, when thirsty, is held fast; the alligator drags him by the mouth.

original: tebhyo godhā ayathaṃ karṣad etad ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipīyanty annaiḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ godhāḥ ayatham karṣat etat ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipīyanti annaiḥ
translated: For them the alligator drags the mouth; for those who are nourished with food from the Brahman.

original: sima ukṣṇo 'vasṛṣṭāṃ adanti svayam balāni tanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ //
analyzed: simaḥ ukṣṇaḥ adanti svayam balāni tanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ
translated: They eat the released bull, their own strength, rending their bodies.

original: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ soma ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ soma ukthaiḥ
translated: They have become very friendly with the shami trees, who have urged their bodies with Soma and hymns.

original: nṛvad vadann upa no māhi vājān divi śravo dadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ //
analyzed: nṛvat vadan upa naḥ māhi vājān divi śravaḥ dadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ
translated: Speaking like a man, bring us strength; in heaven you have established fame, a hero's name.

original: vane na vā yo ny adhāyi cākañ chucir vāṃ stomo bhuraṇāv ajīgaḥ /
analyzed: vane na vā yaḥ ni adhāyi cākam śuciḥ vām stomaḥ bhuraṇau ajīgaḥ
translated: He who has laid down his bow in the forest, like one who is tired, your pure praise, O two swift ones, has succeeded.

original: yasyed indraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ naryo nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān //
analyzed: yasya id indraḥ puru dineṣu hotā nṛṇām naryaḥ nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān
translated: Whose priest Indra is among many people, the best of men, the protector of men.

original: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtamasya nṛṇām /
analyzed: pra te asyāḥ uṣasaḥ pra aparasyāḥ nṛtau syāma nṛtamasya nṛṇām
translated: In the morning and evening rites of this your sacrifice may we be, of men, with the best men.

original: anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yo asat sasavān //
analyzed: anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahat nṝn kutsena rathaḥ yaḥ asat sasavān
translated: Following Trishoka, the chariot with Kutsa, which will be, with a hundred, bringing men.

original: kas te mada indra rantyo bhūd duro giro abhy ugro vi dhāva /
analyzed: kaḥ te madaḥ indra rantyaḥ bhūt duraḥ giraḥ abhī ugraḥ vi dhāva
translated: What is thy joy, O Indra, what the path of thy songs? Run thou unto me, O mighty one.

original: kad vāho arvāg upa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyām upamaṃ rādho annaiḥ //🔽kad u dyumnam indra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan na āgan /
analyzed: kad vāho arvāk upa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyām upamam rādhaḥ annaiḥ  kad u dyumnam indra tvāvataḥ nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kad naḥ āgan
translated: When will thy car come near me? When will my thoughts? How may I win thee with food, O thou who art to be won?🔽When wilt thou, O Indra, be the glory of the men who are thine own? By what thought wilt thou come to us?

original: mitro na satya urugāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yad asan manīṣāḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ na satyaḥ uru gāya bhṛtyāḥ anne samasya yat asan manīṣāḥ
translated: Like a true friend, O thou of wide dominion, when the food is ready, let thy thoughts be with us.

original: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā iva gman /
analyzed: preraya sūraḥ artham na pāram ye asya kāmam janidhāḥ iva gman
translated: Send forth the sun to his goal, to the farther shore, those who have attained his wish as if to a birthplace.

original: giraś ca ye te tuvijāta pūrvīr nara indra pratiśikṣanty annaiḥ //
analyzed: giraḥ ca ye te tuvi jāta pūrvīḥ naraḥ indra pratiśikṣanti annaiḥ
translated: And those many hymns of thine, O thou who art highly born, O Indra, the men strive to win by food.

original: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyaur majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena /
analyzed: mātre nu te su mite indra pūrvī dyauḥ majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena
translated: O Indra, thy two wide-extended measures, heaven and earth, are by their nature distinct.

original: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantu pītaye madhūni //
analyzed: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantu pītaye madhūni
translated: Let the pressed juices, rich in ghee, be sweet for thee to drink, and the meath.

original: ā madhvo asmā asicann amatram indrāya pūrṇaṃ sa hi satyarādhāḥ /
analyzed: ā madhvaḥ asmai asican amatram indrāya pūrṇam sa hi satya rādhāḥ
translated: They have poured the honey-mixture into the drinking-vessel for Indra, for he is the fulfiller of promises.

original: sa vāvṛdhe varimann ā pṛthivyā abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiś ca //
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhe variman ā pṛthivyāḥ abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ ca
translated: He hath grown in greatness beyond the earth, the man, by his wisdom and manly deeds.

original: vy ānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā āsmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: vi ānaṭ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ su ojāḥ ā asmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ
translated: Indra hath scattered the enemies, the mighty ones. Many strive to win his friendship.

original: ā smā rathaṃ na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse //
analyzed: ā smā ratham na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse
translated: Do thou mount the chariot in battles, which thou dost urge on with good will and fair intention.

original: pra devatrā brahmaṇe gātur etv apo acchā manaso na prayukti /
analyzed: pra devatrā brahmaṇe gātuḥ etu apaḥ acchā manasaḥ na prayukti
translated: Let the course go to the gods to the Brahman, to the waters, as the impulse of the mind.

original: mahīm mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim pṛthujrayase rīradhā suvṛktim //🔽adhvaryavo haviṣmanto hi bhūtācchāpa itośatīr uśantaḥ /
analyzed: mahīm mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim pṛthujrayase rīradhā suvṛktim  adhvaryavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ hi bhūtāt śa apaḥ ita uśatīḥ uśantaḥ
translated: Spread out to the far-reaching one the great hymn of praise of Mitra and Varuna, the fair laud.🔽O Adhvaryus, be ye full of oblations, eager to go forth from here with speed and joy.

original: ava yāś caṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇas tam āsyadhvam ūrmim adyā suhastāḥ //
analyzed: ava yāḥ caṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ tam āsyadhvam ūrmim adya su hastāḥ
translated: The red bird looks down upon the wave; with your fair hands take that to you this day.

original: adhvaryavo 'pa itā samudram apāṃ napātaṃ haviṣā yajadhvam /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ paḥ ita samudram apām napātam haviṣā yajadhvam
translated: O Adhvaryus, worship with oblations the waters, the ocean, the son of the waters.

original: sa vo dadad ūrmim adyā supūtaṃ tasmai somam madhumantaṃ sunota //
analyzed: sa vaḥ dadat ūrmim adyā su pūtam tasmai somam madhumantam sunota
translated: He will give you today a well-purified wave; for him press out the Soma mixed with honey.

original: yo anidhmo dīdayad apsv antar yaṃ viprāsa īḷate adhvareṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ anidhmaḥ dīdayat apsu antar yam viprāsaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu
translated: He who shines in the waters without fuel, whom the sages invoke in the sacrifices,

original: apāṃ napān madhumatīr apo dā yābhir indro vāvṛdhe vīryāya //
analyzed: apām napāt madhumatīḥ apaḥ dāḥ yābhiḥ indraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāya
translated: Give the waters of the son of the waters, the sweet waters, by which Indra grew in strength.

original: yābhiḥ somo modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhir yuvatibhir na maryaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ somaḥ modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiḥ yuvatibhiḥ na maryaḥ
translated: By which (waters) Soma rejoices and delights, as a youth with fair maidens.

original: tā adhvaryo apo acchā parehi yad āsiñcā oṣadhībhiḥ punītāt //
analyzed: tāḥ adhvaryo apaḥ acchā parehi yat āsiñcaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ punītāt
translated: Go to those waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify what thou shalt pour out with the plants.

original: eved yūne yuvatayo namanta yad īm uśann uśatīr ety accha /
analyzed: eva id yūne yuvatayaḥ namanta yat īm uśan uśatīḥ eti accha
translated: Even thus the young men bow to the young women, when, eager, the eager ones come together.

original: saṃ jānate manasā saṃ cikitre 'dhvaryavo dhiṣaṇāpaś ca devīḥ //
analyzed: sam jānate manasā sam cikitre dhvaryavaḥ dhiṣaṇāpaḥ ca devīḥ
translated: They agree in mind, they are of one purpose, the Adhvaryus and the Goddesses, the Dispositions.

original: yo vo vṛtābhyo akṛṇod u lokaṃ yo vo mahyā abhiśaster amuñcat /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ vṛtābhyaḥ akṛṇot u lokam yaḥ vaḥ mahyāḥ abhiśasteḥ amuñcat
translated: He who hath made you room in the crowded place, he who hath freed you from the great imprecation,

original: tasmā indrāya madhumantam ūrmiṃ devamādanam pra hiṇotanāpaḥ //
analyzed: tasmai indrāya madhumantam ūrmim deva mādanam pra hiṇotana apaḥ
translated: To him, to Indra, send ye forth a wave rich in honey, a drink for the Gods, O ye Waters.

original: prāsmai hinota madhumantam ūrmiṃ garbho yo vaḥ sindhavo madhva utsaḥ /
analyzed: pra asmai hinota madhumantam ūrmim garbhaḥ yaḥ vaḥ sindhavaḥ madhvaḥ utsaḥ
translated: Send ye forth to him a wave rich in honey, the germ, O ye Rivers, of your sweet reservoir.

original: ghṛtapṛṣṭham īḍyam adhvareṣv āpo revatīḥ śṛṇutā havam me //
analyzed: ghṛta pṛṣṭham īḍyam adhvareṣu āpaḥ revatīḥ śṛṇutā havam me
translated: The back of which is ghee, to be adored in sacrifices. Hearken to my call, O ye wealthy Waters.

original: taṃ sindhavo matsaram indrapānam ūrmim pra heta ya ubhe iyarti /
analyzed: tam sindhavaḥ matsaram indra pānam ūrmim pra heta yaḥ ubhe iyarti
translated: O Rivers, send ye forth that gladdening wave, that drink of Indra, which moveth both worlds,🔽The gladdening drink of the sky-born Trita, which standeth in the three-stringed reservoir.

original: madacyutam auśānaṃ nabhojām pari tritantuṃ vicarantam utsam //🔽āvarvṛtatīr adha nu dvidhārā goṣuyudho na niyavaṃ carantīḥ /
analyzed: mada cyutam auśānam nabhaḥ jām pari tri tantum vicarantam utsam  āvarvṛtatīḥ adha nu dvi dhārāḥ goṣuyudhaḥ na niyavam carantīḥ
translated: The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.🔽The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.

original: ṛṣe janitrīr bhuvanasya patnīr apo vandasva savṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ //
analyzed: ṛṣe janitrīḥ bhuvanasya patnīḥ apaḥ vandasva savṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ
translated: The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in a fight over the kine.

original: hinotā no adhvaraṃ devayajyā hinota brahma sanaye dhanānām /
analyzed: hinota naḥ adhvaram deva yajyā hinota brahma sanaye dhanānām
translated: The two streams which flow together, which move in their course like the combatants in

original: ṛtasya yoge vi ṣyadhvam ūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīr bhūtanāsmabhyam āpaḥ //🔽āpo revatīḥ kṣayathā hi vasvaḥ kratuṃ ca bhadram bibhṛthāmṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: ṛtasya yoge vi syadhvam ūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīḥ bhūtana asmabhyam āpaḥ  āpaḥ revatīḥ kṣayatha hi vasvaḥ kratum ca bhadram bibhṛtha amṛtam ca
translated: At the union of truth, ye must open the udder. Be ye gracious to us, O ye waters.🔽Ye waters, rich in treasure, as ye are the abode of wealth, ye bear the sacrifice and the blessing and immortality.

original: rāyaś ca stha svapatyasya patnīḥ sarasvatī tad gṛṇate vayo dhāt //
analyzed: rāyaḥ ca stha su apatyasya patnīḥ sarasvatī tat gṛṇate vayaḥ dhāt
translated: And ye are the wives of prosperity. May Sarasvatî grant strength to the singer of this.

original: prati yad āpo adṛśram āyatīr ghṛtam payāṃsi bibhratīr madhūni /
analyzed: prati yat āpaḥ adṛśram āyatīḥ ghṛtam payāṃsi bibhratīḥ madhūni
translated: When the waters have been seen coming, bearing ghee and sweet juices,

original: adhvaryubhir manasā saṃvidānā indrāya somaṃ suṣutam bharantīḥ //
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ manasā saṃvidānāḥ indrāya somam suṣutam bharantīḥ
translated: In accord with the Adhvaryus' mind, carrying the well-pressed Soma to Indra.

original: emā agman revatīr jīvadhanyā adhvaryavaḥ sādayatā sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: ā imāḥ agman revatīḥ jīva dhanyāḥ adhvaryavaḥ sādayata sakhāyaḥ
translated: These have come, the rich, the life-giving. O friends, the Adhvaryus, seat them.

original: ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāso 'pāṃ naptrā saṃvidānāsa enāḥ //
analyzed: ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāsaḥ pām naptrā saṃvidānāsaḥ enāḥ
translated: On the sacrificial grass, O ye who are worthy of Soma, in accord with the waters' grandson, place these.

original: āgmann āpa uśatīr barhir edaṃ ny adhvare asadan devayantīḥ /
analyzed: āgman āpaḥ uśatīḥ barhiḥ ā idam ni adhvare asadan devayantīḥ
translated: The waters have come, the eager ones, to this sacrificial grass. They have sat down in the sacrifice, the worshippers.

original: adhvaryavaḥ sunutendrāya somam abhūd u vaḥ suśakā devayajyā //
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ sunuta indrāya somam abhūt u vaḥ su śakā deva yajyā
translated: O Adhvaryus, press the Soma for Indra. May your service to the gods be easy.

original: ā no devānām upa vetu śaṃso viśvebhis turair avase yajatraḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ devānām upa vetu śaṃsaḥ viśvebhiḥ turaiḥ avase yajatraḥ
translated: May the praise of the gods come to us, the holy one, with all the swift ones, for help.

original: tebhir vayaṃ suṣakhāyo bhavema taranto viśvā duritā syāma //
analyzed: tebhiḥ vayam su sakhāyaḥ bhavema tarantaḥ viśvā duritā syāma
translated: By them may we be possessed of good friends. May we pass over all difficulties.

original: pari cin marto draviṇam mamanyād ṛtasya pathā namasā vivāset /
analyzed: pari cit martaḥ draviṇam mamanyāt ṛtasya pathā namasā vivāset
translated: Let the mortal man desire wealth by the path of truth, let him win it by reverence.

original: uta svena kratunā saṃ vadeta śreyāṃsaṃ dakṣam manasā jagṛbhyāt //🔽adhāyi dhītir asasṛgram aṃśās tīrthe na dasmam upa yanty ūmāḥ /
analyzed: uta svena kratunā sam vadeta śreyāṃsam dakṣam manasā jagṛbhyāt  adhāyi dhītiḥ asasṛgram aṃśāḥ tīrthe na dasmam upa yanti ūmāḥ
translated: And let him agree with his own will, let him grasp a better power with his mind.🔽The thought is set, the portions are poured forth, the wondrous ones come to the ford like guests.

original: abhy ānaśma suvitasya śūṣaṃ navedaso amṛtānām abhūma //
analyzed: abhi ānaśma suvitasya śūṣam navedasaḥ amṛtānām abhūma
translated: We have attained the impulse of good fortune, we have become the immortal ones of new knowledge.

original: nityaś cākanyāt svapatir damūnā yasmā u devaḥ savitā jajāna /
analyzed: nityaḥ cākanyāt sva patiḥ damūnāḥ yasmai u devaḥ savitā jajāna
translated: The eternal one, the lord of the house, should be chosen, whom the god Savitar has begotten.

original: bhago vā gobhir aryamem anajyāt so asmai cāruś chadayad uta syāt //
analyzed: bhagaḥ vā gobhiḥ aryamā īm anajyāt saḥ asmai cāruḥ chadayat uta syāt
translated: Or Bhaga should be yoked with the cows by Aryaman. He should be kind and gracious to him.

original: iyaṃ sā bhūyā uṣasām iva kṣā yad dha kṣumantaḥ śavasā samāyan /
analyzed: iyam sā bhūyāḥ uṣasām iva kṣā yat ha kṣumantaḥ śavasā samāyan
translated: This should be the abode, like the light of the dawns, when they who are strong have come together by their power.

original: asya stutiṃ jaritur bhikṣamāṇā ā naḥ śagmāsa upa yantu vājāḥ //
analyzed: asya stutim jarituḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ ā naḥ śagmāsaḥ upa yantu vājāḥ
translated: Seeking the praise of this singer, may his strong powers come to us.

original: asyed eṣā sumatiḥ paprathānābhavat pūrvyā bhūmanā gauḥ /
analyzed: asya id eṣā sumatiḥ paprathānā abhavat pūrvyā bhūmanā gauḥ
translated: This his favour, spreading widely, has become like the ancient earth, like a cow.

original: asya sanīḷā asurasya yonau samāna ā bharaṇe bibhramāṇāḥ //
analyzed: asya sanīḍāḥ asurasya yonau samāne ā bharaṇe bibhramāṇāḥ
translated: In the womb of this Asura, bearing the same support, the Sānīḷas.

original: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ /
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsa yatas dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ
translated: What was the wood, what was the tree, from which they fashioned out the heaven and the earth?

original: saṃtasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīr uṣaso jaranta //
analyzed: saṃtasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ jaranta
translated: The two that stand firm, the two that are not aged, the many days and dawns pass by.

original: naitāvad enā paro anyad asty ukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivī bibharti /
analyzed: na etāvat enā paras anyat asti ukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivī bibharti
translated: There is nothing higher than this, the bull supports heaven and earth.

original: tvacam pavitraṃ kṛṇuta svadhāvān yad īṃ sūryaṃ na harito vahanti //
analyzed: tvacam pavitram kṛṇuta svadhāvān yat īm sūryam na haritaḥ vahanti
translated: The self-existent one makes the skin a strainer, when the green horses draw the sun.

original: stego na kṣām aty eti pṛthvīm mihaṃ na vāto vi ha vāti bhūma /
analyzed: stegaḥ na kṣām ati eti pṛthvīm miham na vātaḥ vi ha vāti bhūma
translated: Like a bull he passes over the broad earth, like wind he blows through the land.

original: mitro yatra varuṇo ajyamāno 'gnir vane na vy asṛṣṭa śokam //
analyzed: mitraḥ yatra varuṇaḥ ajyamānaḥ gniḥ vane na vi asṛṣṭa śokam
translated: Where Mitra and Varuna are anointed, Agni has released his sorrow in the wood.

original: starīr yat sūta sadyo ajyamānā vyathir avyathīḥ kṛṇuta svagopā /
analyzed: starīḥ yat sūta sadyas ajyamānā vyathiḥ avyathīḥ kṛṇuta sva gopā
translated: When the swift one is born, the uninjured one makes the injured one uninjured, the self-protector.

original: putro yat pūrvaḥ pitror janiṣṭa śamyāṃ gaur jagāra yad dha pṛcchān //🔽uta kaṇvaṃ nṛṣadaḥ putram āhur uta śyāvo dhanam ādatta vājī /
analyzed: putraḥ yat pūrvaḥ pitroḥ janiṣṭa śamyām gauḥ jagāra yat ha pṛcchān  uta kaṇvam nṛṣadaḥ putram āhuḥ uta śyāvaḥ dhanam ādatta vājī
translated: When the first son is born to his parents, the cow eats the barley, as it is asked to do.🔽They call Kanva the son of Nṛṣaha, and the dark horse took the wealth.

original: pra kṛṣṇāya ruśad apinvatodhar ṛtam atra nakir asmā apīpet //🔽pra su gmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhir varāṃ abhi ṣu prasīdataḥ /
analyzed: pra kṛṣṇāya ruśat apinvata udhar ṛtam atra nakir asmai apīpet  pra su gmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhiḥ varān abhi su prasīdataḥ
translated: They milked the dark one with a white udder, no one here has fulfilled his vow.🔽The two swift ones, the companion of the one who seeks thought, with the best, they are pleased with the best.

original: asmākam indra ubhayaṃ jujoṣati yat somyasyāndhaso bubodhati //
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ ubhayam jujoṣati yat somyasya andhasaḥ bubodhati
translated: Indra approves of both of us, when he awakens to the Soma drink.

original: vīndra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasā puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: vi indra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasā puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, thou goest to the heavenly lights, through the dust, O much-praised one, to the earthly ones.

original: ye tvā vahanti muhur adhvarāṃ upa te su vanvantu vagvanāṃ arādhasaḥ //🔽tad in me chantsad vapuṣo vapuṣṭaram putro yaj jānam pitror adhīyati /
analyzed: ye tvā vahanti muhur adhvarān upa te su vanvantu vagvanām arādhasaḥ  tat id me chantsat vapuṣaḥ vapuṣṭaram putraḥ yat jānam pitroḥ adhīyati
translated: Let those who often carry thee to the sacrifices, who are eager for praise, obtain the gifts of the generous one.🔽This is my most beautiful form among beautiful forms, that the son dwells with his parents, O knower of beings.

original: jāyā patiṃ vahati vagnunā sumat puṃsa id bhadro vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: jāyā patim vahati vagnunā sumat puṃse id bhadraḥ vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The wife carries the husband with her consent, well-endowed, the blessed one, the one who is purified by the sacrifice.

original: tad it sadhastham abhi cāru dīdhaya gāvo yac chāsan vahatuṃ na dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: tat id sadhastham abhi cāru dīdhaya gāvaḥ yat śāsan vahatum na dhenavaḥ
translated: I think of that beautiful abode, where the cows, like milch cows, lead the way to the sacrifice.

original: mātā yan mantur yūthasya pūrvyābhi vāṇasya saptadhātur ij janaḥ //
analyzed: mātā yat mantuḥ yūthasya pūrvyā abhi vāṇasya sapta dhātuḥ id janaḥ
translated: Where the mother, the ancient leader of the herd, and the people of the seven-fold tribe of the Vāna,

original: pra vo 'cchā ririce devayuṣ padam eko rudrebhir yāti turvaṇiḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ chā ririce devayuḥ padam ekaḥ rudrebhiḥ yāti turvaṇiḥ
translated: Your most beautiful abode, O gods, has been spread out. Alone, the one who goes to the Turvaṇis, goes with the Rudras.

original: jarā vā yeṣv amṛteṣu dāvane pari va ūmebhyaḥ siñcatā madhu //
analyzed: jarā vā yeṣu amṛteṣu dāvane pari vaḥ ūmebhyaḥ siñcata madhu
translated: For whom, in the immortals, old age is for the bestowal of gifts, pour out the honey around the Urmis.

original: nidhīyamānam apagūḷham apsu pra me devānāṃ vratapā uvāca /
analyzed: nidhīyamānam apagūḍham apsu pra me devānām vrata pāḥ uvāca
translated: The one who is being placed, well-hidden in the waters, the guardian of the gods' vow has told me.

original: indro vidvāṃ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham agne anuśiṣṭa āgām //
analyzed: indraḥ vidvān anu hi tvā cacakṣa tena aham agne anuśiṣṭaḥ āgām
translated: Indra, the wise one, has indeed seen thee. Instructed by him, O Agni, I have come.

original: akṣetravit kṣetravidaṃ hy aprāṭ sa praiti kṣetravidānuśiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: a kṣetra vid kṣetra vidam hi aprāṭ sa praiti kṣetra vidā anuśiṣṭaḥ
translated: The ignorant man, not knowing the field, goes to the knower of the field, instructed by the knower of the field.

original: etad vai bhadram anuśāsanasyota srutiṃ vindaty añjasīnām //
analyzed: etat vai bhadram anuśāsanasya uta srutim vindati añjasīnām
translated: This is the blessing of instruction; he finds the path of the swift ones.

original: adyed u prāṇīd amamann imāhāpīvṛto adhayan mātur ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: adyā id u prāṇīt amaman adhayat mātuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: He has eaten, he has breathed, he has rejoiced, he has drunk, covered, from the mother's breast.

original: em enam āpa jarimā yuvānam aheḷan vasuḥ sumanā babhūva //
analyzed: ā īm enam āpa jarimā yuvānam a heḍan vasuḥ sumanāḥ babhūva
translated: Old age has come to him, the young one, the good one has become well-disposed, not harming.

original: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadato maghāni /
analyzed: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadataḥ maghāni
translated: O pot, make these auspicious deeds, O Kurus' fame, bestowing these boons.

original: dāna id vo maghavānaḥ so astv ayaṃ ca somo hṛdi yam bibharmi //
analyzed: dāne id vaḥ maghavānaḥ saḥ astu ayam ca somaḥ hṛdi yam bibharmi
translated: May this be your gift, O wealthy ones, this Soma which I hold in my heart.

original: pra mā yuyujre prayujo janānāṃ vahāmi sma pūṣaṇam antareṇa /
analyzed: pra mā yuyujre prayujaḥ janānām vahāmi sma pūṣaṇam antareṇa
translated: The yokes of men have yoked me, I have carried Pūṣan in between.

original: viśve devāso adha mām arakṣan duḥśāsur āgād iti ghoṣa āsīt //
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ adha mām arakṣan duḥśāsuḥ āgāt iti ghoṣaḥ āsīt
translated: All the gods have protected me, the cry has been: Duḥśāsa has come!

original: sam mā tapanty abhitaḥ sapatnīr iva parśavaḥ /🔽ni bādhate amatir nagnatā jasur ver na vevīyate matiḥ //
analyzed: sam mā tapanti abhitas sapatnīḥ iva parśavaḥ  ni bādhate amatiḥ nagna tā jasuḥ veḥ na vevīyate matiḥ
translated: My ribs burn me, as if from rivals.🔽Want, nakedness, pain, the wound, the thought does not heal.

original: mūṣo na śiśnā vy adanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato /
analyzed: mūṣaḥ na śiśnā vi adanti mā adhya stotāram te śatakrato
translated: Like mice my privy parts bite me, O you of a hundred powers.

original: sakṛt su no maghavann indra mṛḷayādhā piteva no bhava //
analyzed: sakṛt su naḥ maghavan indra mṛḍaya adha pitā iva naḥ bhava
translated: Once, O Indra, be gracious to us, O lord, be like a father to us.

original: kuruśravaṇam āvṛṇi rājānaṃ trāsadasyavam /
analyzed: kuruśravaṇam āvṛṇi rājānam trāsadasyavam
translated: He chose the king Kuruśravas, the son of Trasadasyu,

original: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vāghatām ṛṣiḥ //
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭham vāghatām ṛṣiḥ
translated: The most bountiful of sacrificers, the sage.

original: yasya mā harito rathe tisro vahanti sādhuyā /
analyzed: yasya mā haritaḥ rathe tisraḥ vahanti sādhuyā
translated: Whose three bay horses draw his chariot well,

original: stavai sahasradakṣiṇe //
analyzed: stavai sahasra dakṣiṇe
translated: For the praise of him who gives a thousand gifts.

original: yasya prasvādaso gira upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ /
analyzed: yasya prasvādasaḥ giraḥ upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ
translated: Whose songs, O Upamashrava, are like his father's,

original: kṣetraṃ na raṇvam ūcuṣe //
analyzed: kṣetram na raṇvam ūcuṣe
translated: Are like a pleasant field to me.

original: adhi putropamaśravo napān mitrātither ihi /
analyzed: adhi putra upamaśravaḥ napāt mitra atitheḥ ihi
translated: Go to the son of Upamashrava, the grandson of Mitrātithi,

original: pituṣ ṭe asmi vanditā //
analyzed: pituḥ te asmi vanditā
translated: I am the worshipper of your father.

original: yad īśīyāmṛtānām uta vā martyānām /
analyzed: yat īśīya amṛtānām uta vā martyānām
translated: If I were to be the lord of the immortals or even of mortals,

original: jīved in maghavā mama //
analyzed: jīvet id id maghavā mama
translated: May Maghavan live for me.

original: na devānām ati vrataṃ śatātmā cana jīvati /
analyzed: na devānām ati vratam śata ātmā cana jīvati
translated: Not even one with a hundred souls transgresses the rule of the gods.

original: tathā yujā vi vāvṛte //
analyzed: tathā yujā vi vāvṛte
translated: Thus he turns away from the yoked pair.

original: prāvepā mā bṛhato mādayanti pravātejā iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ /
analyzed: prāvepāḥ mā bṛhataḥ mādayanti pravātejāḥ iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ
translated: The mighty ones delight in me, whirling in the wind, on the plain.

original: somasyeva maujavatasya bhakṣo vibhīdako jāgṛvir mahyam acchān //
analyzed: somasya iva maujavatasya bhakṣaḥ vibhīdakaḥ jāgṛviḥ mahyam acchān
translated: The food of the vigorous Soma is for me, the watchful Vibhīdaka.

original: na mā mimetha na jihīḷa eṣā śivā sakhibhya uta mahyam āsīt /
analyzed: na mā mimetha na jihīḍa eṣā śivā sakhibhyaḥ uta mahyam āsīt
translated: She did not deceive me, she did not despise me; she was gracious to her friends and to me.

original: akṣasyāham ekaparasya hetor anuvratām apa jāyām arodham //
analyzed: akṣasya aham eka parasya hetoḥ anuvratām apa jāyām arodham
translated: For the sake of the one-eyed dice, I have obstructed the obedient wife.

original: dveṣṭi śvaśrūr apa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthito vindate marḍitāram /
analyzed: dveṣṭi śvaśrūḥ apa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthitaḥ vindate marḍitāram
translated: The mother-in-law hates her, the wife restrains him, the suppliant finds no comforter.

original: aśvasyeva jarato vasnyasya nāhaṃ vindāmi kitavasya bhogam //
analyzed: aśvasya iva jarataḥ vasnyasya na aham vindāmi kitavasya bhogam
translated: I find no enjoyment, like a worn-out horse, of the gambler's wealth.

original: anye jāyām pari mṛśanty asya yasyāgṛdhad vedane vājy akṣaḥ /
analyzed: anye jāyām pari mṛśanti asya yasya agṛdhat vedane vājī akṣaḥ
