translated: Others caress the wife of him who is greedy for gain, whose horse is swift in the race.

original: pitā mātā bhrātara enam āhur na jānīmo nayatā baddham etam //
analyzed: pitā mātā bhrātaraḥ enam āhuḥ na jānīmaḥ nayata baddham etam
translated: Father, mother, brothers say of him: We know not whither the captors lead this bound one.

original: yad ādīdhye na daviṣāṇy ebhiḥ parāyadbhyo 'va hīye sakhibhyaḥ /
analyzed: yat ādīdhye na daviṣāṇi ebhiḥ parāyadbhyaḥ vai hīye sakhibhyaḥ
translated: If I were to hate them with this, I should be deprived of my friends who have gone away.

original: nyuptāś ca babhravo vācam akrataṃ emīd eṣāṃ niṣkṛtaṃ jāriṇīva //
analyzed: nyuptāḥ ca babhravaḥ vācam akratam emi id eṣām niṣkṛtam jāriṇī iva
translated: The brown ones, when laid down, have uttered speech: I go to perform the atonement of these.

original: sabhām eti kitavaḥ pṛcchamāno jeṣyāmīti tanvā śūśujānaḥ /
analyzed: sabhām eti kitavaḥ pṛcchamānaḥ jeṣyāmi iti tanvā śūśujānaḥ
translated: The gambler goes to the assembly, asking, Shall I conquer? with his body shining.

original: akṣāso asya vi tiranti kāmam pratidīvne dadhata ā kṛtāni //
analyzed: akṣāsaḥ asya vi tiranti kāmam pratidīvne dadhataḥ ā kṛtāni
translated: The dice frustrate his desire, giving him tasks to do against the man who wagers with him.

original: akṣāsa id aṅkuśino nitodino nikṛtvānas tapanās tāpayiṣṇavaḥ /
analyzed: akṣāsaḥ id aṅkuśinaḥ nitodinaḥ nikṛtvānaḥ tapanāḥ tāpayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: The dice are goads, they are spurs, they are cutters, they are heaters, they are scorchers.

original: kumāradeṣṇā jayataḥ punarhaṇo madhvā sampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā //
analyzed: kumāradeṣṇāḥ jayataḥ punarhaṇaḥ madhvā sampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā
translated: They are the devourers of the young, they are the slayers of the victorious, they are mixed with honey for the gambler's great delight.

original: tripañcāśaḥ krīḷati vrāta eṣāṃ deva iva savitā satyadharmā /
analyzed: tripañcāśaḥ krīḍati vrātaḥ eṣām devaḥ iva savitā satya dharmā
translated: This troop of fifty-three plays, like the god Savitar of true law.

original: ugrasya cin manyave nā namante rājā cid ebhyo nama it kṛṇoti //
analyzed: ugrasya cit manyave nā namante rājā cit ebhyaḥ namaḥ id kṛṇoti
translated: Even the fierce one bows to the anger of the mighty; even the king must pay homage to them.

original: nīcā vartanta upari sphuranty ahastāso hastavantaṃ sahante /
analyzed: nīcā vartantaḥ upari sphuranti ahastāsaḥ hastavantam sahante
translated: They lie low, but leap up above; they, handless, conquer the mighty;

original: divyā aṅgārā iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santo hṛdayaṃ nir dahanti //
analyzed: divyāḥ aṅgārāḥ iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santaḥ hṛdayam niḥ dahanti
translated: The heavenly coals, laid on the barren soil, though cold, burn the heart.

original: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kva svit /
analyzed: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kva svid
translated: The wife of the gambler is afflicted by loss; the mother of the son who wanders, where is she?

original: ṛṇāvā bibhyad dhanam icchamāno 'nyeṣām astam upa naktam eti //
analyzed: ṛṇāvā bibhyat dhanam icchamānaḥ ni eṣām astam upa naktam eti
translated: Fearing the debt, desiring wealth, he goes to the setting of the sun for others.

original: striyaṃ dṛṣṭvāya kitavaṃ tatāpānyeṣāṃ jāyāṃ sukṛtaṃ ca yonim /
analyzed: striyam dṛṣṭvāya kitavam tatāpa anyeṣām jāyām su kṛtam ca yonim
translated: Seeing the wife of another, the gambler is tormented, a well-made womb.

original: pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn so agner ante vṛṣalaḥ papāda //
analyzed: pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn saḥ agneḥ ante vṛṣalaḥ papāda
translated: In the forenoon he yoked the brown horses, at the end of the fire the Vr̥ishala fell.

original: yo vaḥ senānīr mahato gaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamo babhūva /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ senā nīḥ mahataḥ gaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamaḥ babhūva
translated: He who is the general of your great host, the king of the multitude, who became the first,

original: tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśāham prācīs tad ṛtaṃ vadāmi //
analyzed: tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśa aham prācīḥ tat ṛtam vadāmi
translated: To him I make, I do not obstruct the wealth; for ten days I speak this truth to the east.

original: akṣair mā dīvyaḥ kṛṣim it kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahu manyamānaḥ /
analyzed: akṣaiḥ mā dīvyaḥ kṛṣim id kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahu manyamānaḥ
translated: Do not gamble with dice, but plow the field; be content and honored with wealth.

original: tatra gāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tan me vi caṣṭe savitāyam aryaḥ //
analyzed: tatra gāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tat me vi caṣṭe savitā ayam aryaḥ
translated: There, O gambler, are the cows, there is the wife; that Savitar, the righteous one, shows me.

original: mitraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ khalu mṛḷatā no mā no ghoreṇa caratābhi dhṛṣṇu /
analyzed: mitram kṛṇudhvam khalu mṛḍata naḥ mā naḥ ghoreṇa carata abhi dhṛṣṇu
translated: Make friends, indeed, be kind to us; do not attack us with terrible deeds.

original: ni vo nu manyur viśatām arātir anyo babhrūṇām prasitau nv astu //
analyzed: ni vaḥ nu manyuḥ viśatām arātiḥ anyaḥ babhrūṇām prasitau nu astu
translated: Let your anger and hostility pass away; let another be entangled in the snare of the brown ones.

original: abudhram u tya indravanto agnayo jyotir bharanta uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: abudhram u tye indravantaḥ agnayaḥ jyotiḥ bharantaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: The fires, accompanied by Indra, have been kindled; they bear light in the dawns' rising.

original: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatām apo 'dyā devānām ava ā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatām apaḥ dyāḥ devānām avaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the great heaven and earth, and the waters, be aware of this. Today we choose the favor of the gods.

original: divaspṛthivyor ava ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatāñ charyaṇāvataḥ /
analyzed: divaspṛthivyoḥ avaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatām śaryaṇāvataḥ
translated: We choose the favor of heaven and earth, the mothers, the rivers, and the mountains with pleasant valleys.

original: anāgāstvaṃ sūryam uṣāsam īmahe bhadraṃ somaḥ suvāno adyā kṛṇotu naḥ //
analyzed: anāgāstvam sūryam uṣāsam īmahe bhadram somaḥ suvānaḥ adyā kṛṇotu naḥ
translated: We implore the guiltless Sun, Dawn, and Sûrya. May Soma, when pressed, make all things prosperous for us this day.

original: dyāvā no adya pṛthivī anāgaso mahī trāyetāṃ suvitāya mātarā /
analyzed: dyāvā naḥ adya pṛthivī anāgasaḥ mahī trāyetām suvitāya mātarā
translated: May the great heaven and earth, the mothers, protect us today from guilt for our welfare.

original: uṣā ucchanty apa bādhatām aghaṃ svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: uṣāḥ ucchantī apa bādhatām agham svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: May Dawn, rising, drive away evil. We implore the prosperous kindled Agni.

original: iyaṃ na usrā prathamā sudevyaṃ revat sanibhyo revatī vy ucchatu /
analyzed: iyam naḥ usrā prathamā su devyam revat sanibhyaḥ revatī vi ucchatu
translated: May this dawn, the first, most divine, rich for the rich, rise up resplendent.

original: āre manyuṃ durvidatrasya dhīmahi svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: āre manyum durvidatrasya dhīmahi svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: We will direct our thought away from the anger of the one hard to know. We implore the prosperous kindled Agni.

original: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhir jyotir bharantīr uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhiḥ jyotiḥ bharantīḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: Those which spread forth with the rays of the sun, bearing light in the dawns at the break of day,

original: bhadrā no adya śravase vy ucchata svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //🔽anamīvā uṣasa ā carantu na ud agnayo jihatāṃ jyotiṣā bṛhat /
analyzed: bhadrāḥ naḥ adya śravase vi ucchata svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe  anamīvāḥ uṣasaḥ ā carantu naḥ ud agnayaḥ jihatām jyotiṣā bṛhat
translated: Auspicious for our fame today, shine forth. We pray to well-kindled Agni for welfare.🔽May the dawns come to us free from disease. May the fires blaze forth with great light.

original: āyukṣātām aśvinā tūtujiṃ rathaṃ svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: āyukṣātām aśvinā tūtujim ratham svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: May the Ashvins yoke the swift chariot. We pray to well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ no adya savitar vareṇyam bhāgam ā suva sa hi ratnadhā asi /
analyzed: śreṣṭham naḥ adya savitar vareṇyam bhāgam ā suva sa hi ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: Best for us today, O Savitar, bestow the most excellent portion, for thou art the bestower of treasure.

original: rāyo janitrīṃ dhiṣaṇām upa bruve svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: rāyaḥ janitrīm dhiṣaṇām upa bruve svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: I address the thought, the mother of wealth. We pray to well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: pipartu mā tad ṛtasya pravācanaṃ devānāṃ yan manuṣyā amanmahi /
analyzed: pipartu mā tat ṛtasya pravācanam devānām yat manuṣyāḥ amanmahi
translated: May that declaration of truth protect me, which we mortals have conceived of the gods.

original: viśvā id usrā spaḷ ud eti sūryaḥ svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: viśvāḥ id usrāḥ spaṣ ud eti sūryaḥ svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: All the dawns shine forth, the sun rises. We pray to well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: adveṣo adya barhiṣa starīmaṇi grāvṇāṃ yoge manmanaḥ sādha īmahe /
analyzed: a dveṣaḥ adya barhiṣaḥ starīmaṇi grāvṇām yoge manmanaḥ sādhaḥ īmahe
translated: Today, on the strewing of the sacred grass, on the union of the pressing-stones, we pray for the mind to be well-disposed.

original: ādityānāṃ śarmaṇi sthā bhuraṇyasi svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: ādityānām śarmaṇi sthā bhuraṇyasi svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: In the protection of the Adityas, thou movest swiftly. We pray to well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: ā no barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhad divi devāṃ īḷe sādayā sapta hotṝn /
analyzed: ā naḥ barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhat divi devān īḍe sādaya sapta hotṝn
translated: To our great sacrificial grass in the sky, I invite the gods, seat the seven priests.

original: indram mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhagaṃ svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: indram mitram varuṇam sātaye bhagam svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: For the sake of gain, we implore Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Bhaga, and the well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: ta ādityā ā gatā sarvatātaye vṛdhe no yajñam avatā sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: te ādityāḥ ā gata sarvatātaye vṛdhe naḥ yajñam avata sajoṣasaḥ
translated: O Adityas, come to us for the sake of all, for our growth, to help our sacrifice, in unison.

original: bṛhaspatim pūṣaṇam aśvinā bhagaṃ svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim pūṣaṇam aśvinā bhagam svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: We implore Brihaspati, Pushan, the Ashvins, Bhaga, and the well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: tan no devā yacchata supravācanaṃ chardir ādityāḥ subharaṃ nṛpāyyam /
analyzed: tat naḥ devāḥ yacchata su pravācanam chardiḥ ādityāḥ subharam nṛ pāyyam
translated: O gods, grant us that which is well-spoken, the protection, O Adityas, which is good to keep, worthy of kings.

original: paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svasty agniṃ samidhānam īmahe //
analyzed: paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: For our cattle, offspring, and children, for life, we implore the well-kindled Agni for welfare.

original: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantv agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ /
analyzed: viśve adya marutaḥ viśve ūtī viśve bhavantu agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ
translated: May all the Maruts be with us today for all help, may all the fires be kindled for us.

original: viśve no devā avasā gamantu viśvam astu draviṇaṃ vājo asme //
analyzed: viśve naḥ devāḥ avasā gamantu viśvam astu draviṇam vājaḥ asme
translated: May all the gods come to us with help. May all wealth and strength be ours.

original: yaṃ devāso 'vatha vājasātau yaṃ trāyadhve yam pipṛthāty aṃhaḥ /
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ vatha vājasātau yam trāyadhve yam pipṛtha ati aṃhaḥ
translated: Whom the gods help in the battle for strength, whom you protect, whom you deliver from distress,

original: yo vo gopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāma devavītaye turāsaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ gopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāma deva vītaye turāsaḥ
translated: May we be those who know no fear in your drinking of the cows, O mighty ones, for the enjoyment of the gods.

original: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Dawn and Night, vast, of beautiful form, heaven and earth, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: indraṃ huve marutaḥ parvatāṃ apa ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ //
analyzed: indram huve marutaḥ parvatān apaḥ ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svar
translated: Indra, the Maruts, the mountains, the waters, the Adityas, heaven and earth, the waters, the sky,

original: dyauś ca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasa ṛtāvarī rakṣatām aṃhaso riṣaḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasaḥ ṛtāvarī rakṣatām aṃhasaḥ riṣaḥ
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī, the wise ones, guardians of truth, protect us from misfortune and injury.

original: mā durvidatrā nirṛtir na īśata tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: mā durvidatrā nirṛtiḥ naḥ īśata tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the ill-disposed Nirrti not rule over us. That grace of the gods we choose today.

original: viśvasmān no aditiḥ pātv aṃhaso mātā mitrasya varuṇasya revataḥ /
analyzed: viśvasmāt naḥ aditiḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ mātā mitrasya varuṇasya revataḥ
translated: May all-protecting Aditi guard us from misfortune, the mother of Mitra, of Varuna, of the prosperous one.

original: svarvaj jyotir avṛkaṃ naśīmahi tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: svarvat jyotiḥ avṛkam naśīmahi tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May we attain the heavenly light, the shelter free from danger. That grace of the gods we choose today.

original: grāvā vadann apa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣṣvapnyaṃ nirṛtiṃ viśvam atriṇam /
analyzed: grāvā vadan apa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣṣvapnyam nirṛtim viśvam atriṇam
translated: May the pressing stone, speaking, drive away the Raksases, bad dreams, Nirrti, and all the devourers.

original: ādityaṃ śarma marutām aśīmahi tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: ādityam śarma marutām aśīmahi tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May we attain the shelter of the Adityas, of the Maruts. That grace of the gods we choose today.

original: endro barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatām iḷā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhir ṛkvo arcatu /🔽supraketaṃ jīvase manma dhīmahi tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: ā indraḥ barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatām iḍā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhiḥ ṛkvaḥ arcatu  su praketam jīvase manma dhīmahi tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May Indra sit on the sacred grass, may he swell the food. May Brhaspati, the chanter, praise with the Sāman chants.🔽May we direct our thought to the well-marked one for life. That grace of the gods we choose today.

original: divispṛśaṃ yajñam asmākam aśvinā jīrādhvaraṃ kṛṇutaṃ sumnam iṣṭaye /
analyzed: divispṛśam yajñam asmākam aśvinā jīra adhvaram kṛṇutam sumnam iṣṭaye
translated: O Aśvins, make our sacrifice reach to the sky, make it prosperous, the rite, for the sake of bliss.

original: prācīnaraśmim āhutaṃ ghṛtena tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: prācīna raśmim āhutam ghṛtena tat devānām avaḥ adya vṛṇīmahe
translated: The ancient light, offered with ghee, that of the gods we choose today for our help.

original: upa hvaye suhavam mārutaṃ gaṇam pāvakam ṛṣvaṃ sakhyāya śambhuvam /
analyzed: upa hvaye su havam mārutam gaṇam pāvakam ṛṣvam sakhyāya śambhuvam
translated: I invoke the Marut host, easy to invoke, the pure, the lofty, for friendship, for prosperity.

original: rāyas poṣaṃ sauśravasāya dhīmahi tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣam sauśravasāya dhīmahi tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We will direct our thoughts to the increase of wealth, for fame, that of the gods we choose today for our help.

original: apām peruṃ jīvadhanyam bharāmahe devāvyaṃ suhavam adhvaraśriyam /
analyzed: apām perum jīva dhanyam bharāmahe devāvyam su havam adhvara śriyam
translated: We will bring the swift one, the lord of the waters, the one who bestows life, the one who belongs to the gods, the easy to invoke, the one who has the glory of sacrifice.

original: suraśmiṃ somam indriyaṃ yamīmahi tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: su raśmim somam indriyam yamīmahi tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We will invoke the Soma, whose rays are pure, which is powerful, and which is to be desired. That of the gods we choose today for our help.

original: sanema tat susanitā sanitvabhir vayaṃ jīvā jīvaputrā anāgasaḥ /
analyzed: sanema tat su sanitā sanitvabhiḥ vayam jīvāḥ jīva putrāḥ anāgasaḥ
translated: May we accomplish that with good accomplishers, we who are alive, having living children, free from sin.

original: brahmadviṣo viṣvag eno bharerata tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: brahma dviṣaḥ viṣvak enaḥ bharerata tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let the enemies of the Brahmins bear their sin in all directions. That of the gods we choose today for our help.

original: ye sthā manor yajñiyās te śṛṇotana yad vo devā īmahe tad dadātana /
analyzed: ye stha manoḥ yajñiyāḥ te śṛṇotana yat vaḥ devāḥ īmahe tat dadātana
translated: Those who are worthy of sacrifice of Manu, listen to that. What we ask of you, O gods, give that to us.

original: jaitraṃ kratuṃ rayimad vīravad yaśas tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: jaitram kratum rayimat vīravat yaśaḥ tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: The victorious rite, which is full of wealth, which is full of heroic fame, that of the gods we choose today for our help.

original: mahad adya mahatām ā vṛṇīmahe 'vo devānām bṛhatām anarvaṇām /
analyzed: mahat adya mahatām ā vṛṇīmahe vaḥ devānām bṛhatām anarvaṇām
translated: Today we choose the great one of the great, the help of the great gods, the irrepressible ones.

original: yathā vasu vīrajātaṃ naśāmahai tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: yathā vasu vīra jātam naśāmahai tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: That we may enjoy the wealth of heroes, that we may obtain today the favour of the gods.

original: maho agneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇy anāgā mitre varuṇe svastaye /
analyzed: mahaḥ agneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇi anāgāḥ mitre varuṇe svastaye
translated: In the great protection of Agni, the kindled one, in Mitra and Varuna for safety,

original: śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani tad devānām avo adyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani tat devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May we be the best in Savitar's impulse. That we may obtain today the favour of the gods.

original: ye savituḥ satyasavasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasya devāḥ /
analyzed: ye savituḥ satya savasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasya devāḥ
translated: Those who are all of Savitar, the truly powerful one, in the vow of Mitra, of Varuna, the gods,

original: te saubhagaṃ vīravad gomad apno dadhātana draviṇaṃ citram asme //
analyzed: te saubhagam vīravat gomat apnaḥ dadhātana draviṇam citram asme
translated: Grant us good fortune with heroes, with cattle, bestow wealth of various kinds upon us.

original: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitottarāttāt savitādharāttāt /
analyzed: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitā uttarāttāt savitā adharāttāt
translated: Savitar from the west, Savitar from the east, Savitar from the north, Savitar from the south,

original: savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātiṃ savitā no rāsatāṃ dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātim savitā naḥ rāsatām dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: May Savitar grant us all-surpassing prosperity. May Savitar grant us long life.

original: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtaṃ saparyata /
analyzed: namaḥ mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase mahaḥ devāya tat ṛtam saparyata
translated: Homage to the watch of Mitra and Varuna. To the great god offer that truth.

original: dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāya sūryāya śaṃsata //
analyzed: dūredṛśe deva jātāya ketave divaḥ putrāya sūryāya śaṃsata
translated: To the far-seeing, god-born banner, to the son of heaven, to Surya proclaim it.

original: sā mā satyoktiḥ pari pātu viśvato dyāvā ca yatra tatanann ahāni ca /
analyzed: sā mā satya uktiḥ pari pātu viśvatas dyāvā ca yatra tatanan ahāni ca
translated: May that true utterance protect me on every side, where the heavens and the days have spread themselves out.

original: viśvam anyan ni viśate yad ejati viśvāhāpo viśvāhod eti sūryaḥ //
analyzed: viśvam anyat ni viśate yat ejati viśvāhā apaḥ viśvāhā ud eti sūryaḥ
translated: All that moves enters into the other, all days the waters, all days the sun rises.

original: na te adevaḥ pradivo ni vāsate yad etaśebhiḥ patarai ratharyasi /🔽prācīnam anyad anu vartate raja ud anyena jyotiṣā yāsi sūrya //
analyzed: na te adevaḥ pradivaḥ ni vāsate yat etaśebhiḥ pataraiḥ ratharyasi  prācīnam anyat anu vartate rajaḥ ud anyena jyotiṣā yāsi sūrya
translated: Not as a godless one dost thou, O Sun, enter the western quarter, when thou goest on thy way with thy fleet steeds.🔽One other region is in front, the other thou goest to with thy light, O Sun.

original: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamo jagac ca viśvam udiyarṣi bhānunā /
analyzed: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamaḥ jagat ca viśvam udiyarṣi bhānunā
translated: With that light, O Sun, wherewith thou dispellest darkness, and with thy ray illumest all the world,

original: tenāsmad viśvām anirām anāhutim apāmīvām apa duṣṣvapnyaṃ suva //
analyzed: tena asmat viśvām an irām an āhutim apa amīvām apa duṣṣvapnyam suva
translated: With that dispel thou from us every sickness, every malady, every evil dream, and all disease.

original: viśvasya hi preṣito rakṣasi vratam aheḷayann uccarasi svadhā anu /
analyzed: viśvasya hi preṣitaḥ rakṣasi vratam a heḍayan uccarasi svadhāḥ anu
translated: For thou art sent to guard the vow of all the world: thou goest thy way, unhindered, in thy proper course.

original: yad adya tvā sūryopabravāmahai taṃ no devā anu maṃsīrata kratum //
analyzed: yat adya tvā sūrya upabravāmahai tam naḥ devāḥ anu maṃsīrata kratum
translated: If we, O Sun, should this day offend against thee, may the Gods accept our thought and purpose.

original: taṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī tan na āpa indraḥ śṛṇvantu maruto havaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: tam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī tat naḥ āpaḥ indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutaḥ havam vacaḥ
translated: May Heaven and Earth, may the Waters, may Indra, may the Maruts hear our call and our speech.

original: mā śūne bhūma sūryasya saṃdṛśi bhadraṃ jīvanto jaraṇām aśīmahi //
analyzed: mā śūne bhūma sūryasya saṃdṛśi bhadram jīvantaḥ jaraṇām aśīmahi
translated: Let us not in thy rising, O Sun, be childless, but, living long, with store of children, in prosperity.

original: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ sucakṣasaḥ prajāvanto anamīvā anāgasaḥ /
analyzed: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ su cakṣasaḥ prajāvantaḥ anamīvāḥ anāgasaḥ
translated: All days may we be well-disposed to thee, O Sun, with clear sight, with children, free from sickness, sinless.

original: udyantaṃ tvā mitramaho divedive jyog jīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya //
analyzed: udyantam tvā mitra mahas dive dive jyok jīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya
translated: May we long-living look upon thee rising, O Sun, day after day, O thou of mighty bounty.

original: mahi jyotir bibhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantaṃ cakṣuṣecakṣuṣe mayaḥ /
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ bibhratam tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantam cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ
translated: O all-seeing one, bearing great light, shining for the eye, for the eye, may we, O auspicious one,

original: ārohantam bṛhataḥ pājasas pari vayaṃ jīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya //
analyzed: ārohantam bṛhataḥ pājasaḥ pari vayam jīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya
translated: Behold thee, rising from the lofty splendour, we living.

original: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśante aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśante aktubhiḥ
translated: Whose light is the banner of all existing things, and who moves forth and enters them with his rays,

original: anāgāstvena harikeśa sūryāhnāhnā no vasyasāvasyasod ihi //
analyzed: anāgāstvena hari keśa sūrya ahnā ahnā naḥ vasyasā avasyasā ud ihi
translated: O Surya, with the hair of the tawny one, free from sin, come to us day by day with better and better.

original: śaṃ no bhava cakṣasā śaṃ no ahnā śam bhānunā śaṃ himā śaṃ ghṛṇena /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhava cakṣasā śam naḥ ahnā śam bhānunā śam himā śam ghṛṇena
translated: Be auspicious to us with thy sight, be auspicious to us with the day, be auspicious with thy light, be auspicious with the cold, be auspicious with thy wrath.

original: yathā śam adhvañ cham asad duroṇe tat sūrya draviṇaṃ dhehi citram //
analyzed: yathā śam adhvam śam asat duroṇe tat sūrya draviṇam dhehi citram
translated: As thou art auspicious on the path, so be thou auspicious in the house. O Surya, bestow that wondrous wealth on us.

original: asmākaṃ devā ubhayāya janmane śarma yacchata dvipade catuṣpade /
analyzed: asmākam devāḥ ubhayāya janmane śarma yacchata dvipade catuṣpade
translated: O gods, grant protection to both our generations, to the bipeds and the quadrupeds.

original: adat pibad ūrjayamānam āśitaṃ tad asme śaṃ yor arapo dadhātana //
analyzed: adat pibat ūrjayamānam āśitam tat asme śam yos arapaḥ dadhātana
translated: To the eater, the drinker, the one who fattens, the one who is fed, bestow that auspicious, sinless food on us.

original: yad vo devāś cakṛma jihvayā guru manaso vā prayutī devaheḷanam /
analyzed: yat vaḥ devāḥ cakṛma jihvayā guru manasaḥ vā prayutī deva heḍanam
translated: Whatever sin we have committed against the gods with our tongue, or with our mind, O gods, in our devotion,

original: arāvā yo no abhi ducchunāyate tasmin tad eno vasavo ni dhetana //
analyzed: arāvā yaḥ naḥ abhi ducchunāyate tasmin tat enaḥ vasavaḥ ni dhetana
translated: Place that sin upon him, O Vasus, who hates us with malicious intent.

original: asmin na indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāva sātaye /
analyzed: asmin naḥ indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāva sātaye
translated: In this battle, O Indra, in this glorious, impetuous one, thou art invoked for help.

original: yatra goṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvak patanti didyavo nṛṣāhye //
analyzed: yatra goṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvak patanti didyavaḥ nṛṣāhye
translated: Where the cattle are seized, among the bold, devouring ones, the thunderbolts fly in all directions in the battle of men.

original: sa naḥ kṣumantaṃ sadane vy ūrṇuhi goarṇasaṃ rayim indra śravāyyam /
analyzed: sa naḥ kṣumantam sadane vi ūrṇuhi go arṇasam rayim indra śravāyyam
translated: Unloose for us in the dwelling the wealth that is full of food and abounding in cattle, to be praised, O Indra.

original: syāma te jayataḥ śakra medino yathā vayam uśmasi tad vaso kṛdhi //
analyzed: syāma te jayataḥ śakra medinaḥ yathā vayam uśmasi tat vaso kṛdhi
translated: May we be sharers of thy bounty, O victorious one, O Sakra, as we desire it. Do this, O Vasu.

original: yo no dāsa āryo vā puruṣṭutādeva indra yudhaye ciketati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dāsaḥ āryaḥ vā puruṣṭutādevaḥ indra yudhaye ciketati
translated: He who, whether a Dāsa or an Ārya, is much praised, thinks of thee, O Indra, for the fight.

original: asmābhiṣ ṭe suṣahāḥ santu śatravas tvayā vayaṃ tān vanuyāma saṃgame //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ te suṣahāḥ santu śatravaḥ tvayā vayam tān vanuyāma saṃgame
translated: Let thy enemies be easily overcome by us. With thee may we vanquish them in the encounter.

original: yo dabhrebhir havyo yaś ca bhūribhir yo abhīke varivovin nṛṣāhye /🔽taṃ vikhāde sasnim adya śrutaṃ naram arvāñcam indram avase karāmahe //
analyzed: yaḥ dabhrebhiḥ havyaḥ yaḥ ca bhūribhiḥ yaḥ abhīke varivaḥ vid nṛṣāhye  tam vikhāde sasnim adya śrutam naram arvāñcam indram avase karāmahe
translated: He who is to be invoked with the Dāsa armies and with the many, who is the bestower of room in the battle of men,🔽To that swift one, that famous man, we will bring Indra hitherward today for help.

original: svavṛjaṃ hi tvām aham indra śuśravānānudaṃ vṛṣabha radhracodanam /
analyzed: svavṛjam hi tvām aham indra śuśrava anānudam vṛṣabha radhra codanam
translated: For I have heard, O Indra, that thou art easy to invoke, a bull who impels the niggard.

original: pra muñcasva pari kutsād ihā gahi kim u tvāvān muṣkayor baddha āsate //
analyzed: pra muñcasva pari kutsāt iha ā gahi kim u tvāvān muṣkayoḥ baddhaḥ āsate
translated: Be thou set free from Kutsa. Come hither. What is it that stays thee bound to thy testicles?

original: yo vām parijmā suvṛd aśvinā ratho doṣām uṣāso havyo haviṣmatā /
analyzed: yaḥ vām parijmā suvṛt aśvinā rathaḥ doṣām uṣāsaḥ havyaḥ haviṣmatā
translated: Your car, O Asvins, which moves round, which brings good fortune, is to be worshipped by the worshipper at the evening and the morning.

original: śaśvattamāsas tam u vām idaṃ vayam pitur na nāma suhavaṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: śaśvattamāsaḥ tam u vām idam vayam pituḥ na nāma su havam havāmahe
translated: We call upon that most enduring one of you, whose name is easy to invoke, like that of a father.

original: codayataṃ sūnṛtāḥ pinvataṃ dhiya ut purandhīr īrayataṃ tad uśmasi /
analyzed: codayatam sūnṛtāḥ pinvatam dhiyaḥ ud purandhīḥ īrayatam tat uśmasi
translated: Impel our hymns, make our thoughts to swell, send forth our prayers, and that we long for.

original: yaśasam bhāgaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no aśvinā somaṃ na cārum maghavatsu nas kṛtam //🔽amājuraś cid bhavatho yuvam bhago 'nāśoś cid avitārāpamasya cit /
analyzed: yaśasam bhāgam kṛṇutam naḥ aśvinā somam na cārum maghavatsu naḥ kṛtam  amājuraḥ cit bhavathaḥ yuvam bhagaḥ nāśoḥ cit avitārā apamasya cit
translated: Make ye our portion, O ye Asvins, glorious, like the beautiful Soma, among the bountiful.🔽Ye are the two who make the aged young again, the two who give the blind their sight, the two who give the helpless strength.

original: andhasya cin nāsatyā kṛśasya cid yuvām id āhur bhiṣajā rutasya cit //
analyzed: andhasya cit nāsatyā kṛśasya cit yuvām id āhuḥ bhiṣajā rutasya cit
translated: Ye are the two whom they call the physicians of the lame and the blind, O Nâsatyas, of the weak and the dumb.

original: yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ sanayaṃ yathā ratham punar yuvānaṃ carathāya takṣathuḥ /
analyzed: yuvam cyavānam sanayam yathā ratham punar yuvānam carathāya takṣathuḥ
translated: Ye made Cyavana, who was bent together like a car, straight again, and young, that he might move about.

original: niṣ ṭaugryam ūhathur adbhyas pari viśvet tā vāṃ savaneṣu pravācyā //
analyzed: niḥ taugryam ūhathuḥ adbhyaḥ pari viśvā id tā vām savaneṣu pravācyā
translated: Ye brought back Taugrya from the waters, and all that is yours to command shall be done at your drinking-feasts.

original: purāṇā vāṃ vīryā pra bravā jane 'tho hāsathur bhiṣajā mayobhuvā /
analyzed: purāṇā vām vīryā pra bravā jane thaḥ hāsathuḥ bhiṣajā mayobhuvā
translated: I will proclaim your ancient deeds of prowess among the people, and ye have been the physicians who give joy.

original: tā vāṃ nu navyāv avase karāmahe 'yaṃ nāsatyā śrad arir yathā dadhat //
analyzed: tā vām nu navyau avase karāmahe yam nāsatyā śrath ariḥ yathā dadhat
translated: To you, O ye two Nâsatyas, we come for aid, that this man may be as one who has faith and is not faithless.

original: iyaṃ vām ahve śṛṇutam me aśvinā putrāyeva pitarā mahyaṃ śikṣatam /🔽anāpir ajñā asajātyāmatiḥ purā tasyā abhiśaster ava spṛtam //🔽yuvaṃ rathena vimadāya śundhyuvaṃ ny ūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣaṇām /
analyzed: iyam vām ahve śṛṇutam me aśvinā putrāya iva pitarā mahyam śikṣatam  an āpiḥ ajñāḥ asajātyā amatiḥ purā tasyāḥ abhiśasteḥ ava spṛtam  yuvam rathena vimadāya śundhyuvam ni ūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣaṇām
translated: Listen to me, O ye Aṣvins, I invoke you both: instruct me as a father his son.🔽Before that curse of yours, O ye who know not birth, O ye who are not born, O ye who are not of the same race, O ye who are not of the same lineage, protect me.🔽With your chariot you brought the maiden of Purumitra to the sonless Vimada.

original: yuvaṃ havaṃ vadhrimatyā agacchataṃ yuvaṃ suṣutiṃ cakrathuḥ purandhaye //
analyzed: yuvam havam vadhrimatyāḥ agacchatam yuvam suṣutim cakrathuḥ purandhaye
translated: You came to the call of the barren one, you made Susupti for the maiden.

original: yuvaṃ viprasya jaraṇām upeyuṣaḥ punaḥ kaler akṛṇutaṃ yuvad vayaḥ /🔽yuvaṃ vandanam ṛśyadād ud ūpathur yuvaṃ sadyo viśpalām etave kṛthaḥ //
analyzed: yuvam viprasya jaraṇām upeyuṣaḥ punar kaleḥ akṛṇutam yuvat vayaḥ  yuvam vandanam ṛśyadāt ud ūpathuḥ yuvam sadyas viśpalām etave kṛthaḥ
translated: You gave back youth to the sage who had grown old, you made him young again.🔽You raised up the singer from the Rṣyadgava, you made Viṣpalā ready for the guest.

original: yuvaṃ ha rebhaṃ vṛṣaṇā guhā hitam ud airayatam mamṛvāṃsam aśvinā /
analyzed: yuvam ha rebham vṛṣaṇā guhā hitam ud airayatam mamṛvāṃsam aśvinā
translated: You, O ye mighty, raised up the singer hidden in the cave, the singer who was worn out, O ye Aṣvins.

original: yuvam ṛbīsam uta taptam atraya omanvantaṃ cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye //
analyzed: yuvam ṛbīsam uta taptam atraye omanvantam cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye
translated: You made the heated Rībīsa ready for Saptavadhrya, and the one who was to be offered.

original: yuvaṃ śvetam pedave 'śvināśvaṃ navabhir vājair navatī ca vājinam /
analyzed: yuvam śvetam pedave śvinā aśvam navabhiḥ vājaiḥ navatī ca vājinam
translated: You gave to Peḍu the white horse, O ye Aṣvins, with nine powers and ninety strong ones.

original: carkṛtyaṃ dadathur drāvayatsakham bhagaṃ na nṛbhyo havyam mayobhuvam //
analyzed: carkṛtyam dadathuḥ drāvayat sakham bhagam na nṛbhyaḥ havyam mayobhuvam
translated: You gave the helpful one, the friend of the swift, to be offered, like Bhaga, to men, the oblation which brings joy.

original: na taṃ rājānāv adite kutaś cana nāṃho aśnoti duritaṃ nakir bhayam /🔽yam aśvinā suhavā rudravartanī purorathaṃ kṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha //
analyzed: na tam rājānau adite kutas cana na aṃhaḥ aśnoti duritam nakir bhayam  yam aśvinā su havā rudravartanī puroratham kṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha
translated: O King and Queen, I find no fault in you from any quarter, no misfortune, no fear.🔽O Aśvins, whom the R̥ibhus have made your chariot, with which, O ye who are easily entreated, O ye who move in the way of the Rudras, ye make your way, together with your wife.

original: ā tena yātam manaso javīyasā rathaṃ yaṃ vām ṛbhavaś cakrur aśvinā /
analyzed: ā tena yātam manasaḥ javīyasā ratham yam vām ṛbhavaḥ cakruḥ aśvinā
translated: Come hither with that (chariot), swifter than thought, O ye Aśvins, with which the R̥ibhus have made your chariot,

original: yasya yoge duhitā jāyate diva ubhe ahanī sudine vivasvataḥ //🔽tā vartir yātaṃ jayuṣā vi parvatam apinvataṃ śayave dhenum aśvinā /
analyzed: yasya yoge duhitā jāyate divaḥ ubhe ahanī sudine vivasvataḥ  tā vartiḥ yātam jayuṣā vi parvatam apinvatam śayave dhenum aśvinā
translated: With which, in the union (of the sun and dawn), his daughter, the two days, the fair days of Vivasvan, are born.🔽With that (chariot) go ye on your way, and with your strength burst open the mountain, and, O Aśvins, make the cow to flow for Śayu.

original: vṛkasya cid vartikām antar āsyād yuvaṃ śacībhir grasitām amuñcatam //
analyzed: vṛkasya cit vartikām antar āsyāt yuvam śacībhiḥ grasitām amuñcatam
translated: Even from the wolf's mouth ye delivered the youngling that was seized by him with your might.

original: etaṃ vāṃ stomam aśvināv akarmātakṣāma bhṛgavo na ratham /
analyzed: etam vām stomam aśvinau akarma atakṣāma bhṛgavaḥ na ratham
translated: O Aśvins, we have fashioned this hymn for you, as the Bhṛgus fashion a chariot.

original: ny amṛkṣāma yoṣaṇāṃ na marye nityaṃ na sūnuṃ tanayaṃ dadhānāḥ //🔽rathaṃ yāntaṃ kuha ko ha vāṃ narā prati dyumantaṃ suvitāya bhūṣati /
analyzed: ni amṛkṣāma yoṣaṇām na marye nityam na sūnum tanayam dadhānāḥ  ratham yāntam kuha kaḥ ha vām narā prati dyumantam suvitāya bhūṣati
translated: We have rubbed the maiden, as a man (rubs his wife), to conceive a son, a child, who shall always be (ours).🔽Who, O ye Heroes, will prepare for you the splendid (chariot) that is to go, to meet it, for your welfare?

original: prātaryāvāṇaṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśe vastorvastor vahamānaṃ dhiyā śami //
analyzed: prātaryāvāṇam vibhvam viśeviśe vastoḥ vastoḥ vahamānam dhiyā śami
translated: The all-pervading (chariot) that comes in the morning, that is brought to every house, to every house, by the thought, to the place of worship?

original: kuha svid doṣā kuha vastor aśvinā kuhābhipitvaṃ karataḥ kuhoṣatuḥ /
analyzed: kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoḥ aśvinā kuha abhipitvam karataḥ kuha uṣatuḥ
translated: Where, O ye Aṣvins, is your fault, where is your dwelling-place? Where is your coming? where your going?

original: ko vāṃ śayutrā vidhaveva devaram maryaṃ na yoṣā kṛṇute sadhastha ā //
analyzed: kaḥ vām śayutrā vidhavā iva devaram maryam na yoṣā kṛṇute sadhasthe ā
translated: Who, like a widow, O ye Heroes, brings her husband to the house, as a young wife brings her lover?

original: prātar jarethe jaraṇeva kāpayā vastorvastor yajatā gacchatho gṛham /
analyzed: prātar jarethe jaraṇā iva kāpayā vastoḥ vastoḥ yajatā gacchathaḥ gṛham
translated: Ye go at morn, O ye who move at morn, to the house of him who worships, as to your home.

original: kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rājaputreva savanāva gacchathaḥ //
analyzed: kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rāja putrā iva savanā ava gacchathaḥ
translated: To whom, O Heroes, do ye come like impet steeds, as to a feast, as to a prince's home?

original: yuvām mṛgeva vāraṇā mṛgaṇyavo doṣā vastor haviṣā ni hvayāmahe /
analyzed: yuvām mṛgā iva vāraṇā mṛgaṇyavaḥ doṣā vastoḥ haviṣā ni hvayāmahe
translated: We call you with oblation, as a hind calls her mate, O ye who move at eve and morn.

original: yuvaṃ hotrām ṛtuthā juhvate nareṣaṃ janāya vahathaḥ śubhas patī //
analyzed: yuvam hotrām ṛtuthā juhvate narā iṣam janāya vahathaḥ śubhaḥ patī
translated: Ye, O ye Heroes, who are Lords of splendour, bring the Hotar to his season and the people.

original: yuvāṃ ha ghoṣā pary aśvinā yatī rājña ūce duhitā pṛcche vāṃ narā /🔽bhūtam me ahna uta bhūtam aktave 'śvāvate rathine śaktam arvate //
analyzed: yuvām ha ghoṣā pari aśvinā yatī rājñaḥ ūce duhitā pṛcche vām narā  bhūtam me ahne uta bhūtam aktave śvāvate rathine śaktam arvate
translated: Ye, O ye Aṣvins, have been called by Ghosā, the daughter of the King, O Heroes, to your car.🔽Be with me in the day, be with me in the night, be with me when I win the prize, O ye who have a steed to give.

original: yuvaṃ kavī ṣṭhaḥ pary aśvinā rathaṃ viśo na kutso jaritur naśāyathaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam kavī ṣṭhaḥ pari aśvinā ratham viśaḥ na kutsaḥ jarituḥ naśāyathaḥ
translated: Ye two, O ye wise, have mounted on your car, O Aṣvins, and have come to Kutsa's worshipper.

original: yuvor ha makṣā pary aśvinā madhv āsā bharata niṣkṛtaṃ na yoṣaṇā //
analyzed: yuvoḥ ha makṣā pari aśvinā madhu āsā bharata niṣkṛtam na yoṣaṇā
translated: Ye, O ye Aṣvins, have been filled with meath, as a young wife with her husband, O ye Heroes.

original: yuvaṃ ha bhujyuṃ yuvam aśvinā vaśaṃ yuvaṃ śiñjāram uśanām upārathuḥ /
analyzed: yuvam ha bhujyum yuvam aśvinā vaśam yuvam śiñjāram uśanām upārathuḥ
translated: You two delivered Bhujyu, O ye Aṣvins, and Vaṣa, and you brought Śiñjāra and Uśanâ.

original: yuvo rarāvā pari sakhyam āsate yuvor aham avasā sumnam ā cake //
analyzed: yuvoḥ rarāvā pari sakhyam āsate yuvoḥ aham avasā sumnam ā cake
translated: They who are far away sit in your friendship: I, for my part, O ye, through favour, seek your grace.

original: yuvaṃ ha kṛśaṃ yuvam aśvinā śayuṃ yuvaṃ vidhantaṃ vidhavām uruṣyathaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam ha kṛśam yuvam aśvinā śayum yuvam vidhantam vidhavām uruṣyathaḥ
translated: You two, O ye Aṣvins, saved the weak and the strong: you preserved the widow and the childless man.

original: yuvaṃ sanibhya stanayantam aśvināpa vrajam ūrṇuthaḥ saptāsyam //
analyzed: yuvam sanibhyaḥ stanayantam aśvinā apa vrajam ūrṇuthaḥ sapta āsyam
translated: You, O ye Aṣvins, to the thunder-armed, to the seven-mouthed, opened the stall of kine.

original: janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnako vi cāruhan vīrudho daṃsanā anu /
analyzed: janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnakaḥ vi cāru han vīrudhaḥ daṃsanāḥ anu
translated: The woman hath brought forth the infant, the child hath moved, and plants have sprung forth in the rain.

original: āsmai rīyante nivaneva sindhavo 'smā ahne bhavati tat patitvanam //
analyzed: ā asmai rīyante nivanā iva sindhavaḥ smai ahne bhavati tat patitvanam
translated: To him the rivers flow as to a reservoir: that is his manhood which he hath at this time.

original: jīvaṃ rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghām anu prasitiṃ dīdhiyur naraḥ /🔽vāmam pitṛbhyo ya idaṃ samerire mayaḥ patibhyo janayaḥ pariṣvaje //🔽na tasya vidma tad u ṣu pra vocata yuvā ha yad yuvatyāḥ kṣeti yoniṣu /
analyzed: jīvam rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghām anu prasitim dīdhiyuḥ naraḥ  vāmam pitṛbhyaḥ ye idam samerire mayaḥ patibhyaḥ janayaḥ pariṣvaje  na tasya vidma tat u su pra vocata yuvā ha yat yuvatyāḥ kṣeti yoniṣu
translated: They weep for the living: they lament at the sacrifice: the men have stretched out their long arms in their longing.

original: priyosriyasya vṛṣabhasya retino gṛhaṃ gamemāśvinā tad uśmasi //
analyzed: priya usriyasya vṛṣabhasya retinaḥ gṛham gamema aśvinā tat uśmasi
translated: To the Fathers who have gone to the world of the Fathers, to the husbands, to the sons, to the brothers, to the kinsmen, to the friends, to the relatives, to the sires, to the grandsires, to the great-grandsires, to the mothers, to the grandmothers, to the great-grandmothers, to the sisters, to the aunts, to the female relatives, to the female kinsmen, to the female friends, to the female neighbours, to the female companions, to the female associates, to the female relatives by marriage, to the female relatives by the mother's sister, to the female relatives by the father's sister, to the female relatives by the mother's brother, to the female relatives by the father's brother, to the female relatives by the mother's father, to the female relatives by the father's father, to the female relatives by the mother's grandfather, to the female relatives by the father's grandfather, to the female relatives by the mother's great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the father's great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the mother's great-great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the father's great-great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the mother's great-great-great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the father's great-great-great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the mother's great-great-great-great-grandfather, to the female relatives by the father's great-great

original: ā vām agan sumatir vājinīvasū ny aśvinā hṛtsu kāmā ayaṃsata /
analyzed: ā vām agan sumatiḥ vājinīvasū ni aśvinā hṛtsu kāmāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: Your favour, O ye rich in wealth, hath come to us: the wishes in our hearts, O ye Âsyins, have been fulfilled.

original: abhūtaṃ gopā mithunā śubhas patī priyā aryamṇo duryāṃ aśīmahi //
analyzed: abhūtam gopā mithunā śubhaḥ patī priyāḥ aryamṇaḥ duryām aśīmahi
translated: We have come to the house of Aryaman, ye twain, the guardians, lords of splendour, who have been.

original: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā dhattaṃ rayiṃ sahavīraṃ vacasyave /
analyzed: tā mandasānā manuṣaḥ duroṇe ā dhattam rayim saha vīram vacasyave
translated: Gratified, bestow upon the worshipper wealth with brave sons, in the dwelling of a mortal.

original: kṛtaṃ tīrthaṃ suprapāṇaṃ śubhas patī sthāṇum patheṣṭhām apa durmatiṃ hatam //
analyzed: kṛtam tīrtham su prapāṇam śubhaḥ patī sthāṇum patheṣṭhām apa durmatim hatam
translated: Ye lords of splendour, ye have made the ford easy of access, the well easy of approach: ye have destroyed the standing-place of evil thought on the path.

original: kva svid adya katamāsv aśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayete śubhas patī /
analyzed: kva svid adya katamāsu aśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayete śubhaḥ patī
translated: Where now, this day, in what men's habitations are the wondrous Aṣvins, lords of splendour, gladdened?

original: ka īṃ ni yeme katamasya jagmatur viprasya vā yajamānasya vā gṛham //
analyzed: kaḥ īm ni yeme katamasya jagmatuḥ viprasya vā yajamānasya vā gṛham
translated: Who hath confined them? To what one have they gone, to the Brāhman's house or to the worshipper's?

original: samānam u tyam puruhūtam ukthyaṃ rathaṃ tricakraṃ savanā ganigmatam /
analyzed: samānam u tyam puru hūtam ukthyam ratham tri cakram savanā ganigmatam
translated: That car of yours, O ye invoked of many, worthy of praise, with three wheels, that cometh to the rites,

original: parijmānaṃ vidathyaṃ suvṛktibhir vayaṃ vyuṣṭā uṣaso havāmahe //
analyzed: parijmānam vidathyam suvṛktibhiḥ vayam vyuṣṭau uṣasaḥ havāmahe
translated: That passeth by, meet for the sacrifice, with fair hymns of praise, we call at early morn, O Aṣvins.

original: prātaryujaṃ nāsatyādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātaryāvāṇam madhuvāhanaṃ ratham /
analyzed: prātar yujam nāsatyā adhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātar yāvāṇam madhu vāhanam ratham
translated: Ye mount the chariot yoked at early morn, the car that bringeth meath, that goeth at the dawn.

original: viśo yena gacchatho yajvarīr narā kīreś cid yajñaṃ hotṛmantam aśvinā //
analyzed: viśaḥ yena gacchathaḥ yajvarīḥ narā kīreḥ cit yajñam hotṛmantam aśvinā
translated: Therewith, O Heroes, ye visit the worshipper's tribes, and, O ye Aṣvins, the sacrifice of him who hath the press-stone.

original: adhvaryuṃ vā madhupāṇiṃ suhastyam agnidhaṃ vā dhṛtadakṣaṃ damūnasam /
analyzed: adhvaryum vā madhu pāṇim suhastyam agnidham vā dhṛtadakṣam damūnasam
translated: The Adhvaryu with the honey-handed, skilled in work, or the Agnidh, firm in his power, the peace-maker,

original: viprasya vā yat savanāni gacchatho 'ta ā yātam madhupeyam aśvinā //
analyzed: viprasya vā yat savanāni gacchathaḥ te ā yātam madhupeyam aśvinā
translated: Or when ye go to the libations of the sage, come thence, O Asvins, to the drinking of the meath.

original: asteva su prataraṃ lāyam asyan bhūṣann iva pra bharā stomam asmai /🔽vācā viprās tarata vācam aryo ni rāmaya jaritaḥ soma indram //🔽dohena gām upa śikṣā sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram /
analyzed: astā iva su prataram lāyam asyan bhūṣan iva pra bhara stomam asmai  vācā viprāḥ tarata vācam aryaḥ ni rāmaya jaritar some indram  dohena gām upa śikṣa sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram
translated: As one who seeks a good ford, aiming at his goal, adorn him as it were, and bring the praise to him.🔽With speech, O sages, cross the speech of him who hates; make the singer's prayer reach Indra.🔽With the milk of the cow, O friend, approach the friend; awaken, O singer, the lover, Indra.

original: kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya maghadeyāya śūram //
analyzed: kośam na pūrṇam vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya magha deyāya śūram
translated: As a full treasure-house, filled with wealth, so urge thou the hero to give gifts to the liberal.

original: kim aṅga tvā maghavan bhojam āhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayaṃ tvā śṛṇomi /
analyzed: kim aṅga tvā maghavan bhojam āhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayam tvā śṛṇomi
translated: Why, O bountiful one, do they call thee the giver of boons? Excite me; I hear thee as one to be excited.

original: apnasvatī mama dhīr astu śakra vasuvidam bhagam indrā bharā naḥ //
analyzed: apnasvatī mama dhīḥ astu śakra vasu vidam bhagam indra ā bhara naḥ
translated: Let my thought be full of wealth for thee, O Sakra; bring us, O Indra, good fortune that shall find wealth.

original: tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣv indra saṃtasthānā vi hvayante samīke /
analyzed: tvām janāḥ mamasatyeṣu indra saṃtasthānāḥ vi hvayante samīke
translated: In the contests of the people, O Indra, they who are true to me call thee to the encounter.

original: atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ //
analyzed: atrā yujam kṛṇute yaḥ haviṣmān na a sunvatā sakhyam vaṣṭi śūraḥ
translated: Here the man who brings oblations makes thee his ally; the hero seeks not friendship with him who offers not.

original: dhanaṃ na syandram bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrān somāṃ āsunoti prayasvān /
analyzed: dhanam na syandram bahulam yaḥ asmai tīvrān somān āsunoti prayasvān
translated: He who, with abundant wealth, presses for him the strong Soma juices, shall not lack riches.

original: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātar ahno ni svaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram //
analyzed: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātar ahnaḥ ni svaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram
translated: To him Indra smites down the wicked foes in the morning, the impetuous, the youthful, and slays Vrtra.

original: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsam indre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavā kāmam asme /🔽ārāc cit san bhayatām asya śatrur ny asmai dyumnā janyā namantām //
analyzed: yasmin vayam śaṃsam indre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavā kāmam asme  ārāt cit san bhayatām asya śatruḥ ni asmai dyumnā janyā namantām
translated: In whom, O Indra, we place our hope, who, the bountiful, has set his heart on our desire,🔽Even from afar let his foe tremble before him: to him let the glories of men bow down.

original: ārāc chatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugro yaḥ śambaḥ puruhūta tena /🔽asme dhehi yavamad gomad indra kṛdhī dhiyaṃ jaritre vājaratnām //
analyzed: ārāt śatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugraḥ yaḥ śambaḥ puruhūta tena  asme dhehi yavamat gomat indra kṛdhi dhiyam jaritre vāja ratnām
translated: Drive thou the foe afar, drive him away, O thou who art invoked by many, with that terrible thunderbolt of thine.🔽Bestow upon us, O Indra, wealth in horses and in cattle: make the singer's thought rich in spoil.

original: pra yam antar vṛṣasavāso agman tīvrāḥ somā bahulāntāsa indram /
analyzed: pra yam antar vṛṣa savāsaḥ agman tīvrāḥ somāḥ bahula antāsaḥ indram
translated: Whom they, the strong, have reached, the strong who bring the Soma, the many, the mighty, Indra,

original: nāha dāmānam maghavā ni yaṃsan ni sunvate vahati bhūri vāmam //
analyzed: na aha dāmānam maghavā ni yaṃsat ni sunvate vahati bhūri vāmam
translated: Maghavan will not withhold the gift he has promised: he brings much good to him who presses out the juice.

original: uta prahām atidīvyā jayāti kṛtaṃ yac chvaghnī vicinoti kāle /
analyzed: uta prahām atidīvya jayāti kṛtam yat śvaghnī vicinoti kāle
translated: He wins the gambler who plays for a high stake: what the skilful gambler wins in time he keeps.

original: yo devakāmo na dhanā ruṇaddhi sam it taṃ rāyā sṛjati svadhāvān //
analyzed: yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanā ruṇaddhi sam id tam rāyā sṛjati svadhāvān
translated: He whom the God-loving one, the self-dependent, does not withhold from wealth, him he makes rich.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām
translated: With cows may we surmount the evil of sin, with barley all the hunger of the many-invoked.

original: vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāny asmākena vṛjanenā jayema //
analyzed: vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema
translated: With kings may we win the first treasures with our own company.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghāyoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above and from below, O bounteous one.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varivaḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front and from the middle, as a friend, grant room for our friends.

original: acchā ma indram matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīr viśvā uśatīr anūṣata /
analyzed: acchā me indram matayaḥ svar vidaḥ sadhrīcīḥ viśvāḥ uśatīḥ anūṣata
translated: To Indra have come my thoughts, finding the light, all longing, friendly, have sung to him.

original: pari ṣvajante janayo yathā patim maryaṃ na śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye //
analyzed: pari svajante janayaḥ yathā patim maryam na śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye
translated: They have encompassed him as dames their husband, the bountiful, the young man, for help.

original: na ghā tvadrig apa veti me manas tve it kāmam puruhūta śiśraya /
analyzed: na ghā tvadrik apa veti me manaḥ tve id kāmam puruhūta śiśraya
translated: My mind does not turn to thee, O Indra, in this my longing, O much-invoked, be thou propitious.

original: rājeva dasma ni ṣado 'dhi barhiṣy asmin su some 'vapānam astu te //
analyzed: rājā iva dasma ni sadaḥ dhi barhiṣi asmin su some vapānam astu te
translated: O wondrous one, as a king on the sacrificial grass, on this good Soma, be thy drinking.

original: viṣūvṛd indro amater uta kṣudhaḥ sa id rāyo maghavā vasva īśate /
analyzed: viṣūvṛt indraḥ amateḥ uta kṣudhaḥ saḥ id rāyaḥ maghavā vasvaḥ īśate
translated: Indra, the supporter, from want and from hunger, he, the bountiful, rules over wealth and good things.

original: tasyed ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavo vayo vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ //
analyzed: tasya id ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavaḥ vayaḥ vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translated: To him these seven rivers in the two valleys increase the strength of the strong bull.

original: vayo na vṛkṣaṃ supalāśam āsadan somāsa indram mandinaś camūṣadaḥ /
analyzed: vayaḥ na vṛkṣam su palāśam āsadan somāsaḥ indram mandinaḥ camūṣadaḥ
translated: The gladdening Soma-drops, the gladdener, have sat them down upon the tree with goodly branches, on Indra.

original: praiṣām anīkaṃ śavasā davidyutad vidat svar manave jyotir āryam //
analyzed: pra eṣām anīkam śavasā davidyutat vidat svar manave jyotiḥ āryam
translated: Their front hath shone with might: he hath discovered the light that leads to heaven for Manu's offspring.

original: kṛtaṃ na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargaṃ yan maghavā sūryaṃ jayat /
analyzed: kṛtam na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargam yat maghavā sūryam jayat
translated: The gambler never wins the stake which Maghavan the conqueror hath gained, the Sun, the prize.

original: na tat te anyo anu vīryaṃ śakan na purāṇo maghavan nota nūtanaḥ //
analyzed: na tat te anyaḥ anu vīryam śakat na purāṇaḥ maghavan na uta nūtanaḥ
translated: No other man, O Bounteous Lord, can equal thee, neither the ancient nor the modern.

original: viśaṃviśam maghavā pary aśāyata janānāṃ dhenā avacākaśad vṛṣā /
analyzed: viśaṃviśam maghavā pari aśāyata janānām dhenāḥ avacākaśat vṛṣā
translated: Maghavan hath lain down in every house: the Bull hath looked upon the people's songs of praise.

original: yasyāha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ //
analyzed: yasya aha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Whom, O ye men, at your libations, Śakra, the bounteous, loves, he with his strong Soma-drops conquers the foemen.

original: āpo na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsa indraṃ kulyā iva hradam /🔽vardhanti viprā maho asya sādane yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir divyena dānunā //🔽vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayad rajassv ā yo aryapatnīr akṛṇod imā apaḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsaḥ indram kulyāḥ iva hradam  vardhanti viprāḥ mahaḥ asya sādane yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ divyena dānunā  vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayat rajassu ā yaḥ arya patnīḥ akṛṇot imāḥ apaḥ
translated: As waters flow together to the river, so to Indra flow the Soma-drops, O Indu,🔽As streams to a lake. The sages in his dwelling magnify his greatness as the rain the barley with celestial moisture.🔽Like an enraged bull hath he spread himself through the regions, he who hath made these waters subject to the noble dame.

original: sa sunvate maghavā jīradānave 'vindaj jyotir manave haviṣmate //
analyzed: sa sunvate maghavā jīra dānave vindat jyotiḥ manave haviṣmate
translated: He hath discovered light for man who offers gifts, the bounteous to the man who pours the juice and gives him store.

original: uj jāyatām paraśur jyotiṣā saha bhūyā ṛtasya sudughā purāṇavat /
analyzed: ud jāyatām paraśuḥ jyotiṣā saha bhūyāḥ ṛtasya su dughā purāṇa vat
translated: Let the axe be born with light, let the ancient well-milking cow of truth be abundant.

original: vi rocatām aruṣo bhānunā śuciḥ svar ṇa śukraṃ śuśucīta satpatiḥ //
analyzed: vi rocatām aruṣaḥ bhānunā śuciḥ svar na śukram śuśucīta satpatiḥ
translated: Let the red one shine with radiance, pure, may the lord of the good shine with bright light.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām /🔽vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāny asmākena vṛjanenā jayema //
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām  vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema
translated: With cows may we overcome evil desire, with barley all hunger, O you who are invoked by many.🔽May we, with kings, win treasures with our own people.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghāyoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the west, and from the north, from the south, O you who slay the foe.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varivaḥ kṛṇotu //
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the east, from the middle, be our friend, and make room for his friends.

original: ā yātv indraḥ svapatir madāya yo dharmaṇā tūtujānas tuviṣmān /🔽pratvakṣāṇo ati viśvā sahāṃsy apāreṇa mahatā vṛṣṇyena //
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ sva patiḥ madāya yaḥ dharmaṇā tūtujānaḥ tuviṣmān  pratvakṣāṇaḥ ati viśvā sahāṃsi apāreṇa mahatā vṛṣṇyena
translated: May Indra, the lord of the house, come for the feast, he who is mighty, rejoicing in the law.🔽Overpowering all enemies, with boundless great manly power.

original: suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ suyamā harī te mimyakṣa vajro nṛpate gabhastau /
analyzed: suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ su yamā harī te mimyakṣa vajraḥ nṛpate gabhastau
translated: Your chariot is well-made, your two bay horses are easy to drive, O lord of men, your thunderbolt and arms are sharpened.

original: śībhaṃ rājan supathā yāhy arvāṅ vardhāma te papuṣo vṛṣṇyāni //
analyzed: śībham rājan su pathā yāhi arvāṅ vardhāma te papuṣaḥ vṛṣṇyāni
translated: O king, come quickly on the good path, we will increase your manly powers, O you who drink.

original: endravāho nṛpatiṃ vajrabāhum ugram ugrāsas taviṣāsa enam /
analyzed: ā indra vāhaḥ nṛpatim vajra bāhum ugram ugrāsaḥ taviṣāsaḥ enam
translated: The bearers of Indra, the lords of men, with arms like thunderbolts, the mighty ones, the strong ones, have made him strong.

original: pratvakṣasaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ satyaśuṣmam em asmatrā sadhamādo vahantu //
analyzed: pratvakṣasam vṛṣabham satya śuṣmam ā īm asmatrā sadhamādaḥ vahantu
translated: Bring hither to us, to our drinking-feast, the Bull who hath strong shoulders, whose might is true.

original: evā patiṃ droṇasācaṃ sacetasam ūrja skambhaṃ dharuṇa ā vṛṣāyase /
analyzed: eva patim droṇasācam sacetasam ūrjaḥ skambham dharuṇe ā vṛṣāyase
translated: Thus I exalt the Lord of the trough, the wise one, the prop of strength, the supporter, the Bull.

original: ojaḥ kṛṣva saṃ gṛbhāya tve apy aso yathā kenipānām ino vṛdhe //🔽gamann asme vasūny ā hi śaṃsiṣaṃ svāśiṣam bharam ā yāhi sominaḥ /
analyzed: ojaḥ kṛṣva sam gṛbhāya tve api asaḥ yathā kenipānām inaḥ vṛdhe  gaman asme vasūni ā hi śaṃsiṣam su āśiṣam bharam ā yāhi sominaḥ
translated: Gather force, grasp it, and let it be in thee, as thou art the lord of the Kaniyanas for increase.🔽Come to us, for I will proclaim to thee the treasures. Bring the blessing, come to the Soma-presser.

original: tvam īśiṣe sāsminn ā satsi barhiṣy anādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā //
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe sā asmin ā satsi barhiṣi anādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā
translated: Thou art the lord, sit on this strew. Thy vessels are inviolable by law.

original: pṛthak prāyan prathamā devahūtayo 'kṛṇvata śravasyāni duṣṭarā /
analyzed: pṛthak prāyan prathamāḥ deva hūtayaḥ kṛṇvata śravasyāni duṣṭarā
translated: The first invoked by the gods have gone apart, they have made fame hard to win.

original: na ye śekur yajñiyāṃ nāvam āruham īrmaiva te ny aviśanta kepayaḥ //
analyzed: na ye śekuḥ yajñiyām nāvam āruham īrma eva te ni aviśanta kepayaḥ
translated: Those who could not ascend the sacrificial ship, they have sunk down, the slow ones, in the mud.

original: evaivāpāg apare santu dūḍhyo 'śvā yeṣāṃ duryuja āyuyujre /
analyzed: eva eva apāk apare santu dūḍhyaḥ śvā yeṣām duryujaḥ āyuyujre
translated: So let the other evil-doers be far away, whose horses, hard to yoke, have been yoked.

original: itthā ye prāg upare santi dāvane purūṇi yatra vayunāni bhojanā //
analyzed: itthā ye prāk upare santi dāvane purūṇi yatra vayunāni bhojanā
translated: Here are those who are above and below for the giving of many gifts, where there are many deeds to be done.

original: girīṃr ajrān rejamānāṃ adhārayad dyauḥ krandad antarikṣāṇi kopayat /
analyzed: girīn ajrān rejamānām adhārayat dyauḥ krandat antarikṣāṇi kopayat
translated: He hath set the unmoving mountains in motion, the sky hath roared, the airs have been agitated.

original: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi ṣkabhāyati vṛṣṇaḥ pītvā mada ukthāni śaṃsati //🔽imam bibharmi sukṛtaṃ te aṅkuśaṃ yenārujāsi maghavañ chaphārujaḥ /🔽asmin su te savane astv okyaṃ suta iṣṭau maghavan bodhy ābhagaḥ //🔽gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām /🔽vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāny asmākena vṛjanenā jayema //🔽bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghāyoḥ /🔽indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varivaḥ kṛṇotu //🔽divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe agnir asmad dvitīyam pari jātavedāḥ /🔽tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇā ajasram indhāna enaṃ jarate svādhīḥ //
analyzed: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi skabhāyati vṛṣṇaḥ pītvā made ukthāni śaṃsati  imam bibharmi su kṛtam te aṅkuśam yena ārujāsi maghavan śaphārujaḥ  asmin su te savane astu okyam sute iṣṭau maghavan bodhi ābhagaḥ  gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām  vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema  bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ  indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu  divaḥ pari prathamam jajñe agniḥ asmat dvitīyam pari jātavedāḥ  tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇāḥ ajasram indhānaḥ enam jarate svādhīḥ
translated: He who hath two equal arms, he stretches them out, the strong one, after drinking the gladdening drink, sings the praises of the lauds.🔽I bear this well-made goad of thine, wherewith, O Maghavan, thou breakest the shanks of (the Dasyus).🔽Let this be thy home at this libation, be ready, O Maghavan, at the offering of the pressed (Soma).🔽With cattle may we pass over evil want, with barley all hunger, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all, O ye all

original: vidmā te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā /🔽vidmā te nāma paramaṃ guhā yad vidmā tam utsaṃ yata ājagantha //
analyzed: vidma te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidma te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā 🔽vidma te nāma paramam guhā yat vidma tam utsam yatas ājagantha
translated: He who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he who hath two distinct powers, he

original: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsv antar nṛcakṣā īdhe divo agna ūdhan /
analyzed: samudre tvā nṛmaṇāḥ apsu antar nṛ cakṣāḥ īdhe divaḥ agne ūdhan
translated: In the ocean, O man-honoured one, in the waters, O man-seeing one, they have kindled thee, O Agni, in the womb of the sky.

original: tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsam apām upasthe mahiṣā avardhan //🔽akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan /
analyzed: tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsam apām upasthe mahiṣāḥ avardhan  akrandat agniḥ stanayan iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan
translated: In the third region, in the lap of the waters, the mighty ones have increased thee who art standing.🔽Agni has cried out like the thundering sky, shaking the earth, uniting the plants.

original: sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //🔽śrīṇām udāro dharuṇo rayīṇām manīṣāṇām prārpaṇaḥ somagopāḥ /
analyzed: sadyas jajñānaḥ vi hi īm iddhaḥ akhyat ā rodasī bhānunā bhāti antar  śrīṇām udāraḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām manīṣāṇām prārpaṇaḥ soma gopāḥ
translated: As soon as he is born, kindled, he has shone forth, he shines in the two worlds with his light.🔽The most liberal supporter of riches, the bestower of thoughts, the guardian of Soma,

original: vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājā vi bhāty agra uṣasām idhānaḥ //
analyzed: vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahasaḥ apsu rājā vi bhāti agre uṣasām idhānaḥ
translated: The son of strength, the treasure, the king in the waters, is shining forth, kindled at the beginning of the dawns.

original: viśvasya ketur bhuvanasya garbha ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ /🔽vīḷuṃ cid adrim abhinat parāyañ janā yad agnim ayajanta pañca //
analyzed: viśvasya ketuḥ bhuvanasya garbhaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāt jāyamānaḥ  vīḍum cit adrim abhinat parāyam janāḥ yat agnim ayajanta pañca
translated: The banner of the universe, the embryo of the world, he has filled the two worlds as he is born.🔽Even the stone he has shattered, as he went away, when the five peoples worshipped Agni.

original: uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā marteṣv agnir amṛto ni dhāyi /🔽iyarti dhūmam aruṣam bharibhrad uc chukreṇa śociṣā dyām inakṣan //
analyzed: uśij pāvakaḥ aratiḥ sumedhāḥ marteṣu agniḥ amṛtaḥ ni dhāyi  iyarti dhūmam aruṣam bharibhrat ud śukreṇa śociṣā dyām inakṣan
translated: The eager purifier, the good-minded messenger, Agni, the immortal, is placed among mortals.🔽Bearing the ruddy smoke, the trembling one, he will ascend the sky with his bright radiance.

original: dṛśāno rukma urviyā vy adyaud durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ /
analyzed: dṛśānaḥ rukmaḥ urviyā vi adyaut durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ
translated: Shining with his light, the golden one has spread out over the wide earth, his life difficult to bear, shining for glory.

original: agnir amṛto abhavad vayobhir yad enaṃ dyaur janayat suretāḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ amṛtaḥ abhavat vayobhiḥ yat enam dyauḥ janayat su retāḥ
translated: Agni became immortal through his powers, when Dyaus, the well-endowed one, generated him.

original: yas te adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce 'pūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantam agne /
analyzed: yaḥ te adya kṛṇavat bhadra śoce pūpam deva ghṛtavantam agne
translated: O Agni, the one who today prepares for you a cake anointed with ghee, O god,

original: pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo acchābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yaviṣṭha //
analyzed: pra tam naya prataram vasyaḥ accha abhi sumnam deva bhaktam yaviṣṭha
translated: lead him to the further shore, to the better place, to the bliss of the gods, O youngest one.

original: ā tam bhaja sauśravaseṣv agna ukthauktha ā bhaja śasyamāne /
analyzed: ā tam bhaja sauśravaseṣu agne ukthaukthe ā bhaja śasyamāne
translated: O Agni, share him in the good reports, share him in every hymn that is recited.

original: priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāty uj jātena bhinadad uj janitvaiḥ //
analyzed: priyaḥ sūrye priyaḥ agnā bhavāti ud jātena bhinadat ud janitvaiḥ
translated: May he be dear to the sun, dear to Agni, may he be exalted by his offspring, exalted by his children.

original: tvām agne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi /
analyzed: tvām agne yajamānāḥ anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi
translated: O Agni, the sacrificers, following the days, have placed in you all the valuable treasures.

original: tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānā vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ //
analyzed: tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānāḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ
translated: Desiring wealth with you, the eager ones have opened the cow-filled pen.

original: astāvy agnir narāṃ suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥ somagopāḥ /
analyzed: astāvi agniḥ narām su śevaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ ṛṣibhiḥ soma gopāḥ
translated: Agni, the very gracious one among men, Vaiśvānara, has been praised by the Ṛṣis, the guardians of Soma.

original: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayim asme suvīram //
analyzed: a dveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devāḥ dhatta rayim asme su vīram
translated: Let us invoke Dyaus and Pṛthivī in non-enmity. O gods, grant us wealth with good heroes.

original: pra hotā jāto mahān nabhovin nṛṣadvā sīdad apām upasthe /
analyzed: pra hotā jātaḥ mahān nabhaḥ vid nṛṣadvā sīdat apām upasthe
translated: The great, heaven-born priest, born, seated in the lap of the waters, the abode of men,

original: dadhir yo dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhate tanūpāḥ //
analyzed: dadhiḥ yaḥ dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhate tanū pāḥ
translated: he who is supported, your breaths, the protector of your body, the distributor of treasures to the one who has prepared (the sacrifice).

original: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe paśuṃ na naṣṭam padair anu gman /🔽guhā catantam uśijo namobhir icchanto dhīrā bhṛgavo 'vindan //
analyzed: imam vidhantaḥ apām sadhasthe paśum na naṣṭam padaiḥ anu gman  guhā catantam uśijaḥ namobhiḥ icchantaḥ dhīrāḥ bhṛgavaḥ vindan
translated: Seeking him who had disappeared, they found him in the abode of the waters, like a lost animal, by his footprints.🔽The wise ones, the Bhṛgus, found him, seeking him with reverence, hidden away.

original: imaṃ trito bhūry avindad icchan vaibhūvaso mūrdhany aghnyāyāḥ /
analyzed: imam tritaḥ bhūri avindat icchan vaibhūvasaḥ mūrdhani aghnyāyāḥ
translated: Trita, seeking him, found him, the great one, the head of the cow, the possessor of wealth.

original: sa śevṛdho jāta ā harmyeṣu nābhir yuvā bhavati rocanasya //
analyzed: sa śevṛdhaḥ jātaḥ ā harmyeṣu nābhiḥ yuvā bhavati rocanasya
translated: He, the prosperous one, born in the houses, becomes the young navel of the radiant one.

original: mandraṃ hotāram uśijo namobhiḥ prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ netāram adhvarāṇām /
analyzed: mandram hotāram uśijaḥ namobhiḥ prāñcam yajñam netāram adhvarāṇām
translated: The wise ones, with reverence, have made the cheerful one the Hotar, the leader of the sacrifice, the leader of the rites.

original: viśām akṛṇvann aratim pāvakaṃ havyavāhaṃ dadhato mānuṣeṣu //🔽pra bhūr jayantam mahāṃ vipodhām mūrā amūram purāṃ darmāṇam /
analyzed: viśām akṛṇvan aratim pāvakam havyavāham dadhataḥ mānuṣeṣu  pra bhūḥ jayantam mahām vipodhām mūrāḥ amūram purām darmāṇam
translated: They have made him the purifier, the messenger of the people, the bearer of oblations among men.🔽The great one, the conqueror, the supporter of strength, the wise one, the foolish one, the breaker of forts,

original: nayanto garbhaṃ vanāṃ dhiyaṃ dhur hiriśmaśruṃ nārvāṇaṃ dhanarcam //
analyzed: nayantaḥ garbham vanām dhiyam dhuḥ hiriśmaśrum na arvāṇam dhana ṛcam
translated: leading the embryo, the thought, to the woods, the glorious one, the swift one, the one to be praised with wealth.

original: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivīto yonau sīdad antaḥ /
analyzed: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivītaḥ yonau sīdat antar
translated: Trita, having become firm in the houses, sits surrounded in the womb.

original: ataḥ saṃgṛbhyā viśāṃ damūnā vidharmaṇāyantrair īyate nṝn //
analyzed: atas saṃgṛbhyā viśām damūnāḥ vidharmaṇā ayantraiḥ īyate nṝn
translated: From there, the one who delights the people, is led to the men with the reins of the law.

original: asyājarāso damām aritrā arcaddhūmāso agnayaḥ pāvakāḥ /
analyzed: asya ajarāsaḥ damām aritrā arcat dhūmāsaḥ agnayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: His imperishable ploughs, his unwearied ploughmen, his shining-smoked fires, the purifiers,

original: śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāso bhuraṇyavo vanarṣado vāyavo na somāḥ //🔽pra jihvayā bharate vepo agniḥ pra vayunāni cetasā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāsaḥ bhuraṇyavaḥ vanarṣadaḥ vāyavaḥ na somāḥ  pra jihvayā bharate vepaḥ agniḥ pra vayunāni cetasā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The white-backed, the swift, the busy, the rain-pouring, the wind-like, the Soma-like.🔽With his tongue Agni bears away the trembling, with his mind the openings of the earth.

original: tam āyavaḥ śucayantam pāvakam mandraṃ hotāraṃ dadhire yajiṣṭham //
analyzed: tam āyavaḥ śucayantam pāvakam mandram hotāram dadhire yajiṣṭham
translated: The living ones have made him, the purifying, the bright, the pleasant, the best sacrificer, the Hotar.

original: dyāvā yam agnim pṛthivī janiṣṭām āpas tvaṣṭā bhṛgavo yaṃ sahobhiḥ /
analyzed: dyāvā yam agnim pṛthivī janiṣṭa ām āpaḥ tvaṣṭā bhṛgavaḥ yam sahobhiḥ
translated: Whom Dyaus and Agni, whom Pṛthivī and the waters, whom Tvaṣṭar and the Bhṛgus with their strength have generated,

original: īḷenyam prathamam mātariśvā devās tatakṣur manave yajatram //🔽yaṃ tvā devā dadhire havyavāham puruspṛho mānuṣāso yajatram /
analyzed: īḍenyam prathamam mātariśvā devāḥ tatakṣuḥ manave yajatram  yam tvā devāḥ dadhire havya vāham puruspṛhaḥ mānuṣāsaḥ yajatram
translated: Whom Mātariśvan, the most adorable, fashioned first, the gods fashioned for Manu, the adorable.🔽Whom the gods have made thee, O Agni, the bearer of oblations, much-desired by men, the adorable,

original: sa yāmann agne stuvate vayo dhāḥ pra devayan yaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: sa yāman agne stuvate vayaḥ dhāḥ pra devayan yaśasaḥ sam hi pūrvīḥ
translated: In the journey, O Agni, give strength to the praiser, and bestow many glorious (gifts), O you who are worshipped by the gods.

original: jagṛbhmā te dakṣiṇam indra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupate vasūnām /
analyzed: jagṛbhma te dakṣiṇam indra hastam vasūyavaḥ vasu pate vasūnām
translated: We have grasped thy right hand, O Indra, O you who are rich in treasures, O lord of treasures, in order to obtain treasures.

original: vidmā hi tvā gopatiṃ śūra gonām asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: vidma hi tvā gopatim śūra gonām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: We know thee as the lord of cattle, O hero, of cattle; give us wealth, O strong one, variegated (with many qualities).

original: svāyudhaṃ svavasaṃ sunīthaṃ catuḥsamudraṃ dharuṇaṃ rayīṇām /
analyzed: su āyudham su avasam su nītham catur samudram dharuṇam rayīṇām
translated: (I praise) the one with good weapons, the one with good protection, the one with good guidance, the one with four oceans, the supporter of riches.

original: carkṛtyaṃ śaṃsyam bhūrivāram asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: carkṛtyam śaṃsyam bhūri vāram asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: Give us wealth that is to be praised, to be extolled, with abundant room, varied, and strong.

original: subrahmāṇaṃ devavantam bṛhantam uruṃ gabhīram pṛthubudhnam indra /
analyzed: su brahmāṇam devavantam bṛhantam urum gabhīram pṛthu budhnam indra
translated: O Indra, [give us] a good Brahman, divine, vast, wide, deep, with a broad base,

original: śrutaṛṣim ugram abhimātiṣāham asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: śruta ṛṣim ugram abhimātiṣāham asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: heard by the sages, mighty, conquering hostility, give us wealth that is varied, strong.

original: sanadvājaṃ vipravīraṃ tarutraṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ sudakṣam /
analyzed: sanat vājam vipra vīram tarutram dhana spṛtam śūśuvāṃsam su dakṣam
translated: [Give us] one who wins prizes, a hero among the wise, a conqueror, a protector of wealth, shining, very powerful,

original: dasyuhanam pūrbhidam indra satyam asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: dasyu hanam pūrbhidam indra satyam asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: slayer of the Dasyus, breaker of forts, true, O Indra, give us wealth that is varied, strong.

original: aśvāvantaṃ rathinaṃ vīravantaṃ sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃ vājam indra /
analyzed: aśvāvantam rathinam vīravantam sahasriṇam śatinam vājam indra
translated: O Indra, [give us] one who possesses horses, chariots, heroes, a thousand, a hundred prizes,

original: bhadravrātaṃ vipravīraṃ svarṣām asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: bhadra vrātam vipra vīram svarṣām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: with a splendid troop, a hero among the wise, self-luminous, give us wealth that is varied, strong.

original: pra saptagum ṛtadhītiṃ sumedhām bṛhaspatim matir acchā jigāti /
analyzed: pra saptagum ṛta dhītim su medhām bṛhaspatim matiḥ acchā jigāti
translated: My thought goes forth to the wise, the seven-versed, the true-minded Bṛhaspati,

original: ya āṅgiraso namasopasadyo 'smabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ āṅgirasaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ smabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: the son of Aṅgiras, to be worshipped with homage, give us wealth that is varied, strong.

original: vanīvāno mama dūtāsa indraṃ stomāś caranti sumatīr iyānāḥ /
analyzed: vanīvānaḥ mama dūtāsaḥ indram stomāḥ caranti sumatīḥ iyānāḥ
translated: My messengers, like those who desire wealth, my praises, going with good intentions, move to Indra,

original: hṛdispṛśo manasā vacyamānā asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: hṛdispṛśaḥ manasā vacyamānāḥ asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: Touched by the heart, uttered by the mind, grant us wondrous wealth, O mighty one.

original: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tan na indra bṛhantaṃ kṣayam asamaṃ janānām /
analyzed: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tat naḥ indra bṛhantam kṣayam asamam janānām
translated: Whatever I ask of you, give that to me, O Indra, a lofty abode unequalled by men.

original: abhi tad dyāvāpṛthivī gṛṇītām asmabhyaṃ citraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: abhi tat dyāvāpṛthivī gṛṇītām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: Let heaven and earth praise that (gift), grant us wondrous wealth, O mighty one.

original: aham bhuvaṃ vasunaḥ pūrvyas patir ahaṃ dhanāni saṃ jayāmi śaśvataḥ /
analyzed: aham bhuvam vasunaḥ pūrvyaḥ patiḥ aham dhanāni sam jayāmi śaśvataḥ
translated: I have been the ancient lord of wealth, I always win treasures for myself.

original: māṃ havante pitaraṃ na jantavo 'haṃ dāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam //
analyzed: mām havante pitaram na jantavaḥ ham dāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam
translated: Men call on me as on a father, I distribute food to the worshipper.

original: aham indro rodho vakṣo atharvaṇas tritāya gā ajanayam aher adhi /
analyzed: aham indraḥ rodhaḥ vakṣaḥ atharvaṇaḥ tritāya gāḥ ajanayam aheḥ adhi
translated: I am Indra, the obstruction, the chest of Atharvan, I produced the cows of Trita from the serpent.

original: ahaṃ dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇam ā dade gotrā śikṣan dadhīce mātariśvane //
analyzed: aham dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇam ā dade gotrā śikṣan dadhīce mātariśvane
translated: I took away the strength from the Dasyus, teaching the Gotra to Dadhyach for Matarishvan.

original: mahyaṃ tvaṣṭā vajram atakṣad āyasam mayi devāso 'vṛjann api kratum /
analyzed: mahyam tvaṣṭā vajram atakṣat āyasam mayi devāsaḥ vṛjan api kratum
translated: Tvashtar fashioned the iron thunderbolt for me, the gods have placed power in me.

original: mamānīkaṃ sūryasyeva duṣṭaram mām āryanti kṛtena kartvena ca //
analyzed: mama anīkam sūryasya iva duṣṭaram mām āryanti kṛtena kartvena ca
