translated: My splendor is hard to look at like the sun, they honor me for what I have done and what I shall do.

original: aham etaṃ gavyayam aśvyam paśum purīṣiṇaṃ sāyakenā hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: aham etam gavyayam aśvyam paśum purīṣiṇam sāyakena hiraṇyayam
translated: I have with my arrow this cattle, this horse, this wealth with offspring, this golden (wealth).

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yan mā somāsa ukthino amandiṣuḥ //
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yat mā somāsaḥ ukthinaḥ amandiṣuḥ
translated: I have nourished many thousands for the worshipper, since the Soma juices have gladdened me, the lauds.

original: aham indro na parā jigya id dhanaṃ na mṛtyave 'va tasthe kadā cana /
analyzed: aham indraḥ na parā jigye id dhanam na mṛtyave tasthe kadā cana
translated: I am Indra: no wealth have I yet won that is excellent, never have I stood in the way of death.

original: somam in mā sunvanto yācatā vasu na me pūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana //
analyzed: somam id mā sunvantaḥ yācata vasu na me pūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana
translated: Pressing out Soma, ask of me riches: in my friendship, O Pûrus, be not discontented.

original: aham etāñ chāśvasato dvādvendraṃ ye vajraṃ yudhaye 'kṛṇvata /
analyzed: aham etām śāśvasataḥ dvādvā indram ye vajram yudhaye kṛṇvata
translated: These two, who have long existed, have made Indra to wield the thunderbolt for battle.

original: āhvayamānāṃ ava hanmanāhanaṃ dṛḷhā vadann anamasyur namasvinaḥ //
analyzed: āhvayamānām ava hanmanā ahanam dṛḍhā vadan a namasyuḥ namasvinaḥ
translated: Inviting, I have slain the inviter: the strong-voiced have bent their necks, the humble.

original: abhīdam ekam eko asmi niṣṣāḷ abhī dvā kim u trayaḥ karanti /
analyzed: abhi idam ekam ekaḥ asmi niṣṣāh abhī dvā kim u trayaḥ karanti
translated: I alone am this one: alone I am the second. What can two do? What can three?

original: khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kim mā nindanti śatravo 'nindrāḥ //
analyzed: khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kim mā nindanti śatravaḥ na indrāḥ
translated: I strike down many in the desert place. Why do the powerless enemies revile me?

original: ahaṃ guṅgubhyo atithigvam iṣkaram iṣaṃ na vṛtraturaṃ vikṣu dhārayam /
analyzed: aham guṅgubhyaḥ atithigvam iṣkaram iṣam na vṛtra turam vikṣu
translated: I have given Atithigva to the Guṅgus: I have bestowed food on the Vr̥itra-slayer in the people.

original: yat parṇayaghna uta vā karañjahe prāham mahe vṛtrahatye aśuśravi //
analyzed: yat parṇaya ghne uta vā karañja he pra aham mahe vṛtra hatye aśuśravi
translated: When I, the slayer of Parṇaya, and the slayer of Karañja, have proclaimed myself at the great slaughter of Vr̥itra.

original: pra me namī sāpya iṣe bhuje bhūd gavām eṣe sakhyā kṛṇuta dvitā /
analyzed: pra me namī sāpyaḥ iṣe bhuje bhūt gavām eṣe sakhyā kṛṇuta dvitā
translated: Let my humble prayer be accepted for the sake of food and enjoyment: make ye a lasting friendship for the sake of kine.

original: didyuṃ yad asya samitheṣu maṃhayam ād id enaṃ śaṃsyam ukthyaṃ karam //
analyzed: didyum yat asya samitheṣu maṃhayam āt id enam śaṃsyam ukthyam karam
translated: When he is to be praised in battles, when he is to be extolled, then let us make him to be praised and worthy of lauds.

original: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somo antar gopā nemam āvir asthā kṛṇoti /
analyzed: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somaḥ antar gopāḥ nemam āvis kṛṇoti
translated: Soma is seen in this one, in the midst, the guardian. He makes this one manifest.

original: sa tigmaśṛṅgaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yuyutsan druhas tasthau bahule baddho antaḥ //
analyzed: sa tigma śṛṅgam vṛṣabham yuyutsan druhaḥ tasthau bahule baddhaḥ antar
translated: Striving with the sharp-horned bull, he stands in enmity, bound in the midst of the many.

original: ādityānāṃ vasūnāṃ rudriyāṇāṃ devo devānāṃ na mināmi dhāma /
analyzed: ādityānām vasūnām rudriyāṇām devaḥ devānām na mināmi dhāma
translated: I, a god of the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, do not transgress the law of the gods.

original: te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣur aparājitam astṛtam aṣāḷham //🔽ahaṃ dāṃ gṛṇate pūrvyaṃ vasv aham brahma kṛṇavam mahyaṃ vardhanam /
analyzed: te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣuḥ aparājitam astṛtam aṣāḍham  aham dām gṛṇate pūrvyam vasu aham brahma kṛṇavam mahyam vardhanam
translated: They have fashioned me for auspicious strength, invincible, unvanquished, irresistible.🔽I give the singer ancient wealth. I make the prayer that exalts me.

original: aham bhuvaṃ yajamānasya coditāyajvanaḥ sākṣi viśvasmin bhare //
analyzed: aham bhuvam yajamānasya codita ayajvanaḥ sākṣi viśvasmin bhare
translated: I am the impeller of the sacrificer in every contest, the witness of the non-sacrificer.

original: māṃ dhur indraṃ nāma devatā divaś ca gmaś cāpāṃ ca jantavaḥ /
analyzed: mām dhuḥ indram nāma devatāḥ divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca apām ca jantavaḥ
translated: The people of heaven and earth and of the waters have made me the deity named Indra.

original: ahaṃ harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū ahaṃ vajraṃ śavase dhṛṣṇv ā dade //
analyzed: aham harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū aham vajram śavase dhṛṣṇu ā dade
translated: I have the two strong, far-reaching bay horses. I have taken the irresistible thunderbolt for strength.

original: aham atkaṃ kavaye śiśnathaṃ hathair ahaṃ kutsam āvam ābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: aham atkam kavaye śiśnatham hathaiḥ aham kutsam āvam ābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: I have shattered the impious Atka with my hands. I have helped Kutsa with these aids.

original: ahaṃ śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadhar yamaṃ na yo rara āryaṃ nāma dasyave //
analyzed: aham śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadhar yamam na yaḥ rare āryam nāma dasyave
translated: I am the bond of Sushna's slaughter, whom I gave to Yama, the noble name to the Dasyu.

original: aham piteva vetasūṃr abhiṣṭaye tugraṃ kutsāya smadibhaṃ ca randhayam /🔽aham bhuvaṃ yajamānasya rājani pra yad bhare tujaye na priyādhṛṣe //
analyzed: aham pitā iva vetasūṃr abhiṣṭaye tugram kutsāya smadibham ca randhayam  aham bhuvam yajamānasya rājani pra yat bhare tujaye na priyādhṛṣe
translated: I, like a father, to Vetasu for protection, to Kutsa I gave Tugra and Smadibha.🔽I was in the king's house of the sacrificer, when I bore away for Tugra what is dear and hard to grasp.

original: ahaṃ randhayam mṛgayaṃ śrutarvaṇe yan mājihīta vayunā canānuṣak /
analyzed: aham randhayam mṛgayam śrutarvaṇe yat mā ājihīta vayunā cana anuṣak
translated: I gave to Mrigaya Sruatarvan what he had lost, when he had not even a little left.

original: ahaṃ veśaṃ namram āyave 'karam ahaṃ savyāya paḍgṛbhim arandhayam //
analyzed: aham veśam namram āyave karam aham savyāya paḍgṛbhim arandhayam
translated: I made the bent one a dwelling for Ayus, I gave to Savya the five-grasped one.

original: ahaṃ sa yo navavāstvam bṛhadrathaṃ saṃ vṛtreva dāsaṃ vṛtrahārujam /
analyzed: aham sa yaḥ navavāstvam bṛhat ratham sam vṛtrā iva dāsam vṛtra hā arujam
translated: I am he who, like Vrtra, smote down the Dasa, the one with nine abodes and the one with great chariots,

original: yad vardhayantam prathayantam ānuṣag dūre pāre rajaso rocanākaram //
analyzed: yat vardhayantam prathayantam ānuṣak dūre pāre rajasaḥ rocana ākaram
translated: when they were increasing and spreading in succession, making the light of the distant edge of the firmament.

original: ahaṃ sūryasya pari yāmy āśubhiḥ praitaśebhir vahamāna ojasā /
analyzed: aham sūryasya pari yāmi āśubhiḥ pra etaśebhiḥ vahamānaḥ ojasā
translated: I go around with the swift ones of Surya, carrying with the impetuous ones through strength,

original: yan mā sāvo manuṣa āha nirṇija ṛdhak kṛṣe dāsaṃ kṛtvyaṃ hathaiḥ //
analyzed: yat mā sāvaḥ manuṣe āha nirṇijaḥ ṛdhak kṛṣe dāsam kṛtvyam hathaiḥ
translated: when the man Savana calls me to the cleansing, I crush the wicked Dasa with my hands.

original: ahaṃ saptahā nahuṣo nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāvayaṃ śavasā turvaśaṃ yadum /
analyzed: aham sapta hā nahuṣaḥ nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāvayam śavasā turvaśam yadum
translated: I, the seven-horsed, more powerful than Nahusha, made Turvasa and Yadu listen with my strength.

original: ahaṃ ny anyaṃ sahasā sahas karaṃ nava vrādhato navatiṃ ca vakṣayam //
analyzed: aham ni anyam sahasā sahaḥ karam nava vrādhataḥ navatim ca vakṣayam
translated: I suddenly have brought forth a hundred new and ninety more.

original: ahaṃ sapta sravato dhārayaṃ vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyāṃ sīrā adhi /
analyzed: aham sapta sravataḥ dhārayam vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyām sīre adhi
translated: I, the bull, hold back the seven flowing streams, the swift ones, on the earth, above the furrows.

original: aham arṇāṃsi vi tirāmi sukratur yudhā vidam manave gātum iṣṭaye //
analyzed: aham arṇāṃsi vi tirāmi su kratuḥ yudhā vidam manave gātum iṣṭaye
translated: With good thoughts I traverse the waters, and have gained by war a path for Manu to win.

original: ahaṃ tad āsu dhārayaṃ yad āsu na devaś cana tvaṣṭādhārayad ruśat /
analyzed: aham tat āsu dhārayam yat āsu na devaḥ cana tvaṣṭā adhārayat ruśat
translated: I hold in these (waters) what was in them, which no god, not even Tvastr, could hold in the red (waters).

original: spārhaṃ gavām ūdhassu vakṣaṇāsv ā madhor madhu śvātryaṃ somam āśiram //
analyzed: spārham gavām ūdhassu vakṣaṇāsu ā madhoḥ madhu śvātryam somam āśiram
translated: The desirable milk in the udders of the cows, the honey of the honey, the Soma of the sweet juice.

original: evā devāṃ indro vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavā satyarādhāḥ /
analyzed: eva devān indraḥ vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavā satya rādhāḥ
translated: Thus Indra has divided the gods and men, and Maghavan, whose truth is sure, by his might.

original: viśvet tā te harivaḥ śacīvo 'bhi turāsaḥ svayaśo gṛṇanti //🔽pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso 'rcā viśvānarāya viśvābhuve /🔽indrasya yasya sumakhaṃ saho mahi śravo nṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ //
analyzed: viśvā id tā te harivas śacīvas bhi turāsaḥ sva yaśaḥ gṛṇanti  pra vaḥ mahe mandamānāya andhasaḥ rcā viśvānarāya viśvābhuve  indrasya yasya su makham sahaḥ mahi śravaḥ nṛmṇam ca rodasī saparyataḥ
translated: All your mighty deeds, O lord of bays, the impetuous ones praise for their own glory.🔽To your great gladdening juice, to him who belongs to all men, to him who is all-creating, I sing praise.🔽Whose great and glorious strength, whose fame and manly power, Indra, whose Soma-drinking is delightful, the two world-halves honour.

original: so cin nu sakhyā narya ina stutaś carkṛtya indro māvate nare /
analyzed: saḥ cit nu sakhyā naryaḥ ina stutaḥ carkṛtyaḥ indraḥ māvate nare
translated: He, too, O hero, is to be praised as a friend, to be extolled, O Indra, for the man who has done good service.

original: viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vāpsv abhi śūra mandase //
analyzed: viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vā apsu abhi śūra mandase
translated: In all tasks, O lord of the good, in contests for strength, O hero, thou rejoicest in the waters or in the clouds.

original: ke te nara indra ye ta iṣe ye te sumnaṃ sadhanyam iyakṣān /
analyzed: ke te naraḥ indra ye te iṣe ye te sumnam sa dhanyam iyakṣān
translated: What men are they, O Indra, who are dear to thee, who long for thy favour and abundant wealth?

original: ke te vājāyāsuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsūrvarāsu pauṃsye //
analyzed: ke te vājāya asuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsu urvarāsu pauṃsye
translated: Who urge thee on to the impetuous, heavenly prize? Who in their own waters, in the fertile fields, in manly deeds?

original: bhuvas tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ /
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvaḥ viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art great by the holy power, thou art to be worshipped at all the libations.

original: bhuvo nṝṃś cyautno viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaś ca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe //🔽avā nu kaṃ jyāyān yajñavanaso mahīṃ ta omātrāṃ kṛṣṭayo viduḥ /
analyzed: bhuvaḥ nṝn cyautnaḥ viśvasmin bhare jyeṣṭhaḥ ca mantraḥ viśvacarṣaṇe  avā nu kam jyāyān yajñavanasaḥ mahīm te omātrām kṛṣṭayaḥ viduḥ
translated: Thou art the inspirer of men in every contest, and the most excellent hymn, O thou who art worshipped by all.🔽Do they know thee, O thou who art worshipped at sacrifices, better than I, who art greater? They know thy greatness, thy extent.

original: aso nu kam ajaro vardhāś ca viśved etā savanā tūtumā kṛṣe //
analyzed: asaḥ nu kam ajaraḥ vardhāḥ ca viśvā id etā savanā tūtumā kṛṣe
translated: Do they know thee, O thou who art worshipped, better than I, who art immortal and increasing? Thou hast made all these libations impetuous.

original: etā viśvā savanā tūtumā kṛṣe svayaṃ sūno sahaso yāni dadhiṣe /
analyzed: etā viśvā savanā tūtumā kṛṣe svayam sūno sahasaḥ yāni dadhiṣe
translated: Thou hast made all these libations impetuous, O son of strength, which thou hast established.

original: varāya te pātraṃ dharmaṇe tanā yajño mantro brahmodyataṃ vacaḥ //
analyzed: varāya te pātram dharmaṇe tanā yajñaḥ mantraḥ brahma udyatam vacaḥ
translated: The vessel is for thy choice, the body for thy law, the sacrifice, the hymn, the holy power, the uplifted speech.

original: ye te vipra brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnāṃ ca vasunaś ca dāvane /
analyzed: ye te vipra brahma kṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnām ca vasunaḥ ca dāvane
translated: Those who, O sage, have made the holy power for thee, who are ready to give of treasures and wealth,

original: pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasya somyasyāndhasaḥ //
analyzed: pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasya somyasya andhasaḥ
translated: May I be with the mind of him who is to be honoured, on the path of the joy of the pressed Soma juice, of the sweet drink.

original: mahat tad ulbaṃ sthaviraṃ tad āsīd yenāviṣṭitaḥ praviveśithāpaḥ /
analyzed: mahat tat ulbam sthaviram tat āsīt yena āviṣṭitaḥ praviveśitha apaḥ
translated: That was the great, the ancient womb, by which thou didst enter into the waters.

original: viśvā apaśyad bahudhā te agne jātavedas tanvo deva ekaḥ //
analyzed: viśvāḥ apaśyat bahudhā te agne jātavedaḥ tanvaḥ devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, O all-knowing one, hast seen in many ways all thy bodies, O God, as one.

original: ko mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devo yo me tanvo bahudhā paryapaśyat /
analyzed: kaḥ mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devaḥ yaḥ me tanvaḥ bahudhā paryapaśyat
translated: Who saw me? Which was that God who saw my many bodies?

original: kvāha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyanty agner viśvāḥ samidho devayānīḥ //
analyzed: kva aha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyanti agneḥ viśvāḥ samidhaḥ deva yānīḥ
translated: Where, O Mitra-Varuṇa, do the universal sacrificial sticks of Agni, which go to the gods, rest?

original: aicchāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭam agne apsv oṣadhīṣu /
analyzed: aicchāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭam agne apsu oṣadhīṣu
translated: I have sought thee in many ways, O all-knowing Agni, entered into the waters and plants.

original: taṃ tvā yamo acikec citrabhāno daśāntaruṣyād atirocamānam //
analyzed: tam tvā yamaḥ aciket citrabhāno daśa antaruṣyāt atirocamānam
translated: YAMA has pointed thee out to me, O thou of wondrous light, shining beyond the ten (regions), most resplendent.

original: hotrād ahaṃ varuṇa bibhyad āyaṃ ned eva mā yunajann atra devāḥ /
analyzed: hotrāt aham varuṇa bibhyat āyam na id eva mā yunajan atra devāḥ
translated: From the Hotar priest, O Varuṇa, fearing lest he should yoke me here, the gods.

original: tasya me tanvo bahudhā niviṣṭā etam arthaṃ na ciketāham agniḥ //
analyzed: tasya me tanvaḥ bahudhā niviṣṭāḥ etam artham na ciketa aham agniḥ
translated: My bodies, which were entered into in many ways, have not pointed out this object to me, that I am Agni.

original: ehi manur devayur yajñakāmo 'raṅkṛtyā tamasi kṣeṣy agne /
analyzed: ehi manuḥ devayuḥ yajña kāmaḥ raṅkṛtya tamasi kṣeṣi agne
translated: Come, O Manu, devoted to the gods, desirous of sacrifice, thou shalt lie down in the darkness, O Agni, after the performance of the rite.

original: sugān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi devayānān vaha havyāni sumanasyamānaḥ //
analyzed: su gān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi deva yānān vaha havyāni sumanasyamānaḥ
translated: Make the paths easy to travel, which go to the gods, carry the offerings, well-disposed in mind.

original: agneḥ pūrve bhrātaro artham etaṃ rathīvādhvānam anv āvarīvuḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ pūrve bhrātaraḥ artham etam rathī iva adhvānam anu āvarīvuḥ
translated: The brothers of Agni, before him, have gone this way, as on a chariot, along the path.

original: tasmād bhiyā varuṇa dūram āyaṃ gauro na kṣepnor avije jyāyāḥ //
analyzed: tasmāt bhiyā varuṇa dūram āyam gauraḥ na kṣepnoḥ avije jyāyāḥ
translated: From that fear, O Varuṇa, I have gone far away, like a bull from the horns of a bull, from the stronger.

original: kurmas ta āyur ajaraṃ yad agne yathā yukto jātavedo na riṣyāḥ /
analyzed: kurmaḥ te āyuḥ ajaram yat agne yathā yuktaḥ jātavedaḥ na riṣyāḥ
translated: We make your life free from old age, O Agni, so that you, O all-knower, may not be harmed.

original: athā vahāsi sumanasyamāno bhāgaṃ devebhyo haviṣaḥ sujāta //
analyzed: athā vahāsi sumanasyamānaḥ bhāgam devebhyaḥ haviṣaḥ su jāta
translated: Then, being well-disposed, you carry the share of the oblation to the gods, O well-born one.

original: prayājān me anuyājāṃś ca kevalān ūrjasvantaṃ haviṣo datta bhāgam /
analyzed: prayājān me anuyājān ca kevalān ūrjasvantam haviṣaḥ datta bhāgam
translated: May my fore-sacrifices and after-sacrifices be complete, and may the oblation be full of strength and give a good share.

original: ghṛtaṃ cāpām puruṣaṃ cauṣadhīnām agneś ca dīrgham āyur astu devāḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtam ca apām puruṣam ca oṣadhīnām agneḥ ca dīrgham āyuḥ astu devāḥ
translated: May there be ghee for the waters, a man for the plants, and long life for Agni, O gods.

original: tava prayājā anuyājāś ca kevala ūrjasvanto haviṣaḥ santu bhāgāḥ /
analyzed: tava prayājāḥ anuyājāḥ ca kevale ūrjasvantaḥ haviṣaḥ santu bhāgāḥ
translated: May your fore-sacrifices and after-sacrifices be complete, full of strength, and give a good share of the oblation.

original: tavāgne yajño 'yam astu sarvas tubhyaṃ namantām pradiśaś catasraḥ //
analyzed: tava agne yajñaḥ yam astu sarvaḥ tubhyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: May this entire sacrifice be yours, O Agni. May the four quarters bow down to you.

original: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yatheha hotā vṛto manavai yan niṣadya /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yathā iha hotā vṛtaḥ manavai yat niṣadya
translated: O All-gods, instruct me, as I, being chosen as the Hotṛ priest, have sat down to perform the sacrifice.

original: pra me brūta bhāgadheyaṃ yathā vo yena pathā havyam ā vo vahāni //
analyzed: pra me brūta bhāgadheyam yathā vaḥ yena pathā havyam ā vaḥ vahāni
translated: Tell me my share, so that I may carry the oblation to you by that path.

original: ahaṃ hotā ny asīdaṃ yajīyān viśve devā maruto mā junanti /
analyzed: aham hotā ni asīdam yajīyān viśve devāḥ marutaḥ mā junanti
translated: I, the Hotar, have sat down, the most worthy of worship; all the gods and the Maruts urge me on.

original: aharahar aśvinādhvaryavaṃ vām brahmā samid bhavati sāhutir vām //
analyzed: ahar ahar aśvinā ādhvaryavam vām brahmā samidh bhavati sā āhutiḥ vām
translated: Day after day, O Asvins, you are the Adhvaryus; the Brahman is the kindling-stick, and the oblation is for you.

original: ayaṃ yo hotā kir u sa yamasya kam apy ūhe yat samañjanti devāḥ /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ hotā kis u sa yamasya kam api ūhe yat samañjanti devāḥ
translated: This Hotar here, who is he? He is Yama's messenger, whom the gods send forth when they are in agreement.

original: aharahar jāyate māsimāsy athā devā dadhire havyavāham //
analyzed: ahar ahar jāyate māsi māsi athā devāḥ dadhire havyavāham
translated: Day after day he is born in each month; then the gods made him the bearer of offerings.

original: māṃ devā dadhire havyavāham apamluktam bahu kṛcchrā carantam /
analyzed: mām devāḥ dadhire havya vāham apamluktam bahu kṛcchrā carantam
translated: The gods made me the bearer of offerings, who have been cleansed of impurity and have gone through many hardships.

original: agnir vidvān yajñaṃ naḥ kalpayāti pañcayāmaṃ trivṛtaṃ saptatantum //
analyzed: agniḥ vidvān yajñam naḥ kalpayāti pañca yāmam trivṛtam sapta tantum
translated: The wise Agni arranges our sacrifice, five-versed, threefold, with seven threads.

original: ā vo yakṣy amṛtatvaṃ suvīraṃ yathā vo devā varivaḥ karāṇi /
analyzed: ā vaḥ yakṣi amṛta tvam su vīram yathā vaḥ devāḥ varivaḥ karāṇi
translated: I will serve you for the sake of immortality and good heroes, so that you, O gods, may grant me favor.

original: ā bāhvor vajram indrasya dheyām athemā viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāti //
analyzed: ā bāhvoḥ vajram indrasya dheyām atha imāḥ viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayāti
translated: I will place the thunderbolt in Indra's arms, and then he will conquer all these enemies.

original: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇy agniṃ triṃśac ca devā nava cāsaparyan /🔽aukṣan ghṛtair astṛṇan barhir asmā ād id dhotāraṃ ny asādayanta //
analyzed: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇi agnim triṃśat ca devāḥ nava ca asaparyan  aukṣan ghṛtaiḥ astṛṇan barhiḥ asmai āt id hotāram ni asādayanta
translated: Three hundred and three thousand, thirty and nine gods have attended on Agni.🔽They have anointed him with ghee, they have strewn the sacred grass for him, and they have placed him as the Hotar priest.

original: yam aicchāma manasā so 'yam āgād yajñasya vidvān paruṣaś cikitvān /
analyzed: yam aicchāma manasā saḥ yam āgāt yajñasya vidvān paruṣaḥ cikitvān
translated: He whom we have desired in our mind, he has come, knowing the sacrifice, skilled in its details.

original: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān ni hi ṣatsad antaraḥ pūrvo asmat //
analyzed: sa naḥ yakṣat devatātā yajīyān ni hi satsat antaraḥ pūrvaḥ asmat
translated: May he, the most worthy to offer, serve the gods for us, for he sits down between us and the east.

original: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyān abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyat /🔽yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devāṃ īḷāmahā īḍyāṃ ājyena //
analyzed: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyān abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyat  yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devān īḍāmahai īḍyān ājyena
translated: The priest has been gratified, the most worthy to offer has sat down; he shall proclaim the well-ordered invitations.🔽Let us worship the gods worthy of sacrifice; let us invoke with oblation those who are to be invoked.

original: sādhvīm akar devavītiṃ no adya yajñasya jihvām avidāma guhyām /🔽sa āyur āgāt surabhir vasāno bhadrām akar devahūtiṃ no adya //
analyzed: sādhvīm akaḥ deva vītim naḥ adya yajñasya jihvām avidāma guhyām  saḥ āyuḥ āgāt surabhiḥ vasānaḥ bhadrām akaḥ deva hūtim naḥ adya
translated: We have found the secret tongue of the sacrifice, the good offering to the gods for us today.🔽He has come with life, clothed in fragrance; he has made the invocation to the gods good for us today.

original: tad adya vācaḥ prathamam masīya yenāsurāṃ abhi devā asāma /
analyzed: tat adya vācaḥ prathamam masīya yena asurān abhi devāḥ asāma
translated: That today may be the first of our songs, whereby we may surpass the Asuras in the gods' assembly.

original: ūrjāda uta yajñiyāsaḥ pañca janā mama hotraṃ juṣadhvam //
analyzed: ūrjādaḥ uta yajñiyāsaḥ pañca janāḥ mama hotram juṣadhvam
translated: And the five people who are worthy of sacrifice, may they accept my offering for strength.

original: pañca janā mama hotraṃ juṣantāṃ gojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: pañca janāḥ mama hotram juṣantām go jātāḥ uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: May the five people accept my offering, those born of the cow and those worthy of sacrifice.

original: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātv aṃhaso 'ntarikṣaṃ divyāt pātv asmān //
analyzed: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātu aṃhasaḥ ntarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān
translated: May the earth protect us from earthly woe, may the atmosphere protect us from heavenly woe.

original: tantuṃ tanvan rajaso bhānum anv ihi jyotiṣmataḥ patho rakṣa dhiyā kṛtān /
analyzed: tantum tanvan rajasaḥ bhānum anu ihi jyotiṣmataḥ pathaḥ rakṣa dhiyā kṛtān
translated: Weaving the thread, follow the light of the realm; guard the paths made by wisdom, which are full of light.

original: anulbaṇaṃ vayata joguvām apo manur bhava janayā daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: anulbaṇam vayata joguvām apaḥ manuḥ bhava janaya daivyam janam
translated: Weave the two young cows without flaw; be Manu; generate the divine people.

original: akṣānaho nahyatanota somyā iṣkṛṇudhvaṃ raśanā ota piṃśata /
analyzed: akṣānahaḥ nahyatana uta somyāḥ iṣkṛṇudhvam raśanāḥ ā uta piṃśata
translated: O you who are dear to Soma, do not delay, but prepare the reins and make the traces supple.

original: aṣṭāvandhuraṃ vahatābhito rathaṃ yena devāso anayann abhi priyam //
analyzed: aṣṭāvandhuram vahata abhitas ratham yena devāsaḥ anayan abhi priyam
translated: Yoke the eight-spoked chariot on both sides, by which the gods have brought (us) to the beloved (place).

original: aśmanvatī rīyate saṃ rabhadhvam ut tiṣṭhata pra taratā sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata sakhāyaḥ
translated: The water flows along the stone. Be ready! Rise up! Go forward, O friends!

original: atrā jahāma ye asann aśevāḥ śivān vayam ut taremābhi vājān //
analyzed: atra jahāma ye asan aśevāḥ śivān vayam ud tarema abhi vājān
translated: Here we leave behind those who are sluggish. May we, the good, go forward to the higher riches.

original: tvaṣṭā māyā ved apasām apastamo bibhrat pātrā devapānāni śantamā /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā māyāḥ vet apasām apastamaḥ bibhrat pātrā deva pānāni śantamā
translated: Tvastr knows the most excellent of the arts, carrying the most auspicious vessels for the gods to drink from.

original: śiśīte nūnam paraśuṃ svāyasaṃ yena vṛścād etaśo brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: śiśīte nūnam paraśum su āyasam yena vṛścāt etaśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: He now sharpens the axe of stone with which the lord of prayer cut down the Etaṣa tree.

original: sato nūnaṃ kavayaḥ saṃ śiśīta vāśībhir yābhir amṛtāya takṣatha /
analyzed: sataḥ nūnam kavayaḥ sam śiśīta vāśībhiḥ yābhiḥ amṛtāya takṣatha
translated: The wise ones have now sharpened (the axe) with the saws with which they fashion (the sacrificial post) for immortality.

original: vidvāṃsaḥ padā guhyāni kartana yena devāso amṛtatvam ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: vidvāṃsaḥ padā guhyāni kartana yena devāsaḥ amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: The wise ones, knowing the secret steps, by which the gods have attained immortality, are cutting (the post).

original: garbhe yoṣām adadhur vatsam āsany apīcyena manasota jihvayā /
analyzed: garbhe yoṣām adadhuḥ vatsam āsani apīcyena manasā uta jihvayā
translated: They have placed the child in the womb of the woman, the calf in the mother, with the mysterious tongue of the mind.

original: sa viśvāhā sumanā yogyā abhi siṣāsanir vanate kāra ij jitim //
analyzed: sa viśvāhā sumanāḥ yogyā abhi siṣāsaniḥ vanate kāre id jitim
translated: He, who is good-natured in all things, who is worthy of worship, who conquers by his own power, gains the victory.

original: tāṃ su te kīrtim maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasī ahvayetām /
analyzed: tām su te kīrtim maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasī ahvayetām
translated: That fame of thine, O Maghavan, through greatness, when the two worlds in fear invoked thee,

original: prāvo devāṃ ātiro dāsam ojaḥ prajāyai tvasyai yad aśikṣa indra //
analyzed: prāvaḥ devān ātiraḥ dāsam ojaḥ prajāyai tvasyai yat aśikṣaḥ indra
translated: Thou hast helped the gods to overcome the Dāsa, and to this progeny of his, O Indra.

original: yad acaras tanvā vāvṛdhāno balānīndra prabruvāṇo janeṣu /
analyzed: yat acaraḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ balāni indra prabruvāṇaḥ janeṣu
translated: When thou hast grown by thy body, O Indra, proclaiming thy powers among the people,

original: māyet sā te yāni yuddhāny āhur nādya śatruṃ nanu purā vivitse //
analyzed: māyā id sā te yāni yuddhāni āhuḥ na adya śatrum nanu purā vivitse
translated: Let not that deception of thine be, which they call the battles, thou hast not found an enemy today, nor in the past.

original: ka u nu te mahimanaḥ samasyāsmat pūrva ṛṣayo 'ntam āpuḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ u nu te mahimanaḥ samasya asmat pūrve ṛṣayaḥ ntam āpuḥ
translated: Who among us has attained the end of thy greatness, the ancient sages?

original: yan mātaraṃ ca pitaraṃ ca sākam ajanayathās tanvaḥ svāyāḥ //
analyzed: yat mātaram ca pitaram ca sākam ajanayathāḥ tanvaḥ svāyāḥ
translated: Since thou hast generated together the mother and the father from thy own body.

original: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāmādābhyāni mahiṣasya santi /🔽tvam aṅga tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavañ cakartha //
analyzed: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāma adābhyāni mahiṣasya santi  tvam aṅga tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavan cakartha
translated: Four are thy names, O Asura, which are unerring, of the great one.🔽Thou, O Indra, knowest all those, by which thou hast performed the deeds, O bountiful one.

original: tvaṃ viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yāny āvir yā ca guhā vasūni /
analyzed: tvam viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yāni āvis yā ca guhā vasūni
translated: Thou possessest all the treasures, O Indra, which are manifest and which are hidden.

original: kāmam in me maghavan mā vi tārīs tvam ājñātā tvam indrāsi dātā //
analyzed: kāmam id me maghavan mā vi tārīḥ tvam ājñātā tvam indra asi dātā
translated: Do not pass beyond my desire, O bountiful one, thou art known to me, thou art the giver, O Indra.

original: yo adadhāj jyotiṣi jyotir antar yo asṛjan madhunā sam madhūni /
analyzed: yaḥ adadhāt jyotiṣi jyotiḥ antar yaḥ asṛjat madhunā sam madhūni
translated: He who has placed light in the light, he who has created the sweets with honey,

original: adha priyaṃ śūṣam indrāya manma brahmakṛto bṛhadukthād avāci //
analyzed: adha priyam śūṣam indrāya manma brahma kṛtaḥ bṛhat ukthāt avāci
translated: Now I have uttered to Indra the dear hymn, the great hymn, from the maker of prayers.

original: dūre tan nāma guhyam parācair yat tvā bhīte ahvayetāṃ vayodhai /
analyzed: dūre tat nāma guhyam parācais yat tvā bhīte ahvayetām vayodhai
translated: That name of yours is far away, hidden by the distant ones, which the fearful ones, wasting away, invoked.

original: ud astabhnāḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām abhīke bhrātuḥ putrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ //
analyzed: ud astabhnāḥ pṛthivīm dyām abhīke bhrātuḥ putrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ
translated: You have upheld the earth and the sky in the battle, O mighty one, shining with the sons of your brother.

original: mahat tan nāma guhyam puruspṛg yena bhūtaṃ janayo yena bhavyam /
analyzed: mahat tat nāma guhyam puruspṛh yena bhūtam janayaḥ yena bhavyam
translated: That is your great hidden name, which is much sought after, by which you have generated the past and the future.

original: pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotir yad asya priyam priyāḥ sam aviśanta pañca //
analyzed: pratnam jātam jyotiḥ yat asya priyam priyāḥ sam aviśanta pañca
translated: The ancient light that is dear to him, the dear ones have entered together with the five.

original: ā rodasī apṛṇād ota madhyam pañca devāṃ ṛtuśaḥ saptasapta /
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇāt ā uta madhyam pañca devān ṛtuśas sapta sapta
translated: He has filled the two worlds and the middle, the five gods in due season, seven times seven.

original: catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sarūpeṇa jyotiṣā vivratena //
analyzed: catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sa rūpeṇa jyotiṣā vivratena
translated: He looks with thirty-four forms, with light that is the same, with a form that is different.

original: yad uṣa aucchaḥ prathamā vibhānām ajanayo yena puṣṭasya puṣṭam /
analyzed: yat uṣaḥ aucchaḥ prathamā vibhānām ajanayaḥ yena puṣṭasya puṣṭam
translated: When you rose, O Dawn, the first of the lights, by which you have generated the prosperity of prosperity.

original: yat te jāmitvam avaram parasyā mahan mahatyā asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: yat te jāmi tvam avaram parasyāḥ mahat mahatyāḥ asura tvam ekam
translated: Your lower kinship with the higher, your greatness with the great, your oneness with the Asuras.

original: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santam palito jagāra /
analyzed: vidhum dadrāṇam samane bahūnām yuvānam santam palitaḥ jagāra
translated: He has seized the young one, who is young among many, who is young, though his hair is gray.

original: devasya paśya kāvyam mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥ sam āna //
analyzed: devasya paśya kāvyam mahi tvā adyā mamāra sa hyas sam āna
translated: Behold the greatness of the god's plan, who has died today, who is dear, who is assembled.

original: śākmanā śāko aruṇaḥ suparṇa ā yo mahaḥ śūraḥ sanād anīḷaḥ /🔽yac ciketa satyam it tan na moghaṃ vasu spārham uta jetota dātā //
analyzed: śākmanā śākaḥ aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ ā yaḥ mahaḥ śūraḥ sanāt anīḍaḥ  yat ciketa satyam id tat na mogham vasu spārham uta jetā uta dātā
translated: The powerful, red-winged bird, the hero who from of old is great and unvanquished,🔽Whatever he thinks is true, it is not in vain. He wins good wealth and gives it.

original: aibhir dade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhir aukṣad vṛtrahatyāya vajrī /
analyzed: ā ebhiḥ dade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiḥ aukṣat vṛtra hatyāya vajrī
translated: By these (powers) he gained manly powers, by which the wielder of the thunderbolt waxed strong for the slaying of Vrtra.

original: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahna ṛtekarmam udajāyanta devāḥ //
analyzed: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahnaḥ ṛtekarmam udajāyanta devāḥ
translated: Those who were born as gods from the great power of the work that was being done, apart from the work.

original: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśvaujā aśastihā viśvamanās turāṣāṭ /
analyzed: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśva ojāḥ aśasti hā viśva manāḥ turāṣāh
translated: Joining works, begetting all power, free from censure, all-minded, a conqueror,

original: pītvī somasya diva ā vṛdhānaḥ śūro nir yudhādhamad dasyūn //
analyzed: pītvī somasya divaḥ ā vṛdhānaḥ śūraḥ niḥ yudhā adhamat dasyūn
translated: Having drunk the Soma, grown great in heaven, the hero has driven away the Dasyus in battle.

original: idaṃ ta ekam para ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃ viśasva /
analyzed: idam te ekam paras u te ekam tṛtīyena jyotiṣā sam viśasva
translated: This one is one, and that one is one. Unite with the third light.

original: saṃveśane tanvaś cārur edhi priyo devānām parame janitre //
analyzed: saṃveśane tanvaḥ cāruḥ edhi priyaḥ devānām parame janitre
translated: Be beautiful in the union of your bodies. Be dear to the gods, in the highest birthplace.

original: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmam asmabhyaṃ dhātu śarma tubhyam /
analyzed: tanūḥ te vājin tanvam nayantī vāmam asmabhyam dhātu śarma tubhyam
translated: O strong one, let your body lead your body. Grant us what is good. Grant you protection.

original: ahruto maho dharuṇāya devān divīva jyotiḥ svam ā mimīyāḥ //
analyzed: ahrutaḥ mahaḥ dharuṇāya devān divi iva jyotiḥ svam ā mimīyāḥ
translated: Unwavering, for the support of the great gods, measure out your own light as it were in the sky.

original: vājy asi vājinenā suvenīḥ suvita stomaṃ suvito divaṃ gāḥ /
analyzed: vājī asi vājinena suvenīḥ suvitaḥ stomam suvitaḥ divam gāḥ
translated: You are the prize, O prize-winner, with your prize, win the Stoma, with your prize the heavenly cows.

original: suvito dharma prathamānu satyā suvito devān suvito 'nu patma //
analyzed: suvitaḥ dharma prathamā anu satyā suvitaḥ devān suvitaḥ nu patma
translated: The true law is well-established, the true gods are well-established, the true path is well-established.

original: mahimna eṣām pitaraś caneśire devā deveṣv adadhur api kratum /
analyzed: mahimnaḥ eṣām pitaraḥ cana īśire devāḥ deveṣu adadhuḥ api kratum
translated: The fathers have controlled their greatness, the gods have placed their will even among the gods.

original: sam avivyacur uta yāny atviṣur aiṣāṃ tanūṣu ni viviśuḥ punaḥ //🔽sahobhir viśvam pari cakramū rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmāny amitā mimānāḥ /
analyzed: sam avivyacuḥ uta yāni atviṣuḥ ā eṣām tanūṣu ni viviśuḥ punar  sahobhiḥ viśvam pari cakramuḥ rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmāni amitā mimānāḥ
translated: They have united and those which have shone forth have again entered into their bodies.🔽With the Sahobhus they have gone around the whole realm, measuring the ancient immeasurable abodes.

original: tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayanta purudha prajā anu //
analyzed: tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayanta purudha prajāḥ anu
translated: They have settled in all the worlds in their bodies, they have extended their progeny far and wide.

original: dvidhā sūnavo 'suraṃ svarvidam āsthāpayanta tṛtīyena karmaṇā /🔽svām prajām pitaraḥ pitryaṃ saha āvareṣv adadhus tantum ātatam //
analyzed: dvidhā sūnavaḥ suram svar vidam āsthāpayanta tṛtīyena karmaṇā  svām prajām pitaraḥ pitryam sahaḥ ā avareṣu adadhuḥ tantum ātatam
translated: The two sons have established the Asura who knows the heaven, with the third deed.🔽The fathers have placed their own progeny, their own share, in the lower worlds, stretching out the thread.

original: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhir ati durgāṇi viśvā /
analyzed: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiḥ ati durgāṇi viśvā
translated: Like a boat in the waters, like the directions on the earth, with blessings beyond all difficulties,

original: svām prajām bṛhaduktho mahitvāvareṣv adadhād ā pareṣu //
analyzed: svām prajām bṛhadukthaḥ mahitvā avareṣu adadhāt ā pareṣu
translated: Brihaduktha has placed his own progeny in the lower and higher worlds, with greatness.

original: mā pra gāma patho vayam mā yajñād indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: mā pra gāma pathaḥ vayam mā yajñāt indra sominaḥ
translated: Let us not go astray from the path, O Indra, from the sacrifice of the Soma-offerer.

original: mānta sthur no arātayaḥ //
analyzed: mā antar sthuḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Let not the evil spirits stay among us.

original: yo yajñasya prasādhanas tantur deveṣv ātataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yajñasya prasādhanaḥ tantuḥ deveṣu ātataḥ
translated: He who completes the sacrifice, the thread stretched out among the gods,

original: tam āhutaṃ naśīmahi //
analyzed: tam āhutam naśīmahi
translated: We will destroy him when he is offered.

original: mano nv ā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena /
analyzed: manaḥ nu ā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena
translated: We invoke the mind with the Nārāśaṃsa Soma,

original: pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: pitṝṇām ca manmabhiḥ
translated: And with the thoughts of the ancestors.

original: ā ta etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya jīvase /
analyzed: ā te etu manaḥ punar kratve dakṣāya jīvase
translated: May the mind come back to us again for wisdom, for strength, for life,

original: jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe //
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: And to see the sun for a long time.

original: punar naḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ /
analyzed: punar naḥ pitaraḥ manaḥ dadātu daivyaḥ janaḥ
translated: May the divine people, our fathers, grant us back our mind.

original: jīvaṃ vrātaṃ sacemahi //
analyzed: jīvam vrātam sacemahi
translated: May we live together with the living clan.

original: vayaṃ soma vrate tava manas tanūṣu bibhrataḥ /
analyzed: vayam soma vrate tava manaḥ tanūṣu bibhrataḥ
translated: We, O Soma, bearing your mind in our bodies in your vow,

original: prajāvantaḥ sacemahi //
analyzed: prajāvantaḥ sacemahi
translated: May we live with offspring.

original: yat te yamaṃ vaivasvatam mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te yamam vaivasvatam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Your mind that has gone far away to Yama, to Vivasvat's son,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring it back to you for dwelling, for life.

original: yat te divaṃ yat pṛthivīm mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te divam yat pṛthivīm manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Your mind that has gone far away to heaven, to earth,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring it back to you for dwelling, for life.

original: yat te bhūmiṃ caturbhṛṣṭim mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te bhūmim catur bhṛṣṭim manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Your mind that has gone far away to the four-cornered earth,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring it back to you for dwelling, for life.

original: yat te catasraḥ pradiśo mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te catasraḥ pradiśaḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Your mind that has gone far away to the four quarters,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring it back to you for dwelling, for life.

original: yat te samudram arṇavam mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te samudram arṇavam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Your mind that has gone far away to the ocean, to the great deep,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te marīcīḥ pravato mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te marīcīḥ pravataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to the rays of the sun,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te apo yad oṣadhīr mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te apaḥ yat oṣadhīḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to the waters and plants,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te sūryaṃ yad uṣasam mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te sūryam yat uṣasam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to the sun and the dawn,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te parvatān bṛhato mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te parvatān bṛhataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to the great mountains,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te viśvam idaṃ jagan mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te viśvam idam jagat manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to this whole world,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te parāḥ parāvato mano jagāma dūrakam /
analyzed: yat te parāḥ parāvataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to the farthest distance,

original: tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: yat te bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca mano jagāma dūrakam /🔽tat ta ā vartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase //
analyzed: yat te bhūtam ca bhavyam ca manaḥ jagāma dūrakam  tat te ā vartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: If thy thoughts have gone far away to what has been and what will be,🔽We bring that back to thee, to dwell in thy house and live.

original: pra tāry āyuḥ prataraṃ navīya sthātāreva kratumatā rathasya /
analyzed: pra tāri āyuḥ prataram navīya sthātārā iva kratumatā rathasya
translated: Carry across life, the newest ford, as a charioteer with skill carries across a chariot.

original: adha cyavāna ut tavīty artham parātaraṃ su nirṛtir jihītām //
analyzed: adha cyavānaḥ ud tavītī artham parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: And may Chyavâna pass beyond his trouble: may Nirriti depart to distant places.

original: sāman nu rāye nidhiman nv annaṃ karāmahe su purudha śravāṃsi /
analyzed: sāman nu rāye nidhimat nu annam karāmahe su purudha śravāṃsi
translated: We will make songs for wealth, and food for plenty: we will make famous deeds, O thou of wondrous help.

original: tā no viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaraṃ su nirṛtir jihītām //
analyzed: tā naḥ viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: May all these things delight our singer: may Nirriti depart to distant places.

original: abhī ṣv aryaḥ pauṃsyair bhavema dyaur na bhūmiṃ girayo nājrān /
analyzed: abhi su aryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ bhavema dyauḥ na bhūmim girayaḥ na ajrān
translated: May we be rich in manly powers, O Aryaman: may we be strong like Dyaus, like mountains, like the floods.

original: tā no viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaraṃ su nirṛtir jihītām //
analyzed: tā naḥ viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: May all these things delight our singer: may Nirriti depart to distant places.

original: mo ṣu ṇaḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam /🔽dyubhir hito jarimā sū no astu parātaraṃ su nirṛtir jihītām //
analyzed: mā u su naḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam  dyubhiḥ hitaḥ jarimā su naḥ astu parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: O Soma, give us not to death: may we behold the rising sun.🔽May life be lengthened out for us, O thou who art set in the heavens. May Nirriti depart to distant places.

original: asunīte mano asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tirā na āyuḥ /
analyzed: asunīte manaḥ asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tira naḥ āyuḥ
translated: O thou who art not good, fix thy mind on us, and grant us life that we may live long.

original: rārandhi naḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśi ghṛtena tvaṃ tanvaṃ vardhayasva //🔽asunīte punar asmāsu cakṣuḥ punaḥ prāṇam iha no dhehi bhogam /
analyzed: rārandhi naḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśi ghṛtena tvam tanvam vardhayasva  asunīte punar asmāsu cakṣuḥ punar prāṇam iha naḥ dhehi bhogam
translated: Be gracious to us at the rising of the sun: with ghee increase thy body.🔽O thou who art not good, give us back our eye, give us back our breath, give us here enjoyment.

original: jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam anumate mṛḷayā naḥ svasti //
analyzed: jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam anumate mṛḍaya naḥ svasti
translated: Long may we look upon the rising sun. O Anumati, be gracious and give us welfare.

original: punar no asum pṛthivī dadātu punar dyaur devī punar antarikṣam /
analyzed: punar naḥ asum pṛthivī dadātu punar dyauḥ devī punar antarikṣam
translated: May the earth give us life again, may the goddess Dyaus, may the atmosphere give it to us again.

original: punar naḥ somas tanvaṃ dadātu punaḥ pūṣā pathyāṃ yā svastiḥ //
analyzed: punar naḥ somaḥ tanvam dadātu punar pūṣā pathyām yā svastiḥ
translated: May Soma give us our body again, may Pūṣan give us the path which is prosperity again.

original: śaṃ rodasī subandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā /
analyzed: śam rodasī su bandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: May the two worlds, the kindly ones, the young mothers of holy order,

original: bharatām apa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat //
analyzed: bharatām apa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kim cana amamat
translated: remove whatever disease the Bharatas have. May Dyaus and Pṛthivī remove the disease. Let nothing whatever be wanting to you.

original: ava dvake ava trikā divaś caranti bheṣajā /
analyzed: ava dvake ava trikā divaḥ caranti bheṣajā
translated: The two-footed and the three-footed remedies move on the earth from heaven.

original: kṣamā cariṣṇv ekakam bharatām apa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat //
analyzed: kṣamā cariṣṇu ekakam bharatām apa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kim cana amamat
translated: The one-footed moves on the earth. May Dyaus and Pṛthivī remove the disease. Let nothing whatever be wanting to you.

original: sam indreraya gām anaḍvāhaṃ ya āvahad uśīnarāṇyā anaḥ /
analyzed: sam indra īraya gām anaḍvāham yaḥ āvahat uśīnarāṇyāḥ anaḥ
translated: Bring to Indra the cow and the ox which he brought from the land of the Uśīnara people.

original: bharatām apa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat //
analyzed: bharatām apa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kim cana amamat
translated: May Dyaus and Pṛthivī remove the disease. Let nothing whatever be wanting to you.

original: ā janaṃ tveṣasaṃdṛśam māhīnānām upastutam /
analyzed: ā janam tveṣa saṃdṛśam māhīnānām upastutam
translated: To the people who are like him in appearance, who are praised by the Māhīnas,

original: aganma bibhrato namaḥ //
analyzed: aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ
translated: we have come, bearing homage.

original: asamātiṃ nitośanaṃ tveṣaṃ niyayinaṃ ratham /
analyzed: asamātim nitośanam tveṣam niyayinam ratham
translated: To the unequalled, the ever-angry, the shining, the guiding chariot,

original: bhajerathasya satpatim //
analyzed: bhajerathasya sat patim
translated: I honor the good lord of the chariot.

original: yo janān mahiṣāṃ ivātitasthau pavīravān /
analyzed: yaḥ janān mahiṣān iva atitasthau pavīravān
translated: He who has stood over the people like a mighty bull, the impetuous one,

original: utāpavīravān yudhā //
analyzed: uta a pavīravān yudhā
translated: And he who has no hero in battle.

original: yasyekṣvākur upa vrate revān marāyy edhate /
analyzed: yasya ikṣvākuḥ upa vrate revān marāyī edhate
translated: Whose powerful one, in the observance of the vow of Ikshvaku, prospers in the midst of the Maruts,

original: divīva pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: divi iva pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Like five furrows in the sky.

original: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya /
analyzed: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya
translated: O Indra, in the battles of the Rathas and the Praushthas, support (us),

original: divīva sūryaṃ dṛśe //
analyzed: divi iva sūryam dṛśe
translated: Like the sun in the sky to be seen.

original: agastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā /
analyzed: agastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā
translated: You yoke the two red horses of Agastya to the rivers,

original: paṇīn ny akramīr abhi viśvān rājann arādhasaḥ //
analyzed: paṇīn ni akramīḥ abhi viśvān rājan arādhasaḥ
translated: You have stepped over all the enemies, O king, who are not generous.

original: ayam mātāyam pitāyaṃ jīvātur āgamat /
analyzed: ayam mātā ayam pitā ayam jīvātuḥ āgamat
translated: This is the mother, this is the father, this is the living one who has come.

original: idaṃ tava prasarpaṇaṃ subandhav ehi nir ihi //
analyzed: idam tava prasarpaṇam subandho ehi niḥ ihi
translated: This is your path, O well-bound one, come and go out.

original: yathā yugaṃ varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam /
analyzed: yathā yugam varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam
translated: Just as a yoke is fastened with a strap to a post,

original: evā dādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: evā dādhāra te manaḥ jīvātave na mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: So I support your mind for life, not for death, and for freedom from misfortune.

original: yatheyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn
translated: Just as this great earth supports these trees,

original: evā dādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: evā dādhāra te manaḥ jīvātave na mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: So I support your mind for life, not for death, and for freedom from misfortune.

original: yamād ahaṃ vaivasvatāt subandhor mana ābharam /
analyzed: yamāt aham vaivasvatāt subandhoḥ manaḥ ābharam
translated: From Yama, the son of Vivasvat, O well-bound one, I have brought the mind,

original: jīvātave na mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: jīvātave na mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: For life, not for death, and for freedom from misfortune.

original: nyag vāto 'va vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: nyak vātaḥ va vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ
translated: The wind blows downward, the sun shines downward,

original: nīcīnam aghnyā duhe nyag bhavatu te rapaḥ //
analyzed: nīcīnam aghnyā duhe nyak bhavatu te rapaḥ
translated: Let the low-lying cow yield milk for you; let your disease be bent down.

original: ayam me hasto bhagavān ayam me bhagavattaraḥ /
analyzed: ayam me hastaḥ bhagavān ayam me bhagavattaraḥ
translated: This hand of mine is blessed; this hand of mine is more blessed.

original: ayam me viśvabheṣajo 'yaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ //
analyzed: ayam me viśva bheṣajaḥ yam śiva abhimarśanaḥ
translated: This hand of mine is the universal remedy; this hand of mine is the auspicious bestower.

original: idam itthā raudraṃ gūrtavacā brahma kratvā śacyām antar ājau /🔽krāṇā yad asya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣat pakthe ahann ā sapta hotṝn //
analyzed: idam itthā raudram gūrta vacāḥ brahma kratvā śacyām antar ājau  krāṇāḥ yat asya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣat pakthe ahan ā sapta hotṝn
translated: This is the terrible, well-spoken Brahman, in the battle within the powerful one.🔽When his parents, to be honored, were hungry, he carried the seven priests in his belly.

original: sa id dānāya dabhyāya vanvañ cyavānaḥ sūdair amimīta vedim /
analyzed: saḥ id dānāya dabhyāya vanvam cyavānaḥ sūdaiḥ amimīta vedim
translated: He, the one to be chosen for giving and deceit, the old man, measured out the altar with his fingers.

original: tūrvayāṇo gūrtavacastamaḥ kṣodo na reta itaūti siñcat //
analyzed: tūrvayāṇaḥ gūrta vacastamaḥ kṣodaḥ na retaḥ itaūti siñcat
translated: The one who goes far, most eloquent in speech, let him pour out the seed like a stream.

original: mano na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmaṃ vipaḥ śacyā vanutho dravantā /
analyzed: manaḥ na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmam vipaḥ śacyā vanuthaḥ dravantā
translated: In whose offerings the sharp mind, with power and thought, you two delight and hasten.

original: ā yaḥ śaryābhis tuvinṛmṇo asyāśrīṇītādiśaṃ gabhastau //
analyzed: ā yaḥ śaryābhiḥ tuvi nṛmṇaḥ asya āśrīṇīta ādiśam gabhastau
translated: The one who, with his arrows, the powerful one, has brought down the head of this (enemy).

original: kṛṣṇā yad goṣv aruṇīṣu sīdad divo napātāśvinā huve vām /
analyzed: kṛṣṇā yat goṣu aruṇīṣu sīdat divaḥ napātā aśvinā huve vām
translated: When you two, O Aśvins, sit down in the dark cows and the ruddy ones, I call you, O sons of heaven.

original: vītam me yajñam ā gatam me annaṃ vavanvāṃsā neṣam asmṛtadhrū //
analyzed: vītam me yajñam ā gatam me annam vavanvāṃsā na iṣam asmṛtadhrū
translated: Come to my sacrifice, come to my food, you two who are eager, I who am not forgetful.

original: prathiṣṭa yasya vīrakarmam iṣṇad anuṣṭhitaṃ nu naryo apauhat /
analyzed: prathiṣṭa yasya vīrakarmam iṣṇat anuṣṭhitam nu naryaḥ apauhat
translated: The one whose heroic deed has been spread out, the one who has been helped, has removed the obstacle.

original: punas tad ā vṛhati yat kanāyā duhitur ā anubhṛtam anarvā //
analyzed: punar tat ā vṛhati yat kanāyāḥ duhituḥ ā anubhṛtam anarvā
translated: Again he brings forth what was brought forth by the daughter of the maiden, the unvanquished.

original: madhyā yat kartvam abhavad abhīke kāmaṃ kṛṇvāne pitari yuvatyām /
analyzed: madhyā yat kartvam abhavat abhīke kāmam kṛṇvāne pitari yuvatyām
translated: When the middle one became the thing to be done in the presence, the young woman in the father who was making the desire,

original: manānag reto jahatur viyantā sānau niṣiktaṃ sukṛtasya yonau //
analyzed: manānaś retaḥ jahatuḥ viyantā sānau niṣiktam sukṛtasya yonau
translated: The two, the mind and the semen, left, flying, deposited on the lap, in the womb of good deeds.

original: pitā yat svāṃ duhitaram adhiṣkan kṣmayā retaḥ saṃjagmāno ni ṣiñcat /
analyzed: pitā yat svām duhitaram adhiṣkan kṣmayā retaḥ saṃjagmānaḥ ni siñcat
translated: When the father embraced his own daughter, joining with her in the act of love, he deposited (the seed).

original: svādhyo 'janayan brahma devā vāstoṣ patiṃ vratapāṃ nir atakṣan //
analyzed: su ādhyaḥ janayan brahma devāḥ vāstoḥ patim vrata pām niḥ atakṣan
translated: The well-born one generated the Brahman, the gods fashioned Vastospati, the lord of vows.

original: sa īṃ vṛṣā na phenam asyad ājau smad ā paraid apa dabhracetāḥ /🔽sarat padā na dakṣiṇā parāvṛṅ na tā nu me pṛśanyo jagṛbhre //
analyzed: saḥ īm vṛṣā na phenam asyat ājau smat ā parait apa dabhra cetāḥ  sarat padā na dakṣiṇā parāvṛj na tāḥ nu me pṛśanyaḥ jagṛbhre
translated: He, the bull, did not foam in the battle, he went away, his mind turned to the weak.🔽He went away on his feet, not turning back to the south, I did not grasp those praises of mine.

original: makṣū na vahniḥ prajāyā upabdir agniṃ na nagna upa sīdad ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: makṣū na vahniḥ prajāyāḥ upabdiḥ agnim na nagnaḥ upa sīdat ūdhar
translated: Like a swift messenger to offspring, the naked one sat down on the udder of the fire.

original: sanitedhmaṃ sanitota vājaṃ sa dhartā jajñe sahasā yavīyut //
analyzed: sanitā idhmam sanitā uta vājam sa dhartā jajñe sahasā yavīyudh
translated: The supporter was born with strength, the younger one with power.

original: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navagvā ṛtaṃ vadanta ṛtayuktim agman /
analyzed: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyam navagvāḥ ṛtam vadantaḥ ṛta yuktim agman
translated: The Navagvas did not quickly make an alliance with the maiden, speaking the truth, they came to one who is yoked to truth.

original: dvibarhaso ya upa gopam āgur adakṣiṇāso acyutā dudukṣan //
analyzed: dvibarhasaḥ ye upa gopam āguḥ a dakṣiṇāsaḥ acyutā dudukṣan
translated: Those who came to the cowherd in pairs, without gifts, milked the unmoving (cow).

original: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navīyo rādho na reta ṛtam it turaṇyan /
analyzed: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyam navīyaḥ rādhaḥ na retaḥ ṛtam id turaṇyan
translated: As the fresh friendship of a maiden, the treasure of the one who hastens to the truth,

original: śuci yat te rekṇa āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ paya usriyāyāḥ //🔽paśvā yat paścā viyutā budhanteti bravīti vaktarī rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: śuci yat te rekṇaḥ āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payaḥ usriyāyāḥ  paśvā yat paścā viyutā budhanta iti bravīti vaktari rarāṇaḥ
translated: When they worship thy pure wealth, O thou of abundant milk, of the milch-cow.🔽When the cattle, separated, low in the rear, he speaks, rejoicing, the speaker.

original: vasor vasutvā kāravo 'nehā viśvaṃ viveṣṭi draviṇam upa kṣu //🔽tad in nv asya pariṣadvāno agman purū sadanto nārṣadam bibhitsan /
analyzed: vasoḥ vasu tvā kāravaḥ nehāḥ viśvam viveṣṭi draviṇam upa kṣu  tat id nu asya pariṣadvānaḥ agman purū sadantaḥ nārṣadam bibhitsan
translated: The artisans, through the power of Vasu, through exertion, all the wealth which is to be distributed, he distributes.🔽Then, indeed, his attendants have come, many sitting, seeking to burst open the house of the generous one.

original: vi śuṣṇasya saṃgrathitam anarvā vidat puruprajātasya guhā yat //
analyzed: vi śuṣṇasya saṃgrathitam anarvā vidat puru prajātasya guhā yat
translated: He has found the unfettered bond of the very prolific one, which was hidden.

original: bhargo ha nāmota yasya devāḥ svar ṇa ye triṣadhasthe niṣeduḥ /
analyzed: bhargaḥ ha nāma uta yasya devāḥ svar na ye triṣadhasthe niṣeduḥ
translated: The light, indeed, is the name of him whose are the gods, who have sat down in the heaven, in the place of three.

original: agnir ha nāmota jātavedāḥ śrudhī no hotar ṛtasya hotādhruk //
analyzed: agniḥ ha nāma uta jātavedāḥ śrudhi naḥ hotar ṛtasya hotā adhruk
translated: Agni, indeed, is the name of him who knows all, hear us, O Hotar, the unerring priest of truth.

original: uta tyā me raudrāv arcimantā nāsatyāv indra gūrtaye yajadhyai /
analyzed: uta tyā me raudrau arcimantā nāsatyau indra gūrtaye yajadhyai
translated: And for me, O Indra, you should sacrifice the two Nâsatyas, terrible, radiant, for praise.

original: manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣe rarāṇā mandū hitaprayasā vikṣu yajyū //
analyzed: manuṣvat vṛktabarhiṣe rarāṇā mandū hitaprayasā vikṣu yajyū
translated: Favouring the one who strews the grass like Manu, the two who are to be worshipped in the houses, with the mind set on the guest.

original: ayaṃ stuto rājā vandi vedhā apaś ca vipras tarati svasetuḥ /
analyzed: ayam stutaḥ rājā vandi vedhāḥ apaḥ ca vipraḥ tarati sva setuḥ
translated: This king, praised, the creator of the singer, the sage, crosses over the waters with his own bridge.

original: sa kakṣīvantaṃ rejayat so agniṃ nemiṃ na cakram arvato raghudru //🔽sa dvibandhur vaitaraṇo yaṣṭā sabardhuṃ dhenum asvaṃ duhadhyai /
analyzed: sa kakṣīvantam rejayat saḥ agnim nemim na cakram arvataḥ raghudru  sa dvi bandhuḥ vaitaraṇaḥ yaṣṭā sabardhum dhenum duhadhyai
translated: He stretched Kakshivan, and Agni, like a wheel or a car-rim, the swift-running steed.🔽He, the two-related, the Vaitarana, the sacrificer, is ready to milk the cow Sabardhu for his own sake.

original: saṃ yan mitrāvaruṇā vṛñja ukthair jyeṣṭhebhir aryamaṇaṃ varūthaiḥ //
analyzed: sam yat mitrāvaruṇā vṛñje ukthaiḥ jyeṣṭhebhiḥ aryamaṇam varūthaiḥ
translated: When he, with praises, won Mitra and Varuna, with the most excellent protections, Aryaman.

original: tadbandhuḥ sūrir divi te dhiyandhā nābhānediṣṭho rapati pra venan /
analyzed: tad bandhuḥ sūriḥ divi te nābhānediṣṭhaḥ rapati pra venan
translated: That kinsman, the lord, whose thoughts are in heaven, the nearest kinsman, singing, is eager.

original: sā no nābhiḥ paramāsya vā ghāhaṃ tat paścā katithaś cid āsa //
analyzed: sā naḥ nābhiḥ paramā asya vā gha aham tat paścā katithaḥ cit āsa
translated: That is our highest kinship, or this is our home, that is somewhere in the end.

original: iyam me nābhir iha me sadhastham ime me devā ayam asmi sarvaḥ /
analyzed: iyam me nābhiḥ iha me sadhastham ime me devāḥ ayam asmi sarvaḥ
translated: This is my navel, here is my dwelling place, these are my gods, I am all this.

original: dvijā aha prathamajā ṛtasyedaṃ dhenur aduhaj jāyamānā //
analyzed: dvijāḥ aha prathama jāḥ ṛtasya idam dhenuḥ aduhat jāyamānā
translated: The twice-born, the firstborn of order, this cow milked when being born.

original: adhāsu mandro aratir vibhāvāva syati dvivartanir vaneṣāṭ /🔽ūrdhvā yac chreṇir na śiśur dan makṣū sthiraṃ śevṛdhaṃ sūta mātā //
analyzed: mandraḥ aratiḥ vibhāvā ava syati dvi vartaniḥ vaneṣāh  ūrdhvā yat śreṇiḥ na śiśuḥ makṣū sthiram śevṛdham sūta mātā
translated: Then the delightful, shining messenger moves, turning in two directions, from the forest.🔽When the upward line is like a child's teeth, the mother quickly produced the firm, prosperous one.

original: adhā gāva upamātiṃ kanāyā anu śvāntasya kasya cit pareyuḥ /
analyzed: adhā gāvaḥ upamātim kanāyāḥ anu śvāntasya kasya cit pareyuḥ
translated: Then the cows went away from the misfortune of the maiden, beyond the end of the dog.

original: śrudhi tvaṃ sudraviṇo nas tvaṃ yāḷ āśvaghnasya vāvṛdhe sūnṛtābhiḥ //
analyzed: śrudhi tvam su draviṇaḥ naḥ tvam yāṭ āśvaghnasya vāvṛdhe sūnṛtābhiḥ
translated: Listen to us, O very rich one, you who have increased the joy of Ashvakhna with your delights.

original: adha tvam indra viddhy asmān maho rāye nṛpate vajrabāhuḥ /
analyzed: adha tvam indra viddhi asmān mahaḥ rāye nṛpate vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, O lord of men, O thou with the thunderbolt in thy arm, regard us for great wealth.

original: rakṣā ca no maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn anehasas te harivo abhiṣṭau //
analyzed: rakṣā ca naḥ maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn anehasaḥ te harivas abhiṣṭau
translated: Protect our wealthy patrons, guard the princes: thy bay steeds, O bountiful one, are to be praised.

original: adha yad rājānā gaviṣṭau sarat saraṇyuḥ kārave jaraṇyuḥ /🔽vipraḥ preṣṭhaḥ sa hy eṣām babhūva parā ca vakṣad uta parṣad enān //
analyzed: adha yat rājānā gaviṣṭau sarat saraṇyuḥ kārave jaraṇyuḥ  vipraḥ preṣṭhaḥ sa hi eṣām babhūva parā ca vakṣat uta parṣat enān
translated: Now when the two kings, the swift and the slow, are contending for the cow,🔽The priest is dearer to them, for he has become their best. He shall carry them away, and he shall lead them back.

original: adhā nv asya jenyasya puṣṭau vṛthā rebhanta īmahe tad ū nu /
analyzed: adhā nu asya jenyasya puṣṭau vṛthā rebhantaḥ īmahe tat ū nu
translated: Now we will sing to him, to the son of the noble one, to the one who is to be praised, for his prosperity. That is our desire.

original: saraṇyur asya sūnur aśvo vipraś cāsi śravasaś ca sātau //
analyzed: saraṇyuḥ asya sūnuḥ aśvaḥ vipraḥ ca asi śravasaḥ ca sātau
translated: The swift son of the noble one is a horse. And thou art a sage in the winning of glory.

original: yuvor yadi sakhyāyāsme śardhāya stomaṃ jujuṣe namasvān /
analyzed: yuvoḥ yadi sakhyāya asme śardhāya stomam jujuṣe namasvān
translated: If thou, for the sake of our friendship, acceptest the praise of the impetuous one with homage,

original: viśvatra yasminn ā giraḥ samīcīḥ pūrvīva gātur dāśat sūnṛtāyai //
analyzed: viśvatra yasmin ā giraḥ samīcīḥ pūrvī iva gātuḥ dāśat sūnṛtāyai
translated: In whom, O all-supporting one, the songs of praise are combined, may he give the way, as it were, to the truth for the sake of glory.

original: sa gṛṇāno adbhir devavān iti subandhur namasā sūktaiḥ /
analyzed: sa gṛṇānaḥ adbhiḥ devavān iti su bandhuḥ namasā sūktaiḥ
translated: He, being praised with the waters, with devotion, with homage, with hymns,

original: vardhad ukthair vacobhir ā hi nūnaṃ vy adhvaiti payasa usriyāyāḥ //
analyzed: vardhat ukthaiḥ vacobhiḥ ā hi nūnam vi adhvā eti payasaḥ usriyāyāḥ
translated: With praises, is increased by the words. He goes forth to the milk of the cow.

original: ta ū ṣu ṇo maho yajatrā bhūta devāsa ūtaye sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: te ū su naḥ mahaḥ yajatrāḥ bhūta devāsaḥ ūtaye sajoṣāḥ
translated: Be ye now, O ye great to be worshipped, of one mind with the gods, for our help.

original: ye vājāṃ anayatā viyanto ye sthā nicetāro amūrāḥ //
analyzed: ye vājām anayata viyantaḥ ye stha nicetāraḥ amūrāḥ
translated: Those who have brought you strength, the wise, those who are established, the unerring ones.

original: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktā indrasya sakhyam amṛtatvam ānaśa /
analyzed: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktāḥ indrasya sakhyam amṛta tvam ānaśa
translated: Those who have been bound by sacrifice and the sacrificial fee, have attained Indra's friendship and immortality.

original: tebhyo bhadram aṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: tebhyaḥ bhadram aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: May there be good fortune for you, O Angiras, accept the wise one's offering, O you of good thoughts.

original: ya udājan pitaro gomayaṃ vasv ṛtenābhindan parivatsare valam /
analyzed: ye udājan pitaraḥ go mayam vasu ṛtena abhindan parivatsare valam
translated: Those ancestors who have brought forth the cow-pen, who have split the enclosure with the law in a year,

original: dīrghāyutvam aṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: dīrgha āyu tvam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: May you have long life, O Angiras, accept the wise one's offering, O you of good thoughts.

original: ya ṛtena sūryam ārohayan divy aprathayan pṛthivīm mātaraṃ vi /
analyzed: ye ṛtena sūryam ārohayan divi aprathayan pṛthivīm mātaram vi
translated: Those who have raised the sun with the law to the sky, who have extended the mother earth,

original: suprajāstvam aṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: suprajāstvam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: May you have good offspring, O Angiras, accept the wise one's offering, O you of good thoughts.

original: ayaṃ nābhā vadati valgu vo gṛhe devaputrā ṛṣayas tac chṛṇotana /
analyzed: ayam nābhā vadati valgu vaḥ gṛhe deva putrāḥ ṛṣayaḥ tat śṛṇotana
translated: This navel speaks sweetly in your house, O sons of gods, O sages, listen to that.

original: subrahmaṇyam aṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ //
analyzed: subrahmaṇyam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: May you have good Brahmans, O Angiras, accept the wise one's offering, O you of good thoughts.

original: virūpāsa id ṛṣayas ta id gambhīravepasaḥ /🔽te aṅgirasaḥ sūnavas te agneḥ pari jajñire //
analyzed: virūpāsaḥ id ṛṣayaḥ te id gambhīra vepasaḥ  te aṅgirasaḥ sūnavaḥ te agneḥ pari jajñire
translated: The sages are indeed of different forms, they have deep-reaching power.🔽They are the sons of Angiras, they were born from Agni's side.

original: ye agneḥ pari jajñire virūpāso divas pari /
analyzed: ye agneḥ pari jajñire virūpāsaḥ divaḥ pari
translated: Those who were born from Agni's side, of different forms, from the sky,

original: navagvo nu daśagvo aṅgirastamo sacā deveṣu maṃhate //
analyzed: navagvaḥ nu daśagvaḥ aṅgirastamaḥ sacā deveṣu maṃhate
translated: The Angiras-like one, whether nine or ten, is honoured among the gods.

original: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghato vrajaṃ gomantam aśvinam /
analyzed: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghataḥ vrajam gomantam aśvinam
translated: With Indra as his ally, he sends forth the sacrificer's cattle, the stable full of cattle and horses.

original: sahasram me dadato aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravo deveṣv akrata //
analyzed: sahasram me dadataḥ aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravaḥ deveṣu akrata
translated: He who gives me a thousand with eight-holed earrings has made fame for himself among the gods.

original: pra nūnaṃ jāyatām ayam manus tokmeva rohatu /
analyzed: pra nūnam jāyatām ayam manuḥ tokmā iva rohatu
translated: May this man be born anew, may he grow like a plant.

original: yaḥ sahasraṃ śatāśvaṃ sadyo dānāya maṃhate //
analyzed: yaḥ sahasram śata aśvam sadyas dānāya maṃhate
translated: He who immediately gives a thousand with a hundred horses for a gift.

original: na tam aśnoti kaś cana diva iva sānv ārabham /🔽sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhur iva paprathe //
analyzed: na tam aśnoti kaḥ cana divaḥ iva sānū ārabham  sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhuḥ iva paprathe
translated: No one can harm him, as I grasp him like the peak of a mountain.🔽The gifts of Savarni spread out like a river.

original: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī goparīṇasā /
analyzed: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī go parīṇasā
translated: Even the slaves, with their own cattle, with their own wealth,

original: yadus turvaś ca māmahe //
analyzed: yaduḥ turvaḥ ca māmahe
translated: we honour Yadu and Turvasa.

original: sahasradā grāmaṇīr mā riṣan manuḥ sūryeṇāsya yatamānaitu dakṣiṇā /
analyzed: sahasra dāḥ grāmaṇīḥ mā riṣat manuḥ sūryeṇa asya yatamānā etu dakṣiṇā
translated: May the thousand-giver, the village chief, the man who strives, not be harmed. May Manu come with his southern quarter.

original: sāvarṇer devāḥ pra tirantv āyur yasminn aśrāntā asanāma vājam //
analyzed: sāvarṇeḥ devāḥ pra tirantu āyuḥ yasmin a śrāntāḥ asanāma vājam
translated: May the gods prolong the life of Savarni, in whom we have placed our hope for strength.

original: parāvato ye didhiṣanta āpyam manuprītāso janimā vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: parāvataḥ ye didhiṣante āpyam manu prītāsaḥ janimā vivasvataḥ
translated: Those who from afar desire the obtainable, who delight in Manu, in the birth of Vivasvat,

original: yayāter ye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devā āsate te adhi bruvantu naḥ //
analyzed: yayāteḥ ye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devāḥ āsate te adhi bruvantu naḥ
translated: those who sit on the grass of Yayati, of Nahusha's son, may they speak to us.

original: viśvā hi vo namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devā uta yajñiyāni vaḥ /
analyzed: viśvā hi vaḥ namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devāḥ uta yajñiyāni vaḥ
translated: For all your names are worthy of worship, worthy of praise, O Gods, and worthy of sacrifice.

original: ye stha jātā aditer adbhyas pari ye pṛthivyās te ma iha śrutā havam //
analyzed: ye stha jātāḥ aditeḥ adbhyaḥ pari ye pṛthivyāḥ te me iha śrutā havam
translated: Ye who are born from Aditi, from the waters, from the earth, may they all hear my call here.

original: yebhyo mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣaṃ dyaur aditir adribarhāḥ /
analyzed: yebhyaḥ mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣam dyauḥ aditiḥ adri barhāḥ
translated: To whom the mother pours out the sweet milk, the heavenly nectar, Aditi, with the mountains for her strength,

original: ukthaśuṣmān vṛṣabharān svapnasas tāṃ ādityāṃ anu madā svastaye //
analyzed: uktha śuṣmān vṛṣa bharān svapnasaḥ tām ādityām anu madā svastaye
translated: The thunder-wielding, bull-like, self-luminous ones, I, for my welfare, rejoice in those Âdityas.

original: nṛcakṣaso animiṣanto arhaṇā bṛhad devāso amṛtatvam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: nṛ cakṣasaḥ a nimiṣantaḥ arhaṇā bṛhat devāsaḥ amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: The Gods, whose eyes are men, who never close in sleep, have gained immortality by sacrifice.

original: jyotīrathā ahimāyā anāgaso divo varṣmāṇaṃ vasate svastaye //🔽samrājo ye suvṛdho yajñam āyayur aparihvṛtā dadhire divi kṣayam /
analyzed: jyotīrathāḥ ahi māyāḥ anāgasaḥ divaḥ varṣmāṇam vasate svastaye  samrājaḥ ye suvṛdhaḥ yajñam āyayuḥ aparihvṛtāḥ dadhire divi kṣayam
translated: The luminous ones, the guileless ones, the guileless ones, dwell in the height of heaven for our welfare.🔽The Emperors, the mighty ones, who have come to the sacrifice, have established their abode in heaven, unassailed.

original: tāṃ ā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhir maho ādityāṃ aditiṃ svastaye //
analyzed: tām ā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhiḥ mahaḥ ādityām aditim svastaye
translated: I invite them with homage and with hymns, the great Âdityas, Aditi, for our welfare.

original: ko va stomaṃ rādhati yaṃ jujoṣatha viśve devāso manuṣo yati ṣṭhana /
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ stomam rādhati yam jujoṣatha viśve devāsaḥ manuṣaḥ yati ṣṭhana
translated: Who will accept the praise which you approve, O all ye Gods, who are present with mankind?

original: ko vo 'dhvaraṃ tuvijātā araṃ karad yo naḥ parṣad aty aṃhaḥ svastaye //
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ dhvaram tuvi jātāḥ aram karat yaḥ naḥ parṣat ati aṃhaḥ svastaye
translated: Who will make your sacrifice easy for you, O ye of mighty power, who will carry us over misfortune for our welfare?

original: yebhyo hotrām prathamām āyeje manuḥ samiddhāgnir manasā sapta hotṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: yebhyaḥ hotrām prathamām āyeje manuḥ samiddha agniḥ manasā sapta hotṛbhiḥ
translated: To whom Manu first offered the sacrifice, with kindled fire, with mind, with the seven priests,

original: ta ādityā abhayaṃ śarma yacchata sugā naḥ karta supathā svastaye //
analyzed: te ādityāḥ abhayam śarma yacchata sugā naḥ karta su pathā svastaye
translated: May those Ādityas grant us fearless protection, make easy paths for us, for our welfare.

original: ya īśire bhuvanasya pracetaso viśvasya sthātur jagataś ca mantavaḥ /
analyzed: ye īśire bhuvanasya pracetasaḥ viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ ca mantavaḥ
translated: Who are the lords of the world, the wise, to be honored by all that stands and moves,

original: te naḥ kṛtād akṛtād enasas pary adyā devāsaḥ pipṛtā svastaye //
analyzed: te naḥ kṛtāt a kṛtāt enasaḥ pari adyā devāsaḥ pipṛta svastaye
translated: May the gods today deliver us from the guilt we have committed and not committed, for our welfare.

original: bhareṣv indraṃ suhavaṃ havāmahe 'ṃhomucaṃ sukṛtaṃ daivyaṃ janam /
analyzed: bhareṣu indram su havam havāmahe ṃhaḥ mucam su kṛtam daivyam janam
translated: In battles we invoke Indra, the easy to invoke, the one who frees from trouble, the well-made divine people,

original: agnim mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhagaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye //
analyzed: agnim mitram varuṇam sātaye bhagam dyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye
translated: Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for gain, Bhaga, heaven and earth, the Maruts for welfare.

original: sutrāmāṇam pṛthivīṃ dyām anehasaṃ suśarmāṇam aditiṃ supraṇītim /
analyzed: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim
translated: The well-guiding earth, the sky that does not deceive, Aditi who has good guidance and good protection,

original: daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrām anāgasam asravantīm ā ruhemā svastaye //
analyzed: daivīm nāvam su aritrām anāgasam a sravantīm ā ruhema svastaye
translated: We shall mount the divine boat that is well-made, that does not fail, that flows, for our welfare.

original: viśve yajatrā adhi vocatotaye trāyadhvaṃ no durevāyā abhihrutaḥ /
analyzed: viśve yajatrāḥ adhi vocata ūtaye trāyadhvam naḥ durevāyāḥ abhihrutaḥ
translated: All you who are to be worshipped, speak for our protection. Save us from evil deeds, from being called.

original: satyayā vo devahūtyā huvema śṛṇvato devā avase svastaye //
analyzed: satyayā vaḥ deva hūtyā huvema śṛṇvataḥ devāḥ avase svastaye
translated: With true invocation of you, the invokers of the gods, may we invoke you, O gods who hear, for help, for welfare.

original: apāmīvām apa viśvām anāhutim apārātiṃ durvidatrām aghāyataḥ /
analyzed: apa amīvām apa viśvām an āhutim apa arātim durvidatrām aghāyataḥ
translated: Keep far from us all evil, all that is not sacrifice, all hostility, all evil-working want.

original: āre devā dveṣo asmad yuyotanoru ṇaḥ śarma yacchatā svastaye //
analyzed: āre devāḥ dveṣaḥ asmat yuyotana uru naḥ śarma yacchata svastaye
translated: Keep far from us, O ye Gods, all hatred. Grant us wide shelter for our weal.

original: ariṣṭaḥ sa marto viśva edhate pra prajābhir jāyate dharmaṇas pari /
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ sa martaḥ viśvaḥ edhate pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ pari
translated: That mortal man is never harmed, he prospers in all things, and is born again with children round him, through the ordinance of Law,

original: yam ādityāso nayathā sunītibhir ati viśvāni duritā svastaye //
analyzed: yam ādityāsaḥ nayathā su nītibhiḥ ati viśvāni duritā svastaye
translated: Whom ye, O Âdityas, lead by your good guidance beyond all troubles to well-being and prosperity.

original: yaṃ devāso 'vatha vājasātau yaṃ śūrasātā maruto hite dhane /
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ vatha vājasātau yam śūrasātau marutaḥ hite dhane
translated: Whom ye, O Gods, assist in the winning of booty, whom the Maruts aid in the fight for the prize,

original: prātaryāvāṇaṃ ratham indra sānasim ariṣyantam ā ruhemā svastaye //
analyzed: prātaryāvāṇam ratham indra sānasim a riṣyantam ā ruhema svastaye
translated: We will ascend, O Indra, the car that comes in the morning, that is victorious, that is irresistible, for our well-being.

original: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svasty apsu vṛjane svarvati /
analyzed: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svasti apsu vṛjane svarvati
translated: Prosperity to us on the paths, on the desert ways! Prosperity in the waters, in the watery place!

original: svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye maruto dadhātana //🔽svastir id dhi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvaty abhi yā vāmam eti /
analyzed: svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye marutaḥ dadhātana  svastiḥ id hi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvatī abhi yā vāmam eti
translated: Prosperity to us in the wombs that are the place of sons! Prosperity in wealth, O Maruts, vouchsafe to us!🔽Prosperity is the best on the open paths, the prosperous one whom we approach for our good.

original: sā no amā so araṇe ni pātu svāveśā bhavatu devagopā //
analyzed: sā naḥ amā saḥ araṇe ni pātu su āveśā bhavatu deva gopā
translated: May she protect us in the house and in the field. May she, who comes of herself, be our guardian God.

original: evā plateḥ sūnur avīvṛdhad vo viśva ādityā adite manīṣī /
analyzed: eva plateḥ sūnuḥ avīvṛdhat vaḥ viśve ādityāḥ adite manīṣī
translated: Thus hath the son of Plati increased your might, O ye All-Gods, O Âdityas, O Aditi, the wise one.

original: īśānāso naro amartyenāstāvi jano divyo gayena //🔽kathā devānāṃ katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatām manāmahe /
analyzed: īśānāsaḥ naraḥ amartyena astāvi janaḥ divyaḥ gayena  kathā devānām katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatām manāmahe
translated: The immortal men have been praised by the immortal one, the heavenly people by Gaya.🔽What is the name of the god whose path we should choose from among the gods who listen? We think of the one with a good name.

original: ko mṛḷāti katamo no mayas karat katama ūtī abhy ā vavartati //
analyzed: kaḥ mṛḷāti katamaḥ naḥ mayaḥ karat katamaḥ ūtī abhī ā vavartati
translated: Who is kind? Who will do us good? Which one comes to us for help?

original: kratūyanti kratavo hṛtsu dhītayo venanti venāḥ patayanty ā diśaḥ /
