analyzed: kratūyanti kratavaḥ hṛtsu dhītayaḥ venanti venāḥ patayanti ā diśaḥ
translated: The sacrifices move in the hearts, the hymns in the mind, the desires move, they fly to the directions.

original: na marḍitā vidyate anya ebhyo deveṣu me adhi kāmā ayaṃsata //
analyzed: na marḍitā vidyate anyaḥ ebhyaḥ deveṣu me adhi kāmāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: There is no other one to be praised than these. My desires have come to rest in the gods.

original: narā vā śaṃsam pūṣaṇam agohyam agniṃ deveddham abhy arcase girā /
analyzed: narā vā śaṃsam pūṣaṇam agohyam agnim deva iddham abhī arcase girā
translated: You praise in speech the men, the praiseworthy Pusan, Agni who is kindled by the gods,

original: sūryāmāsā candramasā yamaṃ divi tritaṃ vātam uṣasam aktum aśvinā //
analyzed: sūryāmāsā candramasā yamam divi tritam vātam uṣasam aktum aśvinā
translated: the sun and moon, the moon, Yama in the sky, Trita, Vata, Ushas, the dawn, the two Ashvins.

original: kathā kavis tuvīravān kayā girā bṛhaspatir vāvṛdhate suvṛktibhiḥ /
analyzed: kathā kaviḥ tuvīravān kayā girā bṛhaspatiḥ vāvṛdhate suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: How does the wise one become powerful? By what speech does Brihaspati grow through good praises?

original: aja ekapāt suhavebhir ṛkvabhir ahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyo havīmani //
analyzed: ajaḥ ekapād su havebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ ahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyaḥ havīmani
translated: May the one-footed Agni, the swift one, the serpent who dwells in the depths, listen to the invocation with the well-praising ones.

original: dakṣasya vādite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇā vivāsasi /
analyzed: dakṣasya vā adite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇā vivāsasi
translated: In the birth, in the vow of Daksha, you dwell with the two kings Mitra and Varuna.

original: atūrtapanthāḥ pururatho aryamā saptahotā viṣurūpeṣu janmasu //
analyzed: a tūrta panthāḥ puru rathaḥ aryamā sapta hotā viṣurūpeṣu janmasu
translated: Aryaman, whose path is uninterrupted, who has many chariots, the seven-priest, in the various births,

original: te no arvanto havanaśruto havaṃ viśve śṛṇvantu vājino mitadravaḥ /
analyzed: te naḥ arvantaḥ havana śrutaḥ havam viśve śṛṇvantu vājinaḥ mitadravaḥ
translated: May all those swift horses, who hear our call, who are swift to move, listen to our invocation.

original: sahasrasā medhasātāv iva tmanā maho ye dhanaṃ samitheṣu jabhrire //
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ medha sātau iva tmanā mahaḥ ye dhanam samitheṣu jabhrire
translated: They who have won great wealth in battles, with a thousand powers, as if for the sake of the sacrifice.

original: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujam purandhiṃ stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sakhyāya pūṣaṇam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ vāyum ratha yujam purandhim stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvam sakhyāya pūṣaṇam
translated: You must make Vayu, who yokes the chariot, and Pūṣan, the swift one, with your praises, for friendship.

original: te hi devasya savituḥ savīmani kratuṃ sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ //
analyzed: te hi devasya savituḥ savīmani kratum sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ
translated: For they, in the impulse of the god Savitr, are mindful, well-minded, in the mind of the wise one.

original: triḥ sapta sasrā nadyo mahīr apo vanaspatīn parvatāṃ agnim ūtaye /
analyzed: tris sapta sasrāḥ nadyaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vanaspatīn parvatān agnim ūtaye
translated: The three times seven mighty rivers, the great waters, the trees, the mountains, Agni, for help,

original: kṛśānum astṝn tiṣyaṃ sadhastha ā rudraṃ rudreṣu rudriyaṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: kṛśānum astṝn tiṣyam sadhasthe ā rudram rudreṣu rudriyam havāmahe
translated: The swift one, the thrower, the all-pervading one, we invoke Rudra among the Rudras, the Rudra-like one.

original: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhur ūrmibhir maho mahīr avasā yantu vakṣaṇīḥ /🔽devīr āpo mātaraḥ sūdayitnvo ghṛtavat payo madhuman no arcata //
analyzed: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhuḥ ūrmibhiḥ mahaḥ mahīḥ avasā yantu vakṣaṇīḥ  devīḥ āpaḥ mātaraḥ sūdayitnvaḥ ghṛtavat payaḥ madhumat naḥ arcata
translated: May Sarasvatī, the swift one, the river, with her waves, with her great and mighty help, come to us.🔽O divine waters, O mothers, who purify, be rich in ghee, in sweet milk, for us.

original: uta mātā bṛhaddivā śṛṇotu nas tvaṣṭā devebhir janibhiḥ pitā vacaḥ /
analyzed: uta mātā bṛhat divā śṛṇotu naḥ tvaṣṭā devebhiḥ janibhiḥ pitā vacaḥ
translated: May the great mother Dyaus hear us, Tvaṣṭar, the father, with the gods, with the clans, (hear) our speech.

original: ṛbhukṣā vājo rathaspatir bhago raṇvaḥ śaṃsaḥ śaśamānasya pātu naḥ //
analyzed: ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ rathaspatiḥ bhagaḥ raṇvaḥ śaṃsaḥ śaśamānasya pātu naḥ
translated: May Ṛbhukṣan Vāja, lord of the chariot, Bhaga, the kind one, the praised one, protect us who strive.

original: raṇvaḥ saṃdṛṣṭau pitumāṃ iva kṣayo bhadrā rudrāṇām marutām upastutiḥ /
analyzed: raṇvaḥ saṃdṛṣṭau pitumān iva kṣayaḥ bhadrā rudrāṇām marutām upastutiḥ
translated: Lovely to behold, like a father, is the home of the Rudras and Maruts, auspicious, to be praised.

original: gobhiḥ ṣyāma yaśaso janeṣv ā sadā devāsa iḷayā sacemahi //
analyzed: gobhiḥ syāma yaśasaḥ janeṣu ā sadā devāsaḥ iḷayā sacemahi
translated: Through the cattle may we be famous among the people. May we always, O gods, be united with your favour.

original: yām me dhiyam maruta indra devā adadāta varuṇa mitra yūyam /
analyzed: yām me dhiyam marutaḥ indra devāḥ adadāta varuṇa mitra yūyam
translated: That thought of mine, O Maruts, O Indra, O gods, which I have given to you, O Varuṇa, O Mitra,

original: tām pīpayata payaseva dhenuṃ kuvid giro adhi rathe vahātha //
analyzed: tām pīpayata payasā iva dhenum kuvid giraḥ adhi rathe vahātha
translated: Make it grow like a cow with milk. Will you not bring the songs on a chariot?

original: kuvid aṅga prati yathā cid asya naḥ sajātyasya maruto bubodhatha /
analyzed: kuvid aṅga prati yathā cit asya naḥ sajātyasya marutaḥ bubodhatha
translated: How will you, O Maruts, be aware of this of ours, of the kinsman?

original: nābhā yatra prathamaṃ saṃnasāmahe tatra jāmitvam aditir dadhātu naḥ //
analyzed: nābhā yatra prathamam saṃnasāmahe tatra jāmi tvam aditiḥ dadhātu naḥ
translated: Where we first join hands, there may Aditi grant us the status of kinsmen.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī mātarā mahī devī devāñ janmanā yajñiye itaḥ /🔽ubhe bibhṛta ubhayam bharīmabhiḥ purū retāṃsi pitṛbhiś ca siñcataḥ //
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī mātarā mahī devī devām janmanā yajñiye itaḥ  ubhe bibhṛtaḥ ubhayam bharīmabhiḥ purū retāṃsi pitṛbhiḥ ca siñcataḥ
translated: For they, Dyaus and Prithivī, the two great mother goddesses, are worthy of sacrifice from the gods.🔽They both support, with all the supporters, many seed-sorts, and sprinkle with the fathers.

original: vi ṣā hotrā viśvam aśnoti vāryam bṛhaspatir aramatiḥ panīyasī /
analyzed: vi sā hotrā viśvam aśnoti vāryam bṛhaspatiḥ aramatiḥ panīyasī
translated: The two Hotras (priests) obtain all the good things to be had. Brhaspati (is) the highest favour.

original: grāvā yatra madhuṣud ucyate bṛhad avīvaśanta matibhir manīṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: grāvā yatra madhuṣut ucyate bṛhat avīvaśanta matibhiḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Where the stone is called the great honey-purifier, the wise have rejoiced with thoughts.

original: evā kavis tuvīravāṃ ṛtajñā draviṇasyur draviṇasaś cakānaḥ /
analyzed: eva kaviḥ tuvīravān ṛta jñāḥ draviṇasyuḥ draviṇasaḥ cakānaḥ
translated: Thus the wise one, who knows the truth, who is to be praised, who has wealth and desires wealth,

original: ukthebhir atra matibhiś ca vipro 'pīpayad gayo divyāni janma //
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ atra matibhiḥ ca vipraḥ pīpayat gayaḥ divyāni janma
translated: The sage Gāya has filled with hymns and thoughts the heavenly births.

original: evā plateḥ sūnur avīvṛdhad vo viśva ādityā adite manīṣī /
analyzed: eva plateḥ sūnuḥ avīvṛdhat vaḥ viśve ādityāḥ adite manīṣī
translated: Thus the wise son of Plati has increased your strength, O Aditi, O all you Ādityas.

original: īśānāso naro amartyenāstāvi jano divyo gayena //
analyzed: īśānāsaḥ naraḥ amartyena astāvi janaḥ divyaḥ gayena
translated: The people, the lords, have been praised by the immortal one, the heavenly people by Gāya.

original: agnir indro varuṇo mitro aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatī sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatī sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Vāyu, Pūṣan, Sarasvatī, of one mind,

original: ādityā viṣṇur marutaḥ svar bṛhat somo rudro aditir brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: ādityāḥ viṣṇuḥ marutaḥ svar bṛhat somaḥ rudraḥ aditiḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: The Ādityas, Viṣṇu, the Maruts, the lofty heaven, Soma, Rudra, Aditi, the lord of prayer.

original: indrāgnī vṛtrahatyeṣu satpatī mitho hinvānā tanvā samokasā /
analyzed: indra agnī vṛtra hatyeṣu sat patī mithas hinvānā tanvā samokasā
translated: Indra and Agni, lords of the true, in the slaying of Vṛtra, mutually impelling, with one body,

original: antarikṣam mahy ā paprur ojasā somo ghṛtaśrīr mahimānam īrayan //
analyzed: antarikṣam mahi ā papruḥ ojasā somaḥ ghṛtaśrīḥ mahimānam īrayan
translated: Have extended the great atmosphere with might, Soma, glorious with ghee, proclaiming greatness.

original: teṣāṃ hi mahnā mahatām anarvaṇāṃ stomāṃ iyarmy ṛtajñā ṛtāvṛdhām /
analyzed: teṣām hi mahnā mahatām anarvaṇām stomān iyarmi ṛta jñāḥ ṛtāvṛdhām
translated: For their greatness, of those who are great, who are not to be resisted, I offer praises, who know the truth, who increase truth,

original: ye apsavam arṇavaṃ citrarādhasas te no rāsantām mahaye sumitryāḥ //
analyzed: ye apsavam arṇavam citra rādhasaḥ te naḥ rāsantām mahaye sumitryāḥ
translated: Who have the waters and the ocean, who have wondrous gifts, may they be gracious to us for greatness.

original: svarṇaram antarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīṃ skambhur ojasā /
analyzed: svarṇaram antarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīm skambhuḥ ojasā
translated: They have propped up the golden firmaments, the luminous ones, the sky and earth, the earth, with might,

original: pṛkṣā iva mahayantaḥ surātayo devā stavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ //
analyzed: pṛkṣāḥ iva mahayantaḥ su rātayaḥ devā stavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ
translated: The noble ones, like the Pṛkṣas, extolling them with good offerings, the gods are praised by the noble ones for the sake of men.

original: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā na prayucchataḥ /
analyzed: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā na prayucchataḥ
translated: Teach Mitra, offer to Varuṇa, the two who are kings, who do not forsake the mind.

original: yayor dhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhad yayor ubhe rodasī nādhasī vṛtau //
analyzed: yayoḥ dhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhat yayoḥ ubhe rodasī nādhasī vṛtau
translated: Of whom the great abode shines forth with law, of whom the two worlds are encompassed, the lower and the upper.

original: yā gaur vartanim paryeti niṣkṛtam payo duhānā vratanīr avārataḥ /
analyzed: yā gauḥ vartanim paryeti niṣkṛtam payaḥ duhānā vratanīḥ avāratas
translated: The cow who goes around the path, the one who milks the milk, the one who fulfills the vows, the one who is not far away,

original: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyo dāśad dhaviṣā vivasvate //
analyzed: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyaḥ dāśat haviṣā vivasvate
translated: She, proclaiming, may offer to Varuṇa the one who offers, to the gods, may she offer oblations to Vivasvat.

original: divakṣaso agnijihvā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtasya yoniṃ vimṛśanta āsate /
analyzed: divakṣasaḥ agni jihvāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtasya yonim vimṛśantaḥ āsate
translated: The ones who are in the sky, with Agni as their tongue, who increase truth, they contemplate the womb of truth.

original: dyāṃ skabhitvy apa ā cakrur ojasā yajñaṃ janitvī tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ //
analyzed: dyām skabhitvī apaḥ ā cakruḥ ojasā yajñam janitvī tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
translated: Having fixed the sky, they have made the waters with power. Having generated the sacrifice, they have adorned the slender one.

original: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥ samokasā /
analyzed: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥ samokasā
translated: The two parents, the earlier ones, the all-encompassing ones, dwell in the womb of truth, in the same abode.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payo mahiṣāya pinvataḥ //
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payaḥ mahiṣāya pinvataḥ
translated: The two heavens and earth, for Varuṇa of true vows, swell with ghee-like milk for the mighty one.

original: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇendravāyū varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇā indra vāyū varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Parjanya and Vāta, the two bulls, the two with seed, Indra and Vāyu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: devāṃ ādityāṃ aditiṃ havāmahe ye pārthivāso divyāso apsu ye //
analyzed: devām ādityām aditim havāmahe ye pārthivāsaḥ divyāsaḥ apsu ye
translated: We invoke the Āditya gods, Aditi, those who are in the earth, those who are in the sky, those who are in the waters.

original: tvaṣṭāraṃ vāyum ṛbhavo ya ohate daivyā hotārā uṣasaṃ svastaye /
analyzed: tvaṣṭāram vāyum ṛbhavaḥ yaḥ ohate daivyā hotārau uṣasam svastaye
translated: Tvashtar, Vayu, the Rbhus who are to be invoked, the divine Hotars, Ushas for our welfare,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛtrakhādaṃ sumedhasam indriyaṃ somaṃ dhanasā u īmahe //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛtra khādam sumedhasam indriyam somam dhana sāḥ u īmahe
translated: Brihaspati, the consumer of Vritra, the wise one, the powerful Soma, we invoke for wealth.

original: brahma gām aśvaṃ janayanta oṣadhīr vanaspatīn pṛthivīm parvatāṃ apaḥ /
analyzed: brahma gām aśvam janayantaḥ oṣadhīḥ vanaspatīn pṛthivīm parvatān apaḥ
translated: The Brahmans have generated the cow, the horse, the plants, the trees, the earth, the mountains, the waters.

original: sūryaṃ divi rohayantaḥ sudānava āryā vratā visṛjanto adhi kṣami //🔽bhujyum aṃhasaḥ pipṛtho nir aśvinā śyāvam putraṃ vadhrimatyā ajinvatam /
analyzed: sūryam divi rohayantaḥ sudānavaḥ āryā vratā visṛjantaḥ adhi kṣami  bhujyum aṃhasaḥ pipṛthaḥ niḥ aśvinā śyāvam putram vadhrimatyāḥ ajinvatam
translated: The well-giving Aryas, setting the sun in the sky, spreading out the holy vows upon the earth.🔽You, O Asvins, have delivered Bhujyu from distress; you have quickened the lame son of Vadhrimathi.

original: kamadyuvaṃ vimadāyohathur yuvaṃ viṣṇāpvaṃ viśvakāyāva sṛjathaḥ //
analyzed: kamadyuvam vimadāya ūhathuḥ yuvam viṣṇāpvam viśvakāya ava sṛjathaḥ
translated: You have brought the swift one for the one without intoxication; you have released Vishnu's expansion for the all-supporting one.

original: pāvīravī tanyatur ekapād ajo divo dhartā sindhur āpaḥ samudriyaḥ /
analyzed: pāvīravī tanyatuḥ ekapād ajaḥ divaḥ dhartā sindhuḥ āpaḥ samudriyaḥ
translated: The one with the people, the thundering one with one foot, the goat, the supporter of the sky, the ocean, the rivers, the waters.

original: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā //
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā
translated: May all the gods hear my words, Sarasvati together with the thoughts and the inspiration.

original: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manor yajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: All the gods together with the thoughts and the inspiration, the immortal ones who know the truth, the ones to be worshipped by Manu,

original: rātiṣāco abhiṣācaḥ svarvidaḥ svar giro brahma sūktaṃ juṣerata //
analyzed: rātiṣācaḥ abhiṣācaḥ svar vidaḥ svar giraḥ brahma sūktam juṣerata
translated: The ones who bestow gifts, the ones who bestow favors, the ones who find heaven, may they enjoy the heavenly songs, the Brahman, the hymn.

original: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhi pratasthuḥ /
analyzed: devān vasiṣṭhaḥ amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanā abhi pratasthuḥ
translated: Vasistha has worshipped the immortal Gods, who have gone forth over all existing things.

original: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they grant us wide protection this day. Do ye preserve us evermore with your blessings.

original: devān huve bṛhacchravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛto adhvarasya pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: devān huve bṛhat śravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛtaḥ adhvarasya pracetasaḥ
translated: I call the Gods, whose bounty is most great, to bless us, the skilful, the enlighteners of the sacrifice.

original: ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataraṃ viśvavedasa indrajyeṣṭhāso amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataram viśva vedasaḥ indra jyeṣṭhāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: They who have grown in strength, all-knowing, the ford, the immortal, Indra's chief, the strengtheners of truth.

original: indraprasūtā varuṇapraśiṣṭā ye sūryasya jyotiṣo bhāgam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: indra prasūtāḥ varuṇa praśiṣṭāḥ ye sūryasya jyotiṣaḥ bhāgam ānaśuḥ
translated: Urged on by Indra, directed by Varuna, they who have gained a share of the light of the sun.

original: marudgaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṃ janayanta sūrayaḥ //
analyzed: marut gaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñam janayanta sūrayaḥ
translated: In the Maruts' company, in the conflict, we will think upon the hymn. The princes have produced the sacrifice in the house of Maghavan.

original: indro vasubhiḥ pari pātu no gayam ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yacchatu /
analyzed: indraḥ vasubhiḥ pari pātu naḥ gayam ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: May Indra with the Vasus protect our house. May Aditi with the Adityas grant us protection.

original: rudro rudrebhir devo mṛḷayāti nas tvaṣṭā no gnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu //
analyzed: rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ devaḥ mṛḍayāti naḥ tvaṣṭā naḥ gnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu
translated: May Rudra the God with the Rudras be gracious to us. May Tvashtar with the dames stimulate our sacrifice.

original: aditir dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtam mahad indrāviṣṇū marutaḥ svar bṛhat /
analyzed: aditiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtam mahat indrā viṣṇū marutaḥ svar bṛhat
translated: Aditi, Heaven and Earth, great Order, Indra and Vishnu, the Maruts, the lofty sky,

original: devāṃ ādityāṃ avase havāmahe vasūn rudrān savitāraṃ sudaṃsasam //
analyzed: devām ādityām avase havāmahe vasūn rudrān savitāram su daṃsasam
translated: The Gods, the Âdityas, we invoke for aid, the Vasus, the Rudras, and the bounteous Savitar.

original: sarasvān dhībhir varuṇo dhṛtavrataḥ pūṣā viṣṇur mahimā vāyur aśvinā /
analyzed: sarasvān dhībhiḥ varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ pūṣā viṣṇuḥ mahimā vāyuḥ aśvinā
translated: Sarasvat, Varuna of steadfast vow, Pusan, Vishnu, the greatness of Vayu, the two Asvins,

original: brahmakṛto amṛtā viśvavedasaḥ śarma no yaṃsan trivarūtham aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: brahma kṛtaḥ amṛtāḥ viśva vedasaḥ śarma naḥ yaṃsan tri varūtham aṃhasaḥ
translated: Brahma-makers, immortal, all-knowing, may they bestow on us the threefold protection from distress.

original: vṛṣā yajño vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyā vṛṣaṇo devā vṛṣaṇo haviṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā yajñaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyāḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ devāḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ haviṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The sacrifice is a bull, let the sacrificers be bulls, the gods are bulls, the offerers of oblations are bulls.

original: vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarī vṛṣā parjanyo vṛṣaṇo vṛṣastubhaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarī vṛṣā parjanyaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vṛṣa stubhaḥ
translated: The two bulls, heaven and earth, are true to their promise, Parjanya is a bull, the bulls are the thunderers.

original: agnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye purupraśastā vṛṣaṇā upa bruve /
analyzed: agnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye puru praśastā vṛṣaṇā upa bruve
translated: Agni and Soma, O bulls, for the sake of strength, I address you, O bulls, much praised, O bulls.

original: yāv ījire vṛṣaṇo devayajyayā tā naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsataḥ //🔽dhṛtavratāḥ kṣatriyā yajñaniṣkṛto bṛhaddivā adhvarāṇām abhiśriyaḥ /
analyzed: yau ījire vṛṣaṇaḥ deva yajyayā tā naḥ śarma tri varūtham vi yaṃsataḥ  dhṛta vratāḥ kṣatriyāḥ yajña niṣkṛtaḥ bṛhat divāḥ adhvarāṇām abhiśriyaḥ
translated: You who have worshipped as bulls by offering to the gods, may you two bestow on us the threefold protection.🔽The Kshatriyas, whose vows are firm, who perfect the sacrifice, the great overseers of the rites,

original: agnihotāra ṛtasāpo adruho 'po asṛjann anu vṛtratūrye //🔽dyāvāpṛthivī janayann abhi vratāpa oṣadhīr vanināni yajñiyā /
analyzed: agni hotāraḥ ṛtasāpaḥ adruhaḥ asṛjan anu vṛtratūrye  dyāvāpṛthivī janayan abhi vratā apaḥ oṣadhīḥ vanināni yajñiyā
translated: The offerers of the Agnihotra, who are true to their promise and free from guile, have created the waters in the battle against Vritra.🔽Heaven and earth, begetting the waters, the plants, and the sacrificial offerings,

original: antarikṣaṃ svar ā paprur ūtaye vaśaṃ devāsas tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ //
analyzed: antarikṣam svar ā papruḥ ūtaye vaśam devāsaḥ tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
translated: The atmosphere, the sky, they have extended for help. The gods have fashioned the slender Vasha for us.

original: dhartāro diva ṛbhavaḥ suhastā vātāparjanyā mahiṣasya tanyatoḥ /
analyzed: dhartāraḥ divaḥ ṛbhavaḥ su hastāḥ vātāparjanyā mahiṣasya tanyatoḥ
translated: The supporters of heaven, the Rbhus, with fair hands, Vata, Parjanya, and the bull's deep-sounding roar,

original: āpa oṣadhīḥ pra tirantu no giro bhago rātir vājino yantu me havam //
analyzed: āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ pra tirantu naḥ giraḥ bhagaḥ rātiḥ vājinaḥ yantu me havam
translated: The waters, plants, and songs, may they promote for us. May Bhaga, Rati, and the strong ones come to my invocation.

original: samudraḥ sindhū rajo antarikṣam aja ekapāt tanayitnur arṇavaḥ /
analyzed: samudraḥ sindhuḥ rajaḥ antarikṣam ajaḥ ekapād tanayitnuḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: The ocean, the rivers, the dust, the atmosphere, the one-footed, the roaring deep,

original: ahir budhnyaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me viśve devāsa uta sūrayo mama //
analyzed: ahiḥ budhnyaḥ śṛṇavat vacāṃsi me viśve devāsaḥ uta sūrayaḥ mama
translated: The serpent of the deep may listen to my words. May all the gods and the noble ones listen to me.

original: syāma vo manavo devavītaye prāñcaṃ no yajñam pra ṇayata sādhuyā /
analyzed: syāma vaḥ manavaḥ deva vītaye prāñcam naḥ yajñam pra nayata sādhuyā
translated: May we be in your favour, O gods, for the feast. Lead our sacrifice forward in the right way.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sudānava imā brahma śasyamānāni jinvata //
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ sudānavaḥ imā brahma śasyamānāni jinvata
translated: O Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, givers of good gifts, quicken these prayers of mine that are being uttered.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā purohita ṛtasya panthām anv emi sādhuyā /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā purohitaḥ ṛtasya panthām anu emi sādhuyā
translated: The two divine Hotars, first priests, I follow in the right way the path of holy order.

original: kṣetrasya patim prativeśam īmahe viśvān devāṃ amṛtāṃ aprayucchataḥ //🔽vasiṣṭhāsaḥ pitṛvad vācam akrata devāṃ īḷānā ṛṣivat svastaye /
analyzed: kṣetrasya patim prativeśam īmahe viśvān devān amṛtām aprayucchataḥ  vasiṣṭhāsaḥ pitṛ vat vācam akrata devān īḍānāḥ ṛṣi vat svastaye
translated: We implore the lord of the field, the neighbour, all the immortal gods who do not slumber.🔽The Vasishthas have uttered speech like a father, calling on the gods like seers for welfare.

original: prītā iva jñātayaḥ kāmam etyāsme devāso 'va dhūnutā vasu //
analyzed: prītāḥ iva jñātayaḥ kāmam etya asme devāsaḥ vaḥ dhūnutā vasu
translated: Like kinsmen who are well-disposed, coming to their desired goal, O gods, shake for us an abundance of wealth.

original: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhi pratasthuḥ /
analyzed: devān vasiṣṭhaḥ amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanā abhi pratasthuḥ
translated: Vasistha has worshipped the immortal Gods, who have gone forth over all existing things.

original: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they grant us wide pasture today. Do ye preserve us evermore with your protections.

original: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīm pitā na ṛtaprajātām bṛhatīm avindat /
analyzed: imām dhiyam sapta śīrṣṇīm pitā naḥ ṛta prajātām bṛhatīm avindat
translated: This thought, seven-headed, which the Father found, the mighty one, born of holy order,

original: turīyaṃ svij janayad viśvajanyo 'yāsya uktham indrāya śaṃsan //
analyzed: turīyam svid janayat viśvajanyaḥ yā asyaḥ uktham indrāya śaṃsan
translated: The universal creator, begetting the fourth oblation, the hymn, sang it to Indra.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛju dīdhyānā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛju dīdhyānāḥ divaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: Singing holy order, thinking straight, the sons of Dyaus, the Asura's heroes,

original: vipram padam aṅgiraso dadhānā yajñasya dhāma prathamam mananta //
analyzed: vipram padam aṅgirasaḥ dadhānāḥ yajñasya dhāma prathamam mananta
translated: Placing the sage in his place, Angiras, first thought upon the abode of sacrifice.

original: haṃsair iva sakhibhir vāvadadbhir aśmanmayāni nahanā vyasyan /
analyzed: haṃsaiḥ iva sakhibhiḥ vāvadadbhiḥ aśmanmayāni nahanā vyasyan
translated: Like swans, with his companions who utter their notes, opening the stone-built enclosures,

original: bṛhaspatir abhikanikradad gā uta prāstaud uc ca vidvāṃ agāyat //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ abhikanikradat gāḥ uta prāstaut ud ca vidvān agāyat
translated: Brihaspati, bellowing at the cows, sang forth and sang his song, the wise one, to Indra.

original: avo dvābhyām para ekayā gā guhā tiṣṭhantīr anṛtasya setau /
analyzed: avas dvābhyām paras ekayā gāḥ guhā tiṣṭhantīḥ anṛtasya setau
translated: The two first, and then one more, he drove the cows out, that stood in the cave, on the bridge of falsehood.

original: bṛhaspatis tamasi jyotir icchann ud usrā ākar vi hi tisra āvaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ tamasi jyotiḥ icchan ud usrāḥ ākaḥ vi hi tisraḥ āvaḥ
translated: Brihaspati, seeking light in the darkness, brought the three dawns forth, for he had rent them.

original: vibhidyā puraṃ śayathem apācīṃ nis trīṇi sākam udadher akṛntat /
analyzed: vibhidya puram śayatha īm apācīm niḥ trīṇi sākam udadheḥ akṛntat
translated: He cleft the westernmost enclosure, the abode of darkness, and cut out the three together from the ocean.

original: bṛhaspatir uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ gām arkaṃ viveda stanayann iva dyauḥ //🔽indro valaṃ rakṣitāraṃ dughānāṃ kareṇeva vi cakartā raveṇa /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ uṣasam sūryam gām arkam viveda stanayan iva dyauḥ  indraḥ valam rakṣitāram dughānām kareṇa iva vi cakarta raveṇa
translated: Brihaspati discovered the dawn, the sun, the cow, the light, like the sky thundering.🔽Indra, like with a hand, split apart with his roar the guardian Vala of the milk-cows.

original: svedāñjibhir āśiram icchamāno 'rodayat paṇim ā gā amuṣṇāt //
analyzed: sveda añjibhiḥ āśiram icchamānaḥ rodayat paṇim ā gāḥ amuṣṇāt
translated: Desiring the milk-sprinkled one with sweat-smeared (cows), he caused the milker to low and took away the cows.

original: sa īṃ satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhir godhāyasaṃ vi dhanasair adardaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ īm satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhiḥ godhāyasam vi dhanasaiḥ adardar
translated: He, with his true, pure friends, with the milk-cow-stealers, split apart the wealth with his own people.

original: brahmaṇas patir vṛṣabhir varāhair gharmasvedebhir draviṇaṃ vy ānaṭ //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ vṛṣabhiḥ varāhaiḥ gharma svedebhiḥ draviṇam vi ānaṭ
translated: Brahmanaspati, with the bulls, the boars, with those sweating with heat, distributed the wealth.

original: te satyena manasā gopatiṃ gā iyānāsa iṣaṇayanta dhībhiḥ /
analyzed: te satyena manasā gopatim gāḥ iyānāsaḥ iṣaṇayanta dhībhiḥ
translated: With a mind full of truth, seeking the lord of the cows, they urged him with their thoughts, the cows.

original: bṛhaspatir mithoavadyapebhir ud usriyā asṛjata svayugbhiḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ mithoavadyapebhiḥ ud usriyāḥ asṛjata sva yugbhiḥ
translated: Brihaspati, with those who are his own, with those who remove mutual blame, brought forth the cows.

original: taṃ vardhayanto matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃham iva nānadataṃ sadhasthe /
analyzed: tam vardhayantaḥ matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃham iva nānadatam sadhasthe
translated: Extolling him with auspicious thoughts, like a roaring lion in the assembly,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ śūrasātau bharebhare anu madema jiṣṇum //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam śūrasātau bharebhare anu madema jiṣṇum
translated: Brihaspati, the strong one, the victorious one, may we rejoice in every battle.

original: yadā vājam asanad viśvarūpam ā dyām arukṣad uttarāṇi sadma /
analyzed: yadā vājam asanat viśva rūpam ā dyām arukṣat uttarāṇi sadma
translated: When he ascended to the sky, to the highest abode, having taken on the strength of all forms,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhayanto nānā santo bibhrato jyotir āsā //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam vardhayantaḥ nānā santaḥ bibhrataḥ jyotiḥ āsā
translated: Extolling Brihaspati, the strong one, bearing the light together, though they are separate.

original: satyām āśiṣaṃ kṛṇutā vayodhai kīriṃ cid dhy avatha svebhir evaiḥ /
analyzed: satyām āśiṣam kṛṇutā vayodhai kīrim cit hi avatha svebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: Bestow upon us blessings that shall last for ever: help even the feeble with your own protections.

original: paścā mṛdho apa bhavantu viśvās tad rodasī śṛṇutaṃ viśvaminve //
analyzed: paścā mṛdhaḥ apa bhavantu viśvāḥ tat rodasī śṛṇutam viśvaminve
translated: Let all our enemies be behind us, and may the two world-halves listen to us, O ye all-impelling ones.

original: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vi mūrdhānam abhinad arbudasya /
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā mahataḥ arṇavasya vi mūrdhānam abhinat arbudasya
translated: Indra with his greatness cleft the head of the great billowy monster.

original: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn devair dyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ //
analyzed: ahan ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ
translated: He slew the dragon, he loosed the seven rivers. O Heaven and Earth, ye Gods, protect us well.

original: udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ /
analyzed: uda prutaḥ na vayaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ vāvadataḥ abhriyasya iva ghoṣāḥ
translated: Like birds that fly up, guarding their feathers, with the sound of rain-clouds roaring in the sky,

original: giribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatim abhy arkā anāvan //
analyzed: giri bhrajaḥ nā ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ bṛhaspatim abhi arkāḥ anāvan
translated: Like mountain torrents, the streams rejoicing, the hymns have called aloud to mighty Br̥ihaspati.

original: saṃ gobhir āṅgiraso nakṣamāṇo bhaga ived aryamaṇaṃ nināya /
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ āṅgirasaḥ nakṣamāṇaḥ bhagaḥ iva id aryamaṇam nināya
translated: The son of Aṅgiras, seeking the kine, hath brought Aryaman hither, as 'twere, with Bhaga.

original: jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājayāśūṃr ivājau //
analyzed: jane mitraḥ na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājaya āśūn iva ājau
translated: As Mitra to the pair, so hath he anointed the people. O Br̥ihaspati, the swift steeds in the race.

original: sādhvaryā atithinīr iṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇā anavadyarūpāḥ /🔽bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyo vitūryā nir gā ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ //
analyzed: sādhvaryāḥ atithinīḥ iṣirāḥ spārhāḥ su varṇāḥ anavadya rūpāḥ  bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyaḥ vitūrya niḥ gāḥ ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ
translated: The excellent, the hospitable, the strong, the desirable, of fair complexion, and of irreproachable form,🔽Br̥ihaspati, having burst the mountains, hath brought forth the kine as 'twere the barley from the threshing-floors.

original: āpruṣāyan madhuna ṛtasya yonim avakṣipann arka ulkām iva dyoḥ /
analyzed: āpruṣāyan madhunaḥ ṛtasya yonim avakṣipan arkaḥ ulkām iva dyoḥ
translated: The honey-sweet rain hath filled the womb of holy order, and the hymn hath fallen like a meteor from the sky.

original: bṛhaspatir uddharann aśmano gā bhūmyā udneva vi tvacam bibheda //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ uddharan aśmanaḥ gāḥ bhūmyāḥ udnā iva vi tvacam bibheda
translated: Brihaspati, tearing up the stones, the cows from the earth, as with a flood he cleft the skin.

original: apa jyotiṣā tamo antarikṣād udnaḥ śīpālam iva vāta ājat /🔽bṛhaspatir anumṛśyā valasyābhram iva vāta ā cakra ā gāḥ //
analyzed: apa jyotiṣā tamaḥ antarikṣāt udnaḥ śīpālam iva vātaḥ ājat  bṛhaspatiḥ anumṛśya valasya abhram iva vātaḥ ā cakre ā gāḥ
translated: The light hath driven darkness from the firmament, as the wind driveth off the mist.🔽Brihaspati, having touched the cow-stall, hath brought the cows, as the wind bringeth the clouds.

original: yadā valasya pīyato jasum bhed bṛhaspatir agnitapobhir arkaiḥ /
analyzed: yadā valasya pīyataḥ jasum bhet bṛhaspatiḥ agni tapobhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: When Brihaspati with the heat of Agni and with hymns cleft the strength of Vala when he was drunk.

original: dadbhir na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādad āvir nidhīṃr akṛṇod usriyāṇām //
analyzed: dadbhiḥ na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādat āvis nidhīṃr akṛṇot usriyāṇām
translated: He took with his teeth what was not swallowed by the tongue, and revealed the treasures of the kine.

original: bṛhaspatir amata hi tyad āsāṃ nāma svarīṇāṃ sadane guhā yat /🔽āṇḍeva bhittvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanājat //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ amata hi tyad āsām nāma svarīṇām sadane guhā yat  āṇḍā iva bhittvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanā ajat
translated: Brihaspati hath found that out, the name of these, the secret name in the abode of the Svara.🔽As if cleaving the egg of a bird, the embryo, he brought forth the kine from the mountain by his own power.

original: aśnāpinaddham madhu pary apaśyan matsyaṃ na dīna udani kṣiyantam /
analyzed: aśnā apinaddham madhu pari apaśyat matsyam na dīne udani kṣiyantam
translated: They saw the honey wrapped in the skin, as a fish lying in the deep.

original: niṣ ṭaj jabhāra camasaṃ na vṛkṣād bṛhaspatir viraveṇā vikṛtya //
analyzed: niḥ tat jabhāra camasam na vṛkṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ viraveṇa vikṛtya
translated: Brihaspati, having rent it with his cry, brought it forth as one brings a vessel down from a tree.

original: soṣām avindat sa svaḥ so agniṃ so arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi /
analyzed: sa uṣām avindat sa svar saḥ agnim saḥ arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi
translated: He found the light, he found the heaven, he with the sun dispelled the darkness.

original: bṛhaspatir govapuṣo valasya nir majjānaṃ na parvaṇo jabhāra //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ go vapuṣaḥ valasya niḥ majjānam na parvaṇaḥ jabhāra
translated: Brihaspati brought forth the marrow of Vala, as one brings forth the joint of a cow.

original: himeva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinākṛpayad valo gāḥ /
analyzed: himā iva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinā akṛpayat valaḥ gāḥ
translated: As the frost destroys the leaves of the trees, so Brihaspati, out of compassion, destroyed the cattle of Vala.

original: anānukṛtyam apunaś cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mitha uccarātaḥ //🔽abhi śyāvaṃ na kṛśanebhir aśvaṃ nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaro dyām apiṃśan /
analyzed: anānukṛtyam apunar cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithas uccarātaḥ  abhi śyāvam na kṛśanebhiḥ aśvam nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaraḥ dyām apiṃśan
translated: He made it so that it should not be repeated, and the sun and moon go forth together.🔽The fathers have filled the sky with the stars, as with needles, the dark horse with the lean ones.

original: rātryāṃ tamo adadhur jyotir ahan bṛhaspatir bhinad adriṃ vidad gāḥ //
analyzed: rātryām tamaḥ adadhuḥ jyotiḥ ahan bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ
translated: They have put darkness in the night and light in the day. Brihaspati has cleft the rock and found the cattle.

original: idam akarma namo abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīr anv ānonavīti /
analyzed: idam akarma namaḥ abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīḥ anu ānonavīti
translated: This is the homage to the cloud, the work of him who follows the many.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ so aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhir no vayo dhāt //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ saḥ aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhiḥ naḥ vayaḥ dhāt
translated: May Brihaspati bestow upon us strength with cattle, with horses, with heroes, with men.

original: bhadrā agner vadhryaśvasya saṃdṛśo vāmī praṇītiḥ suraṇā upetayaḥ /
analyzed: bhadrāḥ agneḥ vadhryaśvasya saṃdṛśaḥ vāmī praṇītiḥ suraṇāḥ upetayaḥ
translated: The appearances of Agni, the son of Vadhryaṣva, are auspicious. His guidance is lovely, his offerings are well-ordered.

original: yad īṃ sumitrā viśo agra indhate ghṛtenāhuto jarate davidyutat //
analyzed: yat īm sumitrāḥ viśaḥ agre indhate ghṛtena āhutaḥ jarate davidyutat
translated: When the people kindle him as their good friend, offered with ghee, he shines, blazing.

original: ghṛtam agner vadhryaśvasya vardhanaṃ ghṛtam annaṃ ghṛtam v asya medanam /
analyzed: ghṛtam agneḥ vadhryaśvasya vardhanam ghṛtam annam ghṛtam u asya medanam
translated: Ghee is the strengthener of Agni, the son of Vadhryaṣva. Ghee is food. Ghee is his fatness.

original: ghṛtenāhuta urviyā vi paprathe sūrya iva rocate sarpirāsutiḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtena āhutaḥ urviyā vi paprathe sūryaḥ iva rocate sarpiḥ āsutiḥ
translated: Offered with ghee, he extends with his vastness. He shines like the sun, impelled by ghee.

original: yat te manur yad anīkaṃ sumitraḥ samīdhe agne tad idaṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: yat te manuḥ yat anīkam sumitraḥ samīdhe agne tat idam navīyaḥ
translated: The form and countenance which Manu and Sumitra have kindled in thee, O Agni, that is this new (form of thine).

original: sa revac choca sa giro juṣasva sa vājaṃ darṣi sa iha śravo dhāḥ //
analyzed: sa revat śoca sa giraḥ juṣasva sa vājam darṣi saḥ iha śravaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Be thou shining, accept the praises (of men), win thou the booty, and bestow glory here (on thy worshippers).

original: yaṃ tvā pūrvam īḷito vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe agne sa idaṃ juṣasva /
analyzed: yam tvā pūrvam īḍitaḥ vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe agne saḥ idam juṣasva
translated: The Agni whom Vadhryaṣva, when he was worshipped of old, has kindled, accept thou this (worship).

original: sa na stipā uta bhavā tanūpā dātraṃ rakṣasva yad idaṃ te asme //
analyzed: sa na stipāḥ uta bhava tanū pāḥ dātram rakṣasva yat idam te asme
translated: Be thou a guardian of our goods and chattels, and a protector of our bodies. Guard the gift which is here to us.

original: bhavā dyumnī vādhryaśvota gopā mā tvā tārīd abhimātir janānām /
analyzed: bhava dyumnī vādhryaśva uta gopāḥ mā tvā tārīt abhimātiḥ janānām
translated: Be thou glorious, O Vadhryaṣva, and a protector. Let not the hatred of men overcome thee.

original: śūra iva dhṛṣṇuś cyavanaḥ sumitraḥ pra nu vocaṃ vādhryaśvasya nāma //
analyzed: śūraḥ iva dhṛṣṇuḥ cyavanaḥ sumitraḥ pra nu vocam vādhryaśvasya nāma
translated: Like a bold hero, O thou that art hard to overthrow, and friendly to men, I will proclaim the name of Vadhryaṣva.

original: sam ajryā parvatyā vasūni dāsā vṛtrāṇy āryā jigetha /
analyzed: sam ajryā parvatyā vasūni dāsā vṛtrāṇi āryā jigetha
translated: Thou hast gained, O Agni, the wealth of the Parvatan people, and the Dasyus, and the Ârya, and the Vr̥itras.

original: śūra iva dhṛṣṇuś cyavano janānāṃ tvam agne pṛtanāyūṃr abhi ṣyāḥ //
analyzed: śūraḥ iva dhṛṣṇuḥ cyavanaḥ janānām tvam agne pṛtanāyūn abhi syāḥ
translated: Like a bold hero, O thou that art hard to overthrow, thou, O Agni, shalt conquer the people in the battle.

original: dīrghatantur bṛhadukṣāyam agniḥ sahasrastarīḥ śatanītha ṛbhvā /
analyzed: dīrgha tantuḥ bṛhat ukṣā ayam agniḥ sahasra starīḥ śata nīthaḥ ṛbhvā
translated: Agni, whose thread is long, whose milk is great, who hath a thousand shoots, who is the lord of a hundred fords, who is strong,

original: dyumān dyumatsu nṛbhir mṛjyamānaḥ sumitreṣu dīdayo devayatsu //
analyzed: dyumān dyumatsu nṛbhiḥ mṛjyamānaḥ sumitreṣu dīdayaḥ devayatsu
translated: Shining among the glorious men, being cleansed, shine among the friends of the pious.

original: tve dhenuḥ sudughā jātavedo 'saścateva samanā sabardhuk /
analyzed: tve dhenuḥ su dughā jātavedaḥ saścatā iva samanā sabarduh
translated: In thee, O all-knower, the milch cow, yielding good milk, is inexhaustible, like a never-failing spring.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhir dakṣiṇāvadbhir agne sumitrebhir idhyase devayadbhiḥ //
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ dakṣiṇāvadbhiḥ agne sumitrebhiḥ idhyase devayadbhiḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are kindled by men who bring gifts, by good friends, by those who seek the gods.

original: devāś cit te amṛtā jātavedo mahimānaṃ vādhryaśva pra vocan /
analyzed: devāḥ cit te amṛtāḥ jātavedaḥ mahimānam vādhryaśva pra vocan
translated: Even the immortal gods, O all-knower, O son of Vadhryaṣva, have proclaimed your greatness,

original: yat sampṛccham mānuṣīr viśa āyan tvaṃ nṛbhir ajayas tvāvṛdhebhiḥ //
analyzed: yat sampṛccham mānuṣīḥ viśaḥ āyan tvam nṛbhiḥ ajayaḥ tvāvṛdhebhiḥ
translated: When the human tribes came to you for counsel, you were victorious with the men who prospered through you.

original: piteva putram abibhar upasthe tvām agne vadhryaśvaḥ saparyan /
analyzed: pitā iva putram abibhar upasthe tvām agne vadhryaśvaḥ saparyan
translated: Like a father you carry the son in your lap, O Agni, Vadhryaṣva served you.

original: juṣāṇo asya samidhaṃ yaviṣṭhota pūrvāṃ avanor vrādhataś cit //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ asya samidham yaviṣṭha uta pūrvām avanoḥ vrādhataḥ cit
translated: Accepting his fuel, O youngest, even of the earlier and more powerful.

original: śaśvad agnir vadhryaśvasya śatrūn nṛbhir jigāya sutasomavadbhiḥ /
analyzed: śaśvat agniḥ vadhryaśvasya śatrūn nṛbhiḥ jigāya suta somavadbhiḥ
translated: Agni always conquered the enemies of Vadhryaṣva with the men who had good Soma.

original: samanaṃ cid adahaś citrabhāno 'va vrādhantam abhinad vṛdhaś cit //
analyzed: samanam cit adahaḥ citrabhāno vaḥ vrādhantam abhinat vṛdhaḥ cit
translated: You burned even the equal, O you of wondrous light, and you struck down even the more powerful.

original: ayam agnir vadhryaśvasya vṛtrahā sanakāt preddho namasopavākyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vadhryaśvasya vṛtra hā sanakāt preddhaḥ namasā upavākyaḥ
translated: This Agni of Vadhryaṣva is the slayer of Vrtra, kindled from ancient times, worthy of worship with homage.

original: sa no ajāmīṃr uta vā vijāmīn abhi tiṣṭha śardhato vādhryaśva //
analyzed: sa naḥ ajāmīn uta vā vijāmīn abhi tiṣṭha śardhataḥ vādhryaśva
translated: He, whether we are victorious or defeated, stand over against the rushing Vadhryaṣva.

original: imām me agne samidhaṃ juṣasveḷas pade prati haryā ghṛtācīm /
analyzed: imām me agne samidham juṣasva iḷaḥ pade prati harya ghṛtācīm
translated: Accept this my fuel, O Agni, in the place of the altar, carry the ladle full of ghee.

original: varṣman pṛthivyāḥ sudinatve ahnām ūrdhvo bhava sukrato devayajyā //
analyzed: varṣman pṛthivyāḥ su dina tve ahnām ūrdhvaḥ bhava su krato deva yajyā
translated: In the height of the earth, in the fair days, rise up, O wise one, for the worship of the gods.

original: ā devānām agrayāveha yātu narāśaṃso viśvarūpebhir aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: ā devānām agra yāvā iha yātu narāśaṃsaḥ viśva rūpebhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: Let Narāśaṁsa come hither with the foremost of the gods, with horses of all forms,

original: ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedho devebhyo devatamaḥ suṣūdat //
analyzed: ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedhaḥ devebhyaḥ devatamaḥ suṣūdat
translated: By the path of truth, with reverence, with sacrificial food, most divine, he has purified himself for the gods.

original: śaśvattamam īḷate dūtyāya haviṣmanto manuṣyāso agnim /🔽vahiṣṭhair aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathenā devān vakṣi ni ṣadeha hotā //
analyzed: śaśvattamam īḍate dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ manuṣyāsaḥ agnim  vahiṣṭhaiḥ aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena devān vakṣi ni sada iha hotā
translated: Men who offer oblations ever seek Agni as a messenger.🔽With your most distant horses, in a well-yoked chariot, carry the gods to their seat here, O priest.

original: vi prathatāṃ devajuṣṭaṃ tiraścā dīrghaṃ drāghmā surabhi bhūtv asme /
analyzed: vi prathatām deva juṣṭam tiraścā dīrgham drāghmā surabhi bhūtu asme
translated: Let the altar spread out, divine, across and long, becoming fragrant for us, O long-lasting one.

original: aheḷatā manasā deva barhir indrajyeṣṭhāṃ uśato yakṣi devān //
analyzed: a heḍatā manasā deva barhiḥ indra jyeṣṭhām uśataḥ yakṣi devān
translated: With a mind free from anger, O god, worship the gods who desire the sacrificial grass, with Indra as their chief.

original: divo vā sānu spṛśatā varīyaḥ pṛthivyā vā mātrayā vi śrayadhvam /
analyzed: divaḥ vā sānu spṛśata varīyaḥ pṛthivyāḥ vā mātrayā vi śrayadhvam
translated: Touch the highest peak of heaven, or spread out with the measure of the earth.

original: uśatīr dvāro mahinā mahadbhir devaṃ rathaṃ rathayur dhārayadhvam //🔽devī divo duhitarā suśilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ ni yonau /
analyzed: uśatīḥ dvāraḥ mahinā mahadbhiḥ devam ratham rathayuḥ dhārayadhvam  devī divaḥ duhitarā su śilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatām ni yonau
translated: O doors, which delight in the great, with the great, support the divine chariot, O chariot-yoke.🔽O divine daughters of heaven, of beautiful form, Dawn and Night, sit in your own place.

original: ā vāṃ devāsa uśatī uśanta urau sīdantu subhage upasthe //
analyzed: ā vām devāsaḥ uśatī uśantaḥ urau sīdantu subhage upasthe
translated: May the gods, who delight in you, O you who delight, sit in your lap, O you of good fortune.

original: ūrdhvo grāvā bṛhad agniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmāny aditer upasthe /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ grāvā bṛhat agniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmāni aditeḥ upasthe
translated: The stone is raised, the great Agni is kindled, in the dear abode of Aditi.

original: purohitāv ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarā draviṇam ā yajethām //
analyzed: purohitau ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarā draviṇam ā yajethām
translated: As chief priests at this sacrifice, you two wise ones should offer the best wealth.

original: tisro devīr barhir idaṃ varīya ā sīdata cakṛmā vaḥ syonam /
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ idam varīyaḥ ā sīdata cakṛma vaḥ syonam
translated: O three goddesses, sit on this most excellent sacred grass, we have made it pleasant for you.

original: manuṣvad yajñaṃ sudhitā havīṃṣīḷā devī ghṛtapadī juṣanta //
analyzed: manuṣvat yajñam sudhitā havīṃṣi iḷā devī ghṛtapadī juṣanta
translated: Accept the sacrifice like Manu's, the well-prepared oblations, O goddess Iḷā, whose feet are anointed with ghee.

original: deva tvaṣṭar yad dha cārutvam ānaḍ yad aṅgirasām abhavaḥ sacābhūḥ /
analyzed: deva tvaṣṭar yat ha cāru tvam ānaṭ yat aṅgirasām abhavaḥ sacābhūḥ
translated: O god Tvaṣṭar, whatever beauty you have added, whatever you have become in common with the Aṅgiras,

original: sa devānām pātha upa pra vidvāṃ uśan yakṣi draviṇodaḥ suratnaḥ //
analyzed: sa devānām pāthaḥ upa pra vidvān uśan yakṣi draviṇaḥ daḥ su ratnaḥ
translated: knowing that, as one who delights, be a giver of wealth and good things, O you who are skilled in the path of the gods.

original: vanaspate raśanayā niyūyā devānām pātha upa vakṣi vidvān /
analyzed: vanaspate raśanayā niyūyā devānām pāthaḥ upa vakṣi vidvān
translated: O lord of the forest, lead with the rope, knowing the path of the gods, lead them.

original: svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavad dhavīṃṣy avatāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī havam me //
analyzed: svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavat havīṃṣi avatām dyāvāpṛthivī havam me
translated: The god enjoys, may he make the oblations sweet, may heaven and earth protect my invocation.

original: āgne vaha varuṇam iṣṭaye na indraṃ divo maruto antarikṣāt /
analyzed: ā agne vaha varuṇam iṣṭaye naḥ indram divaḥ marutaḥ antarikṣāt
translated: O Agni, bring Varuṇa for our worship, Indra from heaven, the Maruts from the atmosphere.

original: sīdantu barhir viśva ā yajatrāḥ svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām //
analyzed: sīdantu barhiḥ viśve ā yajatrāḥ svāhā devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: May all the worthy ones sit on the sacred grass, may the immortal gods rejoice, svāhā!

original: bṛhaspate prathamaṃ vāco agraṃ yat prairata nāmadheyaṃ dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate prathamam vācaḥ agram yat prairata nāmadheyam dadhānāḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, the first, the beginning of speech, which they set in motion, bearing a name to be given,

original: yad eṣāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ yad aripram āsīt preṇā tad eṣāṃ nihitaṃ guhāviḥ //
analyzed: yat eṣām śreṣṭham yat aripram āsīt preṇā tat eṣām nihitam guhā āvis
translated: What is best among them, what is free from enemies, that is hidden in their innermost being through love.

original: saktum iva titaunā punanto yatra dhīrā manasā vācam akrata /
analyzed: saktum iva titaunā punantaḥ yatra dhīrāḥ manasā vācam akrata
translated: Purifying like flour with a sieve, where the wise have uttered speech with their mind,

original: atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadraiṣāṃ lakṣmīr nihitādhi vāci //
analyzed: atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadrā eṣām lakṣmīḥ nihitā adhi vāci
translated: Here friends know their friendships. Their auspicious glory is hidden in speech.

original: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyam āyan tām anv avindann ṛṣiṣu praviṣṭām /
analyzed: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyam āyan tām anu avindan ṛṣiṣu praviṣṭām
translated: By sacrifice they have attained the path of speech. They have found it, which had entered the seers.

original: tām ābhṛtyā vy adadhuḥ purutrā tāṃ sapta rebhā abhi saṃ navante //
analyzed: tām ābhṛtyāḥ vi adadhuḥ purutrā tām sapta rebhāḥ abhi sam navante
translated: Having brought it, they have placed it in many places. The seven sages sing over it.

original: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācam uta tvaḥ śṛṇvan na śṛṇoty enām /
analyzed: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācam uta tvaḥ śṛṇvan na śṛṇoti enām
translated: And you, seeing, do not see speech. And you, hearing, do not hear it.

original: uto tvasmai tanvaṃ vi sasre jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ //
analyzed: uta u tvasmai tanvam vi sasre jāyā iva patye uśatī su vāsāḥ
translated: And for him, it has extended its body, like a loving wife in beautiful garments for her husband.

original: uta tvaṃ sakhye sthirapītam āhur nainaṃ hinvanty api vājineṣu /
analyzed: uta tvam sakhye sthira pītam āhuḥ na enam hinvanti api vājineṣu
translated: And they say to you, O steadfast one, in friendship, they do not urge him even in the races.

original: adhenvā carati māyayaiṣa vācaṃ śuśruvāṃ aphalām apuṣpām //
analyzed: a dhenvā carati māyayā eṣa vācam śuśruvām aphalām apuṣpām
translated: He moves with a cow by his magic power. He has heard speech without fruit, without flowers.

original: yas tityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācy api bhāgo asti /
analyzed: yaḥ tityāja sacividam sakhāyam na tasya vāci api bhāgaḥ asti
translated: He who abandons a faithful friend, for him there is not even a share in speech.

original: yad īṃ śṛṇoty alakaṃ śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasya panthām //
analyzed: yat īm śṛṇoti alakam śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasya panthām
translated: When he hears it, he hears nonsense. For he does not know the path of good deeds.

original: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyo manojaveṣv asamā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyaḥ manaḥ javeṣu asamāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The friends, with arms and ears, have become unequal in the speed of thought.

original: ādaghnāsa upakakṣāsa u tve hradā iva snātvā u tve dadṛśre //
analyzed: ādaghnāsaḥ upakakṣāsaḥ u tve hradāḥ iva snātvā u tve dadṛśre
translated: They have seen you, O Agni, up to the armpits, as if in lakes.

original: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manaso javeṣu yad brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajante sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manasaḥ javeṣu yat brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajante sakhāyaḥ
translated: When the friends, the Brahmins, perform the sacrifice in the swift movements of the mind, fashioned by the heart.

original: atrāha tvaṃ vi jahur vedyābhir ohabrahmāṇo vi caranty u tve //
analyzed: atra aha tvam vi jahuḥ vedyābhiḥ oha brahmāṇaḥ vi caranti u tve
translated: Here, O Agni, they have abandoned you with the sacrificial offerings. The Brahmins move about in you.

original: ime ye nārvāṅ na paraś caranti na brāhmaṇāso na sutekarāsaḥ /
analyzed: ime ye na arvāk na paras caranti na brāhmaṇāsaḥ na sutekarāsaḥ
translated: These who do not move either this side or the other, who are not Brahmins, who do not perform Soma sacrifices,

original: ta ete vācam abhipadya pāpayā sirīs tantraṃ tanvate aprajajñayaḥ //
analyzed: te ete vācam abhipadya pāpayā sirīḥ tantram tanvate aprajajñayaḥ
translated: They, having seized evil speech, weave a web, not knowing the offspring.

original: sarve nandanti yaśasāgatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ /🔽kilbiṣaspṛt pituṣaṇir hy eṣām araṃ hito bhavati vājināya //
analyzed: sarve nandanti yaśasā āgatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ  kilbiṣa spṛt pituṣaṇiḥ hi eṣām aram hitaḥ bhavati vājināya
translated: The friends rejoice in the fame that has come, in the victory in the assembly, in the friend.🔽For they have the remover of sin, the purifier of the father, who is set free, ready for the prize.

original: ṛcāṃ tvaḥ poṣam āste pupuṣvān gāyatraṃ tvo gāyati śakvarīṣu /
analyzed: ṛcām tvaḥ poṣam āste pupuṣvān gāyatram tvaḥ gāyati śakvarīṣu
translated: The nourisher dwells in the nourishment of the Ṛc verses, the Gāyatrī praises you among the Śakvarī verses.

original: brahmā tvo vadati jātavidyāṃ yajñasya mātrāṃ vi mimīta u tvaḥ //
analyzed: brahmā tvaḥ vadati jāta vidyām yajñasya mātrām vi mimīte u tvaḥ
translated: The Brahmin declares to you the knowledge of the born, he measures out the extent of the sacrifice for you.

original: devānāṃ nu vayaṃ jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā /
analyzed: devānām nu vayam jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā
translated: We will proclaim to the gods your knowledge by the most excellent.

original: uktheṣu śasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyād uttare yuge //
analyzed: uktheṣu śasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāt uttare yuge
translated: He who sees in the hymns being recited in the northern age,

original: brahmaṇas patir etā saṃ karmāra ivādhamat /🔽devānām pūrvye yuge 'sataḥ sad ajāyata //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ etā sam karmāraḥ iva adhamat  devānām pūrvye yuge sataḥ sat ajāyata
translated: Brahman's lord has fashioned this, like a smith,🔽From non-being being was born in the ancient age of the gods.

original: devānāṃ yuge prathame 'sataḥ sad ajāyata /
analyzed: devānām yuge prathame sataḥ sat ajāyata
translated: From non-being being was born in the first age of the gods.

original: tad āśā anv ajāyanta tad uttānapadas pari //
analyzed: tat āśāḥ anu ajāyanta tat uttāna padaḥ pari
translated: The hopes were born after that, and Uttapada surrounded it.

original: bhūr jajña uttānapado bhuva āśā ajāyanta /🔽aditer dakṣo ajāyata dakṣād v aditiḥ pari //
analyzed: bhūḥ jajñe uttānapadaḥ bhuvaḥ āśāḥ ajāyanta  aditeḥ dakṣaḥ ajāyata dakṣāt u aditiḥ pari
translated: Bhū was born, Uttapada, the hopes were born.🔽From Aditi Dakṣa was born, from Dakṣa Aditi was born again.

original: aditir hy ajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava /
analyzed: aditiḥ hi ajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava
translated: For Aditi was born, O Dakṣa, as your daughter.

original: tāṃ devā anv ajāyanta bhadrā amṛtabandhavaḥ //
analyzed: tām devāḥ anu ajāyanta bhadrāḥ amṛta bandhavaḥ
translated: The gods were born after her, the auspicious ones, the companions of the immortal.

original: yad devā adaḥ salile susaṃrabdhā atiṣṭhata /
analyzed: yat devāḥ adaḥ salile su saṃrabdhāḥ atiṣṭhata
translated: When the gods stood in the waters here, very angry,

original: atrā vo nṛtyatām iva tīvro reṇur apāyata //
analyzed: atrā vaḥ nṛtyatām iva tīvraḥ reṇuḥ apāyata
translated: Here the fierce dust was removed, as if from those dancing.

original: yad devā yatayo yathā bhuvanāny apinvata /
analyzed: yat devāḥ yatayaḥ yathā bhuvanāni apinvata
translated: When the gods, like ascetics, expanded the worlds,

original: atrā samudra ā gūḷham ā sūryam ajabhartana //
analyzed: atrā samudre ā gūḍham ā sūryam ajabhartana
translated: Here they brought forth the hidden sun from the ocean.

original: aṣṭau putrāso aditer ye jātās tanvas pari /
analyzed: aṣṭau putrāsaḥ aditeḥ ye jātāḥ tanvaḥ pari
translated: The eight sons of Aditi, who were born around her body,

original: devāṃ upa prait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍam āsyat //
analyzed: devān upa prait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍam āsyat
translated: With the seven went to the gods, and the eighth he pierced Mārtāṇḍa.

original: saptabhiḥ putrair aditir upa prait pūrvyaṃ yugam /
analyzed: saptabhiḥ putraiḥ aditiḥ upa prait pūrvyam yugam
translated: Aditi with her seven sons went to the ancient age,

original: prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punar mārtāṇḍam ābharat //
analyzed: prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punar mārtāṇḍam ābharat
translated: For the sake of offspring, from you, O Death, she brought back the sun.

original: janiṣṭhā ugraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭho bahulābhimānaḥ /
analyzed: janiṣṭhāḥ ugraḥ sahase turāya mandraḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ bahula abhimānaḥ
translated: The fierce one was born for strength, for the swift one, the most delightful, most powerful, with abundant pride.

original: avardhann indram marutaś cid atra mātā yad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā //
analyzed: avardhan indram marutaḥ cit atra mātā yat vīram dadhanat dhaniṣṭhā
translated: The Maruts here increased Indra, when the mother, the most bountiful, nourished the hero.

original: druho niṣattā pṛśanī cid evaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuṣ ṭa indram /
analyzed: druhaḥ niṣattā pṛśanī cit evaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuḥ ṭe indram
translated: Even the deceitful one, the deceitful one, with many praises, increased Indra.

original: abhīvṛteva tā mahāpadena dhvāntāt prapitvād ud aranta garbhāḥ //
analyzed: abhīvṛtā iva tāḥ mahā padena dhvāntāt prapitvāt ud aranta garbhāḥ
translated: As if covered by a great calamity, the embryos came forth from the darkness of the womb.

original: ṛṣvā te pādā pra yaj jigāsy avardhan vājā uta ye cid atra /
analyzed: ṛṣvā te pādā pra yat jigāsi avardhan vājāḥ uta ye cit atra
translated: Your lofty feet, when you were about to sacrifice, increased, and also the powers that are here.

original: tvam indra sālāvṛkān sahasram āsan dadhiṣe aśvinā vavṛtyāḥ //
analyzed: tvam indra sālāvṛkān sahasram āsan dadhiṣe aśvinā vavṛtyāḥ
translated: You, O Indra, have placed a thousand wolves in your mouth. The Ashvins turned away from you.

original: samanā tūrṇir upa yāsi yajñam ā nāsatyā sakhyāya vakṣi /
analyzed: samanā tūrṇiḥ upa yāsi yajñam ā nāsatyā sakhyāya vakṣi
translated: With a swift chariot you come to the sacrifice. You bring the Nāsatyas to friendship.

original: vasāvyām indra dhārayaḥ sahasrāśvinā śūra dadatur maghāni //
analyzed: vasāvyām indra dhārayaḥ sahasrā aśvinā śūra dadatuḥ maghāni
translated: O Indra, you support the thousand Vasavya sons. The Ashvins, O hero, have given great gifts.

original: mandamāna ṛtād adhi prajāyai sakhibhir indra iṣirebhir artham /
analyzed: mandamānaḥ ṛtāt adhi prajāyai sakhibhiḥ indraḥ iṣirebhiḥ artham
translated: The one who is delighted, above truth, for offspring, with friends who strive, Indra seeks wealth.

original: ābhir hi māyā upa dasyum āgān mihaḥ pra tamrā avapat tamāṃsi //
analyzed: ābhiḥ hi māyāḥ upa dasyum āgāt mihaḥ pra tamrāḥ avapat tamāṃsi
translated: For by these illusions he came to the Dasyu, and the dark mists have cast down the darkness.

original: sanāmānā cid dhvasayo ny asmā avāhann indra uṣaso yathānaḥ /🔽ṛṣvair agacchaḥ sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ sākam pratiṣṭhā hṛdyā jaghantha //
analyzed: sanāmānā cit dhvasayaḥ ni asmai avāhan indraḥ uṣasaḥ yathā anaḥ  ṛṣvaiḥ agacchaḥ sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ sākam pratiṣṭhāḥ hṛdyāḥ jaghantha
translated: Even the named he has struck down for us, Indra, as a foe to the dawns.🔽With the lofty, desirable friends thou hast come, and with the dear abodes thou hast smitten him.

original: tvaṃ jaghantha namucim makhasyuṃ dāsaṃ kṛṇvāna ṛṣaye vimāyam /
analyzed: tvam jaghantha namucim makhasyum dāsam kṛṇvānaḥ ṛṣaye vimāyam
translated: Thou hast smitten Namuci the sacrificer, making the Dāsa a slave for the Ṛṣi to rule.

original: tvaṃ cakartha manave syonān patho devatrāñjaseva yānān //
analyzed: tvam cakartha manave syonān pathaḥ devatrā añjasā iva yānān
translated: Thou hast made the paths easy for Manu to travel, as one who is skilled in the ways of the gods.

original: tvam etāni papriṣe vi nāmeśāna indra dadhiṣe gabhastau /
analyzed: tvam etāni papriṣe vi nāma īśānaḥ indra dadhiṣe gabhastau
translated: Thou hast spread out these (paths), O Indra, thou art the lord, thou holdest the two arms.

original: anu tvā devāḥ śavasā madanty uparibudhnān vaninaś cakartha //
analyzed: anu tvā devāḥ śavasā madanti uparibudhnān vaninaḥ cakartha
translated: The gods rejoice in thee for thy strength; thou hast made the trees to be above the ground.

original: cakraṃ yad asyāpsv ā niṣattam uto tad asmai madhv ic cacchadyāt /
analyzed: cakram yat asya apsu ā niṣattam uta u tat asmai madhu id cacchadyāt
translated: What wheel of his is set in the waters, may that also be sweet for him to look on.

original: pṛthivyām atiṣitaṃ yad ūdhaḥ payo goṣv adadhā oṣadhīṣu //
analyzed: pṛthivyām atiṣitam yat ūdhaḥ payaḥ goṣu adadhāḥ oṣadhīṣu
translated: The milk that is set upon the earth, the udder, thou hast placed in the cows, in the plants.

original: aśvād iyāyeti yad vadanty ojaso jātam uta manya enam /
analyzed: aśvāt iyāya iti yat vadanti ojasaḥ jātam uta manye enam
translated: When they say, 'He has gone from the horse,' they think that he is born from strength.

original: manyor iyāya harmyeṣu tasthau yataḥ prajajña indro asya veda //
analyzed: manyoḥ iyāya harmyeṣu tasthau yatas prajajñe indraḥ asya veda
translated: He has gone from the mind, he has stood in the chambers of the mind; from there Indra was born, he knows him.

original: vayaḥ suparṇā upa sedur indram priyamedhā ṛṣayo nādhamānāḥ /
analyzed: vayaḥ suparṇāḥ upa seduḥ indram priyamedhāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nādhamānāḥ
translated: The well-winged Rṣis, the singers of sweet hymns, have sat down near Indra, the bountiful.

original: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣur mumugdhy asmān nidhayeva baddhān //
analyzed: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣuḥ mumugdhi asmān nidhayā iva baddhān
translated: Drive away the darkness, make our eyes to see, deliver us as 'twere from bonds that hold us fast.

original: vasūnāṃ vā carkṛṣa iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñair vā rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: vasūnām vā carkṛṣe iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñaiḥ vā rodasyoḥ
translated: We seek to win the favour of the Vasus, or by our thought or by our sacrifice.

original: arvanto vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanuṃ vā ye suśruṇaṃ suśruto dhuḥ //🔽hava eṣām asuro nakṣata dyāṃ śravasyatā manasā niṃsata kṣām /
analyzed: arvantaḥ vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanum vā ye suśruṇam su śrutaḥ dhuḥ  have eṣām asuraḥ nakṣata dyām śravasyatā manasā niṃsata kṣām
translated: Or those swift ones who have the wealth of riches, or those who have won the well-praised prize in the race.🔽The Asura hath called to the heaven this call of theirs: with a heart that longs for glory they have seized the earth.

original: cakṣāṇā yatra suvitāya devā dyaur na vārebhiḥ kṛṇavanta svaiḥ //
analyzed: cakṣāṇāḥ yatra suvitāya devāḥ dyauḥ na vārebhiḥ kṛṇavanta svaiḥ
translated: Where the Gods look for bliss, as heaven with its own ordinances ordains it.

original: iyam eṣām amṛtānāṃ gīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam /
analyzed: iyam eṣām amṛtānām gīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam
translated: This is the song of these immortal ones, of all those who distribute the treasure.

original: dhiyaṃ ca yajñaṃ ca sādhantas te no dhāntu vasavyam asāmi //
analyzed: dhiyam ca yajñam ca sādhantaḥ te naḥ dhāntu vasavyam asāmi
translated: They who perfect thought and sacrifice: may they bestow on us the treasure of wealth.

original: ā tat ta indrāyavaḥ panantābhi ya ūrvaṃ gomantaṃ titṛtsān /
analyzed: ā tat te indra āyavaḥ pananta abhi yaḥ ūrvam gomantam titṛtsān
translated: Let these thy friends, O Indra, rejoice in the ample pasture which they long to enter,

original: sakṛtsvaṃ ye puruputrām mahīṃ sahasradhārām bṛhatīṃ dudukṣan //
analyzed: sakṛtsvam ye puru putrām mahīm sahasra dhārām bṛhatīm dudukṣan
translated: Where they have milked the great cow, the mother of many sons, the bountiful, the thousand-teatcd.

original: śacīva indram avase kṛṇudhvam anānataṃ damayantam pṛtanyūn /
analyzed: śacīvas indram avase kṛṇudhvam an ānatam damayantam pṛtanyūn
translated: Make Indra strong for help, him who is never overcome, the conqueror of his enemies.

original: ṛbhukṣaṇam maghavānaṃ suvṛktim bhartā yo vajraṃ naryam purukṣuḥ //
analyzed: ṛbhukṣaṇam maghavānam suvṛktim bhartā yaḥ vajram naryam purukṣuḥ
translated: The lord of great wealth, the bountiful one, the one who holds the manly thunderbolt.

original: yad vāvāna purutamam purāṣāḷ ā vṛtrahendro nāmāny aprāḥ /
analyzed: yat vāvāna purutamam purāṣāh ā vṛtra hā indraḥ nāmāni aprāḥ
translated: The many names of Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, which he obtained in ancient times, the most ancient of all.

original: aceti prāsahas patis tuviṣmān yad īm uśmasi kartave karat tat //
analyzed: aceti prāsahaḥ patiḥ tuviṣmān yat īm uśmasi kartave karat tat
translated: The powerful lord of the thunderbolt moves, he who is to be invoked by us, let him do that which we desire.

original: pra su va āpo mahimānam uttamaṃ kārur vocāti sadane vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: pra su vaḥ āpaḥ mahimānam uttamam kāruḥ vocāti sadane vivasvataḥ
translated: The waters have proclaimed your highest greatness in the abode of Vivasvat.

original: pra saptasapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ pra sṛtvarīṇām ati sindhur ojasā //
analyzed: pra sapta sapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ pra sṛtvarīṇām ati sindhuḥ ojasā
translated: The seven times seven have moved in three directions, the river Sindhu has passed over the swift-flowing ones with her might.

original: pra te 'radad varuṇo yātave pathaḥ sindho yad vājāṃ abhy adravas tvam /
analyzed: pra te radat varuṇaḥ yātave pathaḥ sindho yat vājām abhī adravaḥ tvam
translated: Varuna has plowed furrows for you to travel, O river, when you rush upon the prize.

original: bhūmyā adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yad eṣām agraṃ jagatām irajyasi //🔽divi svano yatate bhūmyopary anantaṃ śuṣmam ud iyarti bhānunā /
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yat eṣām agram jagatām irajyasi  divi svanaḥ yatate bhūmyā upari anantam śuṣmam ud iyarti bhānunā
translated: You go with your wave over the earth's surface, when you rule over the foremost of these moving ones.🔽The sound in the sky stretches out over the earth, the infinite strength rises up with the light.

original: abhrād iva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhur yad eti vṛṣabho na roruvat //
analyzed: abhrāt iva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuḥ yat eti vṛṣabhaḥ na roruvat
translated: The rains roar like from a cloud, when the river Sindhu moves like a bull roaring.

original: abhi tvā sindho śiśum in na mātaro vāśrā arṣanti payaseva dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā sindho śiśum id na mātaraḥ vāśrāḥ arṣanti payasā iva dhenavaḥ
translated: O Sindhu, the mother-like waters flow to you, the child, like milch cows with milk.

original: rājeva yudhvā nayasi tvam it sicau yad āsām agram pravatām inakṣasi //
analyzed: rājā iva yudhvā nayasi tvam id sicau yat āsām agram pravatām inakṣasi
translated: Like a king, O warrior, thou leadest these two streams, when thou approachest the beginning of these currents.

original: imam me gaṅge yamune sarasvati śutudri stomaṃ sacatā paruṣṇy ā /
analyzed: imam me gaṅge yamune sarasvati śutudri stomam sacata paruṣṇi ā
translated: O Ganga, Yamuna, Sarasvati, Suturidri, accept this praise of mine, together with Parushni,

original: asiknyā marudvṛdhe vitastayārjīkīye śṛṇuhy ā suṣomayā //
analyzed: asiknyā marut vṛdhe vitastayā ārjīkīye śṛṇuhi ā suṣomayā
translated: Assikni, Marudvrddha, Vitasta, Arjikiya, listen to it with Susomya.

original: tṛṣṭāmayā prathamaṃ yātave sajūḥ susartvā rasayā śvetyā tyā /🔽tvaṃ sindho kubhayā gomatīṃ krumum mehatnvā sarathaṃ yābhir īyase //
analyzed: tṛṣṭā āmayā prathamam yātave sajūs su sartvā rasayā śvetyā tyā  tvam sindho kubhayā gomatīm krumum mehatnvā sa ratham yābhiḥ īyase
translated: With Trista, may you go first to be praised together, with Susarman, with Rasa, with Sveti,🔽O Sindhu, with Kubhaya, with Gomati, with Krumuh, with Mehatnu, with those with whom you go on your chariot.

original: ṛjīty enī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi /
analyzed: ṛjītī enī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi
translated: The dark-hued one with great power carries the dust-clouds around,

original: adabdhā sindhur apasām apastamāśvā na citrā vapuṣīva darśatā //
analyzed: adabdhā sindhuḥ apasām apastamā aśvā na citrā vapuṣi iva darśatā
translated: The undeceiving Sindhu, best of waters, like beautiful horses, is seen with a lovely form.

original: svaśvā sindhuḥ surathā suvāsā hiraṇyayī sukṛtā vājinīvatī /
analyzed: su aśvā sindhuḥ su rathā su vāsāḥ hiraṇyayī su kṛtā vājinīvatī
translated: Sindhu has good horses, a good chariot, good garments, is golden, well-made, rich in strength,

original: ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvaty utādhi vaste subhagā madhuvṛdham //
analyzed: ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvatī uta adhi vaste subhagā madhu vṛdham
translated: Has wool, is a young maiden, has good conduct, and wears a garment that is auspicious and increases sweetness.

original: sukhaṃ rathaṃ yuyuje sindhur aśvinaṃ tena vājaṃ saniṣad asminn ājau /
analyzed: sukham ratham yuyuje sindhuḥ aśvinam tena vājam saniṣat asmin ājau
translated: Sindhu has yoked a pleasant chariot with horses, by which he gains strength in this battle.

original: mahān hy asya mahimā panasyate 'dabdhasya svayaśaso virapśinaḥ //
analyzed: mahān hi asya mahimā panasyate dabdhasya sva yaśasaḥ virapśinaḥ
translated: For his greatness is praised, of the undeceiving one, of the one with his own fame, of the one with a beautiful tail.

original: ā va ṛñjasa ūrjāṃ vyuṣṭiṣv indram maruto rodasī anaktana /
analyzed: ā vaḥ ṛñjasaḥ ūrjām vyuṣṭiṣu indram marutaḥ rodasī anaktana
translated: At the rising of the sun, O ye who are to be implored for strength, anoint Indra, O Maruts, and the two world-halves.

original: ubhe yathā no ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥsado varivasyāta udbhidā //🔽tad u śreṣṭhaṃ savanaṃ sunotanātyo na hastayato adriḥ sotari /
analyzed: ubhe yathā naḥ ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥsadaḥ varivasyātaḥ udbhidā  tat u śreṣṭham savanam sunotana atyaḥ na hasta yataḥ adriḥ sotari
translated: That both days may be propitious to us, coming together, may he favour us in every place, rising up.🔽This is the best libation which ye must press, which is like a stone to be thrown by the hand, to be thrown by the stone-thrower.

original: vidad dhy aryo abhibhūti pauṃsyam maho rāye cit tarute yad arvataḥ //
analyzed: vidat hi aryaḥ abhibhūti pauṃsyam mahaḥ rāye cit tarute yat arvataḥ
translated: For the noble one knows the power of man, that he may give great wealth, even if the horse is slow.

original: tad id dhy asya savanaṃ viver apo yathā purā manave gātum aśret /🔽goarṇasi tvāṣṭre aśvanirṇiji prem adhvareṣv adhvarāṃ aśiśrayuḥ //
analyzed: tat id hi asya savanam viveḥ apaḥ yathā purā manave gātum aśret  go arṇasi tvāṣṭre aśva nirṇiji pra īm adhvareṣu adhvarān aśiśrayuḥ
translated: For this is his libation which he has opened, as he has made a way for Manu in the past.🔽In the contest for cows, for Tvastr, for the winning of horses, they have set him in the sacrifices as the one to be served in the sacrifices.

original: apa hata rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvata skabhāyata nirṛtiṃ sedhatāmatim /
analyzed: apa hata rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ skabhāyata nirṛtim sedhata amatim
translated: Drive away the Raksases, O ye whose course is crooked; break down Nirrti; ward off misfortune.

original: ā no rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ sunotana devāvyam bharata ślokam adrayaḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim sarva vīram sunotana devāvyam bharata ślokam adrayaḥ
translated: Press out for us wealth with all heroes; bring the hymn of praise to the gods, O ye rich ones.

original: divaś cid ā vo 'mavattarebhyo vibhvanā cid āśvapastarebhyaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ cit ā vaḥ mavattarebhyaḥ vibhvanā cit āśu apastarebhyaḥ
translated: Even from the lowest of you who are higher than the low, from those who are most widely ruling,

original: vāyoś cid ā somarabhastarebhyo 'gneś cid arca pitukṛttarebhyaḥ //
analyzed: vāyoḥ cit ā soma rabhastarebhyaḥ gneḥ cit arca pitukṛttarebhyaḥ
translated: from those who are most closely connected with Vayu, from those who are most closely connected with the flame of Agni, the father-cutter.

original: bhurantu no yaśasaḥ sotv andhaso grāvāṇo vācā divitā divitmatā /
analyzed: bhurantu naḥ yaśasaḥ sotu andhasaḥ grāvāṇaḥ vācā divitā divitmatā
translated: Let our famous pressing-stones, with song, O juice, move for us in the heaven, O heavenly ones,

original: naro yatra duhate kāmyam madhv āghoṣayanto abhito mithasturaḥ //
analyzed: naraḥ yatra duhate kāmyam madhu āghoṣayantaḥ abhitas mithasturaḥ
translated: Where the men milk the desirable meath, crying aloud, eager on every side, one to another.

original: sunvanti somaṃ rathirāso adrayo nir asya rasaṃ gaviṣo duhanti te /
analyzed: sunvanti somam rathirāsaḥ adrayaḥ niḥ asya rasam gaviṣaḥ duhanti te
translated: The car-borne stones press out the Soma; they milk his juice, his sap, for the cow.

original: duhanty ūdhar upasecanāya kaṃ naro havyā na marjayanta āsabhiḥ //
analyzed: duhanti ūdhar upasecanāya kam naraḥ havyā na marjayante āsabhiḥ
translated: They milk the udder for the sprinkling; the men make ready the oblations with the steed.

original: ete naraḥ svapaso abhūtana ya indrāya sunutha somam adrayaḥ /
analyzed: ete naraḥ su apasaḥ abhūtana ye indrāya sunutha somam adrayaḥ
translated: These men, O ye who are wise, have come to life, who, O ye stones, press out the Soma for Indra.

original: vāmaṃvāmaṃ vo divyāya dhāmne vasuvasu vaḥ pārthivāya sunvate //🔽abhrapruṣo na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmanto na yajñā vijānuṣaḥ /
analyzed: vāmam vāmam vaḥ divyāya dhāmne vasu vasu vaḥ pārthivāya sunvate  abhrapruṣaḥ na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmantaḥ na yajñāḥ vijānuṣaḥ
translated: For your heavenly abode, for your earthly pressing, you pour out the sweet, the sweet, you pour out the good, the good.🔽Like rain-charged clouds with their rain, with their voice, you pour out the good, like sacrifices with oblations, you who understand.

original: sumārutaṃ na brahmāṇam arhase gaṇam astoṣy eṣāṃ na śobhase //
analyzed: su mārutam na brahmāṇam arhase gaṇam astoṣi eṣām na śobhase
translated: You are worthy of the Maruts' good praise, of the Brahmans' company; you are to be extolled, you shine among these.

original: śriye maryāso añjīṃr akṛṇvata sumārutaṃ na pūrvīr ati kṣapaḥ /
analyzed: śriye maryāsaḥ añjīṃr akṛṇvata su mārutam na pūrvīḥ ati kṣapaḥ
translated: For glory the Maruts have made their own the beautiful forms; they have made the good many times their own, O Maruts, through the night.

original: divas putrāsa etā na yetira ādityāsas te akrā na vāvṛdhuḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ putrāsaḥ etāḥ na yetire ādityāsaḥ te akrāḥ na vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: The sons of Dyaus, these who have not been overcome, the Adityas, have not grown like those who have been overcome.

original: pra ye divaḥ pṛthivyā na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrān na sūryaḥ /
analyzed: pra ye divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrāt na sūryaḥ
translated: They who are greater than heaven and earth by their own greatness, have spread themselves like the cloud and the sun.

original: pājasvanto na vīrāḥ panasyavo riśādaso na maryā abhidyavaḥ //🔽yuṣmākam budhne apāṃ na yāmani vithuryati na mahī śratharyati /🔽viśvapsur yajño arvāg ayaṃ su vaḥ prayasvanto na satrāca ā gata //🔽yūyaṃ dhūrṣu prayujo na raśmibhir jyotiṣmanto na bhāsā vyuṣṭiṣu /🔽śyenāso na svayaśaso riśādasaḥ pravāso na prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ //🔽pra yad vahadhve marutaḥ parākād yūyam mahaḥ saṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ /🔽vidānāso vasavo rādhyasyārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyota //
analyzed: pājasvantaḥ na vīrāḥ panasyavaḥ riśādasaḥ na maryāḥ abhidyavaḥ  yuṣmākam budhne apām na yāmani vithuryati na mahī śratharyati  viśvapsuḥ yajñaḥ arvāk ayam su vaḥ prayasvantaḥ na satrācaḥ ā gata  yūyam dhūrṣu prayujaḥ na raśmibhiḥ jyotiṣmantaḥ na bhāsā vyuṣṭiṣu  śyenāsaḥ na sva yaśasaḥ riśādasaḥ pravāsaḥ na prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ  pra yat vahadhve marutaḥ parākāt yūyam mahaḥ saṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ  vidānāsaḥ vasavaḥ rādhyasya ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyota
translated: Like heroes, O ye Maruts, with your wealth of kine, your own, your bounteous, foe-destroying, irresistible.🔽On your wide lap, O ye who travel in the car, the weakling is not crushed, nor is the great one rent.🔽The sacrifice, all-conquering, is here for you. Come, ye who are rich in food, to our solemn rites.🔽Ye who are harnessed to the poles, as reins to horses, ye who are radiant with light in the dawns,🔽Ye who are like hawks, famous, foe-destroyers, ye who are swift, well-oiled, in your journeys.🔽When ye, O Maruts, come from afar, ye who are the possessors of great wealth of Samvaraṇa,🔽Ye who are finders, O ye Vasus, of what is to be accomplished, drive away even from afar the hatred of the foe.

original: ya udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhā marudbhyo na mānuṣo dadāśat /🔽revat sa vayo dadhate suvīraṃ sa devānām api gopīthe astu //🔽te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmā ādityena nāmnā śambhaviṣṭhāḥ /🔽te no 'vantu rathatūr manīṣām mahaś ca yāmann adhvare cakānāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhāḥ marudbhyaḥ na mānuṣaḥ dadāśat 🔽revat sa vayaḥ dadhate su vīram sa devānām api gopīthe astu 🔽te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsaḥ ūmāḥ ādityena nāmnā śambhaviṣṭhāḥ 🔽te naḥ vantu manīṣām mahaḥ ca yāman adhvare cakānāḥ
translated: Like heroes, O ye Maruts, with your own strength, like birds with your wings, like bulls with your horns, like waters with your waves, like the wind with your speed, like the mountains with your firmness, like the clouds with your rain, like the sun with your light, like the all-seeing eye, like the all-hearing ear, like the all-knowing mind, like the all-supporting earth, like the all-supporting heaven, like the all-supporting waters, like the all-supporting plants, like the all-supporting trees, like the all-supporting mountains, like the all-supporting air, like the all-supporting sky, like the all-supporting quarters, like the all-supporting world, like the all-supporting creation, like the all-supporting time, like the all-supporting destiny, like the all-supporting truth, like the all-supporting law, like the all-supporting virtue, like the all-supporting knowledge, like the all-supporting bliss, like the all-supporting Brahman, like the all-supporting Atman, like the all-supporting universe, like the all-supporting God, like the all-supporting Supreme Spirit, like the all-supporting Absolute, like the all-supporting Infinity, like the all-supporting Eternity, like the all-supporting Bliss, like the all-supporting Brahman, like the all-supporting Atman, like the all-supporting universe, like the all-supporting God, like the all-supporting Supreme Spirit, like the all-supporting Absolute, like the all-supporting Infinity, like the all-supporting Eternity, like the all-supporting Bliss, like the all-supporting Brahman, like the all-supporting Atman, like the all-supporting universe, like the all-supporting God, like the all-supporting Supreme Spirit, like the all-supporting Absolute, like the all-supporting Infinity, like the all-supporting Eternity, like the all-supporting Bliss, like the all-supporting Brahman, like the all-supporting Atman, like the all-supporting universe, like the all-supporting all-supporting Brahman, like the all-supporting Atman, like the all-supporting universe, like the all-supporting God, like the all-supporting Supreme Spirit, like the all-supporting Absolute, like the

original: viprāso na manmabhiḥ svādhyo devāvyo na yajñaiḥ svapnasaḥ /
analyzed: viprāsaḥ na manmabhiḥ su ādhyaḥ na yajñaiḥ svapnasaḥ
translated: The Brahmans by their hymns, the Gods' worshippers by their sacrifices, the Svadhasas,

original: rājāno na citrāḥ susaṃdṛśaḥ kṣitīnāṃ na maryā arepasaḥ //
analyzed: rājānaḥ na citrāḥ su saṃdṛśaḥ kṣitīnām na maryāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: The Kings by their splendour, the fair to look on, the Maruts of the people, the spotless,

original: agnir na ye bhrājasā rukmavakṣaso vātāso na svayujaḥ sadyaūtayaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ na ye bhrājasā rukma vakṣasaḥ vātāsaḥ na sva yujaḥ sadyaūtayaḥ
