translated: The fires, like those that shine with golden breasts, the winds, like those that come with their own teams,

original: prajñātāro na jyeṣṭhāḥ sunītayaḥ suśarmāṇo na somā ṛtaṃ yate //
analyzed: prajñātāraḥ na jyeṣṭhāḥ su nītayaḥ su śarmāṇaḥ na somāḥ ṛtam yate
translated: The most renowned, like the best leaders, the well-ordered, like the good protectors, the Somas that keep the truth.

original: vātāso na ye dhunayo jigatnavo 'gnīnāṃ na jihvā virokiṇaḥ /🔽varmaṇvanto na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇāṃ na śaṃsāḥ surātayaḥ //
analyzed: vātāsaḥ na ye dhunayaḥ jigatnavaḥ gnīnām na jihvāḥ virokiṇaḥ  varmaṇvantaḥ na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇām na śaṃsāḥ su rātayaḥ
translated: The winds, like those that shake, that are eager, the tongues of the fires, like those that shine,🔽The warriors, like those that are armed with armour, the praises of the fathers, like those that are very bountiful.

original: rathānāṃ na ye 'rāḥ sanābhayo jigīvāṃso na śūrā abhidyavaḥ /🔽vareyavo na maryā ghṛtapruṣo 'bhisvartāro arkaṃ na suṣṭubhaḥ //
analyzed: rathānām na ye rāḥ sanābhayaḥ jigīvāṃsaḥ na śūrāḥ abhidyavaḥ  vareyavaḥ na maryāḥ ghṛta pruṣaḥ bhisvartāraḥ arkam na suṣṭubhaḥ
translated: The wheels of the chariots, like those that have the same nave, the victorious, like the brave ones who conquer,🔽The young men, like those who seek choice gifts, the sprinklers of ghee, like those who well praise the hymn.

original: aśvāso na ye jyeṣṭhāsa āśavo didhiṣavo na rathyaḥ sudānavaḥ /🔽āpo na nimnair udabhir jigatnavo viśvarūpā aṅgiraso na sāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ na ye jyeṣṭhāsaḥ āśavaḥ didhiṣavaḥ na rathyaḥ sudānavaḥ  āpaḥ na nimnaiḥ udabhiḥ jigatnavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ aṅgirasaḥ na sāmabhiḥ
translated: The horses, like those that are best, that are swift, the eager, like those that are chariot-borne, the bountiful,🔽The waters, like those that flow in the low places, the eager, the multi-formed, like the Angirases with their hymns.

original: grāvāṇo na sūrayaḥ sindhumātara ādardirāso adrayo na viśvahā /
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ na sūrayaḥ sindhu mātaraḥ ādardirāsaḥ adrayaḥ na viśvahā
translated: The pressing-stones, like the princes, born from the river, the impetuous, like the mountains on all sides,

original: śiśūlā na krīḷayaḥ sumātaro mahāgrāmo na yāmann uta tviṣā //🔽uṣasāṃ na ketavo 'dhvaraśriyaḥ śubhaṃyavo nāñjibhir vy aśvitan /
analyzed: śiśūlāḥ na krīḍayaḥ su mātaraḥ mahā grāmaḥ na yāman uta tviṣā  uṣasām na ketavaḥ dhvara śriyaḥ śubhaṃyavaḥ nā añjibhiḥ vi aśvitan
translated: The young ones do not play, the well-fed ones, the great village, not even with splendor in the path.🔽Like the rays of the dawns, the glories of the sacrifice, the well-parched ones have brightened with their lips.

original: sindhavo na yayiyo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ parāvato na yojanāni mamire //
analyzed: sindhavaḥ na bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ parāvataḥ na yojanāni mamire
translated: Like the rushing rivers, with their shining eyes, they have measured out the distances from afar.

original: subhāgān no devāḥ kṛṇutā suratnān asmān stotṝn maruto vāvṛdhānāḥ /
analyzed: subhāgān naḥ devāḥ kṛṇutā su ratnān asmān stotṝn marutaḥ vāvṛdhānāḥ
translated: O gods, make us fortunate and rich in good things, O Maruts, as we praise you, may you prosper.

original: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gāta sanād dhi vo ratnadheyāni santi //
analyzed: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gāta sanāt hi vaḥ ratna dheyāni santi
translated: Sing in the praise and friendship of the hymn, for from of old are your gifts of treasure.

original: apaśyam asya mahato mahitvam amartyasya martyāsu vikṣu /🔽nānā hanū vibhṛte sam bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūry attaḥ //
analyzed: apaśyam asya mahataḥ mahi tvam amartyasya martyāsu vikṣu  nānā hanū vibhṛte sam bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūri attaḥ
translated: I have seen the greatness of this great one, of the immortal one among mortal people.🔽His two jaws, set apart, he holds together, unwinking, devouring, eating much.

original: guhā śiro nihitam ṛdhag akṣī asinvann atti jihvayā vanāni /
analyzed: guhā śiraḥ nihitam ṛdhak akṣī asinvan atti jihvayā vanāni
translated: His head is hidden, his eyes are turned back; unwinking, with his tongue he eats the woods.

original: atrāṇy asmai paḍbhiḥ sam bharanty uttānahastā namasādhi vikṣu //🔽pra mātuḥ prataraṃ guhyam icchan kumāro na vīrudhaḥ sarpad urvīḥ /
analyzed: atrāṇi asmai paḍbhiḥ sam bharanti uttāna hastāḥ namasā adhi vikṣu  pra mātuḥ prataram guhyam icchan kumāraḥ na vīrudhaḥ sarpat urvīḥ
translated: For him they gather with their feet, with uplifted hands, with reverence, in the people's assemblies.🔽Desiring the secret path of his mother, like a young hero, he creeps along the broad plants.

original: sasaṃ na pakvam avidac chucantaṃ ririhvāṃsaṃ ripa upasthe antaḥ //
analyzed: sasam na pakvam avidat śucantam ririhvāṃsam ripaḥ upasthe antar
translated: He has found the ripe, shining one, the quivering one, the trembling one, in the lap of the rock.

original: tad vām ṛtaṃ rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamāno mātarā garbho atti /
analyzed: tat vām ṛtam rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamānaḥ mātarā garbhaḥ atti
translated: I declare to you both this truth, O Heaven and Earth: the child, being born, eats his mothers.

original: nāhaṃ devasya martyaś ciketāgnir aṅga vicetāḥ sa pracetāḥ //
analyzed: na aham devasya martyaḥ ciketa agniḥ aṅga vicetāḥ sa pracetāḥ
translated: I, a mortal, do not know the god's thought, Agni, O Angiras, you are the wise one who knows.

original: yo asmā annaṃ tṛṣv ādadhāty ājyair ghṛtair juhoti puṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ asmai annam tṛṣu ādadhāti ājyaiḥ ghṛtaiḥ juhoti puṣyati
translated: He who places food in our mouths, who offers with ghee and clarified butter, prospers.

original: tasmai sahasram akṣabhir vi cakṣe 'gne viśvataḥ pratyaṅṅ asi tvam //
analyzed: tasmai sahasram akṣabhiḥ vi cakṣe gne viśvatas pratyaṅ asi tvam
translated: To him I look with a thousand eyes from all sides. You, O Agni, are the one who faces all.

original: kiṃ deveṣu tyaja enaś cakarthāgne pṛcchāmi nu tvām avidvān /🔽akrīḷan krīḷan harir attave 'dan vi parvaśaś cakarta gām ivāsiḥ //
analyzed: kim deveṣu tyajaḥ enaḥ cakartha agne pṛcchāmi nu tvām a vidvān  a krīḍan krīḍan hariḥ attave vi parvaśas cakarta gām iva asiḥ
translated: What sin have you committed among the gods? O Agni, I ask you, being ignorant.🔽Playing, playing, the tawny one eats for eating. He cuts the joints of the cow like a knife.

original: viṣūco aśvān yuyuje vanejā ṛjītibhī raśanābhir gṛbhītān /
analyzed: viṣūcaḥ aśvān yuyuje vanejāḥ ṛjītibhiḥ raśanābhiḥ gṛbhītān
translated: The forest-born one yokes the horses with the reins held by the strong ones.

original: cakṣade mitro vasubhiḥ sujātaḥ sam ānṛdhe parvabhir vāvṛdhānaḥ //🔽agniḥ saptiṃ vājambharaṃ dadāty agnir vīraṃ śrutyaṃ karmaniṣṭhām /🔽agnī rodasī vi carat samañjann agnir nārīṃ vīrakukṣim purandhim //
analyzed: cakṣade mitraḥ vasubhiḥ su jātaḥ sam ānṛdhe parvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ  agniḥ saptim vājambharam dadāti agniḥ vīram śrutyam karma niṣṭhām  agniḥ rodasī vi carat samañjan agniḥ nārīm vīra kukṣim purandhim
translated: Mitra, well-born, shines with the Vasus. He has grown by the joints, he has been joined.🔽Agni gives the horse, the bearer of strength. Agni gives the hero, the famous one, the one who completes the work.🔽Agni moves between the two worlds, arranging. Agni enters the great heaven and earth.

original: agner apnasaḥ samid astu bhadrāgnir mahī rodasī ā viveśa /
analyzed: agneḥ apnasaḥ samidh astu bhadrā agniḥ mahī rodasī ā viveśa
translated: Let the kindling be auspicious for Agni's favor. Agni has entered the great heaven and earth.

original: agnir ekaṃ codayat samatsv agnir vṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi //🔽agnir ha tyaṃ jarataḥ karṇam āvāgnir adbhyo nir adahaj jarūtham /
analyzed: agniḥ ekam codayat samatsu agniḥ vṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi  agniḥ ha tyam jarataḥ karṇam āva agniḥ adbhyaḥ niḥ adahat jarūtham
translated: Agni impels one in battles, Agni destroys many Vritras.🔽Agni has carried away the deaf man's ear, Agni has burned up the impurity from the waters.

original: agnir atriṃ gharma uruṣyad antar agnir nṛmedham prajayāsṛjat sam //
analyzed: agniḥ atrim gharme uruṣyat antar agniḥ nṛ medham prajayā asṛjat sam
translated: Agni has protected Atri within, Agni has created Nrimedha with offspring.

original: agnir dād draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā agnir ṛṣiṃ yaḥ sahasrā sanoti /🔽agnir divi havyam ā tatānāgner dhāmāni vibhṛtā purutrā //
analyzed: agniḥ dāt draviṇam vīra peśāḥ agniḥ ṛṣim yaḥ sahasrā sanoti  agniḥ divi havyam ā tatāna agneḥ dhāmāni vibhṛtā purutrā
translated: Agni gives wealth that adorns heroes, Agni is the Rishi who wins a thousand.🔽Agni has stretched the offering in the sky, Agni's abodes are spread out in many places.

original: agnim ukthair ṛṣayo vi hvayante 'gniṃ naro yāmani bādhitāsaḥ /
analyzed: agnim ukthaiḥ ṛṣayaḥ vi hvayante gnim naraḥ yāmani bādhitāsaḥ
translated: The Rishis invoke Agni with hymns, men oppressed invoke Agni in the race.

original: agniṃ vayo antarikṣe patanto 'gniḥ sahasrā pari yāti gonām //
analyzed: agnim vayaḥ antarikṣe patantaḥ gniḥ sahasrā pari yāti gonām
translated: The birds flying in the atmosphere invoke Agni, Agni goes around a thousand times with the cows.

original: agniṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīr yā agnim manuṣo nahuṣo vi jātāḥ /
analyzed: agnim viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīḥ yāḥ agnim manuṣaḥ nahuṣaḥ vi jātāḥ
translated: The human people invoke Agni, the men born in the world of men invoke Agni.

original: agnir gāndharvīm pathyām ṛtasyāgner gavyūtir ghṛta ā niṣattā //🔽agnaye brahma ṛbhavas tatakṣur agnim mahām avocāmā suvṛktim /
analyzed: agniḥ gāndharvīm pathyām ṛtasya agneḥ gavyūtiḥ ghṛte ā niṣattā  agnaye brahma ṛbhavaḥ tatakṣuḥ agnim mahām avocāma suvṛktim
translated: Agni has the Gandharva's path of truth, Agni's path is seated in ghee.🔽The Rbhus have fashioned the prayer for Agni, we have spoken a good hymn to great Agni.

original: agne prāva jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭhāgne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva //
analyzed: agne prāva jaritāram yaviṣṭha agne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva
translated: O Agni, most youthful, protect the worshipper, O Agni, bestow great wealth on us.

original: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣir hotā ny asīdat pitā naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvat ṛṣiḥ hotā ni asīdat pitā naḥ
translated: He who, offering up all these worlds, sat down as our father, the Rishi, the Hotar.

original: sa āśiṣā draviṇam icchamānaḥ prathamacchad avarāṃ ā viveśa //
analyzed: saḥ āśiṣā draviṇam icchamānaḥ prathamacchad avarām ā viveśa
translated: He, seeking wealth with his blessing, first entered the lower (regions).

original: kiṃ svid āsīd adhiṣṭhānam ārambhaṇaṃ katamat svit kathāsīt /
analyzed: kim svid āsīt adhiṣṭhānam ārambhaṇam katamat svid kathā āsīt
translated: What was the foundation, what the starting-point, what was the place whence the all-creating one,

original: yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarmā vi dyām aurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ //
analyzed: yatas bhūmim janayan viśvakarmā vi dyām aurṇot mahinā viśva cakṣāḥ
translated: bringing forth the earth, with his might covered the sky, the all-seeing one?

original: viśvataścakṣur uta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhur uta viśvataspāt /
analyzed: viśvatas cakṣuḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ viśvatobāhuḥ uta viśvataspād
translated: He who has eyes on all sides, a mouth on all sides, arms on all sides, feet on all sides,

original: sam bāhubhyāṃ dhamati sam patatrair dyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ //
analyzed: sam bāhubhyām dhamati sam patatraiḥ dyāvābhūmī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: with his arms and his wings he blows together the two worlds, the one God, bringing forth heaven and earth.

original: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ /
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsa yatas dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ
translated: What was the wood, what the tree, whence they fashioned the two worlds, heaven and earth?

original: manīṣiṇo manasā pṛcchated u tad yad adhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan //
analyzed: manīṣiṇaḥ manasā pṛcchata id u tat yat adhyatiṣṭhat bhuvanāni dhārayan
translated: Let the wise one ask with his mind that which, standing above the worlds, supports them.

original: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamā viśvakarmann utemā /
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yā avamā yāḥ madhyamāḥ viśvakarman uta imāḥ
translated: Those highest, those lowest abodes of thine, O all-creating one, and these which are in the middle,

original: śikṣā sakhibhyo haviṣi svadhāvaḥ svayaṃ yajasva tanvaṃ vṛdhānaḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa sakhibhyaḥ haviṣi svadhāvas svayam yajasva tanvam vṛdhānaḥ
translated: Teach them to thy friends, O thou of sweet voice, thyself worship thy own great body.

original: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayaṃ yajasva pṛthivīm uta dyām /
analyzed: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayam yajasva pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: O Visvakarman, having grown by the oblation, offer sacrifice to the earth and to the sky yourself.

original: muhyantv anye abhito janāsa ihāsmākam maghavā sūrir astu //🔽vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyā huvema /
analyzed: muhyantu anye abhitas janāsaḥ iha asmākam maghavā sūriḥ astu  vācaḥ patim viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manaḥ juvam vāje adyā huvema
translated: Let other people be confused all around. Here may Maghavan be our patron.🔽To the lord of speech, to Visvakarman, let us invoke today with our mind for speed, for help.

original: sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūr avase sādhukarmā //
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāni havanāni joṣat viśva śambhūḥ avase sādhu karmā
translated: May he accept all our invocations, the all-pervading one, the well-acting one, for help.

original: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtam ene ajanan nannamāne /
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīraḥ ghṛtam ene ajanat nannamāne
translated: The father of sight, the wise one with the mind, they have generated him, the two who are nourished by ghee.

original: yaded antā adadṛhanta pūrva ād id dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām //
analyzed: yadā id antāḥ adadṛhanta pūrve āt id dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
translated: When the ends were firmly fixed, then indeed the two, heaven and earth, were extended.

original: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramota saṃdṛk /
analyzed: viśvakarmā vimanāḥ āt vihāyāḥ dhātā vidhātā paramā uta saṃdṛś
translated: Visvakarman, the wise one, the bird, the spreader, the ordainer, the disposer, and the supreme seer,

original: teṣām iṣṭāni sam iṣā madanti yatrā saptaṛṣīn para ekam āhuḥ //
analyzed: teṣām iṣṭāni sam iṣā madanti yatrā sapta ṛṣīn paras ekam āhuḥ
translated: Their offerings rejoice in food, where they call one beyond the seven Rishis.

original: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pitā janitā yaḥ vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who is our father, the begetter, the ordainer, who knows all abodes and all beings,

original: yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva taṃ sampraśnam bhuvanā yanty anyā //
analyzed: yaḥ devānām nāmadhāḥ ekaḥ eva tam sampraśnam bhuvanā yanti anyā
translated: He who alone bears the names of the gods, to him the other beings go for consultation.

original: ta āyajanta draviṇaṃ sam asmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāro na bhūnā /
analyzed: te āyajanta draviṇam sam asmai ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāraḥ na bhūnā
translated: The ancient Rishis, the singers, have offered to him for wealth.

original: asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtāni samakṛṇvann imāni //
analyzed: asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtāni samakṛṇvan imāni
translated: Set in the asuṛt and the sūrta, in the middle region, they who have made these beings.

original: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhir asurair yad asti /
analyzed: paras divā paras enā pṛthivyā paras devebhiḥ asuraiḥ yat asti
translated: Beyond the heaven, beyond this earth, beyond what is, with gods and Asuras,

original: kaṃ svid garbham prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥ samapaśyanta viśve //🔽tam id garbham prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥ samagacchanta viśve /
analyzed: kam svid garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samapaśyanta viśve  tam id garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samagacchanta viśve
translated: What first germ did the waters hold, where all the gods beheld it?🔽That first germ did the waters hold, where all the gods came together.

original: ajasya nābhāv adhy ekam arpitaṃ yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: ajasya nābhau adhi ekam arpitam yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
translated: In the womb of the unborn one, one is laid, in whom all beings have stood.

original: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānānyad yuṣmākam antaram babhūva /
analyzed: na tam vidātha yaḥ imā jajāna anyat yuṣmākam antaram babhūva
translated: Ye find not him who begat these, another hath been born among you.

original: nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaś caranti //
analyzed: nīhāreṇa prāvṛtāḥ jalpyā ca asutṛpaḥ uktha śāsaḥ caranti
translated: Enveloped in darkness, in delusion, the gods, unsatisfied with prayer, wander.

original: yas te manyo 'vidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak /
analyzed: yaḥ te manyo vidhat vajra sāyaka sahaḥ ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak
translated: O Manyu, he who hath made thee, O Manyu, the arrow, the thunderbolt, who increaseth his own strength in every way,

original: sāhyāma dāsam āryaṃ tvayā yujā sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā //
analyzed: sāhyāma dāsam āryam tvayā yujā sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā
translated: With thee for an ally, O Manyu, may we conquer the Dāsa, the Ārya, the one who hath done a hundred wrongs, with the irresistible one.

original: manyur indro manyur evāsa devo manyur hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: manyuḥ indraḥ manyuḥ eva āsa devaḥ manyuḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Manyu is Indra, Manyu is the god, Manyu is the priest, Varuna, the all-knower.

original: manyuṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīr yāḥ pāhi no manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: manyum viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīḥ yāḥ pāhi naḥ manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ
translated: The human people seek Manyu, be of one mind with us, O Manyu, through austerity, protect us.

original: abhīhi manyo tavasas tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn /
analyzed: abhīhi manyo tavasaḥ tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn
translated: Come hither, O Manyu, stronger than the strong, with heat as thy companion, slay the foes.

original: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūny ā bharā tvaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hā ca viśvā vasūni ā bhara tvam naḥ
translated: Slayer of foes, slayer of Vr̥itra, slayer of Dasyus, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth.

original: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayambhūr bhāmo abhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi manyo abhibhūti ojāḥ svayambhūḥ bhāmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: For thou, O Manyu, art of overpowering might, self-existent, terrible, overcoming malice.

original: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvān asmāsv ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi //🔽abhāgaḥ sann apa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ /
analyzed: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvān asmāsu ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi  a bhāgaḥ san apa paretaḥ asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ
translated: All-conquering, victorious, strong, bestow upon us strength in battles.🔽Though destitute of share, I have come hither to thee, O thou of mighty power, O thou of wise discernment.

original: taṃ tvā manyo akratur jihīḷāhaṃ svā tanūr baladeyāya mehi //
analyzed: tam tvā manyo akratuḥ jihīḍa aham svā tanūḥ bala deyāya mā ihi
translated: Thee, O Manyu, I, who am without a match, would fain attract to myself: come to me with thy own body, to give me strength.

original: ayaṃ te asmy upa mehy arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ /🔽manyo vajrinn abhi mām ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūṃr uta bodhy āpeḥ //
analyzed: ayam te asmi upa mā ihi arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśva dhāyaḥ  manyo vajrin abhi mām ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūṃr uta bodhi āpeḥ
translated: Here am I: come thou to me: come hitherward, O thou who givest all, to aid me.🔽Turn thou to me, O Manyu, armed with thunder: slay the Dasyus, and be watchful for our weal.

original: abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā me 'dhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri /
analyzed: abhi prehi dakṣiṇatas bhava me dhāḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri
translated: Go forward, and be thou on my right hand: trample down many a foe.

original: juhomi te dharuṇam madhvo agram ubhā upāṃśu prathamā pibāva //
analyzed: juhomi te dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram ubhau upāṃśu prathamā pibāva
translated: I offer thee the firm support, the first sweet draught: drink both the draughts that drop with fatness.

original: tvayā manyo saratham ārujanto harṣamāṇāso dhṛṣitā marutvaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā manyo sa ratham ārujantaḥ harṣamāṇāsaḥ dhṛṣitāḥ marutvas
translated: Mounting thy car, O Manyu, with thee to aid, exulting, bold, accompanied by Maruts,

original: tigmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā abhi pra yantu naro agnirūpāḥ //
analyzed: tigma iṣavaḥ āyudhā saṃśiśānāḥ abhi pra yantu naraḥ agni rūpāḥ
translated: With sharp arrows and sharpened weapons, let the men go forth, assuming the appearance of Agni.

original: agnir iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīr naḥ sahure hūta edhi /🔽hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdho nudasva //
analyzed: agniḥ iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senā nīḥ naḥ sahure hūtaḥ edhi  hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva vedaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: Be impetuous, O Manyu, like fire, be victorious; be our general in the battle, invoked.🔽To slay the enemies, divide the regions; measuring strength, drive away the foes.

original: sahasva manyo abhimātim asme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn /🔽ugraṃ te pājo nanv ā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃ nayasa ekaja tvam //
analyzed: sahasva manyo abhimātim asme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn  ugram te pājaḥ nanu ā rurudhre vaśī vaśam nayase eka ja tvam
translated: Be victorious, O Manyu, over the hostility against us; crushing, destroying, go forth against the enemies.🔽Thy fierce splendour now I restrain; thou, the powerful, leadest to subjection; thou art alone.

original: eko bahūnām asi manyav īḷito viśaṃviśaṃ yudhaye saṃ śiśādhi /
analyzed: ekaḥ bahūnām asi manyo īḍitaḥ viśam viśam yudhaye sam śiśādhi
translated: Thou art alone, O Manyu, among many, invoked; sharpen each clan for the battle.

original: akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣaṃ vijayāya kṛṇmahe //
analyzed: a kṛtta ruc tvayā yujā vayam dyumantam ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmahe
translated: With thee as our ally, O uninjured one, we make a glorious shout for victory.

original: vijeṣakṛd indra ivānavabravo 'smākam manyo adhipā bhaveha /
analyzed: vijeṣa kṛt indraḥ iva anavabravaḥ smākam manyo adhipāḥ bhava iha
translated: Like Indra, the victor, I invoke thee; be thou, O Manyu, our overlord.

original: priyaṃ te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidmā tam utsaṃ yata ābabhūtha //
analyzed: priyam te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidma tam utsam yatas ābabhūtha
translated: We praise thy dear name, O hero; we know that spring from which thou hast come.

original: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka saho bibharṣy abhibhūta uttaram /
analyzed: ābhūtyā sahajāḥ vajra sāyaka sahaḥ bibharṣi abhibhūte uttaram
translated: With prosperity, O Manyu, born together, thou bearest the thunderbolt, the weapon, the higher strength.

original: kratvā no manyo saha medy edhi mahādhanasya puruhūta saṃsṛji //
analyzed: kratvā naḥ manyo saha medī edhi mahā dhanasya puru hūta saṃsṛji
translated: Be thou, O Manyu, with our mind, in the assembly of the great wealth, invoked by many.

original: saṃsṛṣṭaṃ dhanam ubhayaṃ samākṛtam asmabhyaṃ dattāṃ varuṇaś ca manyuḥ /
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭam dhanam ubhayam samākṛtam asmabhyam dattām varuṇaḥ ca manyuḥ
translated: The two united treasures have been made equal: Varuṇa and Manyu have given them to us.

original: bhiyaṃ dadhānā hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāso apa ni layantām //
analyzed: bhiyam dadhānāḥ hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāsaḥ apa ni layantām
translated: Let the enemies, placing fear in their hearts, be vanquished and driven away.

original: satyenottabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇottabhitā dyauḥ /
analyzed: satyena uttabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇa uttabhitā dyauḥ
translated: The earth is upheld by truth, the sky is upheld by the sun.

original: ṛtenādityās tiṣṭhanti divi somo adhi śritaḥ //
analyzed: ṛtena ādityāḥ tiṣṭhanti divi somaḥ adhi śritaḥ
translated: The Adityas stand by law, Soma is established in the sky.

original: somenādityā balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī /
analyzed: somena ādityāḥ balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī
translated: The Adityas are strong by Soma, the great earth is by Soma.

original: atho nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe soma āhitaḥ //
analyzed: atha u nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe somaḥ āhitaḥ
translated: And in the lap of these stars Soma is placed.

original: somam manyate papivān yat sampiṃṣanty oṣadhim /
analyzed: somam manyate papivān yat sampiṃṣanti oṣadhim
translated: He who drinks Soma thinks, when they crush the plant,

original: somaṃ yam brahmāṇo vidur na tasyāśnāti kaś cana //
analyzed: somam yam brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ na tasya aśnāti kaḥ cana
translated: that of Soma which the Brahmans know, no one partakes.

original: ācchadvidhānair gupito bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: ācchad vidhānaiḥ gupitaḥ bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ
translated: Guarded by the enclosing sticks, O Soma, protected by the Brihatis,

original: grāvṇām ic chṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ //
analyzed: grāvṇām id śṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ
translated: thou standest, listening to the pressing-stones: the earthly one does not partake of thee.

original: yat tvā deva prapibanti tata ā pyāyase punaḥ /
analyzed: yat tvā deva prapibanti tatas ā pyāyase punar
translated: When the gods drink thee, O god, then thou art filled again.

original: vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānām māsa ākṛtiḥ //
analyzed: vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānām māsaḥ ākṛtiḥ
translated: Vayu is the guardian of Soma, the month is the form of the equal (seasons).

original: raibhy āsīd anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī /
analyzed: raibhī āsīt anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī
translated: Raiva was the follower, the Narashansi the spoon.

original: sūryāyā bhadram id vāso gāthayaiti pariṣkṛtam //
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ bhadram id vāsaḥ gāthayā eti pariṣkṛtam
translated: The auspicious garment of Surya, the purified, is the hymn.

original: cittir ā upabarhaṇaṃ cakṣur ā abhyañjanam /
analyzed: cittiḥ āḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣuḥ āḥ abhyañjanam
translated: The mind was the pillow, the eye the ointment.

original: dyaur bhūmiḥ kośa āsīd yad ayāt sūryā patim //
analyzed: dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośaḥ āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim
translated: The sky and earth were the sheath when she went to her husband, Surya.

original: stomā āsan pratidhayaḥ kurīraṃ chanda opaśaḥ /
analyzed: stomāḥ āsan pratidhayaḥ kurīram chandaḥ opaśaḥ
translated: The hymns were the counter-chants, the metre was the Kuṇḍa, the Opaśa.

original: sūryāyā aśvinā varāgnir āsīt purogavaḥ //
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ aśvinā varā agniḥ āsīt purogavaḥ
translated: The Ashvins were the boons of Surya, Agni was the leader.

original: somo vadhūyur abhavad aśvināstām ubhā varā /
analyzed: somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā
translated: Soma became the wooer, the Ashvins were the two boons,

original: sūryāṃ yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitādadāt //
analyzed: sūryām yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt
translated: When Savitar gave Surya to her husband, praising with her mind.

original: mano asyā ana āsīd dyaur āsīd uta cchadiḥ /🔽śukrāv anaḍvāhāv āstāṃ yad ayāt sūryā gṛham //
analyzed: manaḥ asyāḥ anaḥ āsīt dyauḥ āsīt uta chadiḥ  śukrau anaḍvāhau āstām yat ayāt sūryā gṛham
translated: Her mind was the yoke, the sky was the covering,🔽The two bright oxen were yoked when Surya went to her home.

original: ṛksāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāmanāv itaḥ /🔽śrotraṃ te cakre āstāṃ divi panthāś carācāraḥ //
analyzed: ṛk sāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāmanau itas  śrotram te cakre āstām divi panthāḥ cara ācāraḥ
translated: The two oxen are mentioned by the Ṛc and Sāman, the two Sāmans are from here.🔽The two ears were your wheels, the path in the sky was the moving and unmoving.

original: śucī te cakre yātyā vyāno akṣa āhataḥ /🔽ano manasmayaṃ sūryārohat prayatī patim //
analyzed: śucī te cakre yātyāḥ vyānaḥ akṣaḥ āhataḥ  anaḥ manasmayam sūryā ārohat prayatī patim
translated: The two pure wheels on which you go, the out-breath and in-breath are struck by the axle.🔽The mind-born Surya mounted, striving, to her husband.

original: sūryāyā vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat /
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat
translated: From the conveyance of Surya, Savitar has sent forth the one who goes.

original: aghāsu hanyante gāvo 'rjunyoḥ pary uhyate //
analyzed: aghāsu hanyante gāvaḥ rjunyoḥ pari uhyate
translated: In the dark fortnights the cows are killed, in the two Arjayas it is thrown around.

original: yad aśvinā pṛcchamānāv ayātaṃ tricakreṇa vahatuṃ sūryāyāḥ /
analyzed: yat aśvinā pṛcchamānau ayātam tri cakreṇa vahatum sūryāyāḥ
translated: When the Ashvins, being questioned, went on Surya's conveyance with the three-wheeled (chariot),

original: viśve devā anu tad vām ajānan putraḥ pitarāv avṛṇīta pūṣā //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat vām ajānan putraḥ pitarau avṛṇīta pūṣā
translated: The All-Gods have approved of that, Pusan, the son, has chosen his parents.

original: yad ayātaṃ śubhas patī vareyaṃ sūryām upa /
analyzed: yat ayātam śubhaḥ patī vareyam sūryām upa
translated: When you two, lords of splendor, have gone to the most excellent one, to Surya,

original: kvaikaṃ cakraṃ vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ //
analyzed: kva ekam cakram vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ
translated: where was your single wheel? Where did you stand for the purpose of guiding?

original: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇa ṛtuthā viduḥ /
analyzed: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇaḥ ṛtuthā viduḥ
translated: Two wheels are yours, O Surya; the Brahmans know them in due season.

original: athaikaṃ cakraṃ yad guhā tad addhātaya id viduḥ //
analyzed: atha ekam cakram yat guhā tat addhātayaḥ id viduḥ
translated: And the single wheel which is hidden, that they know as the hidden one.

original: sūryāyai devebhyo mitrāya varuṇāya ca /
analyzed: sūryāyai devebhyaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: To Surya, to the gods, to Mitra, to Varuna,

original: ye bhūtasya pracetasa idaṃ tebhyo 'karaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: ye bhūtasya pracetasaḥ idam tebhyaḥ karam namaḥ
translated: to those who are the wise overseers of being, I have made this obeisance to them.

original: pūrvāparaṃ carato māyayaitau śiśū krīḷantau pari yāto adhvaram /🔽viśvāny anyo bhuvanābhicaṣṭa ṛtūṃr anyo vidadhaj jāyate punaḥ //
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ adhvaram  viśvāni anyaḥ bhuvanā abhicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyate punar
translated: The two move about in the east and west by magic power, these two children playing, they go around the sacrifice.🔽One of them observes all the worlds, the other, establishing the seasons, is born again.

original: navonavo bhavati jāyamāno 'hnāṃ ketur uṣasām ety agram /
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavati jāyamānaḥ hnām ketuḥ uṣasām eti agram
translated: He is born anew each time, the ensign of the days, coming to the front of the dawns.

original: bhāgaṃ devebhyo vi dadhāty āyan pra candramās tirate dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāti āyan pra candramāḥ tirate dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: He distributes his portion to the gods as he goes, and the moon extends his long life.

original: sukiṃśukaṃ śalmaliṃ viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyavarṇaṃ suvṛtaṃ sucakram /
analyzed: su kiṃśukam śalmalim viśva rūpam hiraṇya varṇam suvṛtam su cakram
translated: The well-formed, many-formed, golden-colored, well-covered, well-wheeled shalmali tree,

original: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokaṃ syonam patye vahatuṃ kṛṇuṣva //
analyzed: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokam syonam patye vahatum kṛṇuṣva
translated: Ascend the sun, to the world of the immortal. Make yourself ready to go to your husband.

original: ud īrṣvātaḥ pativatī hy eṣā viśvāvasuṃ namasā gīrbhir īḷe /
analyzed: ud īrṣva atas pativatī hi eṣā viśvāvasum namasā gīrbhiḥ īḍe
translated: Rise up from here, for this (earth) is full of lords. I praise Viśvāvasu with homage and songs.

original: anyām iccha pitṛṣadaṃ vyaktāṃ sa te bhāgo januṣā tasya viddhi //
analyzed: anyām iccha pitṛṣadam vyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi
translated: Choose another, manifest, dwelling with the fathers. That is your share by birth. Know that.

original: ud īrṣvāto viśvāvaso namaseḷā mahe tvā /
analyzed: ud īrṣva atas viśvāvaso namasā iḍā mahe tvā
translated: Rise up from here, O Viśvāvasu, for homage and praise, for great you are.

original: anyām iccha prapharvyaṃ saṃ jāyām patyā sṛja //🔽anṛkṣarā ṛjavaḥ santu panthā yebhiḥ sakhāyo yanti no vareyam /
analyzed: anyām iccha prapharvyam sam jāyām patyā sṛja  anṛkṣarāḥ ṛjavaḥ santu panthāḥ yebhiḥ sakhāyaḥ yanti naḥ vareyam
translated: Choose another, a young woman, to unite with her husband.🔽May the paths be free from thorns and straight, by which our friends go to a better place.

original: sam aryamā sam bhago no ninīyāt saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam astu devāḥ //
analyzed: sam aryamā sam bhagaḥ naḥ ninīyāt sam jāspatyam suyamam astu devāḥ
translated: May Aryaman and Bhaga lead us together. May the gods make our lordship easy to govern.

original: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitā suśevaḥ /
analyzed: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā su śevaḥ
translated: I release you from the noose of Varuna, by which Savitar, the kindly one, has bound you.

original: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke 'riṣṭāṃ tvā saha patyā dadhāmi //
analyzed: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke riṣṭām tvā saha patyā dadhāmi
translated: In the womb of truth, in the world of good deeds, I place you unharmed with your husband.

original: preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ subaddhām amutas karam /
analyzed: pretaḥ muñcāmi na amutas su baddhām amutas karam
translated: I release you from here, not from there, well-bound, from there I make you.

original: yatheyam indra mīḍhvaḥ suputrā subhagāsati //
analyzed: yathā iyam indra mīḍhvaḥ su putrā subhagā asati
translated: So that you, O bountiful Indra, may have good sons and good fortune, O you who have good fortune.

original: pūṣā tveto nayatu hastagṛhyāśvinā tvā pra vahatāṃ rathena /
analyzed: pūṣā tvā itas nayatu hasta gṛhya aśvinā tvā pra vahatām rathena
translated: May Pūṣan lead you from here, taking you by the hand. May the two Aśvins carry you on their chariot.

original: gṛhān gaccha gṛhapatnī yathāso vaśinī tvaṃ vidatham ā vadāsi //
analyzed: gṛhān gaccha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ vaśinī tvam vidatham ā vadāsi
translated: Go to the house, O housewife, as you will, you speak in the assembly as a powerful one.

original: iha priyam prajayā te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi /
analyzed: iha priyam prajayā te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi
translated: Here let what is dear to you be accomplished through offspring. In this house be watchful for the sake of the household fire.

original: enā patyā tanvaṃ saṃ sṛjasvādhā jivrī vidatham ā vadāthaḥ //
analyzed: enā patyā tanvam sam sṛjasva adhā jivrī vidatham ā vadāthaḥ
translated: With this husband unite your body. Live long. Speak in the assembly.

original: nīlalohitam bhavati kṛtyāsaktir vy ajyate /🔽edhante asyā jñātayaḥ patir bandheṣu badhyate //🔽parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyo vi bhajā vasu /
analyzed: nīla lohitam bhavati kṛtyā saktiḥ vi ajyate  edhante asyāḥ jñātayaḥ patiḥ bandheṣu badhyate  parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyaḥ vi bhajā vasu
translated: It becomes blue and red. The noose of witchcraft is untied.🔽Her relatives prosper. The husband is bound in bonds.🔽Give away the quarrel. Divide the wealth among the Brahmans.

original: kṛtyaiṣā padvatī bhūtvy ā jāyā viśate patim //
analyzed: kṛtyā eṣā padvatī bhūtvī ā jāyā viśate patim
translated: This witchcraft, having become a two-footed being, enters the husband's wife.

original: aśrīrā tanūr bhavati ruśatī pāpayāmuyā /
analyzed: aśrīrā tanūḥ bhavati ruśatī pāpayā amuyā
translated: The body becomes ugly, pale, and evil-looking.

original: patir yad vadhvo vāsasā svam aṅgam abhidhitsate //
analyzed: patiḥ yat vadhvaḥ vāsasā svam aṅgam abhidhitsate
translated: When the husband desires to touch his own body with the bride's garment.

original: ye vadhvaś candraṃ vahatuṃ yakṣmā yanti janād anu /
analyzed: ye vadhvaḥ candram vahatum yakṣmāḥ yanti janāt anu
translated: The consumption that follows people, that seeks to carry away the bride's beauty,

original: punas tān yajñiyā devā nayantu yata āgatāḥ //🔽mā vidan paripanthino ya āsīdanti dampatī /
analyzed: punar tān yajñiyāḥ devāḥ nayantu yatas āgatāḥ  mā vidan paripanthinaḥ ye āsīdanti dampatī
translated: May the divine ones lead them back again from where they have come.🔽May the enemies who lie in wait for the couple as they depart,

original: sugebhir durgam atītām apa drāntv arātayaḥ //
analyzed: sugebhiḥ durgam atītām apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: May the evil spirits flee away. May they pass over the difficult places by the easy paths.

original: sumaṅgalīr iyaṃ vadhūr imāṃ sameta paśyata /
analyzed: su maṅgalīḥ iyam vadhūḥ imām sameta paśyata
translated: This bride is auspicious. Look upon her as she comes.

original: saubhāgyam asyai dattvāyāthāstaṃ vi paretana //
analyzed: saubhāgyam asyai dattvāya atha astam vi parā itana
translated: Having given her good fortune, go back to your place.

original: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam etad apāṣṭhavad viṣavan naitad attave /
analyzed: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam etat apāṣṭhavat viṣavat na etat attave
translated: This is bitter, this is pungent, like a razor's edge, like poison, it is not to be eaten.

original: sūryāṃ yo brahmā vidyāt sa id vādhūyam arhati //
analyzed: sūryām yaḥ brahmā vidyāt saḥ id vādhūyam arhati
translated: Only he who knows the Sūryā hymn is worthy to remove this.

original: āśasanaṃ viśasanam atho adhivikartanam /
analyzed: āśasanam viśasanam atha u adhivikartanam
translated: Cutting, cutting through, and then cutting above,

original: sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahmā tu śundhati //
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahmā tu śundhati
translated: see the forms of the Sūryā, the Brahman purifies them.

original: gṛbhṇāmi te saubhagatvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭir yathāsaḥ /
analyzed: gṛbhṇāmi te saubhaga tvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asaḥ
translated: I grasp your hand for good fortune, that I may have a husband with long sight like this one.

original: bhago aryamā savitā purandhir mahyaṃ tvādur gārhapatyāya devāḥ //
analyzed: bhagaḥ aryamā savitā purandhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ
translated: May Bhaga, Aryaman, Savitar, Purandhi, and the gods give you to me for my household fire.

original: tām pūṣañ chivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣyā vapanti /
analyzed: tām pūṣam śivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣyāḥ vapanti
translated: O Pūṣan, send her to me, the most auspicious one, in whom men sow their seed.

original: yā na ūrū uśatī viśrayāte yasyām uśantaḥ praharāma śepam //
analyzed: yā naḥ ūrū uśatī viśrayāte yasyām uśantaḥ praharāma śepam
translated: In whom the eager one spreads her thighs, in whom the eager one inserts his member.

original: tubhyam agre pary avahan sūryāṃ vahatunā saha /🔽punaḥ patibhyo jāyāṃ dā agne prajayā saha //
analyzed: tubhyam agre pari avahan sūryām vahatunā saha  punar patibhyaḥ jāyām dāḥ agne prajayā saha
translated: First they brought the Sūryā to you together with the oblation.🔽The gods have given the wife back to her husbands together with offspring, O Agni.

original: punaḥ patnīm agnir adād āyuṣā saha varcasā /
analyzed: punar patnīm agniḥ adāt āyuṣā saha varcasā
translated: Agni has given the wife back together with life and splendor.

original: dīrghāyur asyā yaḥ patir jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ asyāḥ yaḥ patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam
translated: Long-lived will be the husband of this one, he will live a hundred autumns.

original: somaḥ prathamo vivide gandharvo vivida uttaraḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ prathamaḥ vivide gandharvaḥ vivide uttaraḥ
translated: Soma first found her, the Gandharva found her next,

original: tṛtīyo agniṣ ṭe patis turīyas te manuṣyajāḥ //
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ
translated: The third was Agni, thy lord, the fourth is thy human lord.

original: somo dadad gandharvāya gandharvo dadad agnaye /
analyzed: somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye
translated: Soma gave her to the Gandharva, the Gandharva gave her to Agni.

original: rayiṃ ca putrāṃś cādād agnir mahyam atho imām //
analyzed: rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām
translated: Agni gave me wealth and sons, and also this (woman).

original: ihaiva stam mā vi yauṣṭaṃ viśvam āyur vy aśnutam /
analyzed: iha eva stam mā vi viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutam
translated: Here only, do not be separated, attain the whole of your life.

original: krīḷantau putrair naptṛbhir modamānau sve gṛhe //
analyzed: krīḍantau putraiḥ naptṛbhiḥ modamānau sve gṛhe
translated: Rejoicing with your sons and grandsons, delighting in your own house.

original: ā naḥ prajāṃ janayatu prajāpatir ājarasāya sam anaktv aryamā /
analyzed: ā naḥ prajām janayatu prajāpatiḥ ājarasāya sam anaktu aryamā
translated: May Prajapati beget offspring for us; may Aryaman anoint us for long life.

original: adurmaṅgalīḥ patilokam ā viśa śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
analyzed: adurmaṅgalīḥ pati lokam ā viśa śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Be thou auspicious, enter the world of thy husband; be thou a blessing to us, to bipeds and to quadrupeds.

original: aghoracakṣur apatighny edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ sumanāḥ suvarcāḥ /
analyzed: aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ sumanāḥ suvarcāḥ
translated: Be thou of auspicious eye, not slaying thy husband, be thou propitious to cattle, of good will, of fair face.

original: vīrasūr devakāmā syonā śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
analyzed: vīra sūḥ deva kāmā syonā śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Bringing forth heroes, loving the gods, kindly, be thou a blessing to us, to bipeds and to quadrupeds.

original: imāṃ tvam indra mīḍhvaḥ suputrāṃ subhagāṃ kṛṇu /
analyzed: imām tvam indra mīḍhvaḥ su putrām subhagām kṛṇu
translated: O bountiful Indra, make this woman good, good-natured, and well-favoured.

original: daśāsyām putrān ā dhehi patim ekādaśaṃ kṛdhi //
analyzed: daśa asyām putrān ā dhehi patim ekādaśam kṛdhi
translated: Place in her ten sons, and make her husband the eleventh.

original: samrājñī śvaśure bhava samrājñī śvaśrvām bhava /
analyzed: samrājñī śvaśure bhava samrājñī śvaśrvām bhava
translated: Be thou a queen to thy father-in-law, be thou a queen to thy mother-in-law,

original: nanāndari samrājñī bhava samrājñī adhi devṛṣu //🔽sam añjantu viśve devāḥ sam āpo hṛdayāni nau /
analyzed: nanāndari samrājñī bhava samrājñī adhi devṛṣu  sam añjantu viśve devāḥ sam āpaḥ hṛdayāni nau
translated: O daughter-in-law, be a queen, a queen over the gods.🔽May all the gods anoint us, may the waters anoint the hearts of us two.

original: sam mātariśvā saṃ dhātā sam u deṣṭrī dadhātu nau //
analyzed: sam mātariśvā sam dhātā sam u deṣṭrī dadhātu nau
translated: May Matariśvan, may Dhatr, may the Ordainer unite us two.

original: vi hi sotor asṛkṣata nendraṃ devam amaṃsata /
analyzed: vi hi sotoḥ asṛkṣata na indram devam amaṃsata
translated: The streams have flowed apart; they have not thought of the god Indra,

original: yatrāmadad vṛṣākapir aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu matsakhā viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: yatra amadat vṛṣākapiḥ aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu mad sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Where the red-spotted deer has become intoxicated, my friend among the Aryas in the rich pastures. Indra is superior to all.

original: parā hīndra dhāvasi vṛṣākaper ati vyathiḥ /
analyzed: parā hi indra dhāvasi vṛṣākapeḥ ati vyathiḥ
translated: You run away, O Indra, from the distress of the red-spotted deer.

original: no aha pra vindasy anyatra somapītaye viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: na u aha pra vindasi anyatra soma pītaye viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: You will not find a place for yourself elsewhere than for the drinking of Soma. Indra is superior to all.

original: kim ayaṃ tvāṃ vṛṣākapiś cakāra harito mṛgaḥ /
analyzed: kim ayam tvām vṛṣākapiḥ cakāra haritaḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: What has this red-spotted deer, the tawny beast, done to you,

original: yasmā irasyasīd u nv aryo vā puṣṭimad vasu viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: yasmai irasyasīt u nu aryaḥ vā puṣṭimat vasu viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: That you are angry with it, O noble one, with its rich possessions? Indra is superior to all.

original: yam imaṃ tvaṃ vṛṣākapim priyam indrābhirakṣasi /
analyzed: yam imam tvam vṛṣākapim priyam indra abhirakṣasi
translated: This red-spotted deer, O Indra, whom you cherish so dearly,

original: śvā nv asya jambhiṣad api karṇe varāhayur viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: śvā nu asya jambhiṣat api karṇe varāhayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The dog will seize him by the jaw, the boar-hunter by the ear. Indra is superior to all.

original: priyā taṣṭāni me kapir vyaktā vy adūduṣat /
analyzed: priyā taṣṭāni me kapiḥ vyaktā vi adūduṣat
translated: The red-spotted deer has broken my dear-fashioned ornaments.

original: śiro nv asya rāviṣaṃ na sugaṃ duṣkṛte bhuvaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: śiraḥ nu asya rāviṣam na sugam duṣkṛte bhuvam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: I have torn out his head, not an easy task for the evildoer. Indra is superior to all.

original: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat /
analyzed: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat
translated: No woman is more beautiful than me, none swifter.

original: na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthy udyamīyasī viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthi udyamīyasī viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: None is more modest than me, none has thighs more shapely. Indra is superior to all.

original: uve amba sulābhike yathevāṅga bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: amba sulābhike yathā iva aṅga bhaviṣyati
translated: O mother, easy to obtain, as if you were my own mother,

original: bhasan me amba sakthi me śiro me vīva hṛṣyati viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: bhasad me amba sakthi me śiraḥ me vi iva hṛṣyati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: my hips, my thighs, my head seem to be trembling. Indra is superior to all.

original: kiṃ subāho svaṅgure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthujāghane /
analyzed: kim su bāho su aṅgure
translated: O you with beautiful arms, with beautiful thighs, with broad hips, with broad buttocks,

original: kiṃ śūrapatni nas tvam abhy amīṣi vṛṣākapiṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: kim śūra patni naḥ tvam abhī amīṣi vṛṣākapim viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: why do you hate me, O wife of a hero? Why do you despise Vṛṣākapi? Indra is superior to all.

original: avīrām iva mām ayaṃ śarārur abhi manyate /
analyzed: avīrām iva mām ayam śarāruḥ abhi manyate
translated: This wicked one thinks of me as if I were childless.

original: utāham asmi vīriṇīndrapatnī marutsakhā viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: uta aham asmi vīriṇī indra patnī marut sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: But I am a woman of heroic deeds, the wife of Indra, the friend of the Maruts. Indra is superior to all.

original: saṃhotraṃ sma purā nārī samanaṃ vāva gacchati /🔽vedhā ṛtasya vīriṇīndrapatnī mahīyate viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: saṃhotram sma purā nārī samanam vāva gacchati  vedhāḥ ṛtasya vīriṇī indra patnī mahīyate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: In the past, a woman used to go to the Saman assembly as a Samhót.🔽The wife of Indra, the performer of holy rites, is honored. Indra is superior to all.

original: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam /
analyzed: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam
translated: I have heard that among women, Indrāṇī is the most fortunate.

original: nahy asyā aparaṃ cana jarasā marate patir viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: nahi asyāḥ aparam cana jarasā marate patiḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: For this one, not even old age, nor her husband, nor all, can overcome Indra.

original: nāham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyur vṛṣākaper ṛte /
analyzed: na aham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyuḥ vṛṣākapeḥ ṛte
translated: I do not delight, O Indra's wife, apart from my friend Vrishakapi,

original: yasyedam apyaṃ haviḥ priyaṃ deveṣu gacchati viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: yasya idam apyam haviḥ priyam deveṣu gacchati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: whose pure oblation goes to the beloved gods. Indra is superior to all.

original: vṛṣākapāyi revati suputra ād u susnuṣe /
analyzed: vṛṣākapāyi revati su putre āt u su snuṣe
translated: O Revati, Vrishakapi's wife, with good sons and a good daughter-in-law,

original: ghasat ta indra ukṣaṇaḥ priyaṃ kācitkaraṃ havir viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: ghasat te indraḥ ukṣaṇaḥ priyam kācitkaram haviḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: may Indra enjoy your oblation, which makes him happy. Indra is superior to all.

original: ukṣṇo hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃśatim /
analyzed: ukṣṇaḥ hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃśatim
translated: For me, fifteen bulls are cooked together, and twenty,

original: utāham admi pīva id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: uta aham admi pīvaḥ id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: and I eat them well-fed. Both my stomachs are filled. Indra is superior to all.

original: vṛṣabho na tigmaśṛṅgo 'ntar yūtheṣu roruvat /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ na tigma śṛṅgaḥ ntar yūtheṣu roruvat
translated: The bull with sharp horns, roaring among the herds,

original: manthas ta indra śaṃ hṛde yaṃ te sunoti bhāvayur viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: manthaḥ te indra śam hṛde yam te sunoti bhāvayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: the churning stick for your heart, O Indra, which the one who presses (the Soma) offers to you, is dear. Indra is superior to all.

original: na seśe yasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛt /
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya rambate ntarā kapṛth
translated: He is not a lord whose knee-cap rattles between his thighs.

original: sed īśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: sa id īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: He is a lord whose bristling hair stands on end when he sits down and stretches himself. Indra is superior to all.

original: na seśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate /
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate
translated: He is not a lord whose bristling hair stands on end when he sits down and stretches himself.

original: sed īśe yasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛd viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: sa id īśe yasya rambate ntarā kapṛth viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: He is the Lord whose thigh trembles, the goat is superior to all, O Indra.

original: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantaṃ hataṃ vidat /
analyzed: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantam hatam vidat
translated: This Indra, the monkey, found the slain one who had lost his wealth,

original: asiṃ sūnāṃ navaṃ carum ād edhasyāna ācitaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: asim sūnām navam carum āt edhasya anaḥ ācitam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The knife, the new vessel, the fresh food, and the heap of fuel, O Indra, is superior to all.

original: ayam emi vicākaśad vicinvan dāsam āryam /
analyzed: ayam emi vicākaśat vicinvan dāsam āryam
translated: I am going, looking around, searching for the slave and the noble one.

original: pibāmi pākasutvano 'bhi dhīram acākaśaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: pibāmi pākasutvanaḥ bhi dhīram acākaśam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: I am drinking the son of Paka, I am looking at the wise one, O Indra, is superior to all.

original: dhanva ca yat kṛntatraṃ ca kati svit tā vi yojanā /
analyzed: dhanva ca yat kṛntatram ca kati svid tā vi yojanā
translated: How many are those two, the bow and the net, the plans?

original: nedīyaso vṛṣākape 'stam ehi gṛhāṃ upa viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: nedīyasaḥ vṛṣākape stam ehi gṛhān upa viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: O Vrishâkapi, come back to the house, O Indra, is superior to all.

original: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai /
analyzed: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai
translated: Come back, O Vrishâkapi, let us arrange good fortune.

original: ya eṣa svapnanaṃśano 'stam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa svapnanaṃśano stam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: You who go back on the path, eating the dream-eater, O Indra, is superior to all.

original: yad udañco vṛṣākape gṛham indrājagantana /
analyzed: yat udañcaḥ vṛṣākape gṛham indra ajagantana
translated: When you, O Vrishâkapi, went to the house, O Indra,

original: kva sya pulvagho mṛgaḥ kam agañ janayopano viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: kva sya pulu aghaḥ mṛgaḥ kam agam jana yopanaḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: where is that old deer? Which man did you go to? O Indra, is superior to all.

original: parśur ha nāma mānavī sākaṃ sasūva viṃśatim /
analyzed: parśuḥ ha nāma mānavī sākam sasūva viṃśatim
translated: The one named Parshu, the human, gave birth to twenty at once.

original: bhadram bhala tyasyā abhūd yasyā udaram āmayad viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ //
analyzed: bhadram bhala tyasyāḥ abhūt yasyāḥ udaram viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Blessed is the one whose belly has become diseased; Indra is superior to all.

original: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma /
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma
translated: I warm the powerful one who slays the Rakshasas; I go to the widest shelter, to Mitra.

original: śiśāno agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam //🔽ayodaṃṣṭro arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam  ayaḥ daṃṣṭraḥ arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ
translated: Agni, sharpened by the holy rites, well-kindled, may he protect us by day and night from evil.🔽With your flame, O all-knower, well-kindled, touch the Rakshasas with your iron fangs.

original: ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravyādo vṛktvy api dhatsvāsan //
analyzed: ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravyādaḥ vṛktvī api dhatsva āsan
translated: With your tongue, seize the evil-minded ones; devour the flesh-eaters, O chosen one.

original: ubhobhayāvinn upa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśāno 'varam paraṃ ca /
analyzed: ubhā ubhayāvin upa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśānaḥ varam param ca
translated: O you who go both ways, set your fangs, the fierce one, sharpening the lower and the upper.

original: utāntarikṣe pari yāhi rājañ jambhaiḥ saṃ dhehy abhi yātudhānān //
analyzed: uta antarikṣe pari yāhi rājam jambhaiḥ sam dhehi abhi yātudhānān
translated: O king, go around in the atmosphere; bind the Rakshasas with your jaws.

original: yajñair iṣūḥ saṃnamamāno agne vācā śalyāṃ aśanibhir dihānaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ iṣūḥ saṃnamamānaḥ agne vācā śalyām aśanibhiḥ dihānaḥ
translated: O Agni, aiming your arrows with sacrifices, anointing your darts with speech and thunderbolts,

original: tābhir vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīco bāhūn prati bhaṅdhy eṣām //
analyzed: tābhiḥ vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīcaḥ bāhūn prati bhaṅdhi eṣām
translated: With them pierce the Rakshasas in the heart; break their arms back towards themselves.

original: agne tvacaṃ yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsrāśanir harasā hantv enam /
analyzed: agne tvacam yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsra aśaniḥ harasā hantu enam
translated: O Agni, break the skin of the Rakshasa; may the fierce thunderbolt kill him with its power.

original: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyāt kraviṣṇur vi cinotu vṛkṇam //
analyzed: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyād kraviṣṇuḥ vi cinotu vṛkṇam
translated: O Jātavedas, loosen the joints of him, let the flesh-devouring, flesh-eating one tear asunder what is torn.

original: yatredānīm paśyasi jātavedas tiṣṭhantam agna uta vā carantam /
analyzed: yatra idānīm paśyasi jātavedaḥ tiṣṭhantam agne uta vā carantam
translated: Where now, O Jātavedas, thou seest him standing, O Agni, or moving about,

original: yad vāntarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantaṃ tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ //
analyzed: yat vā antarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantam tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ
translated: Or him flying through the paths in the atmosphere, sharpen thy dart and pierce him.

original: utālabdhaṃ spṛṇuhi jātaveda ālebhānād ṛṣṭibhir yātudhānāt /
analyzed: uta ālabdham spṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ ālebhānāt ṛṣṭibhiḥ yātudhānāt
translated: And what thou findest, O Jātavedas, seize it, with thy burning spears, from the Yātudhāna who licks,

original: agne pūrvo ni jahi śośucāna āmādaḥ kṣviṅkās tam adantv enīḥ //
analyzed: agne pūrvaḥ ni jahi śośucānaḥ āmādaḥ kṣviṅkāḥ tam adantu enīḥ
translated: O Agni, burn him first who shines forth, let the raw-devouring, black-teethed ones devour him.

original: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ so agne yo yātudhāno ya idaṃ kṛṇoti /
analyzed: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ saḥ agne yaḥ yātudhānaḥ yaḥ idam kṛṇoti
translated: Here declare, O Agni, who he is, O Agni, who this Yātudhāna does,

original: tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛcakṣasaś cakṣuṣe randhayainam //
analyzed: tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛ cakṣasaḥ cakṣuṣe randhaya enam
translated: Seize him with the kindling-stick, O youngest, and for the eye of the men, give him to destruction.

original: tīkṣṇenāgne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcaṃ vasubhyaḥ pra ṇaya pracetaḥ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇena agne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcam vasubhyaḥ pra naya pracetaḥ
translated: With thy sharp eye, O Agni, guard the sacrifice, O wise one, lead it forward to the Vasus.

original: hiṃsraṃ rakṣāṃsy abhi śośucānam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānā nṛcakṣaḥ //
analyzed: hiṃsram rakṣāṃsi abhi śośucānam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: Let not the Yātudhānas, O thou of human eyes, harm thee, the fierce one, shining upon the Raksases.

original: nṛcakṣā rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhy agrā /
analyzed: nṛ cakṣāḥ rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhi agrā
translated: O thou of human eyes, look around upon the Raksas, crush down his three heads.

original: tasyāgne pṛṣṭīr harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlaṃ yātudhānasya vṛśca //
analyzed: tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca
translated: With thy flame, O Agni, crush his ribs, cut off in three places the root of the mischief-maker.

original: trir yātudhānaḥ prasitiṃ ta etv ṛtaṃ yo agne anṛtena hanti /
analyzed: tris yātudhānaḥ prasitim te etu ṛtam yaḥ agne anṛtena hanti
translated: Three times let the mischief-maker go to destruction, he who, O Agni, with untruth strikes the truth-speaker.

original: tam arciṣā sphūrjayañ jātavedaḥ samakṣam enaṃ gṛṇate ni vṛṅdhi //🔽tad agne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujaṃ yena paśyasi yātudhānam /
analyzed: tam arciṣā sphūrjayam jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam gṛṇate ni vṛṅdhi  tat agne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujam yena paśyasi yātudhānam
translated: With thy flame, O all-knower, drive him away, and deliver him up to the singer face to face.🔽O Agni, the singer, restore to us that eye whereby we may behold the mischief-maker.

original: atharvavaj jyotiṣā daivyena satyaṃ dhūrvantam acitaṃ ny oṣa //
analyzed: atharva vat jyotiṣā daivyena satyam dhūrvantam acitam ni oṣa
translated: With the divine light of the Atharvan, O Agni, drive away the wicked, the deceitful.

original: yad agne adya mithunā śapāto yad vācas tṛṣṭaṃ janayanta rebhāḥ /
analyzed: yat agne adya mithunā śapātaḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ
translated: Whatever, O Agni, the pairs of birds have cursed today, whatever the Rishis have uttered in wrath,

original: manyor manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān //
analyzed: manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān
translated: The arrow of anger and of mind is shot: with it pierce the hearts of the mischief-makers.

original: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parāgne rakṣo harasā śṛṇīhi /🔽parārciṣā mūradevāñ chṛṇīhi parāsutṛpo abhi śośucānaḥ //
analyzed: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi  parā arciṣā mūradevām śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ abhi śośucānaḥ
translated: Destroy the mischief-makers with thy heat, O Agni, destroy the Rakshas with thy flame.🔽Destroy the worshippers of the Muras with thy flame, O thou who art bright and insatiable.

original: parādya devā vṛjinaṃ śṛṇantu pratyag enaṃ śapathā yantu tṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: parā adya devāḥ vṛjinam śṛṇantu pratyak enam śapathāḥ yantu tṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Let the gods today destroy the wicked one: let the angry curses return to him.

original: vācāstenaṃ śarava ṛcchantu marman viśvasyaitu prasitiṃ yātudhānaḥ //
analyzed: vācāstenam śaravaḥ ṛcchantu marman viśvasya aitu prasitim yātudhānaḥ
translated: Let the words of the singer reach his vitals: let the mischief-maker sink into destruction.

original: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yo aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yaḥ aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ
translated: He who anoints himself with the blood of human beings, the demon who has a horse as his victim,

original: yo aghnyāyā bharati kṣīram agne teṣāṃ śīrṣāṇi harasāpi vṛśca //
analyzed: yaḥ aghnyāyāḥ bharati kṣīram agne teṣām śīrṣāṇi harasā api vṛśca
translated: He who milks the cow for the sacrifice, O Agni, crush with thy flame their heads to pieces.

original: saṃvatsarīṇam paya usriyāyās tasya māśīd yātudhāno nṛcakṣaḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsarīṇam payaḥ usriyāyāḥ tasya mā aśīt yātudhānaḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: The demon with human eyes shall not drink of the cow's milk which is a year old.

original: pīyūṣam agne yatamas titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marman //🔽viṣaṃ gavāṃ yātudhānāḥ pibantv ā vṛścyantām aditaye durevāḥ /
analyzed: pīyūṣam agne yatamaḥ titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marman  viṣam gavām yātudhānāḥ pibantu ā vṛścyantām aditaye durevāḥ
translated: O Agni, pierce to the heart him who would fain taste the sweet juice.🔽Let the demons drink the poison of the cows; let the evil spirits be cut off from Aditi.

original: parainān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnāṃ jayantām //
analyzed: parā enān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnām jayantām
translated: Let the god Savitar give them up; let them be defeated, the portion of the plants.

original: sanād agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ /
analyzed: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ
translated: From of old, O Agni, thou crushest the demons; the Raksases have not conquered thee in battle.

original: anu daha sahamūrān kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣata daivyāyāḥ //
analyzed: anu daha sahamūrān kravyādaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ
translated: Burn the flesh-eaters with thy flame, O thou of mighty strength; let not the arrow of the gods overtake thee.

original: tvaṃ no agne adharād udaktāt tvam paścād uta rakṣā purastāt /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne adharāt udaktāt tvam paścāt uta rakṣa purastāt
translated: From below, O Agni, from above, from behind, and from the front, protect us.

original: prati te te ajarāsas tapiṣṭhā aghaśaṃsaṃ śośucato dahantu //
analyzed: prati te te ajarāsaḥ tapiṣṭhāḥ agha śaṃsam śośucataḥ dahantu
translated: Let thy most burning, undecaying flames burn up the evil-doer who is inflamed with hate.

original: paścāt purastād adharād udaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhi rājan /
analyzed: paścāt purastāt adharāt udaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhi rājan
translated: From behind, from the front, from below, and from above, O wise one, protect us with thy wisdom, O king.

original: sakhe sakhāyam ajaro jarimṇe 'gne martāṃ amartyas tvaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: sakhe sakhāyam ajaraḥ jarimṇe gne martām amartyaḥ tvam naḥ
translated: O immortal one, as a friend, protect your friend from old age, O Agni, you who are mortal among mortals.

original: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi
translated: We will think of you, O Agni, as a fortress, as a sage, as a conqueror,

original: dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ divedive hantāram bhaṅgurāvatām //🔽viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati ṣma rakṣaso daha /
analyzed: dhṛṣat varṇam dive dive hantāram bhaṅgurāvatām  viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣasaḥ daha
translated: as one with a keen edge, day by day, as a destroyer of the unsteady ones.🔽With poison, O unsteady one, burn the Rakshas with the frost.

original: agne tigmena śociṣā tapuragrābhir ṛṣṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: agne tigmena śociṣā tapuḥ agrābhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, with your sharp flame, with your spears that grasp quickly.

original: praty agne mithunā daha yātudhānā kimīdinā /
analyzed: prati agne mithunā daha yātudhānā kimīdinā
translated: Burn the pairs, O Agni, the Yatudhanas and the Kimidins.

original: saṃ tvā śiśāmi jāgṛhy adabdhaṃ vipra manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: sam tvā śiśāmi jāgṛhi adabdham vipra manmabhiḥ
translated: I enkindle you, O watchful one, the undeceivable one, O sage, with my thoughts.

original: praty agne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvataḥ prati /
analyzed: prati agne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvatas prati
translated: Burn with your flame, O Agni, the flame, from all sides, O Agni,

original: yātudhānasya rakṣaso balaṃ vi ruja vīryam //
analyzed: yātudhānasya rakṣasaḥ balam vi ruja vīryam
translated: the strength of the Yatudhani Rakshas, break her power and her vigor.

original: haviṣ pāntam ajaraṃ svarvidi divispṛśy āhutaṃ juṣṭam agnau /
analyzed: haviḥ pāntam ajaram svar vidi divispṛśi āhutam juṣṭam agnau
translated: The one who protects the oblation, the ageless one, in the heaven of heaven, invoked, pleasing in the fire,

original: tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devā dharmaṇe kaṃ svadhayā paprathanta //
analyzed: tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devāḥ dharmaṇe kam svadhayā paprathanta
translated: For his bearing, for the world, the gods have extended him in his own nature, in his law.

original: gīrṇam bhuvanaṃ tamasāpagūḷham āviḥ svar abhavaj jāte agnau /
analyzed: gīrṇam bhuvanam tamasā apagūḍham āvis svar abhavat jāte agnau
translated: The world, swallowed by darkness, covered, became manifest in the heaven when Agni was born.

original: tasya devāḥ pṛthivī dyaur utāpo 'raṇayann oṣadhīḥ sakhye asya //
analyzed: tasya devāḥ pṛthivī dyauḥ uta apaḥ raṇayan oṣadhīḥ sakhye asya
translated: The gods, the earth, the sky, and the waters, the plants, have brought him forth for his friendship.

original: devebhir nv iṣito yajñiyebhir agniṃ stoṣāṇy ajaram bṛhantam /
analyzed: devebhiḥ nu iṣitaḥ yajñiyebhiḥ agnim stoṣāṇi ajaram bṛhantam
translated: Urged on by the gods who are worthy of sacrifice, I will praise Agni, the imperishable great one,

original: yo bhānunā pṛthivīṃ dyām utemām ātatāna rodasī antarikṣam //
analyzed: yaḥ bhānunā pṛthivīm dyām uta imām ātatāna rodasī antarikṣam
translated: Who with his light has stretched out this earth and this sky, and the two world-halves and the atmosphere between them.

original: yo hotāsīt prathamo devajuṣṭo yaṃ samāñjann ājyenā vṛṇānāḥ /🔽sa patatrītvaraṃ sthā jagad yac chvātram agnir akṛṇoj jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ hotā āsīt prathamaḥ deva juṣṭaḥ yam samāñjan ājyena ā vṛṇānāḥ  sa patatrītvaram sthāḥ jagat yat śvātram agniḥ akṛṇot jātavedāḥ
translated: He who was the first Hotar, dear to the gods, whom they anointed with ghee, choosing him,🔽He made the moving and the unmoving, the earth and the sky, and the light of heaven, O Agni Jâtavedas.

original: yaj jātavedo bhuvanasya mūrdhann atiṣṭho agne saha rocanena /
analyzed: yat jātavedaḥ bhuvanasya mūrdhan atiṣṭhaḥ agne saha rocanena
translated: O Agni Jâtavedas, who standest on the head of the world, O Agni, with thy light,

original: taṃ tvāhema matibhir gīrbhir ukthaiḥ sa yajñiyo abhavo rodasiprāḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā ahema matibhiḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ sa yajñiyaḥ abhavaḥ rodasi prāḥ
translated: Thee we approach with our thoughts, with our songs, with our hymns. Thou hast become worthy of sacrifice, thou who fillest the two world-halves.

original: mūrdhā bhuvo bhavati naktam agnis tataḥ sūryo jāyate prātar udyan /
analyzed: mūrdhā bhuvaḥ bhavati naktam agniḥ tatas sūryaḥ jāyate prātar udyan
translated: He is the head of the earth, he is Agni at night, from him the sun is born, rising in the morning.

original: māyām ū tu yajñiyānām etām apo yat tūrṇiś carati prajānan //
analyzed: māyām u tu yajñiyānām etām apaḥ yat tūrṇiḥ carati prajānan
translated: This is the magic of the worthy ones, which the swift one knows, when he moves through the waters.

original: dṛśenyo yo mahinā samiddho 'rocata diviyonir vibhāvā /🔽tasminn agnau sūktavākena devā havir viśva ājuhavus tanūpāḥ //
analyzed: dṛśenyaḥ yaḥ mahinā samiddhaḥ rocata diviyoniḥ vibhāvā  tasmin agnau sūktavākena devāḥ haviḥ viśve ājuhavuḥ tanū pāḥ
translated: He who is to be seen, who is great, who is kindled with his own power, who shines forth, whose birthplace is the sky, who is radiant,🔽In that fire the gods, with the Sûktavâka, offered oblations, all of them, for the protection of their bodies.

original: sūktavākam prathamam ād id agnim ād id dhavir ajanayanta devāḥ /
analyzed: sūktavākam prathamam āt id agnim āt id haviḥ ajanayanta devāḥ
translated: The Sûktavâka, indeed, is the first Agni. In the Sûktavâka the gods produced the first oblation.

original: sa eṣāṃ yajño abhavat tanūpās taṃ dyaur veda tam pṛthivī tam āpaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ eṣām yajñaḥ abhavat tanū pāḥ tam dyauḥ veda tam pṛthivī tam āpaḥ
translated: He became their protector in the sacrifice. Heaven knows him, Earth knows him, and the waters know him.

original: yaṃ devāso 'janayantāgniṃ yasminn ājuhavur bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ janayanta agnim yasmin ājuhavuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: The Agni whom the gods generated, in whom they offered all the worlds,

original: so arciṣā pṛthivīṃ dyām utemām ṛjūyamāno atapan mahitvā //
analyzed: saḥ arciṣā pṛthivīm dyām uta imām ṛjūyamānaḥ atapat mahitvā
translated: He, with his flame, has heated the earth and this sky, straightening himself through his greatness.

original: stomena hi divi devāso agnim ajījanañ chaktibhī rodasiprām /
analyzed: stomena hi divi devāsaḥ agnim ajījanam śaktibhiḥ rodasiprām
translated: For by the Stoma the gods in heaven generated Agni, the supporter of the two worlds by his powers.

original: tam ū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kaṃ sa oṣadhīḥ pacati viśvarūpāḥ //
analyzed: tam u akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kam saḥ oṣadhīḥ pacati viśva rūpāḥ
translated: They made him threefold, to be in three places. He cooks the plants of all forms.

original: yaded enam adadhur yajñiyāso divi devāḥ sūryam āditeyam /
analyzed: yadā id enam adadhuḥ yajñiyāsaḥ divi devāḥ sūryam āditeyam
translated: When the divine ones placed him, the sun, the son of Aditi, in the sky,

original: yadā cariṣṇū mithunāv abhūtām ād it prāpaśyan bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: yadā cariṣṇū mithunau abhūtām āt id prāpaśyan bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: When the two moving twins became, then indeed he saw all the worlds.

original: viśvasmā agnim bhuvanāya devā vaiśvānaraṃ ketum ahnām akṛṇvan /
analyzed: viśvasmai agnim bhuvanāya devāḥ vaiśvānaram ketum ahnām akṛṇvan
translated: The gods made Agni Vaiśvānara the light of the days for all the worlds.

original: ā yas tatānoṣaso vibhātīr apo ūrṇoti tamo arciṣā yan //🔽vaiśvānaraṃ kavayo yajñiyāso 'gniṃ devā ajanayann ajuryam /
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatāna uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ apaḥ ūrṇoti tamaḥ arciṣā yan  vaiśvānaram kavayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ gnim devāḥ ajanayan ajuryam
translated: He who stretches out the shining dawns, who with his flame removes the darkness.🔽The wise, the holy, the gods generated Agni Vaiśvānara, the imperishable one.

original: nakṣatram pratnam aminac cariṣṇu yakṣasyādhyakṣaṃ taviṣam bṛhantam //
analyzed: nakṣatram pratnam aminat cariṣṇu yakṣasya adhyakṣam taviṣam bṛhantam
translated: The moving star, the ancient one, the lord of wealth, the mighty, the great one.

original: vaiśvānaraṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam mantrair agniṃ kavim acchā vadāmaḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānaram viśvahā dīdivāṃsam mantraiḥ agnim kavim acchā vadāmaḥ
translated: We address with hymns the wise Agni, Vaiśvānara, shining in every house,

original: yo mahimnā paribabhūvorvī utāvastād uta devaḥ parastāt //
analyzed: yaḥ mahimnā paribabhūva urvī uta avastāt uta devaḥ parastāt
translated: The god who hath encompassed the two wide regions, and is beyond and above.

original: dve srutī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇām ahaṃ devānām uta martyānām /
analyzed: dve srutī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇām aham devānām uta martyānām
translated: I have heard two paths of the fathers, of the gods and of mortals.

original: tābhyām idaṃ viśvam ejat sam eti yad antarā pitaram mātaraṃ ca //
analyzed: tābhyām idam viśvam ejat sam eti yat antarā pitaram mātaram ca
translated: On these two this moving world is gathered together, that which is between father and mother.

original: dve samīcī bibhṛtaś carantaṃ śīrṣato jātam manasā vimṛṣṭam /
analyzed: dve samīcī bibhṛtaḥ carantam śīrṣataḥ jātam manasā vimṛṣṭam
translated: The two straight-going supporters carry him, born from the head, measured by the mind.

original: sa pratyaṅ viśvā bhuvanāni tasthāv aprayucchan taraṇir bhrājamānaḥ //🔽yatrā vadete avaraḥ paraś ca yajñanyoḥ kataro nau vi veda /
analyzed: sa pratyaṅ viśvā bhuvanāni tasthau aprayucchan taraṇiḥ bhrājamānaḥ  yatrā vadete avaraḥ paraḥ ca yajñanyoḥ kataraḥ nau vi veda
translated: He stands facing all the worlds, not blinking, the swift one shining.🔽Where the lower and the higher speak, which of the two knows us at the sacrifice?

original: ā śekur it sadhamādaṃ sakhāyo nakṣanta yajñaṃ ka idaṃ vi vocat //
analyzed: ā śekuḥ id sadhamādam sakhāyaḥ nakṣanta yajñam kaḥ idam vi vocat
translated: The friends have been able to reach the place of assembly. They hasten to the sacrifice. Who will tell this to you?

original: katy agnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ katy uṣāsaḥ katy u svid āpaḥ /
analyzed: kati agnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ kati uṣāsaḥ kati u svid āpaḥ
translated: How many are the fires, how many suns, how many dawns, and how many waters?

original: nopaspijaṃ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi pṛcchāmi vaḥ kavayo vidmane kam //
analyzed: na upaspijam vaḥ pitaraḥ vadāmi pṛcchāmi vaḥ kavayaḥ vidmane kam
translated: I do not speak to you, O fathers, who are not purified. I ask you, O wise ones, for the sake of knowledge.

original: yāvanmātram uṣaso na pratīkaṃ suparṇyo vasate mātariśvaḥ /
analyzed: yāvanmātram uṣasaḥ na pratīkam suparṇyaḥ vasate mātariśvaḥ
translated: As far as the appearance of the dawns extends, O Suparṇī, Vāsati, and Mātarīṣva,

original: tāvad dadhāty upa yajñam āyan brāhmaṇo hotur avaro niṣīdan //🔽indraṃ stavā nṛtamaṃ yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmo antān /
analyzed: tāvat dadhāti upa yajñam āyan brāhmaṇaḥ hotuḥ avaraḥ niṣīdan  indram stavā nṛtamam yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmaḥ antān
translated: So long as he supports the sacrifice, the Brahman, sitting down below the Hotri,🔽Praise Indra, best of men, by whose greatness he hath filled the luminous realms and the ends of the earth,

original: ā yaḥ paprau carṣaṇīdhṛd varobhiḥ pra sindhubhyo riricāno mahitvā //
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau carṣaṇī dhṛt varobhiḥ pra sindhubhyaḥ riricānaḥ mahitvā
translated: He who hath spread out with his boons, the supporter of men, overflowing with greatness beyond the rivers.

original: sa sūryaḥ pary urū varāṃsy endro vavṛtyād rathyeva cakrā /
analyzed: sa sūryaḥ pari urū varāṃsi ā indraḥ vavṛtyāt rathyā iva cakrā
translated: That Sûrya hath encompassed the wide realms, Indra hath turned back like a chariot wheel,

original: atiṣṭhantam apasyaṃ na sargaṃ kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi tviṣyā jaghāna //
analyzed: atiṣṭhantam apasyam na sargam kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi tviṣyā jaghāna
translated: The uncreated, unperceived, standing, he hath smitten the dark gloom with his radiance.

original: samānam asmā anapāvṛd arca kṣmayā divo asamam brahma navyam /
analyzed: samānam asmai anapāvṛt arca kṣmayā divaḥ asamam brahma navyam
translated: He hath made the new prayer of the unequal heaven equal to this (prayer),

original: vi yaḥ pṛṣṭheva janimāny arya indraś cikāya na sakhāyam īṣe //
analyzed: vi yaḥ pṛṣṭhā iva janimāni aryaḥ indraḥ cikāya na sakhāyam īṣe
translated: He who, like a back, hath measured out the generations, Aryaman, Indra, seeketh not a friend.

original: indrāya giro aniśitasargā apaḥ prerayaṃ sagarasya budhnāt /
analyzed: indrāya giraḥ aniśita sargāḥ apaḥ prerayam sagarasya budhnāt
translated: To Indra the songs with their keen courses have sent the waters from the depths of the ocean,

original: yo akṣeṇeva cakriyā śacībhir viṣvak tastambha pṛthivīm uta dyām //
analyzed: yaḥ akṣeṇa iva cakriyā śacībhiḥ viṣvak tastambha pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: Who with his might, as with a pin, hath fixed on every side the earth and the sky.

original: āpāntamanyus tṛpalaprabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvāñ charumāṃ ṛjīṣī /
analyzed: āpāntamanyuḥ tṛpala prabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvān śarumān ṛjīṣī
translated: With his wrath restrained, with his anger held back, with his strength increased, with his roar, with his speed, with his arrow, with his shaft,

original: somo viśvāny atasā vanāni nārvāg indram pratimānāni debhuḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ viśvāni atasā vanāni na arvāk indram pratimānāni debhuḥ
translated: Soma hath overcome all the forests that are hard to subdue. The people have not brought Indra his due measure.

original: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī na dhanva nāntarikṣaṃ nādrayaḥ somo akṣāḥ /
analyzed: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī na dhanva na antarikṣam na adrayaḥ somaḥ akṣāḥ
translated: Whose are not the heavens and earth, not the wide air, not the mountains, not the waters, O Soma?

original: yad asya manyur adhinīyamānaḥ śṛṇāti vīḷu rujati sthirāṇi //🔽jaghāna vṛtraṃ svadhitir vaneva ruroja puro aradan na sindhūn /
analyzed: yat asya manyuḥ adhinīyamānaḥ śṛṇāti vīḷu rujati sthirāṇi  jaghāna vṛtram svadhitiḥ vanā iva ruroja puraḥ aradat na sindhūn
translated: When his wrath is excited, he destroys, he breaks the firm things, as a wild boar breaks down the trees.🔽He has slain Vritra, as an axe a tree; he has cleft the forts, as a plough the rivers.

original: bibheda giriṃ navam in na kumbham ā gā indro akṛṇuta svayugbhiḥ //
analyzed: bibheda girim navam id na kumbham ā gāḥ indraḥ akṛṇuta svayugbhiḥ
translated: He has broken the new mountain as a jar; with his friends, Indra has brought forth the kine.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad ṛṇayā indra dhīro 'sir na parva vṛjinā śṛṇāsi /🔽pra ye mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma yujaṃ na janā minanti mitram //
analyzed: tvam ha tyad ṛṇayāḥ indra dhīraḥ siḥ na parva vṛjinā śṛṇāsi  pra ye mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma yujam na janāḥ minanti mitram
translated: Thou, O Indra, art that wise one who with a debt, as an axe with a knotty tree, dost cleave the wicked.🔽They who have made a friend of the law of Mitra and Varuna, as men make a friend of the yoke,

original: pra ye mitram prāryamaṇaṃ durevāḥ pra saṃgiraḥ pra varuṇam minanti /
analyzed: pra ye mitram pra aryamaṇam durevāḥ pra saṃgiraḥ pra varuṇam minanti
translated: They who have made a friend of Mitra, of Aryaman, of the far-seeing one, of Varuna,

original: ny amitreṣu vadham indra tumraṃ vṛṣan vṛṣāṇam aruṣaṃ śiśīhi //
analyzed: ni amitreṣu vadham indra tumram vṛṣan vṛṣāṇam aruṣam śiśīhi
translated: On the enemies, O Indra, sharpen the strong, the manly, the red weapon, O bull.

original: indro diva indra īśe pṛthivyā indro apām indra it parvatānām /
analyzed: indraḥ divaḥ indraḥ īśe pṛthivyāḥ indraḥ apām indraḥ id parvatānām
translated: Indra is the lord of the sky, Indra is the lord of the earth, Indra is of the waters, Indra is of the mountains.

original: indro vṛdhām indra in medhirāṇām indraḥ kṣeme yoge havya indraḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ vṛdhām indraḥ id medhirāṇām indraḥ kṣeme yoge havyaḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra is of the prosperous, Indra is of the wise, Indra is to be invoked in peace and in the yoke.

original: prāktubhya indraḥ pra vṛdho ahabhyaḥ prāntarikṣāt pra samudrasya dhāseḥ /
analyzed: pra aktubhyaḥ indraḥ pra vṛdhaḥ ahabhyaḥ pra antarikṣāt pra samudrasya dhāseḥ
translated: Indra from the east, from the west, from the north, from the south, from the sky, from the ocean's abode,

original: pra vātasya prathasaḥ pra jmo antāt pra sindhubhyo ririce pra kṣitibhyaḥ //
analyzed: pra vātasya prathasaḥ pra jmaḥ antāt pra sindhubhyaḥ ririce pra kṣitibhyaḥ
