translated: From the wind's rush, from the ends of the earth, from the rivers, from the abodes, he is exalted.

original: pra śośucatyā uṣaso na ketur asinvā te vartatām indra hetiḥ /
analyzed: pra śośucatyāḥ uṣasaḥ na ketuḥ asinvān te vartatām indra hetiḥ
translated: Like the dawn's banner, shining forth, let thy dart, O Indra, be unerring.

original: aśmeva vidhya diva ā sṛjānas tapiṣṭhena heṣasā droghamitrān //
analyzed: aśmā iva vidhya divaḥ ā sṛjānaḥ tapiṣṭhena heṣasā drogha mitrān
translated: Like a stone, piercing the sky, drive away with thy most burning roar the treacherous foes.

original: anv aha māsā anv id vanāny anv oṣadhīr anu parvatāsaḥ /
analyzed: anu aha māsāḥ anu id vanāni anu oṣadhīḥ anu parvatāsaḥ
translated: The months follow thee, the woods, the plants, the mountains.

original: anv indraṃ rodasī vāvaśāne anv āpo ajihata jāyamānam //
analyzed: anu indram rodasī vāvaśāne anu āpaḥ ajihata jāyamānam
translated: The two world-halves, O Indra, in their longing, the waters have followed thee as thou wast born.

original: karhi svit sā ta indra cetyāsad aghasya yad bhinado rakṣa eṣat /
analyzed: karhi svid sā te indra cetyā asat aghasya yat bhinadaḥ rakṣaḥ eṣat
translated: When, O Indra, wilt thou be inclined to that, to the slaying of the Raksases, to the destruction of evil,

original: mitrakruvo yac chasane na gāvaḥ pṛthivyā āpṛg amuyā śayante //
analyzed: mitra kruvaḥ yat śasane na gāvaḥ pṛthivyāḥ āpṛś amuyā śayante
translated: When, like cows in the judgment of a friend, they shall lie down on the earth, on the wide plain?

original: śatrūyanto abhi ye nas tatasre mahi vrādhanta ogaṇāsa indra /
analyzed: śatrūyantaḥ abhi ye naḥ tatasre mahi vrādhantaḥ ogaṇāsaḥ indra
translated: Those who have risen up against us, O Indra, who are hostile, who are mighty, who are in bands,

original: andhenāmitrās tamasā sacantāṃ sujyotiṣo aktavas tāṃ abhi ṣyuḥ //
analyzed: andhena amitrāḥ tamasā sacantām su jyotiṣaḥ aktavaḥ tām abhi syuḥ
translated: Let them lie down with their foes in the darkness, let them go to the darkness, the light-destroyers.

original: purūṇi hi tvā savanā janānām brahmāṇi mandan gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām /
analyzed: purūṇi hi tvā savanā janānām brahmāṇi mandan gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
translated: For many are the libations of the people, the prayers of the singing Rsis delight thee.

original: imām āghoṣann avasā sahūtiṃ tiro viśvāṃ arcato yāhy arvāṅ //
analyzed: imām āghoṣan avasā sahūtim tiras viśvān arcataḥ yāhi arvāṅ
translated: This have I uttered, calling thee to the assembly: come hitherward, O thou who hearest all our songs.

original: evā te vayam indra bhuñjatīnāṃ vidyāma sumatīnāṃ navānām /🔽vidyāma vastor avasā gṛṇanto viśvāmitrā uta ta indra nūnam //
analyzed: eva te vayam indra bhuñjatīnām vidyāma sumatīnām navānām  vidyāma vastoḥ avasā gṛṇantaḥ viśvāmitrāḥ uta te indra nūnam
translated: So may we, Indra, find thee, when we call thee, in the enjoyment of thy newest and kindest favours.🔽May we, O Indra, find thee, when we call thee, in the enjoyment of thy newest and kindest favours.🔽May we, O Indra, find thee, when we call thee, in the enjoyment of thy newest and kindest favours.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bounteous Indra, best of heroes in this fight for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The terrible One who listens to our call in battles, the slayer of foes, the winner of possessions.

original: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt /
analyzed: sahasra śīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The Person is a thousand-headed, a thousand-eyed, a thousand-footed.

original: sa bhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvāty atiṣṭhad daśāṅgulam //🔽puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhavyam /
analyzed: sa bhūmim viśvatas vṛtvā ati atiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam  puruṣaḥ eva idam sarvam yat bhūtam yat ca bhavyam
translated: He pervades the earth on all sides, and stands beyond ten fingers' breadth.

original: utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yad annenātirohati //
analyzed: uta amṛta tvasya īśānaḥ yat annena atirohati
translated: This Person is all that yet hath been and all that is to be; The Lord of Immortality which waxes greater still by food.

original: etāvān asya mahimāto jyāyāṃś ca pūruṣaḥ /🔽pādo 'sya viśvā bhūtāni tripād asyāmṛtaṃ divi //
analyzed: etāvān asya mahimā atas jyāyān ca pūruṣaḥ  pādaḥ u sya viśvā bhūtāni tri pād asya amṛtam divi
translated: So great is his greatness; greater than he is Purusha.🔽All creatures are one-fourth of him, three-fourths eternal life in heaven.

original: tripād ūrdhva ud ait puruṣaḥ pādo 'syehābhavat punaḥ /
analyzed: tri pād ūrdhvaḥ ud ait puruṣaḥ pādaḥ u sya iha abhavat punar
translated: The Person, rising up, filled the three quarters, above and below and around.

original: tato viṣvaṅ vy akrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi //
analyzed: tatas viṣvaṅ vi akrāmat sa aśana anaśane abhi
translated: From him was born what breathes and what not breathes, all the world's creatures.

original: tasmād virāḷ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt virāj ajāyata virājaḥ adhi pūruṣaḥ
translated: From that Virāj was born, and from Virāj the Purusha.

original: sa jāto aty aricyata paścād bhūmim atho puraḥ //
analyzed: sa jātaḥ ati aricyata paścāt bhūmim atha u puras
translated: When he was born, he extended beyond death, beyond this earth, and beyond this heaven.

original: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñam atanvata /
analyzed: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devāḥ yajñam atanvata
translated: When the gods performed the sacrifice with the Purusha as the sacrificial offering,

original: vasanto asyāsīd ājyaṃ grīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ //
analyzed: vasantaḥ asya āsīt ājyam grīṣmaḥ idhmaḥ śarad haviḥ
translated: the spring was its clarified butter, the summer its fuel, and the autumn its oblation.

original: taṃ yajñam barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātam agrataḥ /
analyzed: tam yajñam barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣam jātam agratas
translated: They sprinkled that sacrifice on the sacrificial grass, the Purusha who was born first.

original: tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaś ca ye //
analyzed: tena devāḥ ayajanta sādhyāḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca ye
translated: With him the gods, the Sadhyas, and the Rishis performed the sacrifice.

original: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ sambhṛtam pṛṣadājyam /
analyzed: tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ sambhṛtam pṛṣadājyam
translated: From that sacrifice, offered with all oblations, the speckled ghee was produced.

original: paśūn tāṃś cakre vāyavyān āraṇyān grāmyāś ca ye //🔽tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire /
analyzed: paśūn tān cakre vāyavyān āraṇyān grāmyāḥ ca ye  tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire
translated: He made those animals, the wild ones and those of the village, the offerings to Vayu.🔽From that sacrifice, offered with all oblations, the Rik and Saman verses were born.

original: chandāṃsi jajñire tasmād yajus tasmād ajāyata //
analyzed: chandāṃsi jajñire tasmāt yajuḥ tasmāt ajāyata
translated: The metres were born from it, and from it the Yajus was born.

original: tasmād aśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt aśvāḥ ajāyanta ye ke ca ubhaya adataḥ
translated: From it were born the horses, and all animals with two rows of teeth.

original: gāvo ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāj jātā ajāvayaḥ //
analyzed: gāvaḥ ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāt jātāḥ aja avayaḥ
translated: From it the cows were born, and from it the goats and sheep were born.

original: yat puruṣaṃ vy adadhuḥ katidhā vy akalpayan /
analyzed: yat puruṣam vi adadhuḥ katidhā vi akalpayan
translated: When they divided the Purusha how many portions did they make?

original: mukhaṃ kim asya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete //
analyzed: mukham kim asya kau bāhū kau ūrū pādau ucyete
translated: What was his mouth? What were his two arms? What do they call his two thighs and two feet?

original: brāhmaṇo 'sya mukham āsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ sya mukham āsīt bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: His mouth became the Brahmin, his two arms were made into the Kshatriya,

original: ūrū tad asya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāṃ śūdro ajāyata //
analyzed: ūrū tat asya yat vaiśyaḥ padbhyām śūdraḥ ajāyata
translated: The thighs are his, what is the Vaiśya, from the feet was born the Śūdra.

original: candramā manaso jātaś cakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata /
analyzed: candramāḥ manasaḥ jātaḥ cakṣoḥ sūryaḥ ajāyata
translated: The moon was born from the mind, from the eye the sun was born.

original: mukhād indraś cāgniś ca prāṇād vāyur ajāyata //🔽nābhyā āsīd antarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ sam avartata /
analyzed: mukhāt indraḥ ca agniḥ ca prāṇāt vāyuḥ ajāyata  nābhyāḥ āsīt antarikṣam śīrṣṇaḥ dyauḥ sam avartata
translated: From the mouth Indra and Agni were born, from the breath the wind was born.🔽From the navel was the atmosphere, from the head the sky was formed.

original: padbhyām bhūmir diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokāṃ akalpayan //
analyzed: padbhyām bhūmiḥ diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā
translated: From the feet the earth, from the ears the quarters, thus they arranged the worlds.

original: saptāsyāsan paridhayas triḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ /🔽devā yad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣam paśum //🔽yajñena yajñam ayajanta devās tāni dharmāṇi prathamāny āsan /
analyzed: sapta asya āsan paridhayaḥ tris sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ  devāḥ yat yajñam tanvānāḥ abadhnan puruṣam paśum  yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan
translated: He had seven enclosing sticks, three times seven kindling sticks were made.🔽When the gods were performing the sacrifice, they bound Puruṣa as an animal.🔽The gods worshipped the sacrifice with the sacrifice, those were the first rites.

original: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ //
analyzed: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ
translated: Those of great glory attend on the vault, where the Sādhyas, the ancient gods, are.

original: saṃ jāgṛvadbhir jaramāṇa idhyate dame damūnā iṣayann iḷas pade /🔽viśvasya hotā haviṣo vareṇyo vibhur vibhāvā suṣakhā sakhīyate //
analyzed: sam jāgṛvadbhiḥ jaramāṇaḥ idhyate dame damūnāḥ iṣayan iḷaḥ pade  viśvasya hotā haviṣaḥ vareṇyaḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā su sakhā sakhīyate
translated: He is kindled, the wise one, by those who are watchful, in the house, in the house, in the abode, seeking food, in the place of Iḷā.

original: sa darśataśrīr atithir gṛhegṛhe vanevane śiśriye takvavīr iva /
analyzed: sa darśata śrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe gṛhe vanevane śiśriye iva
translated: The all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all-illumining, most excellent Hotṛ of the sacrificial oblation, the all-pervading, all

original: janaṃjanaṃ janyo nāti manyate viśa ā kṣeti viśyo viśaṃviśam //
analyzed: janaṃjanam janyaḥ na ati manyate viśaḥ ā kṣeti viśyaḥ viśam viśam
translated: The people's friend, he is not proud; the people's guest, he dwells among the people, people by people.

original: sudakṣo dakṣaiḥ kratunāsi sukratur agne kaviḥ kāvyenāsi viśvavit /
analyzed: su dakṣaḥ dakṣaiḥ kratunā asi su kratuḥ agne kaviḥ kāvyena asi viśva vid
translated: O Agni, thou art well-skilled with thy skills, well-minded with thy mind, thou art the all-knowing sage with thy wisdom.

original: vasur vasūnāṃ kṣayasi tvam eka id dyāvā ca yāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ //
analyzed: vasuḥ vasūnām kṣayasi tvam ekaḥ id dyāvā ca yāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ
translated: Thou art the single abode of the Vasus, of all that the heaven and earth contain.

original: prajānann agne tava yonim ṛtviyam iḷāyās pade ghṛtavantam āsadaḥ /
analyzed: prajānan agne tava yonim ṛtviyam iḷāyāḥ pade ghṛtavantam āsadaḥ
translated: O Agni, knowing, thou hast sat down in thy proper place, in the lap of Iḷā, anointed with ghee.

original: ā te cikitra uṣasām ivetayo 'repasaḥ sūryasyeva raśmayaḥ //
analyzed: ā te cikitre uṣasām iva ītayaḥ repasaḥ sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ
translated: Thy rays are seen like the rays of the sun, like the dawns' own rays.

original: tava śriyo varṣyasyeva vidyutaś citrāś cikitra uṣasāṃ na ketavaḥ /🔽yad oṣadhīr abhisṛṣṭo vanāni ca pari svayaṃ cinuṣe annam āsye //
analyzed: tava śriyaḥ varṣyasya iva vidyutaḥ citrāḥ cikitre uṣasām na ketavaḥ  yat oṣadhīḥ abhisṛṣṭaḥ vanāni ca pari svayam cinuṣe annam āsye
translated: Thy glories are seen like the flashes of rain, like the banners of the dawns.🔽When, appointed, thou dost consume the plants and the woods, thou dost make food in thy mouth.

original: tam oṣadhīr dadhire garbham ṛtviyaṃ tam āpo agniṃ janayanta mātaraḥ /
analyzed: tam oṣadhīḥ dadhire garbham ṛtviyam tam āpaḥ agnim janayanta mātaraḥ
translated: The plants have received thee as their proper child; the waters, O Agni, the mothers, have generated thee.

original: tam it samānaṃ vaninaś ca vīrudho 'ntarvatīś ca suvate ca viśvahā //
analyzed: tam id samānam vaninaḥ ca vīrudhaḥ ntarvatīḥ ca suvate ca viśvahā
translated: Thee, the common one, the trees and the plants, the enclosed ones and the open ones, all-hail!

original: vātopadhūta iṣito vaśāṃ anu tṛṣu yad annā veviṣad vitiṣṭhase /
analyzed: vāta upadhūtaḥ iṣitaḥ vaśām anu tṛṣu yat annā veviṣat vitiṣṭhase
translated: Urged on by the wind, as thou wishest, along the ridge, when thou dost spread out in the three, O thou who art to be sought for food.

original: ā te yatante rathyo yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsy agne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ //
analyzed: ā te yatante rathyaḥ yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsi agne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ
translated: Thy car-borne (warriors) strive to be ready, each one separately, O Agni, for the undecaying hosts that burn.

original: medhākāraṃ vidathasya prasādhanam agniṃ hotāram paribhūtamam matim /
analyzed: medhā kāram vidathasya prasādhanam agnim hotāram paribhūtamam matim
translated: The inspirer of thought, the completer of the sacrifice, Agni, the Hotar, the most widely spread thought,

original: tam id arbhe haviṣy ā samānam it tam in mahe vṛṇate nānyaṃ tvat //
analyzed: tam id arbhe haviṣi ā samānam id tam id mahe vṛṇate na anyam tvat
translated: Him, even in the young oblation, they agree upon; in the great one they choose thee, none other.

original: tvām id atra vṛṇate tvāyavo hotāram agne vidatheṣu vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: tvām id atra vṛṇate tvāyavaḥ hotāram agne vidatheṣu vedhasaḥ
translated: Here they choose thee, O Agni, the active one, the Hotar, in the sacrifices, O thou who ordainest,

original: yad devayanto dadhati prayāṃsi te haviṣmanto manavo vṛktabarhiṣaḥ //
analyzed: yat devayantaḥ dadhati prayāṃsi te haviṣmantaḥ manavaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: When the pious ones place their offerings before thee, the men who bring oblations, with strewn grass.

original: tavāgne hotraṃ tava potram ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvam agnid ṛtāyataḥ /
analyzed: tava agne hotram tava potram ṛtviyam tava neṣṭram tvam agnidh ṛta āyataḥ
translated: Thy office of Hotar, O Agni, thy office of Potri, thy office of Neṣṭṛ, thou art the Āgnīdh, O thou who art righteous,

original: tava praśāstraṃ tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi gṛhapatiś ca no dame //
analyzed: tava praśāstram tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā ca asi gṛhapatiḥ ca naḥ dame
translated: Thy office of Praśāstṛ, thou officiatest as Adhvaryu; thou art the Brahman, and the lord of the house in our house.

original: yas tubhyam agne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśad uta vā haviṣkṛti /
analyzed: yaḥ tubhyam agne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśat uta vā haviṣkṛti
translated: The mortal who, O Agni, to thee, the immortal, brings a kindling-stick, or prepares an oblation,

original: tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyam upa brūṣe yajasy adhvarīyasi //
analyzed: tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyam upa brūṣe yajasi adhvarīyasi
translated: For him thou art a Hotar; thou goest as a messenger; thou art invoked; thou officiatest as Adhvaryu.

original: imā asmai matayo vāco asmad āṃ ṛco giraḥ suṣṭutayaḥ sam agmata /
analyzed: imāḥ asmai matayaḥ vācaḥ asmat ām ṛcaḥ giraḥ suṣṭutayaḥ sam agmata
translated: These thoughts, these words of ours, these hymns, these songs have come together for him,

original: vasūyavo vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cid vardhano yāsu cākanat //
analyzed: vasūyavaḥ vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cit vardhanaḥ yāsu cākanat
translated: More worthy of worship than the Vasus, for the Vasu Jâtavedas, in the oldest rites, in those which he delights to strengthen.

original: imām pratnāya suṣṭutiṃ navīyasīṃ voceyam asmā uśate śṛṇotu naḥ /
analyzed: imām pratnāya suṣṭutim navīyasīm voceyam asmai uśate śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: To him, the Ancient, I will sing this newest hymn of praise: may he, the Lover of delight, hear us.

original: bhūyā antarā hṛdy asya nispṛśe jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ //
analyzed: bhūyāḥ antarā hṛdi asya nispṛśe jāyā iva patye uśatī su vāsāḥ
translated: May he be nearer than the heart's most secret thoughts, like a devoted wife in beauteous raiment.

original: yasminn aśvāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo vaśā meṣā avasṛṣṭāsa āhutāḥ /🔽kīlālape somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase hṛdā matiṃ janaye cārum agnaye //
analyzed: yasmin aśvāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ vaśāḥ meṣāḥ avasṛṣṭāsaḥ āhutāḥ  kīlāla pe soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase hṛdā matim janaye cārum agnaye
translated: In whom are offered horses, bulls, and oxen, and barren cows and rams, and sacrificial food,🔽To him, the Soma-drinker, whose back the press-stone kisses, the wise, the sweet, generate in your heart a lovely thought for Agni.

original: ahāvy agne havir āsye te srucīva ghṛtaṃ camvīva somaḥ /
analyzed: ahāvi agne haviḥ āsye te sruci iva ghṛtam camvi iva somaḥ
translated: O Agni, in thy mouth is offered the oblation, as in a ladle ghee, as Soma in a cup.

original: vājasaniṃ rayim asme suvīram praśastaṃ dhehi yaśasam bṛhantam //
analyzed: vāja sanim rayim asme su vīram praśastam dhehi yaśasam bṛhantam
translated: Grant us, O thou who givest strength, wealth with brave sons, glorious, exalted, and renowned.

original: yajñasya vo rathyaṃ viśpatiṃ viśāṃ hotāram aktor atithiṃ vibhāvasum /🔽śocañ chuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhurad vṛṣā ketur yajato dyām aśāyata //
analyzed: yajñasya vaḥ rathyam viśpatim viśām hotāram aktoḥ atithim vibhāvasum  śocam śuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhurat vṛṣā ketuḥ yajataḥ dyām aśāyata
translated: The charioteer of sacrifice, the lord of men, the priest of the house, the guest of the radiant ones,🔽The ruddy banner of the worshipper hath shone, glowing among the dry trees, and hath mounted to the sky.

original: imam añjaspām ubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇam agniṃ vidathasya sādhanam /
analyzed: imam añjaspām ubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇam agnim vidathasya sādhanam
translated: Both sides have made him the swift one, the righteous, Agni, the fulfiller of the sacrifice.

original: aktuṃ na yahvam uṣasaḥ purohitaṃ tanūnapātam aruṣasya niṃsate //
analyzed: aktum na yahvam uṣasaḥ purohitam tanū napātam aruṣasya niṃsate
translated: The youthful priest of the dawns, the ruddy one, the one who strews the grass, is anointed.

original: baḷ asya nīthā vi paṇeś ca manmahe vayā asya prahutā āsur attave /
analyzed: baṭ asya nīthā vi paṇeḥ ca manmahe vayāḥ asya prahutāḥ āsuḥ attave
translated: We think of his laws and of his thought as of a lord, his wings are offered to be eaten.

original: yadā ghorāso amṛtatvam āśatād ij janasya daivyasya carkiran //🔽ṛtasya hi prasitir dyaur uru vyaco namo mahy aramatiḥ panīyasī /
analyzed: yadā ghorāsaḥ amṛta tvam āśata āt id janasya daivyasya carkiran  ṛtasya hi prasitiḥ dyauḥ uru vyacaḥ namaḥ mahī aramatiḥ panīyasī
translated: When the terrible ones have attained immortality, they have been set in motion by the divine people.🔽For the expanse of the sky is the enclosure of truth, the great reverence is the wide-open space.

original: indro mitro varuṇaḥ saṃ cikitrire 'tho bhagaḥ savitā pūtadakṣasaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ sam cikitrire thaḥ bhagaḥ savitā pūta dakṣasaḥ
translated: Indra, Mitra, Varuna have been conceived together, and also Bhaga, Savitar of pure power.

original: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavas tiro mahīm aramatiṃ dadhanvire /
analyzed: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavaḥ tiras mahīm aramatim dadhanvire
translated: The rivers flow with Rudra, the swift one, they have spread out over the great reverence.

original: yebhiḥ parijmā pariyann uru jrayo vi roruvaj jaṭhare viśvam ukṣate //
analyzed: yebhiḥ parijmā pariyan uru jrayaḥ vi roruvat jaṭhare viśvam ukṣate
translated: By which the wanderer, going around with wide strength, roars in his belly and fills it with all.

original: krāṇā rudrā maruto viśvakṛṣṭayo divaḥ śyenāso asurasya nīḷayaḥ /
analyzed: krāṇāḥ rudrāḥ marutaḥ viśvakṛṣṭayaḥ divaḥ śyenāsaḥ asurasya nīḷayaḥ
translated: The Rudras, the Maruts, all the powerful ones, the hawks of the sky, the attendants of the Asura,

original: tebhiś caṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamendro devebhir arvaśebhir arvaśaḥ //🔽indre bhujaṃ śaśamānāsa āśata sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye /
analyzed: tebhiḥ caṣṭe varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā indraḥ devebhiḥ arvaśebhiḥ arvaśaḥ  indre bhujam śaśamānāsaḥ āśata sūraḥ dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaḥ ca pauṃsye
translated: with them Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Indra, the powerful one, rule with the powerful gods.🔽The worshippers have come to Indra for the arm, the strong ones for the sun's beholding and manly deeds.

original: pra ye nv asyārhaṇā tatakṣire yujaṃ vajraṃ nṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ //
analyzed: pra ye nu asya arhaṇā tatakṣire yujam vajram nṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ
translated: Who have fashioned for him the offerings that are worthy, the yoke, the thunderbolt, in the assemblies of men.

original: sūraś cid ā harito asya rīramad indrād ā kaś cid bhayate tavīyasaḥ /
analyzed: sūraḥ cit ā haritaḥ asya rīramat indrāt ā kaḥ cit bhayate tavīyasaḥ
translated: Even the strong one is afraid of his tawny horses, and no one is more powerful than Indra.

original: bhīmasya vṛṣṇo jaṭharād abhiśvaso divedive sahuri stann abādhitaḥ //
analyzed: bhīmasya vṛṣṇaḥ jaṭharāt dive dive sahuri stan a bādhitaḥ
translated: From the terrible and mighty one's belly, the irresistible breath goes out day by day.

original: stomaṃ vo adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasā didiṣṭana /
analyzed: stomam vaḥ adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasā didiṣṭana
translated: Today, with homage, offer your praise to Rudra, the powerful one, whose heroes perish.

original: yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavāṃ evayāvabhir divaḥ siṣakti svayaśā nikāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavān eva yāvabhiḥ divaḥ siṣakti sva yaśāḥ nikāmabhiḥ
translated: By which (praise) he is gracious, self-luminous, and goes to heaven with his own glory and desires.

original: te hi prajāyā abharanta vi śravo bṛhaspatir vṛṣabhaḥ somajāmayaḥ /
analyzed: te hi prajāyai abharanta vi śravaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ soma jāmayaḥ
translated: For they have brought forth fame for offspring, Brhaspati, the bull, the son of Soma.

original: yajñair atharvā prathamo vi dhārayad devā dakṣair bhṛgavaḥ saṃ cikitrire //
analyzed: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ vi dhārayat devāḥ dakṣaiḥ bhṛgavaḥ sam cikitrire
translated: With sacrifices, Atharvan first established them, the gods with their powers, the Bhrigus have conceived together.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā narāśaṃsaś caturaṅgo yamo 'ditiḥ /
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri retasā narāśaṃsaḥ catur aṅgaḥ yamaḥ ditiḥ
translated: For they, Dyaus and Prithivī, of great seed, Narâṣansa, Catûragga, Yama, Aditi,

original: devas tvaṣṭā draviṇodā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pra rodasī maruto viṣṇur arhire //
analyzed: devaḥ tvaṣṭā draviṇaḥ dāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pra rodasī marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ arhire
translated: The god Tvastr, the giver of wealth, the Rbhukṣaṇs, the Maruts, Viṣṇu have obtained the two world-halves.

original: uta sya na uśijām urviyā kavir ahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyo havīmani /
analyzed: uta sya naḥ uśijām urviyā kaviḥ ahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyaḥ havīmani
translated: And may the wise serpent of the swift ones, the deep one, hear our call from afar.

original: sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyā śamīnahuṣī asya bodhatam //
analyzed: sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyā śamī nahuṣī asya bodhatam
translated: The sun and moon, moving, looking towards heaven, may they, the two Nâsatyas, be awakened by this prayer.

original: pra naḥ pūṣā carathaṃ viśvadevyo 'pāṃ napād avatu vāyur iṣṭaye /
analyzed: pra naḥ pūṣā caratham viśvadevyā u pām napāt avatu vāyuḥ iṣṭaye
translated: May Pusan, with all the deities, and the foot of the waters, and Vayu, protect our chariot for the sake of our welfare.

original: ātmānaṃ vasyo abhi vātam arcata tad aśvinā suhavā yāmani śrutam //🔽viśām āsām abhayānām adhikṣitaṃ gīrbhir u svayaśasaṃ gṛṇīmasi /
analyzed: ātmānam vasyaḥ abhi vātam arcata tat aśvinā su havā yāmani śrutam  viśām āsām abhayānām adhikṣitam gīrbhiḥ u sva yaśasam gṛṇīmasi
translated: Praise Vata, the good one, for your own sake. O Aśvins, who are easy to invoke, listen to this invocation.🔽We praise with our songs the one who is the lord of these fearless and powerful people, the one who is famous by himself.

original: gnābhir viśvābhir aditim anarvaṇam aktor yuvānaṃ nṛmaṇā adhā patim //
analyzed: gnābhiḥ viśvābhiḥ aditim anarvaṇam aktoḥ yuvānam nṛmaṇāḥ adhā patim
translated: With all the wives, with Aditi, the one who is not to be disturbed, the young lord of men, we make offerings to the one who is anointed.

original: rebhad atra januṣā pūrvo aṅgirā grāvāṇa ūrdhvā abhi cakṣur adhvaram /
analyzed: rebhat atra januṣā pūrvaḥ aṅgirāḥ grāvāṇaḥ ūrdhvāḥ abhi cakṣuḥ adhvaram
translated: The ancient Angiras shone here by birth, the pressing stones rose up to look at the sacrifice.

original: yebhir vihāyā abhavad vicakṣaṇaḥ pāthaḥ sumekaṃ svadhitir vananvati //
analyzed: yebhiḥ vihāyāḥ abhavat vicakṣaṇaḥ pāthaḥ sumekam svadhitiḥ vananvati
translated: By which (stones) he became the all-seeing one, the path is well-trodden, the axe follows the wood.

original: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtam urvī nārī yahvī na rodasī sadaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtam urvī nārī yahvī na rodasī sadam naḥ
translated: The great, vast heaven and earth are the two women, the young ones, the two worlds, the ancient ones, for us.

original: tebhir naḥ pātaṃ sahyasa ebhir naḥ pātaṃ śūṣaṇi //
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ pātam sahyasaḥ ebhiḥ naḥ pātam śūṣaṇi
translated: Protect us with those (powers), protect us with those (powers), O you who are to be worshipped.

original: yajñeyajñe sa martyo devān saparyati /
analyzed: yajñeyajñe sa martyaḥ devān saparyati
translated: In every sacrifice that mortal worships the gods.

original: yaḥ sumnair dīrghaśruttama āvivāsaty enān //
analyzed: yaḥ sumnaiḥ dīrghaśruttamaḥ āvivāsati enān
translated: He who with (their) favors most renowned, invites them.

original: viśveṣām irajyavo devānāṃ vār mahaḥ /
analyzed: viśveṣām irajyavaḥ devānām vār mahaḥ
translated: The great waters of all the self-ruling gods.

original: viśve hi viśvamahaso viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ //
analyzed: viśve hi viśva mahasaḥ viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ
translated: For all are all-powerful, all are worthy of worship in sacrifices.

original: te ghā rājāno amṛtasya mandrā aryamā mitro varuṇaḥ parijmā /
analyzed: te gha rājānaḥ amṛtasya mandrāḥ aryamā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ parijmā
translated: They are the kings, the joyful ones of immortality, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, Parijman,

original: kad rudro nṛṇāṃ stuto marutaḥ pūṣaṇo bhagaḥ //
analyzed: kad rudraḥ nṛṇām stutaḥ marutaḥ pūṣaṇaḥ bhagaḥ
translated: Kadru, Rudra, praised by men, the Maruts, Pushan, Bhaga.

original: uta no naktam apāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāya sadhanyā /
analyzed: uta naḥ naktam apām vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāya sa dhanyā
translated: And for us by night, O ye rich in waters, Surya and Moon, to the seat, ye who possess all wealth,

original: sacā yat sādy eṣām ahir budhneṣu budhnyaḥ //
analyzed: sacā yat sādi eṣām ahiḥ budhneṣu budhnyaḥ
translated: When ye two come together, that Ahi of the depths, the deep one, among the depths.

original: uta no devāv aśvinā śubhas patī dhāmabhir mitrāvaruṇā uruṣyatām /
analyzed: uta naḥ devau aśvinā śubhaḥ patī dhāmabhiḥ mitrāvaruṇau uruṣyatām
translated: And for us, O ye two gods, the Asvins, lords of splendour, do ye, O Mitra and Varuna, with your powers, protect us.

original: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate 'ti dhanveva duritā //
analyzed: mahaḥ sa rāyaḥ eṣate ti dhanva iva duritā
translated: He seeks great wealth, as one passes over difficulties.

original: uta no rudrā cin mṛḷatām aśvinā viśve devāso rathaspatir bhagaḥ /🔽ṛbhur vāja ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśvavedasaḥ //
analyzed: uta naḥ rudrā cit mṛḍatām aśvinā viśve devāsaḥ rathaspatiḥ bhagaḥ  ṛbhuḥ vājaḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśva vedasaḥ
translated: And may the two Rudras also be gracious to us, the two Asvins, all the gods, the lord of the chariot, Bhaga,🔽Ribhu, Vaja, the Ribhukshanas, Parijman, the possessors of all wealth.

original: ṛbhur ṛbhukṣā ṛbhur vidhato mada ā te harī jūjuvānasya vājinā /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ ṛbhuḥ vidhataḥ madaḥ ā te harī jūjuvānasya vājinā
translated: Ribhu, the Ribhukshanas, Ribhu, the creator, the swift one, thy two Bay Horses, O thou who art strong like Jūjūvāna,

original: duṣṭaraṃ yasya sāma cid ṛdhag yajño na mānuṣaḥ //
analyzed: duṣṭaram yasya sāma cit ṛdhak yajñaḥ na mānuṣaḥ
translated: Whose praise is hard to attain, whose sacrifice is not like that of men.

original: kṛdhī no ahrayo deva savitaḥ sa ca stuṣe maghonām /
analyzed: kṛdhī naḥ ahrayaḥ deva savitar sa ca stuṣe maghonām
translated: Grant us, O god Savitar, prosperity, and may I praise the wealthy ones.

original: saho na indro vahnibhir ny eṣāṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ cakraṃ raśmiṃ na yoyuve //
analyzed: saha u naḥ indraḥ vahnibhiḥ ni eṣām carṣaṇīnām cakram raśmim na yoyuve
translated: May Indra with the fires of these people, the wheel, as it were, yoked to the reins, of the people.

original: aiṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātam mahad asme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇi śravaḥ /
analyzed: ā eṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātam mahat asme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇi śravaḥ
translated: In these two, O Heaven and Earth, lay great power, in our heroes, O All-worker, glory.

original: pṛkṣaṃ vājasya sātaye pṛkṣaṃ rāyota turvaṇe //
analyzed: pṛkṣam vājasya sātaye pṛkṣam rāyā uta turvaṇe
translated: For the winning of strength, for the winning of wealth, for the sake of wealth,

original: etaṃ śaṃsam indrāsmayuṣ ṭvaṃ kūcit santaṃ sahasāvann abhiṣṭaye /
analyzed: etam śaṃsam indra asmayuḥ tvam kūcid santam sahasāvan abhiṣṭaye
translated: This praise, O Indra, who art to be invoked, O Victor, thou who art near for help,

original: sadā pāhy abhiṣṭaye medatāṃ vedatā vaso //
analyzed: sadā pāhi abhiṣṭaye medatām vedatā vaso
translated: Always protect for help. Be thou a sharer of the offering, O good one, of the sacrifice.

original: etam me stomaṃ tanā na sūrye dyutadyāmānaṃ vāvṛdhanta nṛṇām /
analyzed: etam me stomam tanā na sūrye dyutat yāmānam vāvṛdhanta nṛṇām
translated: This praise of mine, like a horse for the sun, which the men have increased, which shines in the sky,

original: saṃvananaṃ nāśvyaṃ taṣṭevānapacyutam //
analyzed: saṃvananam na aśvyam taṣṭā iva an apacyutam
translated: Like a horse to be courted, well-fashioned, not to be shaken.

original: vāvarta yeṣāṃ rāyā yuktaiṣāṃ hiraṇyayī /
analyzed: vāvarta yeṣām rāyā yuktā eṣām hiraṇyayī
translated: They whose wealth turns back, whose wealth is yoked, whose wealth is golden,

original: nemadhitā na pauṃsyā vṛtheva viṣṭāntā //
analyzed: nemadhitā na pauṃsyā vṛthā iva viṣṭa antā
translated: Like the unfulfilled hopes of men, like the unfulfilled ends of men.

original: pra tad duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme vocam asure maghavatsu /
analyzed: pra tat duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme vocam asure maghavatsu
translated: That I proclaim to you, O Dushyanta, to Prithvi, to Vena, to Rama, to the wealthy Asuras,

original: ye yuktvāya pañca śatāsmayu pathā viśrāvy eṣām //
analyzed: ye yuktvāya pañca śatā asmayu pathā viśrāvi eṣām
translated: Who, yoked for the sake of the five hundred, for the sake of the people, for the sake of their fame,

original: adhīn nv atra saptatiṃ ca sapta ca /🔽sadyo didiṣṭa tānvaḥ sadyo didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyo didiṣṭa māyavaḥ //
analyzed: adhi id nu atra saptatim ca sapta ca  sadyas didiṣṭa tānvaḥ sadyas didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyas didiṣṭa māyavaḥ
translated: There are indeed seventy-seven.🔽Let Tanva of the Sudas, let Parthya, let Mayava quickly be inflamed.

original: praite vadantu pra vayaṃ vadāma grāvabhyo vācaṃ vadatā vadadbhyaḥ /
analyzed: pra ete vadantu pra vayam vadāma grāvabhyaḥ vācam vadata vadadbhyaḥ
translated: Let them speak forth, let us speak forth, let us speak to the pressing-stones, to those that speak, to those that are speaking.

original: yad adrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākam āśavaḥ ślokaṃ ghoṣam bharathendrāya sominaḥ //
analyzed: yat adrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākam āśavaḥ ślokam ghoṣam bharatha indrāya sominaḥ
translated: When the swift mountains, the rocks, together make Indra's praise and shout, the Soma-pressers.

original: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravad abhi krandanti haritebhir āsabhiḥ /
analyzed: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravat abhi krandanti haritebhiḥ āsabhiḥ
translated: These speak in hundreds, in thousands, they cry aloud with their green horses that carry them.

original: viṣṭvī grāvāṇaḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā hotuś cit pūrve haviradyam āśata //
analyzed: viṣṭvī grāvāṇaḥ su kṛtaḥ su kṛtyayā hotuḥ cit pūrve haviḥ adyam āśata
translated: The well-fashioned pressing-stones, through good performance, have obtained even the Hotar's share of the sacrificial food.

original: ete vadanty avidann anā madhu ny ūṅkhayante adhi pakva āmiṣi /
analyzed: ete vadanti avidan anā madhu ni ūṅkhayante adhi pakve āmiṣi
translated: These speak, knowing, the honey; they hum over the cooked flesh on the spit.

original: vṛkṣasya śākhām aruṇasya bapsatas te sūbharvā vṛṣabhāḥ prem arāviṣuḥ //🔽bṛhad vadanti madireṇa mandinendraṃ krośanto 'vidann anā madhu /🔽saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhir anartiṣur āghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīm upabdibhiḥ //
analyzed: vṛkṣasya śākhām aruṇasya bapsataḥ te sūbharvāḥ vṛṣabhāḥ pra īm arāviṣuḥ  bṛhat vadanti madireṇa mandinā indram krośantaḥ vidan anā madhu  saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiḥ anartiṣuḥ āghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīm upabdibhiḥ
translated: The two good workers have loudly roared, seizing a branch of the ruddy tree.🔽They speak loudly, rejoicing in the gladdening drink; they have found the honey, crying to Indra.🔽The wise ones have danced together with their sisters, proclaiming with their loud voices to the earth.

original: suparṇā vācam akratopa dyavy ākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirā anartiṣuḥ /
analyzed: suparṇāḥ vācam akrata upa dyavi ākhare kṛṣṇāḥ iṣirāḥ anartiṣuḥ
translated: The birds have raised their voice in the sky; the dark, powerful ones have danced in the hole.

original: nyaṅ ni yanty uparasya niṣkṛtam purū reto dadhire sūryaśvitaḥ //
analyzed: nyak ni yanti uparasya niṣkṛtam purū retaḥ dadhire sūryaśvitaḥ
translated: They go down to the completion of the lower (world); many have produced seed from the sun-bright (world).

original: ugrā iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākaṃ yuktā vṛṣaṇo bibhrato dhuraḥ /
analyzed: ugrāḥ iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākam yuktāḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ bibhrataḥ dhuraḥ
translated: Like fierce ones, they are drawn together with a pull; the strong ones, yoked together, bear the yoke.

original: yac chvasanto jagrasānā arāviṣuḥ śṛṇva eṣām prothatho arvatām iva //🔽daśāvanibhyo daśakakṣyebhyo daśayoktrebhyo daśayojanebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yat śvasantaḥ jagrasānāḥ arāviṣuḥ śṛṇve eṣām prothathaḥ arvatām iva  daśa avanibhyaḥ daśa kakṣyebhyaḥ daśa yoktrebhyaḥ daśa yojanebhyaḥ
translated: What they have swallowed, breathing, roaring, let us hear the neighing of them as of horses.🔽To those of ten abodes, of ten girdles, of ten yokes, of ten traces,

original: daśābhīśubhyo arcatājarebhyo daśa dhuro daśa yuktā vahadbhyaḥ //🔽te adrayo daśayantrāsa āśavas teṣām ādhānam pary eti haryatam /🔽ta ū sutasya somyasyāndhaso 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamasya bhejire //🔽te somādo harī indrasya niṃsate 'ṃśuṃ duhanto adhy āsate gavi /🔽tebhir dugdham papivān somyam madhv indro vardhate prathate vṛṣāyate //🔽vṛṣā vo aṃśur na kilā riṣāthaneḷāvantaḥ sadam it sthanāśitāḥ /🔽raivatyeva mahasā cārava sthana yasya grāvāṇo ajuṣadhvam adhvaram //
analyzed: daśa abhīśubhyaḥ arcata ajarebhyaḥ daśa dhuraḥ daśa yuktāḥ vahadbhyaḥ  te adrayaḥ daśa yantrāsaḥ āśavaḥ teṣām ādhānam pari eti haryatam  te ū sutasya somyasya andhasaḥ oṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamasya bhejire  te somādaḥ harī indrasya niṃsate ṃśum duhantaḥ adhi āsate gavi  tebhiḥ dugdham papivān somyam madhu indraḥ vardhate prathate vṛṣāyate  vṛṣā vaḥ aṃśuḥ na kilā riṣāthana iḷāvantaḥ sadam id sthana āśitāḥ  raivatyā iva mahasā cāravaḥ sthana yasya grāvāṇaḥ ajuṣadhvam adhvaram
translated: To those of ten reins, to those who are worshipped, to those who are not old, to ten poles, to ten yoked and moving (horses).

original: tṛdilā atṛdilāso adrayo 'śramaṇā aśṛthitā amṛtyavaḥ /🔽anāturā ajarā sthāmaviṣṇavaḥ supīvaso atṛṣitā atṛṣṇajaḥ //
analyzed: tṛdilāḥ atṛdilāsaḥ adrayaḥ śramaṇāḥ aśṛthitāḥ amṛtyavaḥ 🔽anāturāḥ ajarāḥ stha a maviṣṇavaḥ su pīvasaḥ atṛṣitāḥ atṛṣṇajaḥ
translated: Those are the ten swift-moving, ten-wheeled, ten-jointed, ten-yoked, ten-tethered, ten-reined, ten-pole, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing, ten-yoke-moving, ten-yoke-bearing,

original: dhruvā eva vaḥ pitaro yugeyuge kṣemakāmāsaḥ sadaso na yuñjate /
analyzed: dhruvāḥ eva vaḥ pitaraḥ yuge yuge kṣema kāmāsaḥ sadasaḥ na yuñjate
translated: Your fathers, O men, are ever firm, in every age, longing for rest, they join the assembly as if they were yoked.

original: ajuryāso hariṣāco haridrava ā dyāṃ raveṇa pṛthivīm aśuśravuḥ //
analyzed: ajuryāsaḥ haridravaḥ ā dyām raveṇa pṛthivīm aśuśravuḥ
translated: Ageless, tawny, with tawny flowing hair, they have made the heaven and earth resound with their voice.

original: tad id vadanty adrayo vimocane yāmann añjaspā iva ghed upabdibhiḥ /
analyzed: tat id vadanti adrayaḥ vimocane yāman añjaspāḥ iva gha id upabdibhiḥ
translated: This, indeed, the mountains speak at the time of release, as if they were going straight forward with their loud sounds.

original: vapanto bījam iva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcanti somaṃ na minanti bapsataḥ //
analyzed: vapantaḥ bījam iva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcanti somam na minanti bapsataḥ
translated: Scattering seed, as it were, of the form of grain, they purify the Soma, they do not diminish the sacrificer.

original: sute adhvare adhi vācam akratā krīḷayo na mātaraṃ tudantaḥ /🔽vi ṣū muñcā suṣuvuṣo manīṣāṃ vi vartantām adrayaś cāyamānāḥ //
analyzed: sute adhvare adhi vācam akratā krīḍayaḥ na mātaram tudantaḥ  vi su muñca suṣuvuṣaḥ manīṣām vi vartantām adrayaḥ cāyamānāḥ
translated: In the pressed sacrifice they have uttered a voice, as if striking the mother in sport.🔽Let them release the thought of those who have pressed the Soma; let the mountains roll away, being moved.

original: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrā kṛṇavāvahai nu /
analyzed: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrā kṛṇavāvahai nu
translated: O wife, stand firm in spirit, O terrible one; let us two make our words agree.

original: na nau mantrā anuditāsa ete mayas karan paratare canāhan //
analyzed: na nau mantrāḥ anuditāsaḥ ete mayaḥ karan paratare ca na ahan
translated: Let not these admonitions of ours, sent from afar, make us miserable.

original: kim etā vācā kṛṇavā tavāham prākramiṣam uṣasām agriyeva /
analyzed: kim etā vācā kṛṇavā tava aham prākramiṣam uṣasām agriyā iva
translated: What shall I do with this speech of yours? I have gone forward, as it were, to the first flush of dawn.

original: purūravaḥ punar astam parehi durāpanā vāta ivāham asmi //
analyzed: purūravaḥ punar astam parehi durāpanā vātaḥ iva aham asmi
translated: O Purūravas, return to your home; I am as unattainable as the wind.

original: iṣur na śriya iṣudher asanā goṣāḥ śatasā na raṃhiḥ /
analyzed: iṣuḥ na śriyaḥ iṣudheḥ asanā goṣāḥ śata sāḥ na raṃhiḥ
translated: Like an arrow from the bow-string, like a cow-stealer a hundredfold,

original: avīre kratau vi davidyutan norā na māyuṃ citayanta dhunayaḥ //
analyzed: avīre kratau vi davidyutan na urāḥ na māyum citayanta dhunayaḥ
translated: In the hero-less sacrifice, the dawns have flashed upon us like two houses, the winds have shaken our magic power.

original: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vaya uṣo yadi vaṣṭy antigṛhāt /
analyzed: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vayaḥ uṣaḥ yadi vaṣṭi antigṛhāt
translated: If Dawn, bestowing wealth, departs from her father-in-law's house, to her own home,

original: astaṃ nanakṣe yasmiñ cākan divā naktaṃ śnathitā vaitasena //
analyzed: astam nanakṣe yasmin cākan divā naktam śnathitā vaitasena
translated: She who hath gone to rest in that place where she hath been fain to go, by day or night, bound with the Vaitana bonds.

original: triḥ sma māhnaḥ śnathayo vaitasenota sma me 'vyatyai pṛṇāsi /
analyzed: tris sma mā ahnaḥ śnathayaḥ vaitasena uta sma me vyatyai pṛṇāsi
translated: Three times in the day the Vaitana bonds have been loosed for me, and once for my own safety thou hast filled (the cup).

original: purūravo 'nu te ketam āyaṃ rājā me vīra tanvas tad āsīḥ //🔽yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpir hradecakṣur na granthinī caraṇyuḥ /
analyzed: purūravaḥ nu te ketam āyam rājā me vīra tanvaḥ tat āsīḥ  yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpiḥ hradecakṣuḥ na granthinī caraṇyuḥ
translated: O Purûravâs, I have followed thy light, O king, thou hast been my body, O hero.🔽That which is well-ordered, a row, a giver of bliss, an eye in the lake, a knot, a wanderer,

original: tā añjayo 'ruṇayo na sasruḥ śriye gāvo na dhenavo 'navanta //
analyzed: tāḥ añjayaḥ ruṇayaḥ na sasruḥ śriye gāvaḥ na dhenavaḥ navanta
translated: Those two have flowed on, anointed, ruddy, for glory, like cows, like milch cows, have they been filled.

original: sam asmiñ jāyamāna āsata gnā utem avardhan nadyaḥ svagūrtāḥ /
analyzed: sam asmin jāyamāne āsata gnāḥ uta īm avardhan nadyaḥ sva gūrtāḥ
translated: The Gnas have sat together in him as he was born, and the self-shining rivers have increased him,

original: mahe yat tvā purūravo raṇāyāvardhayan dasyuhatyāya devāḥ //
analyzed: mahe yat tvā purūravaḥ raṇāya avardhayan dasyu hatyāya devāḥ
translated: When, for the great contest, Purûravâs, the gods have exalted thee for the slaying of the Dasyus.

original: sacā yad āsu jahatīṣv atkam amānuṣīṣu mānuṣo niṣeve /
analyzed: sacā yat āsu jahatīṣu atkam amānuṣīṣu mānuṣaḥ niṣeve
translated: When thou, a human being, hast dwelt with those who have gone away, with those who have left their homes, with those who are not human,

original: apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyus tā atrasan rathaspṛśo nāśvāḥ //
analyzed: apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyuḥ tāḥ atrasan ratha spṛśaḥ na aśvāḥ
translated: Then hast thou fled from them, like a swift horse, like horses that delight in the chariot.

original: yad āsu marto amṛtāsu nispṛk saṃ kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhir na pṛṅkte /
analyzed: yat āsu martaḥ amṛtāsu nispṛś sam kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhiḥ na pṛṅkte
translated: The mortal man who has intercourse with these immortal ones is not filled with the regions and powers.

original: tā ātayo na tanvaḥ śumbhata svā aśvāso na krīḷayo dandaśānāḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ ātayaḥ na tanvaḥ śumbhata svāḥ aśvāsaḥ na krīḍayaḥ dandaśānāḥ
translated: These bodies of theirs are adorned like birds, their horses like playful dogs, biting.

original: vidyun na yā patantī davidyod bharantī me apyā kāmyāni /
analyzed: vidyut na yā patantī davidyot bharantī me apyā kāmyāni
translated: Like lightning flashing down from the sky, bringing me what I desire.

original: janiṣṭo apo naryaḥ sujātaḥ prorvaśī tirata dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: janiṣṭa u apaḥ naryaḥ su jātaḥ pra urvaśī tirata dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: The man, well-born, has generated the waters. Urvasi, give long life to Pururava.

original: jajñiṣa itthā gopīthyāya hi dadhātha tat purūravo ma ojaḥ /
analyzed: jajñiṣe itthā gopīthyāya hi tat purūravaḥ me ojaḥ
translated: You were born here for the protection of the cows. You have given me that strength, O Pururava.

original: aśāsaṃ tvā viduṣī sasminn ahan na ma āśṛṇoḥ kim abhug vadāsi //
analyzed: aśāsam tvā viduṣī ahan na me āśṛṇoḥ kim abhuj vadāsi
translated: I, the wise one, have instructed you in this matter. Do you not hear me? What do you say?

original: kadā sūnuḥ pitaraṃ jāta icchāc cakran nāśru vartayad vijānan /
analyzed: kadā sūnuḥ pitaram jātaḥ icchāt na aśru vartayat vijānan
translated: When will the son, born, desire his father, and, knowing, shed tears?

original: ko dampatī samanasā vi yūyod adha yad agniḥ śvaśureṣu dīdayat //
analyzed: kaḥ dampatī samanasā vi adha yat agniḥ śvaśureṣu dīdayat
translated: Who will separate the couple with one mind, when Agni shines among the fathers-in-law?

original: prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru cakran na krandad ādhye śivāyai /
analyzed: prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru na krandat śivāyai
translated: I will answer the one who turns back the tears. He weeps, but does not cry out for the sake of peace.

original: pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehy astaṃ nahi mūra māpaḥ //
analyzed: pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehi astam nahi mūra mā āpaḥ
translated: I will take away from you what is with us. Come, go away. Do not be angry with me.

original: sudevo adya prapated anāvṛt parāvatam paramāṃ gantavā u /
analyzed: sudevaḥ adya prapatet anāvṛt parāvatam paramām gantavai u
translated: Today the well-god will fall back, not to return. He will go to the farthest, highest place.

original: adhā śayīta nirṛter upasthe 'dhainaṃ vṛkā rabhasāso adyuḥ //
analyzed: adhā śayīta nirṛteḥ upasthe dhā enam vṛkāḥ rabhasāsaḥ adyuḥ
translated: Then would he lie in the lap of destruction, then would the wolves and the rapacious beasts devour him.

original: purūravo mā mṛthā mā pra papto mā tvā vṛkāso aśivāsa u kṣan /
analyzed: purūravaḥ mā mṛthāḥ mā pra paptaḥ mā tvā vṛkāsaḥ aśivāsaḥ u kṣan
translated: O Purūravas, do not die, do not fall away, may the wolves and the rapacious beasts not seize you.

original: na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi sālāvṛkāṇāṃ hṛdayāny etā //
analyzed: na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi sālāvṛkāṇām hṛdayāni etā
translated: For there are no female friendships, the hearts of the wolves are like these.

original: yad virūpācaram martyeṣv avasaṃ rātrīḥ śaradaś catasraḥ /
analyzed: yat virūpā acaram martyeṣu avasam rātrīḥ śaradaḥ catasraḥ
translated: When I, the deformed one, lived among mortals for four nights and autumns,

original: ghṛtasya stokaṃ sakṛd ahna āśnāṃ tād evedaṃ tātṛpāṇā carāmi //
analyzed: ghṛtasya stokam sakṛt ahnaḥ āśnām eva idam tātṛpāṇā carāmi
translated: I ate a little ghee once a day. I am still wandering around from hunger for that.

original: antarikṣaprāṃ rajaso vimānīm upa śikṣāmy urvaśīṃ vasiṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: antarikṣa prām rajasaḥ vimānīm upa śikṣāmi urvaśīm vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: I, Vasiṣṭha, approach Urvaśī, who dwells in the atmosphere, who measures the space,

original: upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhān ni vartasva hṛdayaṃ tapyate me //
analyzed: upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhāt ni vartasva hṛdayam tapyate me
translated: May the reward of your good deeds come to you. Turn back, my heart is burning within me.

original: iti tvā devā ima āhur aiḷa yathem etad bhavasi mṛtyubandhuḥ /
analyzed: iti tvā devāḥ ime āhuḥ aiḷa yathā īm etat bhavasi mṛtyu bandhuḥ
translated: Thus do these gods speak to you, O Aila, as if you were a friend of death.

original: prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svarga u tvam api mādayāse //
analyzed: prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svarge u tvam api mādayāse
translated: Your offspring will worship the gods with oblations, and you will rejoice in heaven.

original: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣo haryatam madam /
analyzed: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣam harī pra te vanve vanuṣaḥ haryatam madam
translated: I will praise your two bay horses in the great assembly. I, the worshipper, will win your delightful joy.

original: ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiś cāru secata ā tvā viśantu harivarpasaṃ giraḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtam na yaḥ haribhiḥ cāru secate ā tvā viśantu hari varpasam giraḥ
translated: Like ghee, which is poured out with the bay horses, may the songs, whose appearance is like that of the bay horse, enter into you.

original: hariṃ hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃ yathā sadaḥ /
analyzed: harim hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvantaḥ harī divyam yathā sadaḥ
translated: They who have sung forth to Hari, the womb, urging the two bay steeds to the seat in heaven,

original: ā yam pṛṇanti haribhir na dhenava indrāya śūṣaṃ harivantam arcata //
analyzed: ā yam pṛṇanti haribhiḥ na dhenavaḥ indrāya śūṣam harivantam arcata
translated: Whom the tawny ones nourish as Indra's strength, praise ye the tawny-backed one with your songs.

original: so asya vajro harito ya āyaso harir nikāmo harir ā gabhastyoḥ /
analyzed: saḥ asya vajraḥ haritaḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ hariḥ nikāmaḥ hariḥ ā gabhastyoḥ
translated: His is this tawny thunderbolt of iron, tawny is his desire, tawny his arms.

original: dyumnī suśipro harimanyusāyaka indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire //
analyzed: dyumnī su śipraḥ harimanyusāyakaḥ indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire
translated: The tawny forms are blended in Indra, the glorious, the fair-visored, whose shaft is wrath.

original: divi na ketur adhi dhāyi haryato vivyacad vajro harito na raṃhyā /
analyzed: divi na ketuḥ adhi dhāyi haryataḥ vivyacat vajraḥ haritaḥ na raṃhyā
translated: The tawny one's banner hath been set in heaven, the tawny one's thunderbolt hath been stretched out like a car.

original: tudad ahiṃ hariśipro ya āyasaḥ sahasraśokā abhavad dharimbharaḥ //
analyzed: tudat ahim hari śipraḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ sahasraśokāḥ abhavat harimbharaḥ
translated: The tawny-visored one, the iron one, hath smitten the dragon, and hath become the bearer of the tawny one with a thousand powers.

original: tvaṃtvam aharyathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhir indra harikeśa yajvabhiḥ /
analyzed: tvam tvam aharyathāḥ upastutaḥ pūrvebhiḥ indra hari keśa yajvabhiḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art to be praised as thou wast aforetime by the sacrificers, O thou of tawny hair.

original: tvaṃ haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādho harijāta haryatam //🔽tā vajriṇam mandinaṃ stomyam mada indraṃ rathe vahato haryatā harī /
analyzed: tvam haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādhaḥ hari jāta haryatam  tā vajriṇam mandinam stomyam made indram rathe vahataḥ haryatā harī
translated: Thou shinest forth, all that is worthy of praise is thine. O thou of tawny birth, the tawny one is to be desired.🔽They bear on the chariot the tawny steeds, the two bay steeds, to Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the gladdener, the one to be praised in the hymn.

original: purūṇy asmai savanāni haryata indrāya somā harayo dadhanvire //
analyzed: purūṇi asmai savanāni haryate indrāya somāḥ harayaḥ dadhanvire
translated: To him the tawny one hath flowed, the Soma to Indra, the tawny one, for many libations.

original: araṃ kāmāya harayo dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayo harī turā /
analyzed: aram kāmāya harayaḥ dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayaḥ harī turā
translated: The tawny ones have stretched themselves for the desire of the strong one, the tawny ones, urging the two tawny strong ones.

original: arvadbhir yo haribhir joṣam īyate so asya kāmaṃ harivantam ānaśe //🔽hariśmaśārur harikeśa āyasas turaspeye yo haripā avardhata /🔽arvadbhir yo haribhir vājinīvasur ati viśvā duritā pāriṣad dharī //
analyzed: arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ joṣam īyate saḥ asya kāmam harivantam ānaśe  hari śmaśāruḥ hari keśaḥ āyasaḥ turaspeye yaḥ hari pāḥ avardhata  arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ vājinīvasuḥ ati viśvā duritā pāriṣat harī
translated: He who goes to the agreement with the tawny horses, he has fulfilled his desire for the tawny one.🔽The tawny-bearded, tawny-haired one, made of iron, who has been strengthened in the swift drinking, with the tawny ones as his guardians.🔽He who, with the tawny horses, the possessor of wealth, will carry us over all the difficulties, with the tawny ones.

original: sruveva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ /
analyzed: sruvā iva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ
translated: Whose two tawny ones have moved like a ladle, the two tawny ones for the swift course to the prize.

original: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjad dharī pītvā madasya haryatasyāndhasaḥ //
analyzed: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjat harī pītvā madasya haryatasya andhasaḥ
translated: When, in the prepared bowl, he has cleansed the two tawny ones, having drunk of the tawny, gladdening drink, of the juice.

original: uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyor atyo na vājaṃ harivāṃ acikradat /🔽mahī cid dhi dhiṣaṇāharyad ojasā bṛhad vayo dadhiṣe haryataś cid ā //
analyzed: uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyoḥ atyaḥ na vājam harivān acikradat  mahī cit hi dhiṣaṇā a haryat ojasā bṛhat vayaḥ dadhiṣe haryataḥ cit ā
translated: And he, like a horse, has neighed in the abode of the tawny one, the lord of the house, for the prize, the tawny one.🔽Even the great one, with the tawny strength, with the mind, has placed the great life of the tawny one.

original: ā rodasī haryamāṇo mahitvā navyaṃnavyaṃ haryasi manma nu priyam /
analyzed: ā rodasī haryamāṇaḥ mahitvā navyam navyam haryasi manma nu priyam
translated: With thy tawny greatness thou hast filled the two world-halves, thou art ever renewed, thou rejoicest in the new dear hymn.

original: pra pastyam asura haryataṃ gor āviṣ kṛdhi haraye sūryāya //
analyzed: pra pastyam asura haryatam goḥ āvis kṛdhi haraye sūryāya
translated: Make thou visible, O Asura, the tawny abode of the cow, for the tawny Surya.

original: ā tvā haryantam prayujo janānāṃ rathe vahantu hariśipram indra /
analyzed: ā tvā haryantam prayujaḥ janānām rathe vahantu hari śipram indra
translated: Let the teams of men bring thee hitherward, O joyous One, O Indra, on the car, O thou of tawny steeds.

original: pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvo haryan yajñaṃ sadhamāde daśoṇim //
analyzed: pibāḥ yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ haryan yajñam sadhamāde daśa ūṇim
translated: Drink as thou findest it, of meath poured forth, rejoicing in the sacrifice, O thou of ample wealth, in the tenth place.

original: apāḥ pūrveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutānām atho idaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te /
analyzed: apāḥ pūrveṣām harivas sutānām atha u idam savanam kevalam te
translated: Thou hast drunk of the juices of old time, O thou who lovest the tawny (steed); this libation is thine only.

original: mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣañ jaṭhara ā vṛṣasva //
analyzed: mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣam jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva
translated: Rejoice in the sweet Soma, O Indra; ever be thou strong, be thou strong in thy belly.

original: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrvā jātā devebhyas triyugam purā /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ pūrvāḥ jātāḥ devebhyaḥ tri yugam purā
translated: Those plants which sprang up first, for the gods, three ages ago,

original: manai nu babhrūṇām ahaṃ śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca //
analyzed: nu babhrūṇām aham śatam dhāmāni sapta ca
translated: I think of the brown ones, a hundred and seven abodes.

original: śataṃ vo amba dhāmāni sahasram uta vo ruhaḥ /
analyzed: śatam vaḥ amba dhāmāni sahasram uta vaḥ ruhaḥ
translated: A hundred are your abodes, O ye Amba, and a thousand your shoots.

original: adhā śatakratvo yūyam imam me agadaṃ kṛta //
analyzed: adha śata kratvaḥ yūyam imam me agadam kṛta
translated: Now do ye, O ye of a hundred powers, make this man of mine well.

original: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvam puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ /
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvam puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ
translated: Rejoice in the plants, in the flowering, in the fruitful ones.

original: aśvā iva sajitvarīr vīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ //
analyzed: aśvāḥ iva sa jitvarīḥ vīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ
translated: The plants are like mares, victorious, saving.

original: oṣadhīr iti mātaras tad vo devīr upa bruve /🔽saneyam aśvaṃ gāṃ vāsa ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa //
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ iti mātaraḥ tat vaḥ devīḥ upa bruve  saneyam aśvam gām vāsaḥ ātmānam tava pūruṣa
translated: O plants, thus I address you, O ye mothers, O ye goddesses.🔽I would win a horse, a cow, a garment, myself, O ye, O ye men.

original: aśvatthe vo niṣadanam parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā /
analyzed: aśvatthe vaḥ niṣadanam parṇe vaḥ vasatiḥ kṛtā
translated: The fig-tree is your seat, in the leaf your dwelling is made.

original: gobhāja it kilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam //
analyzed: go bhājaḥ id kila asatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam
translated: You will receive a share of the cattle when you restore the man.

original: yatrauṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitāv iva /
analyzed: yatra oṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitau iva
translated: Where the plants have come together like kings in a council,

original: vipraḥ sa ucyate bhiṣag rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ //
analyzed: vipraḥ saḥ ucyate bhiṣaj rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ
translated: He is called a wise physician, a slayer of demons, a remover of disease.

original: aśvāvatīṃ somāvatīm ūrjayantīm udojasam /
analyzed: aśvāvatīm somāvatīm ūrjayantīm udojasam
translated: The one rich in horses, rich in Soma, nourishing, full of vigor,

original: āvitsi sarvā oṣadhīr asmā ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: āvitsi sarvāḥ oṣadhīḥ asmai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: I have obtained all the plants for the safety of this one.

original: uc chuṣmā oṣadhīnāṃ gāvo goṣṭhād iverate /
analyzed: ud śuṣmāḥ oṣadhīnām gāvaḥ goṣṭhāt iva īrate
translated: The strength of the plants rises up like cows from a stable,

original: dhanaṃ saniṣyantīnām ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa //
analyzed: dhanam saniṣyantīnām ātmānam tava pūruṣa
translated: The wealth of those who will gain it, and your own self, O man.

original: iṣkṛtir nāma vo mātātho yūyaṃ stha niṣkṛtīḥ /🔽sīrāḥ patatriṇī sthana yad āmayati niṣ kṛtha //
analyzed: iṣkṛtiḥ nāma vaḥ mātā atha u yūyam stha niṣkṛtīḥ  sīrāḥ patatriṇīḥ sthana yat āmayati niḥ kṛtha
translated: The name of your mother is Iṣkṛti, and you are indeed Niṣkṛtis.🔽You are plowwomen with wings, when you cure what is diseased, you cut it out.

original: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajam akramuḥ /
analyzed: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhāḥ stenaḥ iva vrajam akramuḥ
translated: They have passed over all obstacles, like a thief over a stable,

original: oṣadhīḥ prācucyavur yat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ //
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ prācucyavuḥ yat kim ca tanvaḥ rapaḥ
translated: The plants have shaken off whatever disease there is in the body.

original: yad imā vājayann aham oṣadhīr hasta ādadhe /
analyzed: yat imāḥ vājayan aham oṣadhīḥ haste ādadhe
translated: When I, desiring strength, take these plants in my hand,

original: ātmā yakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvagṛbho yathā //
analyzed: ātmā yakṣmasya naśyati purā jīva gṛbhaḥ yathā
translated: The self of the disease is destroyed, as if before it has seized a living being.

original: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgamaṅgam paruṣparuḥ /
analyzed: yasya oṣadhīḥ prasarpatha aṅgam aṅgam paruḥ paruḥ
translated: Of him whom you enter, O plants, limb by limb, hair by hair,

original: tato yakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ugro madhyamaśīr iva //
analyzed: tatas yakṣmam vi bādhadhve ugraḥ madhyamaśīḥ iva
translated: From that you drive away the disease, like a strong one the middlemost.

original: sākaṃ yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā /
analyzed: sākam yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā
translated: Go away with consumption, O bird, with the screeching owl,

original: sākaṃ vātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā //
analyzed: sākam vātasya dhrājyā sākam naśya nihākayā
translated: With the rushing of the wind, go away with the lightning flash.

original: anyā vo anyām avatv anyānyasyā upāvata /
analyzed: anyā vaḥ anyām avatu anyā anyasyai upāvata
translated: Let one of you help another, let another come to the help of one.

original: tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānā idam me prāvatā vacaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ idam me prāvata vacaḥ
translated: All of you, being of one mind, further this speech of mine.

original: yāḥ phalinīr yā aphalā apuṣpā yāś ca puṣpiṇīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ phalinīḥ yāḥ aphalāḥ apuṣpāḥ yāḥ ca puṣpiṇīḥ
translated: Those that are fruitful, those that are fruitless, those that are flowerless, and those that are flowery,

original: bṛhaspatiprasūtās tā no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May they, impelled by Brihaspati, deliver us from tribulation.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyād atho varuṇyād uta /
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta
translated: Deliver me from the curse, and also from Varuna's noose,

original: atho yamasya paḍbīśāt sarvasmād devakilbiṣāt //
analyzed: atha u yamasya paḍbīśāt sarvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt
translated: And from Yama's fetter, from every sin against the gods.

original: avapatantīr avadan diva oṣadhayas pari /
analyzed: avapatantīḥ avadan divaḥ oṣadhayaḥ pari
translated: The plants that fall down, that speak, from the sky around,

original: yaṃ jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ //
analyzed: yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ
translated: The living one whom we shall find, he will not perish, the man.

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr bahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ bahvīḥ śata vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: O you many plants, O you that have a hundred different forms, O you that have Soma for your king,

original: tāsāṃ tvam asy uttamāraṃ kāmāya śaṃ hṛde //
analyzed: tāsām tvam asi uttamā aram kāmāya śam hṛde
translated: You are the best of them. To this man, for the sake of his desire, give peace to his heart.

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu
translated: O you plants that have Soma for your king, that are spread out over the earth,

original: bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam //
analyzed: bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ asyai sam datta vīryam
translated: Impelled by Brihaspati, give to this one strength and vigour.

original: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ /
analyzed: mā vaḥ riṣat khanitā yasmai ca aham khanāmi vaḥ
translated: Let not the digging harm you, nor him for whom I dig you.

original: dvipac catuṣpad asmākaṃ sarvam astv anāturam //
analyzed: dvipad catuṣpad asmākam sarvam astu anāturam
translated: May all our two-footed and four-footed be free from sickness.

original: yāś cedam upaśṛṇvanti yāś ca dūram parāgatāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ ca idam upaśṛṇvanti yāḥ ca dūram parāgatāḥ
translated: And those that hear this, and those that have gone far away,

original: sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudho 'syai saṃ datta vīryam //
analyzed: sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudhaḥ syai sam datta vīryam
translated: Having all assembled together, give strength to this plant.

original: oṣadhayaḥ saṃ vadante somena saha rājñā /
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ sam vadante somena saha rājñā
translated: The plants speak together with Soma, the king,

original: yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇas taṃ rājan pārayāmasi //
analyzed: yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇaḥ tam rājan pārayāmasi
translated: Whom the Brahmin makes, O king, we deliver him.

original: tvam uttamāsy oṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam uttamā asi oṣadhe tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ
translated: You are the best of plants, the trees are your supporters.

original: upastir astu so 'smākaṃ yo asmāṃ abhidāsati //
analyzed: upastiḥ astu saḥ smākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Let him be a supporter to us who injures us.

original: bṛhaspate prati me devatām ihi mitro vā yad varuṇo vāsi pūṣā /
analyzed: bṛhaspate prati me devatām ihi mitraḥ vā yat varuṇaḥ vā asi pūṣā
translated: O Brihaspati, come to me as a god, as Mitra, Varuna, or Pushan,

original: ādityair vā yad vasubhir marutvān sa parjanyaṃ śantanave vṛṣāya //🔽ā devo dūto ajiraś cikitvān tvad devāpe abhi mām agacchat /
analyzed: ādityaiḥ vā yat vasubhiḥ marutvān sa parjanyam śantanave vṛṣāya  ā devaḥ dūtaḥ ajiraḥ cikitvān tvat devāpe abhi mām agacchat
translated: As you are with the Adityas, the Vasus, and the Maruts, give rain to the peaceful bull.🔽The swift, wise god-messenger has come to me, to the place of your worship.

original: pratīcīnaḥ prati mām ā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīṃ vācam āsan //
analyzed: pratīcīnaḥ prati mām ā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīm vācam āsan
translated: Turn to me from the west, I place in you the glorious speech.

original: asme dhehi dyumatīṃ vācam āsan bṛhaspate anamīvām iṣirām /
analyzed: asme dhehi dyumatīm vācam āsan bṛhaspate anamīvām iṣirām
translated: Place in us the glorious speech, O Brihaspati, the strong, the healthy,

original: yayā vṛṣṭiṃ śantanave vanāva divo drapso madhumāṃ ā viveśa //
analyzed: yayā vṛṣṭim śantanave vanāva divaḥ drapsaḥ madhumān ā viveśa
translated: By which you send rain to the peaceful, the drop of honey has entered from the sky.

original: ā no drapsā madhumanto viśantv indra dehy adhirathaṃ sahasram /🔽ni ṣīda hotram ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpe haviṣā saparya //
analyzed: ā naḥ drapsāḥ madhumantaḥ viśantu indra dehi adhiratham sahasram  ni sīda hotram ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpe haviṣā saparya
translated: Let the sweet drops enter us, O Indra, give us a thousand chariots.🔽Sit down as Hotar, offer according to the season, worship the gods with oblation, O god-invoker.

original: ārṣṭiṣeṇo hotram ṛṣir niṣīdan devāpir devasumatiṃ cikitvān /
analyzed: ārṣṭiṣeṇaḥ hotram ṛṣiḥ niṣīdan devāpiḥ deva sumatim cikitvān
translated: The Rsi Arshtishena, sitting as Hotar, the god-invoker, thinking of the favor of the gods,

original: sa uttarasmād adharaṃ samudram apo divyā asṛjad varṣyā abhi //
analyzed: saḥ uttarasmāt adharam samudram apaḥ divyāḥ asṛjat varṣyāḥ abhi
translated: Sent forth from the northern to the southern ocean the heavenly waters, the rain-giving ones.

original: asmin samudre adhy uttarasminn āpo devebhir nivṛtā atiṣṭhan /
analyzed: asmin samudre adhi uttarasmin āpaḥ devebhiḥ nivṛtāḥ atiṣṭhan
translated: In this northern ocean the waters, restrained by the gods, stood.

original: tā adravann ārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭā devāpinā preṣitā mṛkṣiṇīṣu //
analyzed: tāḥ adravan ārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭāḥ devāpinā preṣitāḥ mṛkṣiṇīṣu
translated: They flowed forth, sent by Arshtishena, urged by the god-invoker, in the moist places.

original: yad devāpiḥ śantanave purohito hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayann adīdhet /
analyzed: yat devāpiḥ śantanave purohitaḥ hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayan adīdhet
translated: When the god-invoker Arshtishena, the priest, chosen as Hotar, desiring to favor Shantanu,

original: devaśrutaṃ vṛṣṭivaniṃ rarāṇo bṛhaspatir vācam asmā ayacchat //
analyzed: deva śrutam vṛṣṭi vanim rarāṇaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vācam asmai ayacchat
translated: Gratified him, longing for the god-heard one who wins rain, Brihaspati gave him speech.

original: yaṃ tvā devāpiḥ śuśucāno agna ārṣṭiṣeṇo manuṣyaḥ samīdhe /
analyzed: yam tvā devāpiḥ śuśucānaḥ agne ārṣṭiṣeṇaḥ manuṣyaḥ samīdhe
translated: O Agni, whom the god-invoker Arshtishena, the man, inflamed, kindled,

original: viśvebhir devair anumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyam īrayā vṛṣṭimantam //
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ anumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyam īraya vṛṣṭimantam
translated: Being approved by all the gods, urge on Parjanya, the rain-bringer.

original: tvām pūrva ṛṣayo gīrbhir āyan tvām adhvareṣu puruhūta viśve /
analyzed: tvām pūrve ṛṣayaḥ gīrbhiḥ āyan tvām adhvareṣu puruhūta viśve
translated: You whom the ancient Rsis invited with songs, you whom all the much-invoked ones chose for the sacrifices,

original: sahasrāṇy adhirathāny asme ā no yajñaṃ rohidaśvopa yāhi //
analyzed: sahasrāṇi adhirathāni asme ā naḥ yajñam rohit aśva upa yāhi
translated: Come to our sacrifice, O thou whose horses are red.

original: etāny agne navatir nava tve āhutāny adhirathā sahasrā /
analyzed: etāni agne navatiḥ nava tve āhutāni adhirathā sahasrā
translated: These, O Agni, are thy ninety-nine hundred chariots,

original: tebhir vardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīr divo no vṛṣṭim iṣito rirīhi //
analyzed: tebhiḥ vardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīḥ divaḥ naḥ vṛṣṭim iṣitaḥ rirīhi
translated: With them, O hero, increase thy many forms, and send us rain from the sky, O thou who art urged on.

original: etāny agne navatiṃ sahasrā sam pra yaccha vṛṣṇa indrāya bhāgam /
analyzed: etāni agne navatim sahasrā sam pra yaccha vṛṣṇe indrāya bhāgam
translated: These, O Agni, ninety thousand, give to Indra, O mighty one, as his share.

original: vidvān patha ṛtuśo devayānān apy aulānaṃ divi deveṣu dhehi //
analyzed: vidvān pathaḥ ṛtuśas deva yānān api aulānam divi deveṣu dhehi
translated: Knowing the paths in due season, leading to the gods, place the oblation in the sky among the gods.

original: agne bādhasva vi mṛdho vi durgahāpāmīvām apa rakṣāṃsi sedha /
analyzed: agne bādhasva vi mṛdhaḥ vi durgahā apa amīvām apa rakṣāṃsi sedha
translated: O Agni, drive away the enemies, drive away the difficulties, drive away evil speech, drive away the Raksases.

original: asmāt samudrād bṛhato divo no 'pām bhūmānam upa naḥ sṛjeha //🔽kaṃ naś citram iṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthugmānaṃ vāśraṃ vāvṛdhadhyai /🔽kat tasya dātu śavaso vyuṣṭau takṣad vajraṃ vṛtraturam apinvat //
analyzed: asmāt samudrāt bṛhataḥ divaḥ naḥ pām bhūmānam upa naḥ sṛja iha  kam naḥ citram iṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthugmānam vāśram vāvṛdhadhyai  kad tasya dātu śavasaḥ vyuṣṭau takṣat vajram vṛtra turam apinvat
translated: From this great ocean, from the sky, from the waters, send us here the wide expanse.🔽To what wondrous thing dost thou incline thy mind, O wise one, to increase the wide-spreading light?🔽What is his power at the time of his rising? He fashions the thunderbolt, the conqueror of Vritra, he fills it.

original: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthuṃ yonim asuratvā sasāda /
analyzed: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthum yonim asura tvā sasāda
translated: For he moves with lightnings and flashes, he has sat down in the wide womb, in the nature of an Asura.

original: sa sanīḷebhiḥ prasahāno asya bhrātur na ṛte saptathasya māyāḥ //
analyzed: sa sanīḍebhiḥ prasahānaḥ asya bhrātuḥ na ṛte saptathasya māyāḥ
translated: He, overcoming with his companions the seven illusions of his brother,

original: sa vājaṃ yātāpaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari ṣadat saniṣyan /🔽anarvā yac chatadurasya vedo ghnañ chiśnadevāṃ abhi varpasā bhūt //
analyzed: sa vājam yātā apaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari sadat saniṣyan  anarvā yat śatadurasya vedaḥ ghnam śiśna devān abhi varpasā bhūt
translated: He, when he goes to win the prize, the hard-won prize, having sat down, desirous of gaining it,🔽When he, the unresisted one, the hundred-doored one's treasure, became, destroying, with his form, the gods who have a member for a god.

original: sa yahvyo 'vanīr goṣv arvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ /
analyzed: sa yahvyaḥ vanīḥ goṣu arvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ
translated: He, the young one, in the low places, in the cows, the most valuable ones, the swift one, offers.

original: apādo yatra yujyāso 'rathā droṇyaśvāsa īrate ghṛtaṃ vāḥ //
analyzed: a pādaḥ yatra yujyāsaḥ rathāḥ droṇī aśvāsaḥ īrate ghṛtam vār
translated: Where the unyoked ones, the chariotless ones, the trough-horses, go forth, the waters of ghee.

original: sa rudrebhir aśastavāra ṛbhvā hitvī gayam āreavadya āgāt /
analyzed: sa rudrebhiḥ a śasta vāraḥ ṛbhvā hitvī gayam āreavadyaḥ āgāt
translated: He, with the Rudras, the one who has no weapon, the powerful one, having left the house, has come, free from blame.

original: vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annam abhītyārodayan muṣāyan //
analyzed: vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annam abhītya arodayat muṣāyan
translated: I think of the pair of the Vamra, the two that have separated, having gone to the food, having caused to rise, having deceived.

original: sa id dāsaṃ tuvīravam patir dan ṣaḷakṣaṃ triśīrṣāṇaṃ damanyat /
analyzed: saḥ id dāsam tuvīravam patiḥ dan ṣaṣ akṣam tri śīrṣāṇam damanyat
translated: He, the lord, has killed the Dāsa, the strong one, the one with six teeth, the three-headed one.

original: asya trito nv ojasā vṛdhāno vipā varāham ayoagrayā han //🔽sa druhvaṇe manuṣa ūrdhvasāna ā sāviṣad arśasānāya śarum /
analyzed: asya tritaḥ nu ojasā vṛdhānaḥ vipā varāham ayoagrayā han  sa druhvaṇe manuṣe ūrdhvasānaḥ ā sāviṣat arśasānāya śarum
translated: By the strength of this Trita, the great one, he has killed the boar with a fang sharp as iron.🔽He, the one who looks up, for Manu, the one who is to be pitied, has sent down the arrow for the one who is to be pitied.

original: sa nṛtamo nahuṣo 'smat sujātaḥ puro 'bhinad arhan dasyuhatye //
analyzed: sa nṛtamaḥ nahuṣaḥ smat su jātaḥ puraḥ bhinat arhan dasyu hatye
translated: He, the best of men, the Nahusha, well-born, the worthy one, has broken through the foe in the battle against the Dasyus.

original: so abhriyo na yavasa udanyan kṣayāya gātuṃ vidan no asme /
analyzed: saḥ abhriyaḥ na yavasaḥ udanyan kṣayāya gātum vidat naḥ asme
translated: He, the one who is not to be overcome, having gone to the food, has found the way for us to go to our own.

original: upa yat sīdad induṃ śarīraiḥ śyeno 'yopāṣṭir hanti dasyūn //
analyzed: upa yat sīdat indum śarīraiḥ śyenaḥ yopāṣṭiḥ hanti dasyūn
translated: When he hath sat down with his own bodies on the stone, the falcon, the iron-beaked, slays the Dasyus.

original: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhir asya kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ kṛpaṇe parādāt /
analyzed: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhiḥ asya kutsāya śuṣṇam kṛpaṇe parādāt
translated: He, with his most powerful ones, hath given away to Kutsa to be slain the wicked Sushna.

original: ayaṃ kavim anayac chasyamānam atkaṃ yo asya sanitota nṛṇām //
analyzed: ayam kavim anayat śasyamānam atkam yaḥ asya sanitā uta nṛṇām
translated: He hath brought hither the poet to be praised, the youngling who is the son of this (man) and of men.

original: ayaṃ daśasyan naryebhir asya dasmo devebhir varuṇo na māyī /
analyzed: ayam daśasyan naryebhiḥ asya dasmaḥ devebhiḥ varuṇaḥ na māyī
translated: This (Indra), the bountiful, with the heroes of this (man), the wondrous, the wise like Varuna,

original: ayaṃ kanīna ṛtupā avedy amimītāraruṃ yaś catuṣpāt //🔽asya stomebhir auśija ṛjiśvā vrajaṃ darayad vṛṣabheṇa piproḥ /
analyzed: ayam kanīnaḥ ṛtu pāḥ avedi amimīta ararum yaḥ catuṣpād  asya stomebhiḥ auśijaḥ ṛjiśvā vrajam darayat vṛṣabheṇa piproḥ
translated: This (Indra) hath known the youngling who is the guardian of the seasons, and hath measured out the four-footed (beast).🔽By his praises Rijiṣvan Auśija hath with the bull of Pipru burst open the stall,

original: sutvā yad yajato dīdayad gīḥ pura iyāno abhi varpasā bhūt //
analyzed: sutvā yat yajataḥ dīdayat gīḥ puraḥ iyānaḥ abhi varpasā bhūt
translated: When, having pressed the juice, the worshipper's song hath shone forth, he hath become, advancing, manifold.

original: evā maho asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhir upa sarpad indram /
analyzed: eva mahaḥ asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhiḥ upa sarpat indram
translated: So, O great Asura, for the sake of speech, Vamraka hath crept with his four (feet) to Indra.

original: sa iyānaḥ karati svastim asmā iṣam ūrjaṃ sukṣitiṃ viśvam ābhāḥ //
analyzed: saḥ iyānaḥ karati svastim asmai iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim viśvam ābhāḥ
translated: He, advancing, makes prosperity for us, and all food and strength and a good dwelling-place.

original: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvad id bhuja iha stutaḥ sutapā bodhi no vṛdhe /
analyzed: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvat id bhuja iha stutaḥ suta pāḥ bodhi naḥ vṛdhe
translated: So, O Indra, be thou propitious, O Maghavan, to us, here praised, O thou of good exhortation, be thou mindful of our prosperity.

original: devebhir naḥ savitā prāvatu śrutam ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: devebhiḥ naḥ savitā prāvatu śrutam ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: May Savitar, the God, prosper us with the Gods: we choose all-surpassing Aditi.

original: bharāya su bharata bhāgam ṛtviyam pra vāyave śucipe krandadiṣṭaye /
analyzed: bharāya su bharata bhāgam ṛtviyam pra vāyave śuci pe krandat iṣṭaye
translated: For the burden, O good Bharata, carry the proper share, to Vayu who delights in the pure, to him who cries out.

original: gaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītim ānaśa ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: gaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītim ānaśe ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose all-surpassing Aditi, to whom belongs the drinking of the milk of the white cow.

original: ā no devaḥ savitā sāviṣad vaya ṛjūyate yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: ā naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat vayaḥ ṛjūyate yajamānāya sunvate
translated: May the god Savitar impel us to strength, to the upright, to the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavad ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavat ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That we may be able to serve the gods with food, we choose all-surpassing Aditi.

original: indro asme sumanā astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasyādhy etu naḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ asme sumanāḥ astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasya adhi etu naḥ
translated: May Indra be well-disposed to us always, may Soma, the king, come to us for our welfare.

original: yathāyathā mitradhitāni saṃdadhur ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: yathā yathā mitradhitāni saṃdadhuḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That the agreements made with our friends may be fulfilled, we choose all-surpassing Aditi.

original: indra ukthena śavasā parur dadhe bṛhaspate pratarītāsy āyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ ukthena śavasā paruḥ dadhe bṛhaspate pratarītā asi āyuṣaḥ
translated: Indra, by the Uktha, has taken up strength, Brihaspati is the leader of our life.

original: yajño manuḥ pramatir naḥ pitā hi kam ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: yajñaḥ manuḥ pramatiḥ naḥ pitā hi kam ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the sacrifice be our Manu, our wise father, we choose all-surpassing Aditi.

original: indrasya nu sukṛtaṃ daivyaṃ saho 'gnir gṛhe jaritā medhiraḥ kaviḥ /
analyzed: indrasya nu su kṛtam daivyam sahaḥ gniḥ gṛhe jaritā medhiraḥ kaviḥ
translated: The well-performed divine strength of Indra, Agni, the wise, the poet, is in my house.

original: yajñaś ca bhūd vidathe cārur antama ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: yajñaḥ ca bhūt vidathe cāruḥ antamaḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: And may the sacrifice be beautiful in the assembly, we choose all-surpassing Aditi.

original: na vo guhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtaṃ nāviṣṭyaṃ vasavo devaheḷanam /🔽mākir no devā anṛtasya varpasa ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: na vaḥ guhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtam na āviṣṭyam vasavaḥ deva heḷanam  mākir naḥ devāḥ anṛtasya varpasaḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
