translated: We have not done you many secret wrongs, nor, O Vasus, have we offended against the gods.🔽May we not, O ye Gods, be subject to the power of untruth. We choose all-protecting Aditi.

original: apāmīvāṃ savitā sāviṣan nyag varīya id apa sedhantv adrayaḥ /
analyzed: apa amīvām savitā sāviṣat varīyaḥ id apa sedhantu adrayaḥ
translated: Savitar hath sent away our evil dream. The stones shall drive it downward and away.

original: grāvā yatra madhuṣud ucyate bṛhad ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //🔽ūrdhvo grāvā vasavo 'stu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutar yuyota /
analyzed: grāvā yatra madhuṣut ucyate bṛhat ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe  ūrdhvaḥ grāvā vasavaḥ stu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutar yuyota
translated: Where the stone is set up, purified with honey, high, we choose all-protecting Aditi.🔽High be the stone, O ye Vasus, in the press-stone. Drive ye away all enmities, O ye all-surpassing.

original: sa no devaḥ savitā pāyur īḍya ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: sa naḥ devaḥ savitā pāyuḥ īḍyaḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That God Savitar is to be invoked as our protector. We choose all-protecting Aditi.

original: ūrjaṃ gāvo yavase pīvo attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośe aṅgdhve /
analyzed: ūrjam gāvaḥ yavase pīvaḥ attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośe aṅgdhve
translated: Let the cows eat the food in the fodder, ye that are fastened in the reservoir of holy order.

original: tanūr eva tanvo astu bheṣajam ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: tanūḥ eva tanvaḥ astu bheṣajam ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let the body be a healing balm for the body. We choose all-protecting Aditi.

original: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatām ava indra id bhadrā pramatiḥ sutāvatām /
analyzed: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatām avaḥ indraḥ id bhadrā pramatiḥ sutāvatām
translated: The singer, Indra, is the best of all in the assemblies, the most bountiful in bestowing his favour.

original: pūrṇam ūdhar divyaṃ yasya siktaya ā sarvatātim aditiṃ vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: pūrṇam ūdhar divyam yasya siktaye ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: Whose heavenly udder is full of libations. We choose all-protecting Aditi.

original: citras te bhānuḥ kratuprā abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdho jaraṇiprā adhṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: citraḥ te bhānuḥ kratu prāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdhaḥ jaraṇi prāḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Wonderful is thy light, O Indra, bountiful thy protection. The foes are subject to thee, O thou who hast the bolt, invincible.

original: rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśva ā gos tūtūrṣati pary agraṃ duvasyuḥ //
analyzed: rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśvaḥ ā goḥ tūtūrṣati pari agram duvasyuḥ
translated: With the most excellent rule he strives for cattle and for the cow, the worshipper for the foremost.

original: ud budhyadhvaṃ samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ sam agnim indhvam bahavaḥ sanīḷāḥ /
analyzed: ud budhyadhvam samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ sam agnim indhvam bahavaḥ sanīḍāḥ
translated: Awake, with one mind, O friends; kindle together the fire, ye many with one purpose.

original: dadhikrām agnim uṣasaṃ ca devīm indrāvato 'vase ni hvaye vaḥ //
analyzed: dadhikrām agnim uṣasam ca devīm indrāvataḥ vase ni hvaye vaḥ
translated: I call you to the help of Indra, to Dadhikrâvan, to the Goddess Dawn.

original: mandrā kṛṇudhvaṃ dhiya ā tanudhvaṃ nāvam aritraparaṇīṃ kṛṇudhvam /🔽iṣkṛṇudhvam āyudhāraṃ kṛṇudhvam prāñcaṃ yajñam pra ṇayatā sakhāyaḥ //
analyzed: mandrā kṛṇudhvam dhiyaḥ ā tanudhvam nāvam aritra paraṇīm kṛṇudhvam  iṣkṛṇudhvam āyudhā aram kṛṇudhvam prāñcam yajñam pra nayata sakhāyaḥ
translated: Make the hymn delightful; spread out the ship that is guided by the oar.🔽Make the boat that carries life; make the sacrifice go forward, O friends.

original: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam /🔽girā ca śruṣṭiḥ sabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt //
analyzed: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvam kṛte yonau vapata iha bījam  girā ca śruṣṭiḥ sabharāḥ asat naḥ nedīyaḥ id sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt
translated: Yoke the ploughs, spread out the yokes; in the prepared soil sow the seed.🔽And may the harvest be abundant for us, and may the reaper come soon.

original: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yugā vi tanvate pṛthak /
analyzed: sīrā yuñjanti kavayaḥ yugā vi tanvate pṛthak
translated: The wise yoke the ploughs, they spread out the yokes separately,

original: dhīrā deveṣu sumnayā //
analyzed: dhīrāḥ deveṣu sumnayā
translated: The wise with a mind inclined to the gods.

original: nir āhāvān kṛṇotana saṃ varatrā dadhātana /🔽siñcāmahā avatam udriṇaṃ vayaṃ suṣekam anupakṣitam //
analyzed: niḥ āhāvān kṛṇotana sam varatrāḥ dadhātana  siñcāmahai avatam udriṇam vayam suṣekam an upakṣitam
translated: Make the ploughs straight, put on the yokes,🔽We will pour out the rain-filled (plough), the well-flowing, the uninjured.

original: iṣkṛtāhāvam avataṃ suvaratraṃ suṣecanam /
analyzed: iṣkṛta āhāvam avatam su varatram suṣecanam
translated: The plough that has a straight share, that has good yokes, that is well-oiled,

original: udriṇaṃ siñce akṣitam //
analyzed: udriṇam siñce akṣitam
translated: I pour out the rain-filled (plough), the uninjured.

original: prīṇītāśvān hitaṃ jayātha svastivāhaṃ ratham it kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: prīṇīta aśvān hitam jayātha svasti vāham ratham id kṛṇudhvam
translated: Anoint the horses, win the booty, and make the chariot victorious and prosperous.

original: droṇāhāvam avatam aśmacakram aṃsatrakośaṃ siñcatā nṛpāṇam //
analyzed: droṇa āhāvam avatam aśma cakram aṃsatra kośam siñcata nṛpāṇam
translated: Remove the bone-breaking, stone-hurling weapon, and sprinkle the chariot with the flesh-cutting one.

original: vrajaṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ sa hi vo nṛpāṇo varma sīvyadhvam bahulā pṛthūni /
analyzed: vrajam kṛṇudhvam sa hi vaḥ nṛpāṇaḥ varma sīvyadhvam bahulā pṛthūni
translated: Make the pen, for that is your flesh-cutting weapon. Sew the many broad coverings.

original: puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīr adhṛṣṭā mā vaḥ susroc camaso dṛṃhatā tam //
analyzed: puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ mā vaḥ susrot camasaḥ dṛṃhata tam
translated: Make the iron forts that cannot be breached. Do not let the leaking pot shake that one.

original: ā vo dhiyaṃ yajñiyāṃ varta ūtaye devā devīṃ yajatāṃ yajñiyām iha /
analyzed: ā vaḥ dhiyam yajñiyām varte ūtaye devāḥ devīm yajatām yajñiyām iha
translated: We invoke your sacrificial thought for help, O gods, the divine one worthy of sacrifice, here.

original: sā no duhīyad yavaseva gatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī gauḥ //🔽ā tū ṣiñca harim īṃ dror upasthe vāśībhis takṣatāśmanmayībhiḥ /
analyzed: sā naḥ duhīyat yavasā iva gatvī sahasra dhārā payasā mahī gauḥ  ā tu siñca harim īm droḥ upasthe vāśībhiḥ takṣata aśmanmayībhiḥ
translated: May it yield for us, like a cow coming to the fodder, the great cow with a thousand streams of milk.🔽Pour out the tawny one on the lap of the press-stone, fashion him with the stone-made ladles.

original: pari ṣvajadhvaṃ daśa kakṣyābhir ubhe dhurau prati vahniṃ yunakta //
analyzed: pari svajadhvam daśa kakṣyābhiḥ ubhe dhurau prati vahnim yunakta
translated: Embrace him with the ten girdles, yoke the fire to both poles.

original: ubhe dhurau vahnir āpibdamāno 'ntar yoneva carati dvijāniḥ /🔽vanaspatiṃ vana āsthāpayadhvaṃ ni ṣū dadhidhvam akhananta utsam //
analyzed: ubhe dhurau vahniḥ āpibdamānaḥ ntar yonā iva carati dvi jāniḥ  vanaspatim vane āsthāpayadhvam ni su dadhidhvam a khanantaḥ utsam
translated: The fire, being pressed between the two poles, moves like a bird in its nest.🔽Establish the tree in the forest, press him down, dig the pit.

original: kapṛn naraḥ kapṛtham ud dadhātana codayata khudata vājasātaye /
analyzed: kapṛth naraḥ kapṛtham ud dadhātana codayata khudata vājasātaye
translated: O men, lift up the tawny one, urge him on to win the prize.

original: niṣṭigryaḥ putram ā cyāvayotaya indraṃ sabādha iha somapītaye //
analyzed: niṣṭigryaḥ putram ā cyāvaya ūtaye indram sabādhaḥ iha soma pītaye
translated: Having seized the son of Niṣṭi, and having driven him away, Indra, with all his might, here to the drinking of Soma.

original: pra te ratham mithūkṛtam indro 'vatu dhṛṣṇuyā /
analyzed: pra te ratham mithūkṛtam indraḥ vatu dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: May Indra help thy chariot yoked in pairs for daring.

original: asminn ājau puruhūta śravāyye dhanabhakṣeṣu no 'va //
analyzed: asmin ājau puruhūta śravāyye dhana bhakṣeṣu naḥ vaḥ
translated: In this battle, O much-invoked one, which brings fame, be thou near us in the contests for booty.

original: ut sma vāto vahati vāso 'syā adhirathaṃ yad ajayat sahasram /🔽rathīr abhūn mudgalānī gaviṣṭau bhare kṛtaṃ vy aced indrasenā //
analyzed: ud sma vātaḥ vahati vāsaḥ syāḥ adhiratham yat ajayat sahasram  rathīḥ abhūt mudgalānī gaviṣṭau bhare kṛtam vi acet indrasenā
translated: The wind blows her garment, when she won a thousand chariots in the race.🔽Mudgalani became a charioteer in the contest for cattle; she divided the booty won by Indra's army.

original: antar yaccha jighāṃsato vajram indrābhidāsataḥ /
analyzed: antar yaccha jighāṃsataḥ vajram indra abhidāsataḥ
translated: Hold back the thunderbolt, O Indra, from those who would slay and injure.

original: dāsasya vā maghavann āryasya vā sanutar yavayā vadham //🔽udno hradam apibaj jarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭaṃ sma tṛṃhad abhimātim eti /🔽pra muṣkabhāraḥ śrava icchamāno 'jiram bāhū abharat siṣāsan //
analyzed: dāsasya vā maghavan āryasya vā sanutar yavaya vadham  udnaḥ hradam apibat jarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭam sma tṛṃhat abhimātim eti  pra muṣka bhāraḥ śravaḥ icchamānaḥ jiram bāhū abharat siṣāsan
translated: Whether of a Dāsa or an Ārya, O bountiful one, send forth thy weapon.🔽He drank the lake Urdhvavāha with joy; he broke the dam and came to the enemy.🔽The one with the heavy testicles, desiring fame, took up his swift arms, longing for (victory).

original: ny akrandayann upayanta enam amehayan vṛṣabham madhya ājeḥ /
analyzed: ni akrandayan upayantaḥ enam amehayan vṛṣabham madhye ājeḥ
translated: They made him roar, approaching him; they made the bull bellow in the midst of the goats.

original: tena sūbharvaṃ śatavat sahasraṃ gavām mudgalaḥ pradhane jigāya //
analyzed: tena sūbharvam śatavat sahasram gavām mudgalaḥ pradhane jigāya
translated: By him Mudgala won a hundred times a thousand excellent cattle in the contest.

original: kakardave vṛṣabho yukta āsīd avāvacīt sārathir asya keśī /
analyzed: kakardave vṛṣabhaḥ yuktaḥ āsīt avāvacīt sārathiḥ asya keśī
translated: The bull was yoked to the mire; his charioteer Keśin cried out.

original: dudher yuktasya dravataḥ sahānasa ṛcchanti ṣmā niṣpado mudgalānīm //
analyzed: dudheḥ yuktasya dravataḥ saha anase ṛcchanti sma niṣpadaḥ mudgalānīm
translated: When the yoked, flowing Dudha, with his companion, they reached the Mudgalani.

original: uta pradhim ud ahann asya vidvān upāyunag vaṃsagam atra śikṣan /
analyzed: uta pradhim ud ahan asya vidvān upāyunak vaṃsagam atra śikṣan
translated: And the wise one lifted up his wheel, and, learning here, yoked the axle.

original: indra ud āvat patim aghnyānām araṃhata padyābhiḥ kakudmān //
analyzed: indraḥ ud āvat patim aghnyānām araṃhata padyābhiḥ kakudmān
translated: Indra lifted up the bull, the lord of the cows, he rushed with the hoppers.

original: śunam aṣṭrāvy acarat kapardī varatrāyāṃ dārv ānahyamānaḥ /
analyzed: śunam aṣṭrāvī acarat kapardī varatrāyām dārū ānahyamānaḥ
translated: The shaven one went well to the bleeding one, the wooden one fastened to the strap.

original: nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya gāḥ paspaśānas taviṣīr adhatta //
analyzed: nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya gāḥ paspaśānaḥ taviṣīḥ adhatta
translated: Making many manly deeds for the people, he, seeing the cows, bestowed his powers.

original: imaṃ tam paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjaṃ kāṣṭhāyā madhye drughaṇaṃ śayānam /
analyzed: imam tam paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjam kāṣṭhāyāḥ madhye drughaṇam śayānam
translated: See him, the yoke of the bull, lying in the middle of the wood, the tormentor.

original: yena jigāya śatavat sahasraṃ gavām mudgalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu //
analyzed: yena jigāya śatavat sahasram gavām mudgalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu
translated: By whom Mudgala conquered a hundred and a thousand cows in the battles for the sacrificial butter.

original: āre aghā ko nv itthā dadarśa yaṃ yuñjanti tam v ā sthāpayanti /🔽nāsmai tṛṇaṃ nodakam ā bharanty uttaro dhuro vahati pradediśat //
analyzed: āre aghā kaḥ nu itthā dadarśa yam yuñjanti tam u ā sthāpayanti  na asmai tṛṇam na udakam ā bharanti uttaraḥ dhuraḥ vahati pradediśat
translated: Who has seen this? Who has seen him whom they yoke and then set free?🔽They bring him neither grass nor water; the upper yoke is drawn by the one who is sent.

original: parivṛkteva patividyam ānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇeva siñcan /
analyzed: parivṛktā iva pati vidyam ānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇa iva siñcan
translated: As if surrounded, he has found his wife; as if overflowing, he pours with the swelling.

original: eṣaiṣyā cid rathyā jayema sumaṅgalaṃ sinavad astu sātam //
analyzed: eṣaiṣyā cit rathyā jayema su maṅgalam sinavat astu sātam
translated: May we win with this chariot, even if it comes. May it be well-omened and bring prosperity.

original: tvaṃ viśvasya jagataś cakṣur indrāsi cakṣuṣaḥ /
analyzed: tvam viśvasya jagataḥ cakṣuḥ indra asi cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, are the eye of the entire world and of the eye,

original: vṛṣā yad ājiṃ vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā //
analyzed: vṛṣā yat ājim vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā
translated: When as a bull you strive in the race, O mighty one, with your lame companion, urging him on.

original: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaś carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Swift, terrible like a bull, the crusher of the strong, the agitator of the people,

original: saṃkrandano 'nimiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senā ajayat sākam indraḥ //
analyzed: saṃkrandanaḥ nimiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākam indraḥ
translated: The roaring, unblinking, single hero Indra, together with the lame one, conquered a hundred armies.

original: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā /
analyzed: saṃkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā
translated: With the roaring, unblinking, victorious, fighting, hard-to-move, daring one,

original: tad indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho nara iṣuhastena vṛṣṇā //
analyzed: tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ naraḥ iṣu hastena vṛṣṇā
translated: With that, O Indra, conquer, be united, in the battle, O men, with the mighty one who wields the arrow.

original: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhir vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudha indro gaṇena /
analyzed: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaḥ indraḥ gaṇena
translated: He, the powerful one, with those who wield arrows and quivers, the gatherer, Indra with his troop,

original: saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhy ugradhanvā pratihitābhir astā //🔽bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrāṃ apabādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭa jit soma pāḥ bāhuśardhī ugra dhanvā pratihitābhiḥ astā  bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrān apabādhamānaḥ
translated: The conqueror in the gathering, the drinker of Soma, the mighty-armed one, the wielder of the fierce bow, with his well-aimed arrows.🔽O Brihaspati, go around with your chariot, the slayer of demons, repelling the enemies,

original: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayann asmākam edhy avitā rathānām //
analyzed: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇaḥ yudhā jayan asmākam edhi avitā rathānām
translated: Crushing the armies, destroying in battle, victorious, be our protector, O Indra, of the chariots.

original: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamāna ugraḥ /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ
translated: Strong, wise, the elder, the hero, the conqueror, the mighty, the strong, the enduring,

original: abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha govit //
analyzed: abhivīraḥ abhisatvā sahaḥ jāḥ jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha go vid
translated: The hero over the heroes, the strong over the strong, born of strength, O Indra, mount the conquering chariot, finding the cattle.

original: gotrabhidaṃ govidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā /
analyzed: gotrabhidam go vidam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā
translated: The splitter of cowpens, the finder of cattle, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the victor, the crusher of enemies with might,

original: imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvam indraṃ sakhāyo anu saṃ rabhadhvam //
analyzed: imam sajātāḥ anu vīrayadhvam indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam
translated: Exert yourselves after this Indra, O kinsmen, be zealous, O friends, after this Indra.

original: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamāno 'dayo vīraḥ śatamanyur indraḥ /
analyzed: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ dayaḥ vīraḥ śata manyuḥ indraḥ
translated: Plunging into the cowpens with violence, the generous hero, Indra of a hundred resentments,

original: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ ayudhyo 'smākaṃ senā avatu pra yutsu //
analyzed: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh ayudhyaḥ smākam senāḥ avatu pra yutsu
translated: Hard to overthrow, victorious in battle, may he protect our army in the battles.

original: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatir dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etu somaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ āsām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etu somaḥ
translated: May Indra be their leader, may Brihaspati be on their right, may the sacrifice go in front, may Soma (go)

original: devasenānām abhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnām maruto yantv agram //
analyzed: deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu agram
translated: May the Maruts go in front of the victorious, conquering hosts of the gods.

original: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānām marutāṃ śardha ugram /
analyzed: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram
translated: The mighty host of Indra the strong, of Varuna the king, of the Adityas, of the Maruts,

original: mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣo devānāṃ jayatām ud asthāt //
analyzed: mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām ud asthāt
translated: The shout of the victorious gods has arisen, of those who move the worlds with their great minds.

original: ud dharṣaya maghavann āyudhāny ut satvanām māmakānām manāṃsi /
analyzed: ud dharṣaya maghavan āyudhāni ud satvanām māmakānām manāṃsi
translated: Excite, O bountiful one, the weapons, excite the minds of my heroes.

original: ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājināny ud rathānāṃ jayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ //
analyzed: ud vṛtrahan vājinām vājināni ud rathānām jayatām yantu ghoṣāḥ
translated: O Vṛtra-slayer, let the forces of the forces, let the shouts of the victorious chariots rise up.

original: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣv asmākaṃ yā iṣavas tā jayantu /
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu
translated: May Indra be with us when our banners are victorious, may our arrows be victorious.

original: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantv asmāṃ u devā avatā haveṣu //🔽amīṣāṃ cittam pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇāṅgāny apve parehi /
analyzed: asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān u devāḥ avata haveṣu  amīṣām cittam pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi
translated: May our heroes be superior, O gods, help us in our invocations.🔽Confusing the minds of these, taking away their limbs, go away, O Apvī.

original: abhi prehi nir daha hṛtsu śokair andhenāmitrās tamasā sacantām //
analyzed: abhi prehi niḥ daha hṛtsu śokaiḥ andhena amitrāḥ tamasā sacantām
translated: Go forth, burn them in their hearts with grief, may the enemies go about in blinding darkness.

original: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yacchatu /
analyzed: pra ita jayata naraḥ indraḥ vaḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: Go forth, O victorious men, may Indra grant you protection.

original: ugrā vaḥ santu bāhavo 'nādhṛṣyā yathāsatha //
analyzed: ugrāḥ vaḥ santu bāhavaḥ na adhṛṣyāḥ yathā asatha
translated: May your arms be strong, as you are unassailable.

original: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyaṃ haribhyāṃ yajñam upa yāhi tūyam /
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyam haribhyām yajñam upa yāhi tūyam
translated: The Soma has been pressed for you, O much-invoked one, come quickly with your two bay horses to the sacrifice.

original: tubhyaṃ giro vipravīrā iyānā dadhanvira indra pibā sutasya //
analyzed: tubhyam giraḥ vipra vīrāḥ iyānāḥ dadhanvire indra piba sutasya
translated: The songs, led by the wise, have come to you, O Indra, drink of the pressed (Soma).

original: apsu dhūtasya harivaḥ pibeha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharam pṛṇasva /
analyzed: apsu dhūtasya harivas piba iha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharam pṛṇasva
translated: Drink of the Soma washed in the waters, O you who love the tawny (horses), fill your belly with the Soma pressed by men.

original: mimikṣur yam adraya indra tubhyaṃ tebhir vardhasva madam ukthavāhaḥ //
analyzed: mimikṣuḥ yam adrayaḥ indra tubhyam tebhiḥ vardhasva madam uktha vāhaḥ
translated: The pressing-stones have mixed this (Soma) for you, O Indra, with them increase your joy, O you who are to be praised with hymns.

original: progrām pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam /
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam
translated: I send forth the true call to the Vṛṣṇis, I send forth the call to the tawny-steed for the sake of the Soma.

original: indra dhenābhir iha mādayasva dhībhir viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ
translated: O Indra, rejoice here with the Dhēna, with all the thoughts, with Śacī, being praised.

original: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayo dadhānā uśija ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayaḥ dadhānāḥ uśijaḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: With your help, O mighty one, through your strength, the wise ones, knowing the truth, bestowing life,

original: prajāvad indra manuṣo duroṇe tasthur gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ //
analyzed: prajāvat indra manuṣaḥ duroṇe tasthuḥ gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ
translated: In the house of men, O Indra, have stood, praising, the best at the feast.

original: praṇītibhiṣ ṭe haryaśva suṣṭoḥ suṣumnasya pururuco janāsaḥ /
analyzed: praṇītibhiḥ te hari aśva suṣṭoḥ suṣumnasya puru rucaḥ janāsaḥ
translated: With the offerings, O you with tawny horses, of the well-praised, the very gracious one, the people,

original: maṃhiṣṭhām ūtiṃ vitire dadhānā stotāra indra tava sūnṛtābhiḥ //
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhām ūtim vitire dadhānāḥ stotāraḥ indra tava sūnṛtābhiḥ
translated: With the most bountiful help, bestowing, O Indra, with your favors, the praisers.

original: upa brahmāṇi harivo haribhyāṃ somasya yāhi pītaye sutasya /
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi harivas haribhyām somasya yāhi pītaye sutasya
translated: Come with the prayers, O you with tawny steeds, with the two tawny ones, to drink the Soma, to drink the pressed (Soma).

original: indra tvā yajñaḥ kṣamamāṇam ānaḍ dāśvāṃ asy adhvarasya praketaḥ //
analyzed: indra tvā yajñaḥ kṣamamāṇam ānaṭ dāśvān asi adhvarasya praketaḥ
translated: The sacrifice has brought you, O Indra, who are to be worshipped, you are the charioteer of this sacrifice, the forerunner.

original: sahasravājam abhimātiṣāhaṃ suteraṇam maghavānaṃ suvṛktim /🔽upa bhūṣanti giro apratītam indraṃ namasyā jarituḥ pananta //
analyzed: sahasra vājam abhimātiṣāham suta īraṇam maghavānam suvṛktim  upa bhūṣanti giraḥ apratītam indram namasyāḥ jarituḥ pananta
translated: The thousand-powered one, the conqueror of enemies, the wealthy one, the one to be praised with good hymns,🔽The unvanquished Indra, the singers praise, the songs adorn him.

original: saptāpo devīḥ suraṇā amṛktā yābhiḥ sindhum atara indra pūrbhit /
analyzed: sapta apaḥ devīḥ su raṇāḥ amṛktāḥ yābhiḥ sindhum ataraḥ indra pūḥ bhid
translated: The seven unerring divine thoughts, O Indra, by which you crossed the river, the fort-destroyer,

original: navatiṃ srotyā nava ca sravantīr devebhyo gātum manuṣe ca vindaḥ //
analyzed: navatim srotyāḥ nava ca sravantīḥ devebhyaḥ gātum manuṣe ca vindaḥ
translated: The ninety streams and the nine flowing rivers, you have found the path for the gods and for man.

original: apo mahīr abhiśaster amuñco 'jāgar āsv adhi deva ekaḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ mahīḥ abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ jāgar āsu adhi devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: You have freed the waters and the great ones from the curse, alone you have watched over them, O god.

original: indra yās tvaṃ vṛtratūrye cakartha tābhir viśvāyus tanvam pupuṣyāḥ //
analyzed: indra yāḥ tvam vṛtratūrye cakartha tābhiḥ viśvāyuḥ tanvam pupuṣyāḥ
translated: O Indra, with those deeds you have done in the battle with Vṛtra, may you, all-life-giving, nourish your body.

original: vīreṇyaḥ kratur indraḥ suśastir utāpi dhenā puruhūtam īṭṭe /
analyzed: vīreṇyaḥ kratuḥ indraḥ su śastiḥ uta api dhenā puruhūtam īṭṭe
translated: Indra is the heroic and praiseworthy power, even the milk-offering invites the much-invoked one.

original: ārdayad vṛtram akṛṇod u lokaṃ sasāhe śakraḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ //🔽śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: ārdayat vṛtram akṛṇot u lokam sasāhe śakraḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ  śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: He has crushed Vṛtra, he has made room, Śakra has conquered the battles as a protector.🔽We should invoke the generous, the most powerful Indra in this task, the best of men in the winning of booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The mighty one who listens for help in the battles, the conqueror of Vr̥itras, the winner of treasures.

original: kadā vaso stotraṃ haryata āva śmaśā rudhad vāḥ /
analyzed: kadā vasoḥ stotram haryataḥ āva śmaśā rudhat vāḥ
translated: When, O Vasu, will you delight in the praise, will you pour down the flowing waters in the desert?

original: dīrghaṃ sutaṃ vātāpyāya //🔽harī yasya suyujā vivratā ver arvantānu śepā /
analyzed: dīrgham sutam vātāpyāya  harī yasya su yujā vivratā veḥ arvantā anu śepā
translated: The long-drawn Soma, to be enjoyed by Vāta.🔽Whose two well-yoked, well-directed bay horses, O Arvān, are to be praised.

original: ubhā rajī na keśinā patir dan //
analyzed: ubhā rajī na keśinā patiḥ
translated: Both are swift, not slow, the lord.

original: apa yor indraḥ pāpaja ā marto na śaśramāṇo bibhīvān /
analyzed: apa yoḥ indraḥ pāpa jaḥ ā martaḥ na śaśramāṇaḥ bibhīvān
translated: Indra, like a frightened mortal, has driven away evil.

original: śubhe yad yuyuje taviṣīvān //
analyzed: śubhe yat yuyuje taviṣīvān
translated: When he has yoked himself for the auspicious, the powerful one.

original: sacāyor indraś carkṛṣa āṃ upānasaḥ saparyan /
analyzed: sacā ayoḥ indraḥ carkṛṣe ām upānasaḥ saparyan
translated: And if Indra is their companion, their supporter, their worshipper,

original: nadayor vivratayoḥ śūra indraḥ //
analyzed: nadayoḥ vivratayoḥ śūraḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra is the hero of the two roaring, widely opened ones.

original: adhi yas tasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai /🔽vanoti śiprābhyāṃ śipriṇīvān //
analyzed: adhi yaḥ tasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai  vanoti śiprābhyām śipriṇīvān
translated: He who stands above them, the two wide ones, the two with hair, for growth,🔽The one with beautiful teeth, with his two beautiful teeth.

original: prāstaud ṛṣvaujā ṛṣvebhis tatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā /
analyzed: prāstaut ṛṣva ojāḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ tatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā
translated: The one of lofty strength has praised with the lofty ones, the hero has fashioned with his strength,

original: ṛbhur na kratubhir mātariśvā //
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ na kratubhiḥ mātariśvā
translated: The wise one with his wisdom, like Matariśvan.

original: vajraṃ yaś cakre suhanāya dasyave hirīmaśo hirīmān /
analyzed: vajram yaḥ cakre su hanāya dasyave hirīmaśaḥ hirīmān
translated: The one who made the thunderbolt for the easy killing of the Dasyu, the daring one, the bold one,

original: arutahanur adbhutaṃ na rajaḥ //
analyzed: a ruta hanuḥ adbhutam na rajaḥ
translated: The one with uncracked jaws, the wondrous one, not the dust.

original: ava no vṛjinā śiśīhy ṛcā vanemānṛcaḥ /
analyzed: ava naḥ vṛjinā śiśīhi ṛcā vanema anṛcaḥ
translated: Sharpen for us the crooked one, with the Ṛc, the one to be praised with the Ṛc.

original: nābrahmā yajña ṛdhag joṣati tve //
analyzed: na abrahmā yajñaḥ ṛdhak joṣati tve
translated: The sacrifice does not prosper for one who is not a brahmin, in you.

original: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūd yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman /
analyzed: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūt yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman
translated: When your third part rose up, in the abode of the sacrifice's smoke,

original: sajūr nāvaṃ svayaśasaṃ sacāyoḥ //
analyzed: sajūs nāvam sva yaśasam sacā ayoḥ
translated: The boat with its own glory, together with the companion.

original: śriye te pṛśnir upasecanī bhūc chriye darvir arepāḥ /
analyzed: śriye te pṛśniḥ upasecanī bhūt śriye darviḥ arepāḥ
translated: May the speckled one be your sprinkling for glory, the unsoiled ladle for glory,

original: yayā sve pātre siñcasa ut //
analyzed: yayā sve pātre siñcase ud
translated: With which you sprinkle in your own vessel.

original: śataṃ vā yad asurya prati tvā sumitra itthāstaud durmitra itthāstaut /
analyzed: śatam vā yat asurya prati tvā sumitraḥ itthā astaut durmitraḥ itthā astaut
translated: If the Asura, a hundred times, has praised you here, the one with good friends, the one with bad friends has praised you here,

original: āvo yad dasyuhatye kutsaputram prāvo yad dasyuhatye kutsavatsam //
analyzed: āvaḥ yat dasyu hatye kutsa putram prāvaḥ yat dasyu hatye kutsa vatsam
translated: When you came to the killing of the Dasyu, the son of Kutsa, when you came to the killing of the Dasyu, the son of Kutsa.

original: ubhā u nūnaṃ tad id arthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyo vastrāpaseva /
analyzed: ubhau u nūnam tat id arthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyaḥ vastrā apasā iva
translated: Both of you now do that for which you were created; you spread forth your thoughts like two clouds.

original: sadhrīcīnā yātave prem ajīgaḥ sudineva pṛkṣa ā taṃsayethe //🔽uṣṭāreva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogeva śvātryā śāsur ethaḥ /🔽dūteva hi ṣṭho yaśasā janeṣu māpa sthātam mahiṣevāvapānāt //
analyzed: sadhrīcīnā yātave pra īm ajīgaḥ su dinā iva pṛkṣaḥ ā taṃsayethe  uṣṭārā iva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogā iva śvātryā śāsuḥ ethaḥ  dūtā iva hi sthaḥ yaśasā janeṣu mā apa sthātam mahiṣā iva avapānāt
translated: You have come together to go, like two well-timed drops of rain, you have united like two pieces of wood.🔽You have settled down like two camels in the desert, you have come like two dogs in a contest.🔽For you are like two messengers with fame among the people; do not stay away like two bulls from the trough.

original: sākaṃyujā śakunasyeva pakṣā paśveva citrā yajur ā gamiṣṭam /
analyzed: sākaṃyujā śakunasya iva pakṣā paśū eva citrā yajuḥ ā gamiṣṭam
translated: Like the two wings of a bird yoked together, like two variegated sacrificial formulas, come to us.

original: agnir iva devayor dīdivāṃsā parijmāneva yajathaḥ purutrā //
analyzed: agniḥ iva devayoḥ dīdivāṃsā parijmānā iva yajathaḥ purutrā
translated: Like two fires burning in the house of the gods, like two wandering (fires), you two worship in many ways.

original: āpī vo asme pitareva putrogreva rucā nṛpatīva turyai /
analyzed: āpī vaḥ asme pitarā iva putrā ugrā iva rucā nṛpatī iva turyai
translated: Like a father to his son, like two bulls with great splendor, like two kings for the sake of the people,

original: iryeva puṣṭyai kiraṇeva bhujyai śruṣṭīvāneva havam ā gamiṣṭam //
analyzed: iryā iva puṣṭyai kiraṇā iva bhujyai havam ā gamiṣṭam
translated: Like two who are to be heard, come to my call, like two who are to be nourished, like two who are to be enjoyed, like two who are to be served.

original: vaṃsageva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitreva ṛtā śatarā śātapantā /
analyzed: vaṃsagā iva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitrā iva ṛtā śatarā
translated: Like two who are to be praised, like two who are to be honored, like two who are to be served, like two who are to be worshipped,

original: vājevoccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣeveṣā saparyā purīṣā //
analyzed: vājā iva uccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣā iva īṣā saparyā purīṣā
translated: Like two who are to be exalted, like two who are to be praised, like two who are to be served, like two who are to be honored.

original: sṛṇyeva jarbharī turpharītū naitośeva turpharī parpharīkā /
analyzed: sṛṇyā iva jarbharī naitośā iva turpharī parpharīkā
translated: Like two who are to be served, like two who are to be praised, like two who are to be served, like two who are to be honored.

original: udanyajeva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyv ajaram marāyu //🔽pajreva carcaraṃ jāram marāyu kṣadmevārtheṣu tartarītha ugrā /🔽ṛbhū nāpat kharamajrā kharajrur vāyur na parpharat kṣayad rayīṇām //🔽gharmeva madhu jaṭhare sanerū bhagevitā turpharī phārivāram /🔽patareva cacarā candranirṇiṅ manaṛṅgā mananyā na jagmī //
analyzed: udanya jā iva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyū ajaram marāyu  carcaram jāram marāyu kṣadma iva artheṣu tartarītha ugrā  ṛbhū kharamajrā kharajruḥ vāyuḥ na kṣayat rayīṇām  gharmā iva madhu jaṭhare sanerū turpharī  patarā iva cacarā candra nirṇij manaṛṅgā mananyā na jagmī
translated: Like a bird in the sky, in the joy of the dance, you two, with your old age, have made me immortal, with your youth, mortal.

original: bṛhanteva gambhareṣu pratiṣṭhām pādeva gādhaṃ tarate vidāthaḥ /🔽karṇeva śāsur anu hi smarātho 'ṃśeva no bhajataṃ citram apnaḥ //🔽āraṅgareva madhv erayethe sāragheva gavi nīcīnabāre /🔽kīnāreva svedam āsiṣvidānā kṣāmevorjā sūyavasāt sacethe //🔽ṛdhyāma stomaṃ sanuyāma vājam ā no mantraṃ sarathehopa yātam /🔽yaśo na pakvam madhu goṣv antar ā bhūtāṃśo aśvinoḥ kāmam aprāḥ //
analyzed: bṛhantā iva gambhareṣu pratiṣṭhām pādā iva gādham tarate vidāthaḥ 🔽karṇā iva śāsuḥ anu hi smarātha u ṃśā iva naḥ bhajatam citram apnaḥ 🔽āraṅgarā iva madhū erayethe sāraghā iva gavi nīcīna bāre 🔽kīnārā iva svedam āsiṣvidānā kṣāmā iva ūrjā sū yavasāt sacethe 🔽ṛdhyāma stomam sanuyāma vājam ā naḥ mantram sa rathā iha upa yātam 🔽yaśaḥ na pakvam madhu goṣu antar ā bhūtāṃśaḥ aśvinoḥ kāmam aprāḥ
translated: Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a bird, you two, in the sky, have made the mortal immortal. Like a

original: āvir abhūn mahi māghonam eṣāṃ viśvaṃ jīvaṃ tamaso nir amoci /
analyzed: āvis abhūt mahi māghonam eṣām viśvam jīvam tamasaḥ niḥ amoci
translated: This great light of theirs became manifest, which set free all living beings from darkness.

original: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhir dattam āgād uruḥ panthā dakṣiṇāyā adarśi //
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhiḥ dattam āgāt uruḥ panthāḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ adarśi
translated: The great light given by the Fathers has come. A wide path has been seen for the Dakṣiṇā.

original: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthur ye aśvadāḥ saha te sūryeṇa /
analyzed: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvantaḥ asthuḥ ye aśva dāḥ saha te sūryeṇa
translated: Those who give horses have gone up high in heaven with the Dakṣiṇā, together with the sun.

original: hiraṇyadā amṛtatvam bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pra tiranta āyuḥ //
analyzed: hiraṇya dāḥ amṛta tvam bhajante vāsaḥ dāḥ soma pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: Those who give gold attain immortality, O Soma, those who give garments prolong their life.

original: daivī pūrtir dakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi te pṛṇanti /
analyzed: daivī pūrtiḥ dakṣiṇā deva yajyā na kavā aribhyaḥ nahi te pṛṇanti
translated: The Dakṣiṇā is the divine fulfillment, the divine sacrifice. They do not satisfy the niggards, for they do not give.

original: athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso 'vadyabhiyā bahavaḥ pṛṇanti //
analyzed: athā naraḥ prayata dakṣiṇāsaḥ vadya bhiyā bahavaḥ pṛṇanti
translated: But many men who offer the Dakṣiṇā, who are afraid of blame, satisfy (the gods).

original: śatadhāraṃ vāyum arkaṃ svarvidaṃ nṛcakṣasas te abhi cakṣate haviḥ /
analyzed: śata dhāram vāyum arkam svar vidam nṛ cakṣasaḥ te abhi cakṣate haviḥ
translated: The hundred-streamed wind, the sun that finds the heaven, the men who see with the eye of truth look upon the oblation.

original: ye pṛṇanti pra ca yacchanti saṃgame te dakṣiṇāṃ duhate saptamātaram //
analyzed: ye pṛṇanti pra ca yacchanti saṃgame te dakṣiṇām duhate sapta mātaram
translated: Those who give and bestow at the meeting, they milk the seven-mothered Dakṣiṇā.

original: dakṣiṇāvān prathamo hūta eti dakṣiṇāvān grāmaṇīr agram eti /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvān prathamaḥ hūtaḥ eti dakṣiṇāvān grāmaṇīḥ agram eti
translated: He who possesses the Dakṣiṇā goes first, invited. He who possesses the Dakṣiṇā, the village chief, goes first.

original: tam eva manye nṛpatiṃ janānāṃ yaḥ prathamo dakṣiṇām āvivāya //
analyzed: tam eva manye nṛpatim janānām yaḥ prathamaḥ dakṣiṇām āvivāya
translated: I think of him alone as the king of men, who first offers the Dakṣiṇā.

original: tam eva ṛṣiṃ tam u brahmāṇam āhur yajñanyaṃ sāmagām ukthaśāsam /
analyzed: tam eva ṛṣim tam u brahmāṇam āhuḥ yajñanyam sāma gām uktha śāsam
translated: Him alone they call the Ṛṣi, the Brahman, the one who loves the sacrifice, the chanter of the Sāman, the one who knows the hymns.

original: sa śukrasya tanvo veda tisro yaḥ prathamo dakṣiṇayā rarādha //
analyzed: sa śukrasya tanvaḥ veda tisraḥ yaḥ prathamaḥ dakṣiṇayā rarādha
translated: He who first gave a reward knows the three forms of Shukra.

original: dakṣiṇāśvaṃ dakṣiṇā gāṃ dadāti dakṣiṇā candram uta yad dhiraṇyam /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā aśvam dakṣiṇā gām dadāti dakṣiṇā candram uta yat hiraṇyam
translated: The reward gives a horse, the reward gives a cow, the reward gives a moon and also gold.

original: dakṣiṇānnaṃ vanute yo na ātmā dakṣiṇāṃ varma kṛṇute vijānan //
analyzed: dakṣiṇā annam vanute yaḥ naḥ ātmā dakṣiṇām varma kṛṇute vijānan
translated: The reward wins food, which is our own self, the reward makes a shield, the wise one.

original: na bhojā mamrur na nyartham īyur na riṣyanti na vyathante ha bhojāḥ /
analyzed: na bhojāḥ mamruḥ na nyartham īyuḥ na riṣyanti na vyathante ha bhojāḥ
translated: The Bhojas have not died, they have not gone to ruin, the Bhojas are not harmed, they do not suffer.

original: idaṃ yad viśvam bhuvanaṃ svaś caitat sarvaṃ dakṣiṇaibhyo dadāti //🔽bhojā jigyuḥ surabhiṃ yonim agre bhojā jigyur vadhvaṃ yā suvāsāḥ /🔽bhojā jigyur antaḥpeyaṃ surāyā bhojā jigyur ye ahūtāḥ prayanti //
analyzed: idam yat viśvam bhuvanam svar ca etat sarvam dakṣiṇā ebhyaḥ dadāti  bhojāḥ jigyuḥ surabhim yonim agre bhojāḥ jigyuḥ vadhvam yā su vāsāḥ  bhojāḥ jigyuḥ antaḥpeyam surāyāḥ bhojāḥ jigyuḥ ye a hūtāḥ prayanti
translated: He gives to the Bhojas all this universe and the heaven, all this he gives to the Bhojas.🔽The Bhojas first won the fragrant womb, the Bhojas won the bride who has fine clothes.🔽The Bhojas won the drink to be drunk with the Surā, the Bhojas won those who go when not invited.

original: bhojāyāśvaṃ sam mṛjanty āśum bhojāyāste kanyā śumbhamānā /
analyzed: bhojāya aśvam sam mṛjanti āśum bhojāya āste kanyā śumbhamānā
translated: For the Bhoja they besmear the swift horse, for the Bhoja your maiden is adorned.

original: bhojasyedam puṣkariṇīva veśma pariṣkṛtaṃ devamāneva citram //
analyzed: bhojasya idam puṣkariṇī iva veśma pariṣkṛtam deva mānā iva citram
translated: This house of the Bhoja is like a lotus-pond, well-fashioned, beautiful like a god's abode.

original: bhojam aśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāho vahanti suvṛd ratho vartate dakṣiṇāyāḥ /
analyzed: bhojam aśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāhaḥ vahanti suvṛt rathaḥ vartate dakṣiṇāyāḥ
translated: The horses of the Bhoja carry him, the swift one, the well-formed chariot moves for the reward.

original: bhojaṃ devāso 'vatā bhareṣu bhojaḥ śatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā //🔽kim icchantī saramā predam ānaḍ dūre hy adhvā jaguriḥ parācaiḥ /
analyzed: bhojam devāsaḥ vata bhareṣu bhojaḥ śatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā  kim icchantī saramā pra idam ānaṭ dūre hi adhvā jaguriḥ parācais
translated: The Gods have made the Bhojam strong in battles, the Bhojam, in the van, the conqueror of foemen.🔽What did Saramâ desire that she should come hither? The way is long, the journey is fatiguing.

original: kāsmehitiḥ kā paritakmyāsīt kathaṃ rasāyā ataraḥ payāṃsi //
analyzed: kā asmehitiḥ kā paritakmyā āsīt katham rasāyāḥ ataraḥ payāṃsi
translated: What was her errand here? What was her business? How didst thou pass the streams of the Rasâ?

original: indrasya dūtīr iṣitā carāmi maha icchantī paṇayo nidhīn vaḥ /
analyzed: indrasya dūtīḥ iṣitā carāmi mahaḥ icchantī paṇayaḥ nidhīn vaḥ
translated: I go as a messenger of Indra, seeking great things, to your treasures, O Paṇis.

original: atiṣkado bhiyasā tan na āvat tathā rasāyā ataram payāṃsi //
analyzed: atiṣkadaḥ bhiyasā tat naḥ āvat tathā rasāyāḥ ataram payāṃsi
translated: The destroyer hath been afraid of me: thus have I passed the streams of the Rasâ.

original: kīdṛṅṅ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasyedaṃ dūtīr asaraḥ parākāt /
analyzed: kīdṛś indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasya idam dūtīḥ asaraḥ parākāt
translated: What kind of Indra is Saramâ? What like is he, whose messenger thou hast come from afar?

original: ā ca gacchān mitram enā dadhāmāthā gavāṃ gopatir no bhavāti //
analyzed: ā ca gacchāt mitram enā dadhāma athā gavām gopatiḥ naḥ bhavāti
translated: We will go to him and make him our friend: then will he be the lord of our cattle.

original: nāhaṃ taṃ veda dabhyaṃ dabhat sa yasyedaṃ dūtīr asaram parākāt /
analyzed: na aham tam veda dabhyam dabhat sa yasya idam dūtīḥ asaram parākāt
translated: I know not him whom thou hast come to visit from afar, the deceiver of the deceiver.

original: na taṃ gūhanti sravato gabhīrā hatā indreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve //
analyzed: na tam gūhanti sravataḥ gabhīrāḥ hatāḥ indreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve
translated: The deep streams do not hide him: slain by Indra, the Paṇis lie down.

original: imā gāvaḥ sarame yā aicchaḥ pari divo antān subhage patantī /
analyzed: imāḥ gāvaḥ sarame yāḥ aicchaḥ pari divaḥ antān subhage patantī
translated: These are the cows, O Saramâ, which thou hast sought: flying round the ends of the sky, O blessed one.

original: kas ta enā ava sṛjād ayudhvy utāsmākam āyudhā santi tigmā //
analyzed: kaḥ te enāḥ ava sṛjāt a yudhvī uta asmākam āyudhā santi tigmā
translated: Who shall loose them for thee, who is not a warrior? But our weapons are sharp.

original: asenyā vaḥ paṇayo vacāṃsy aniṣavyās tanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ /
analyzed: asenyā vaḥ paṇayaḥ vacāṃsi aniṣavyāḥ tanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ
translated: Let your words, O enemies, be unwarlike, let your bodies be unwarlike, O wicked ones.

original: adhṛṣṭo va etavā astu panthā bṛhaspatir va ubhayā na mṛḷāt //
analyzed: adhṛṣṭaḥ vaḥ etavai astu panthāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vaḥ ubhayā na mṛḷāt
translated: Let your path be unassailable, O you two, may Brihaspati be kind to both of us.

original: ayaṃ nidhiḥ sarame adribudhno gobhir aśvebhir vasubhir nyṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: ayam nidhiḥ sarame adri budhnaḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ vasubhiḥ ni ṛṣṭaḥ
translated: This treasure, O Saramā, with a rocky base, is filled with cattle, horses, and riches.

original: rakṣanti tam paṇayo ye sugopā reku padam alakam ā jagantha //
analyzed: rakṣanti tam paṇayaḥ ye su gopāḥ reku padam alakam ā jagantha
translated: The enemies guard it, who are good guardians. You have come to the hidden place, the hidden foot.

original: eha gamann ṛṣayaḥ somaśitā ayāsyo aṅgiraso navagvāḥ /
analyzed: ā iha gaman ṛṣayaḥ soma śitāḥ ayāsyaḥ aṅgirasaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: Come hither, O Saramā, the Rṣis who are purified by Soma, the Aṅgiras with new songs, the Aṛṣṭanemi.

original: ta etam ūrvaṃ vi bhajanta gonām athaitad vacaḥ paṇayo vamann it //
analyzed: te etam ūrvam vi bhajanta gonām atha etat vacaḥ paṇayaḥ vaman id
translated: They divide this pasture of cattle. Then the enemies, vomiting this speech,

original: evā ca tvaṃ sarama ājagantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena /
analyzed: evā ca tvam sarame ājagantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena
translated: Thus, O Saramā, you have come. You are oppressed by the divine power.

original: svasāraṃ tvā kṛṇavai mā punar gā apa te gavāṃ subhage bhajāma //
analyzed: svasāram tvā kṛṇavai mā punar gāḥ apa te gavām subhage bhajāma
translated: I will make you my sister. Do not go again. O you of good fortune, I will give you a share of the cattle.

original: nāhaṃ veda bhrātṛtvaṃ no svasṛtvam indro vidur aṅgirasaś ca ghorāḥ /
analyzed: na aham veda bhrātṛ tvam no svasṛ tvam indraḥ viduḥ aṅgirasaḥ ca ghorāḥ
translated: I do not know our brotherhood or sisterhood. Indra and the terrible Aṅgiras know.

original: gokāmā me acchadayan yad āyam apāta ita paṇayo varīyaḥ //
analyzed: go kāmāḥ me acchadayan yat āyam apa atas ita paṇayaḥ varīyaḥ
translated: They have hidden this, desiring cattle, when it came. The enemies have gone away better.

original: dūram ita paṇayo varīya ud gāvo yantu minatīr ṛtena /
analyzed: dūram ita paṇayaḥ varīyaḥ ud gāvaḥ yantu minatīḥ ṛtena
translated: Far away have the enemies gone better. Let the cows go forth, measuring with the Ṛte.

original: bṛhaspatir yā avindan nigūḷhāḥ somo grāvāṇa ṛṣayaś ca viprāḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ yāḥ avindat nigūḍhāḥ somaḥ grāvāṇaḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca viprāḥ
translated: Brihaspati, the hidden ones whom they found, Soma, the pressing-stone, and the Rishis, the sages.

original: te 'vadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe 'kūpāraḥ salilo mātariśvā /
analyzed: te vadan prathamāḥ brahma kilbiṣe kūpāraḥ salilaḥ mātariśvā
translated: They spoke first about the sin against the Brahman-wife: Akupâra, the watery one, and Matarisvan,

original: vīḷuharās tapa ugro mayobhūr āpo devīḥ prathamajā ṛtena //
analyzed: vīḍu harāḥ tapaḥ ugraḥ mayaḥ bhūḥ āpaḥ devīḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtena
translated: The cloud-bringers, the fierce heat, the beneficent one, the divine waters, the first-born by truth.

original: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyām punaḥ prāyacchad ahṛṇīyamānaḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ rājā prathamaḥ brahma jāyām punar prāyacchat a hṛṇīyamānaḥ
translated: King Soma first, without being asked, gave back the Brahman-wife.

original: anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīd agnir hotā hastagṛhyā nināya //
analyzed: anvartitā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ āsīt agniḥ hotā hasta gṛhya ā nināya
translated: Varuna followed, Mitra was present, the priest Agni took her by the hand and led her away.

original: hastenaiva grāhya ādhir asyā brahmajāyeyam iti ced avocan /
analyzed: hastena eva grāhyaḥ ādhiḥ asyāḥ brahma jāyā iyam iti ced avocan
translated: If they said, The pledge is to be taken by the hand, this is the Brahman-wife,

original: na dūtāya prahye tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ gupitaṃ kṣatriyasya //
analyzed: na dūtāya prahye tasthe eṣā tathā rāṣṭram gupitam kṣatriyasya
translated: Not to the messenger is this to be given, so is the protected kingdom of the Kshatriya.

original: devā etasyām avadanta pūrve saptaṛṣayas tapase ye niṣeduḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ etasyām avadanta pūrve sapta ṛṣayaḥ tapase ye niṣeduḥ
translated: The gods spoke about this in the past, the seven Rishis who sat down to austerity.

original: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyopanītā durdhāṃ dadhāti parame vyoman //
analyzed: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasya upanītā durdhām dadhāti parame vyoman
translated: The terrible wife of the Brahman, when brought, places a burden hard to bear in the highest heaven.

original: brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavaty ekam aṅgam /
analyzed: brahmacārī carati veviṣat viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavati ekam aṅgam
translated: The student moves about in the house of his teacher, he becomes one of the limbs of the gods.

original: tena jāyām anv avindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃ juhvaṃ na devāḥ //
analyzed: tena jāyām anu avindat bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītām juhvam na devāḥ
translated: By him Brihaspati found his wife again, whom the gods led away with Soma, as if she were an oblation.

original: punar vai devā adaduḥ punar manuṣyā uta /
analyzed: punar vai devāḥ adaduḥ punar manuṣyāḥ uta
translated: The gods have given back again, and men have given back again.

original: rājānaḥ satyaṃ kṛṇvānā brahmajāyām punar daduḥ //
analyzed: rājānaḥ satyam kṛṇvānāḥ brahma jāyām punar daduḥ
translated: The kings, making truth their vow, have given back the Brahman's wife.

original: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvī devair nikilbiṣam /
analyzed: punar dāya brahma jāyām kṛtvī devaiḥ nikilbiṣam
translated: Having given back the Brahman's wife, and made atonement to the gods,

original: ūrjam pṛthivyā bhaktvāyorugāyam upāsate //
analyzed: ūrjam pṛthivyāḥ bhaktvāya urugāyam upāsate
translated: They enjoy the food of the earth, the food of the wide air.

original: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ /🔽ā ca vaha mitramahaś cikitvān tvaṃ dūtaḥ kavir asi pracetāḥ //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ adya manuṣaḥ duroṇe devaḥ devān yajasi jātavedaḥ  ā ca vaha mitra mahas cikitvān tvam dūtaḥ kaviḥ asi pracetāḥ
translated: Kindled today in the house of Manu, O man, thou, O all-knower, worshippest the gods.🔽And bringing them together, O wise one, thou art the messenger, the wise, the far-seeing sage.

original: tanūnapāt patha ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadayā sujihva /
analyzed: tanūnapāt pathaḥ ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadaya sujihva
translated: O Tanūnapāt, anointing with honey the paths of sacrifice, with thy tongue, O good-tongued one,

original: manmāni dhībhir uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhy adhvaraṃ naḥ //
analyzed: manmāni dhībhiḥ uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhi adhvaram naḥ
translated: Inspiring our thoughts and our sacrifice, make our sacrifice acceptable to the gods.

original: ājuhvāna īḍyo vandyaś cā yāhy agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ īḍyaḥ vandyaḥ ca ā yāhi agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: To be invoked, to be praised, to be worshipped, go, O Agni, in unison with the Vasus.

original: tvaṃ devānām asi yahva hotā sa enān yakṣīṣito yajīyān //
analyzed: tvam devānām asi yahva hotā saḥ enān yakṣi iṣitaḥ yajīyān
translated: Thou art the young Hotri priest of the gods; serve them, being invoked, as the best sacrificer.

original: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyā vastor asyā vṛjyate agre ahnām /
analyzed: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ vastoḥ asyāḥ vṛjyate agre ahnām
translated: The ancient sacrificial grass is spread out in the direction of the earth, in front of this dwelling, at the beginning of the days.

original: vy u prathate vitaraṃ varīyo devebhyo aditaye syonam //
analyzed: vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ devebhyaḥ aditaye syonam
translated: It spreads out widely, more widely, in a pleasant way, for the gods, for Aditi.

original: vyacasvatīr urviyā vi śrayantām patibhyo na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ /
analyzed: vyacasvatīḥ urviyā vi śrayantām patibhyaḥ na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: Let the spacious ones, extending with their breadth, be set in order, like the women of a house, for their lords.

original: devīr dvāro bṛhatīr viśvaminvā devebhyo bhavata suprāyaṇāḥ //
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ bṛhatīḥ viśvaminvāḥ devebhyaḥ bhavata su prāyaṇāḥ
translated: Ye heavenly doors, ye lofty ones, ye all-impelling ones, be easy of access to the gods.

original: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ ni yonau /
analyzed: ā yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatām ni yonau
translated: The two who are eager to attend the sacrifice, Dawn and Night, let them sit in the place of worship.

original: divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī surukme adhi śriyaṃ śukrapiśaṃ dadhāne //
analyzed: divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī su rukme adhi śriyam śukrapiśam dadhāne
translated: The two heavenly maidens, lofty, of beautiful wheels, bestowing on us the bright and the pure glory.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā suvācā mimānā yajñam manuṣo yajadhyai /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā su vācā mimānā yajñam manuṣaḥ yajadhyai
translated: The two divine Hotars, first in good speech, allotting the sacrifice for man to worship,

original: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnaṃ jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā //
analyzed: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnam jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā
translated: Urging the priests in the sacrifices, pointing out the light of the east in the directions.

original: ā no yajñam bhāratī tūyam etv iḷā manuṣvad iha cetayantī /
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam bhāratī tūyam etu iḷā manuṣvat iha cetayantī
translated: May Bharati come quickly to our sacrifice, Iḷā, thinking here as among men.

original: tisro devīr barhir edaṃ syonaṃ sarasvatī svapasaḥ sadantu //
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam syonam sarasvatī su apasaḥ sadantu
translated: Let the three goddesses, Sarasvatī, with good powers, sit on this pleasant sacrificial strew.

original: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpair apiṃśad bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpaiḥ apiṃśat bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who has fashioned these two, heaven and earth, the two mothers, with forms, all the worlds,

original: tam adya hotar iṣito yajīyān devaṃ tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān //
analyzed: tam adya hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān devam tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān
translated: Him, O Hotṛ, urged on, most worthy of worship, knower, worship here the god Tvaṣṭar.

original: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pātha ṛtuthā havīṃṣi /
analyzed: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pāthaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi
translated: Pouring out, uniting with thyself, offer the oblations to the gods in due season.

original: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devo agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena //
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devaḥ agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena
translated: May the tree, the purifying god Agni, relish the offering with honey and ghee.

original: sadyo jāto vy amimīta yajñam agnir devānām abhavat purogāḥ /
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ vi amimīta yajñam agniḥ devānām abhavat purogāḥ
translated: As soon as born, he measured out the sacrifice. Agni became the leader of the gods.

original: asya hotuḥ pradiśy ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtaṃ havir adantu devāḥ //
analyzed: asya hotuḥ pradiśi ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtam haviḥ adantu devāḥ
translated: Of this Hotar, in the direction of truth's speech, may the gods enjoy the oblation offered with svāhā.

original: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvam manīṣāṃ yathāyathā matayaḥ santi nṛṇām /🔽indraṃ satyair erayāmā kṛtebhiḥ sa hi vīro girvaṇasyur vidānaḥ //
analyzed: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvam manīṣām yathā yathā matayaḥ santi nṛṇām  indram satyaiḥ ā īrayāma kṛtebhiḥ sa hi vīraḥ girvaṇasyuḥ vidānaḥ
translated: You who are wise, bring forth your wisdom, as the thoughts of men are in various ways.🔽With true words they have urged Indra, for he is the hero who loves the song, the finder.

original: ṛtasya hi sadaso dhītir adyaut saṃ gārṣṭeyo vṛṣabho gobhir ānaṭ /
analyzed: ṛtasya hi sadasaḥ dhītiḥ adyaut sam gārṣṭeyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ gobhiḥ ānaṭ
translated: For the thought of the seat of truth has shone forth. The bull of the Gārhapatya has come with the cows.

original: ud atiṣṭhat taviṣeṇā raveṇa mahānti cit saṃ vivyācā rajāṃsi //
analyzed: ud atiṣṭhat taviṣeṇa raveṇa mahānti cit sam vivyāca rajāṃsi
translated: He has stood up with powerful roar, he has penetrated even the great expanses.

original: indraḥ kila śrutyā asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛt sūryāya /
analyzed: indraḥ kila śrutyāḥ asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛt sūryāya
translated: Indra, indeed, knows him by his fame, for he is the victorious one who makes paths for the sun.

original: ān menāṃ kṛṇvann acyuto bhuvad goḥ patir divaḥ sanajā apratītaḥ //
analyzed: āt menām kṛṇvan acyutaḥ bhuvat goḥ patiḥ divaḥ sana jāḥ apratītaḥ
translated: Making the cloud, he has become the imperishable lord of the cow, the lord of heaven, unconquered from birth.

original: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vratāminād aṅgirobhir gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā mahataḥ arṇavasya vratā amināt aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: By means of the Aṅgiras, Indra, being praised, has fulfilled the vow of the great ocean.

original: purūṇi cin ni tatānā rajāṃsi dādhāra yo dharuṇaṃ satyatātā //
analyzed: purūṇi cit ni tatāna rajāṃsi dādhāra yaḥ dharuṇam satyatātā
translated: He who upholds the true support has spread out even many expanses.

original: indro divaḥ pratimānam pṛthivyā viśvā veda savanā hanti śuṣṇam /
analyzed: indraḥ divaḥ pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ viśvā veda savanā hanti śuṣṇam
translated: Indra is the measure of heaven and earth. He knows all the libations and slays the wicked.

original: mahīṃ cid dyām ātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha cit kambhanena skabhīyān //🔽vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtram astar adevasya śūśuvānasya māyāḥ /
analyzed: mahīm cit dyām ātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha cit kambhanena skabhīyān  vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtram astar adevasya śūśuvānasya māyāḥ
translated: He has stretched out the vast sky with the sun, and with the more powerful bolt he has supported it.🔽For with the thunderbolt the Vr̥itra-slayer smote down Vr̥itra, and the illusions of the godless one who waxed in strength.

original: vi dhṛṣṇo atra dhṛṣatā jaghanthāthābhavo maghavan bāhvojāḥ //
analyzed: vi dhṛṣṇaḥ atra dhṛṣatā jaghantha atha abhavaḥ maghavan bāhu ojāḥ
translated: Then, O bold one, thou slewest boldly here, and then, O Maghavan, thou becamest strong of arm.

original: sacanta yad uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrām asya ketavo rām avindan /
analyzed: sacanta yat uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrām asya ketavaḥ rām avindan
translated: When the Dawns follow him with the Sun, his wondrous banners have found the light.

original: ā yan nakṣatraṃ dadṛśe divo na punar yato nakir addhā nu veda //
analyzed: ā yat nakṣatram dadṛśe divaḥ na punar yataḥ nakir addhā nu veda
translated: When the star is seen in the heaven, from whence it came no one knows again.

original: dūraṃ kila prathamā jagmur āsām indrasya yāḥ prasave sasrur āpaḥ /
analyzed: dūram kila prathamāḥ jagmuḥ āsām indrasya yāḥ prasave sasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: Far, indeed, have these first gone of those which flowed forth at the impulse of Indra.

original: kva svid agraṃ kva budhna āsām āpo madhyaṃ kva vo nūnam antaḥ //
analyzed: kva svid agram kva budhnaḥ āsām āpaḥ madhyam kva vaḥ nūnam antaḥ
translated: Where is their beginning, where their depth? In the middle, indeed, are the waters. Where now is their end?

original: sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānāṃ ād id etāḥ pra vivijre javena /
analyzed: sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānām āt id etāḥ pra vivijre javena
translated: Thou hast let loose the rivers which the serpent held. Then these have spread themselves abroad with speed.

original: mumukṣamāṇā uta yā mumucre 'dhed etā na ramante nitiktāḥ //
analyzed: mumukṣamāṇāḥ uta yāḥ mumucre dhā id etāḥ na ramante nitiktāḥ
translated: Those which have been let loose, and those which have not been let loose, but are desirous of being let loose, they are not delighted, being full of longing.

original: sadhrīcīḥ sindhum uśatīr ivāyan sanāj jāra āritaḥ pūrbhid āsām /
analyzed: sadhrīcīḥ sindhum uśatīḥ iva āyan sanāt jāraḥ āritaḥ pūrbhid āsām
translated: They have come together, as if longing for the river, the ancient lover, the breaker of their dams.

original: astam ā te pārthivā vasūny asme jagmuḥ sūnṛtā indra pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: astam ā te pārthivā vasūni asme jagmuḥ sūnṛtāḥ indra pūrvīḥ
translated: Your earthly treasures have set for you, your many bounties have gone to Indra, O bountiful one.

original: indra piba pratikāmaṃ sutasya prātaḥsāvas tava hi pūrvapītiḥ /
analyzed: indra piba pratikāmam sutasya prātaḥsāvaḥ tava hi pūrva pītiḥ
translated: O Indra, drink as you desire of the pressed (Soma), for the morning pressing is your first drinking.

original: harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūn ukthebhiṣ ṭe vīryā pra bravāma //🔽yas te ratho manaso javīyān endra tena somapeyāya yāhi /
analyzed: harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūn ukthebhiḥ te vīryā pra bravāma  yaḥ te rathaḥ manasaḥ javīyān ā indra tena soma peyāya yāhi
translated: Rejoice, O hero, to smite the foes; by our hymns we proclaim your deeds of prowess.🔽O Indra, with that chariot of thine which is swifter than thought, come hither on it to drink the Soma.

original: tūyam ā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhir yāsi vṛṣabhir mandamānaḥ //
analyzed: tūyam ā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiḥ yāsi vṛṣabhiḥ mandamānaḥ
translated: Let thy tawny coursers run swiftly, with which thou goest, O mighty one, in a merry mood.

original: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhai rūpais tanvaṃ sparśayasva /
analyzed: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhaiḥ rūpaiḥ tanvam sparśayasva
translated: With the tawny colour of the sun, with the best forms, adorn thy body.

original: asmābhir indra sakhibhir huvānaḥ sadhrīcīno mādayasvā niṣadya //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ indra sakhibhiḥ huvānaḥ sadhrīcīnaḥ mādayasva niṣadya
translated: O Indra, invoked by us, thy friends, rejoice, sitting together, with us.

original: yasya tyat te mahimānam madeṣv ime mahī rodasī nāviviktām /
analyzed: yasya tyad te mahimānam madeṣu ime mahī rodasī na aviviktām
translated: Whose greatness in thy joys, O Indra, these two great worlds cannot comprehend.

original: tad oka ā haribhir indra yuktaiḥ priyebhir yāhi priyam annam accha //
analyzed: tat okaḥ ā haribhiḥ indra yuktaiḥ priyebhiḥ yāhi priyam annam accha
translated: Come to that abode of thine, O Indra, with thy yoked tawny (horses), with thy dear (horses), come to the dear food.

original: yasya śaśvat papivāṃ indra śatrūn anānukṛtyā raṇyā cakartha /
analyzed: yasya śaśvat papivān indra śatrūn anānukṛtyā raṇyā cakartha
translated: Whose foes, O Indra, thou hast ever crushed, O thou that art not to be overcome, and hast made them childless.

original: sa te purandhiṃ taviṣīm iyarti sa te madāya suta indra somaḥ //
analyzed: sa te purandhim taviṣīm iyarti sa te madāya sutaḥ indra somaḥ
translated: That (Soma) presses out for thee Purandhi, thy strength; that Soma, O Indra, is pressed for thy joy.

original: idaṃ te pātraṃ sanavittam indra pibā somam enā śatakrato /
analyzed: idam te pātram sanavittam indra piba somam enā śatakrato
translated: This is thy cup, O Indra, filled with strength; drink the Soma with it, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: pūrṇa āhāvo madirasya madhvo yaṃ viśva id abhiharyanti devāḥ //
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ āhāvaḥ madirasya madhvaḥ yam viśve id abhiharyanti devāḥ
translated: The full libation of the gladdening mead, which all the gods delight in.

original: vi hi tvām indra purudhā janāso hitaprayaso vṛṣabha hvayante /
analyzed: vi hi tvām indra purudhā janāsaḥ hita prayasaḥ vṛṣabha hvayante
translated: For many are the people, O bull, O Indra, who, with their teams ready, call thee to the feast.

original: asmākaṃ te madhumattamānīmā bhuvan savanā teṣu harya //
analyzed: asmākam te madhumattamāni imā bhuvan savanā teṣu harya
translated: Let these libations of ours be the sweetest to thee, in which thou rejoicest, O thou who lovest the song.

original: pra ta indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnaṃ vīryā vocam prathamā kṛtāni /
analyzed: pra te indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnam vīryā vocam prathamā kṛtāni
translated: I will tell of thy ancient and recent exploits, O Indra, of the first deeds thou hast done.

original: satīnamanyur aśrathāyo adriṃ suvedanām akṛṇor brahmaṇe gām //
analyzed: satīna manyuḥ aśrathāyaḥ adrim su vedanām akṛṇoḥ brahmaṇe gām
translated: Thou madest the stone easy to be handled for the Brahman, whose wrath was real, to be smitten.

original: ni ṣu sīda gaṇapate gaṇeṣu tvām āhur vipratamaṃ kavīnām /
analyzed: ni su sīda gaṇapate gaṇeṣu tvām āhuḥ vipratamam kavīnām
translated: Sit down, O lord of the host, among the hosts; thee they call the wisest of the wise.

original: na ṛte tvat kriyate kiṃ canāre mahām arkam maghavañ citram arca //🔽abhikhyā no maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupate sakhīnām /
analyzed: na ṛte tvat kriyate kim cana are arkam maghavam citram arca  naḥ maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasu pate sakhīnām
translated: Nothing is done without thee, O thou of great glory; sing aloud the wondrous song to the bountiful one.🔽Be thou visible to us, O bountiful one, when we are afflicted; be a friend, O lord of treasure, to thy friends.

original: raṇaṃ kṛdhi raṇakṛt satyaśuṣmābhakte cid ā bhajā rāye asmān //
analyzed: raṇam kṛdhi raṇa kṛt satya śuṣma a bhakte cit ā bhaja rāye asmān
translated: Make us to rejoice, O thou who makest to rejoice, with true strength, even though we be despised; give us riches.

original: tam asya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhir devair anu śuṣmam āvatām /
analyzed: tam asya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ anu śuṣmam āvatām
translated: May the heaven and the earth, of one mind, with all the gods, favour his might.

original: yad ait kṛṇvāno mahimānam indriyam pītvī somasya kratumāṃ avardhata //
analyzed: yat ait kṛṇvānaḥ mahimānam indriyam pītvī somasya kratumān avardhata
translated: When he went forth, creating greatness and power, having drunk Soma, he grew in strength and wisdom.

original: tam asya viṣṇur mahimānam ojasāṃśuṃ dadhanvān madhuno vi rapśate /🔽devebhir indro maghavā sayāvabhir vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ abhavad vareṇyaḥ //🔽vṛtreṇa yad ahinā bibhrad āyudhā samasthithā yudhaye śaṃsam āvide /🔽viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanāvardhann ugra mahimānam indriyam //🔽jajñāna eva vy abādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyad vīro abhi pauṃsyaṃ raṇam /🔽avṛścad adrim ava sasyadaḥ sṛjad astabhnān nākaṃ svapasyayā pṛthum //
analyzed: tam asya viṣṇuḥ mahimānam ojasā aṃśum dadhanvān madhunaḥ vi rapśate  devebhiḥ indraḥ maghavā sa yāvabhiḥ vṛtram jaghanvān abhavat vareṇyaḥ  vṛtreṇa yat ahinā bibhrat āyudhā samasthithāḥ yudhaye śaṃsam āvide  viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanā avardhan ugra mahimānam indriyam  jajñānaḥ eva vi abādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyat vīraḥ abhi pauṃsyam raṇam  avṛścat adrim ava sasyadaḥ sṛjat astabhnāt nākam su apasyayā pṛthum
translated: Vishnu, his greatness and strength,

original: ād indraḥ satrā taviṣīr apatyata varīyo dyāvāpṛthivī abādhata /🔽avābharad dhṛṣito vajram āyasaṃ śevam mitrāya varuṇāya dāśuṣe //🔽indrasyātra taviṣībhyo virapśina ṛghāyato araṃhayanta manyave /
analyzed: āt indraḥ satrā taviṣīḥ apatyata varīyaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abādhata 🔽avābharat dhṛṣitaḥ vajram āyasam śevam mitrāya varuṇāya dāśuṣe 🔽indrasya atra taviṣībhyaḥ virapśinaḥ ṛghāyataḥ araṃhayanta manyave
translated: the sage, the wise one, the powerful one, the lord of the people, the one to be praised, the one to be glorified, the one to be honored, the one to be worshipped, the one to be revered, the one to be esteemed, the one to be respected, the one to be regarded highly, the one to be looked up to, the one to be gazed upon, the one to be admired, the one to be delighted in, the one to be pleased, the one to be satisfied, the one to be fulfilled, the one to be accomplished, the one to be perfected, the one to be completed, the one to be finished, the one to be ended, the one to be concluded, the one to be settled, the one to be determined, the one to be decided, the one to be judged, the one to be considered, the one to be thought of, the one to be remembered, the one to be recalled, the one to be brought to mind, the one to be contemplated, the one to be meditated upon, the one to be reflected upon, the one to be examined, the one to be investigated, the one to be analyzed, the one to be scrutinized, the one to be studied, the one to be researched, the one to be inquired into, the one to be sought after, the one to be pursued, the one to be followed, the one to be attended to, the one to be served, the one to be worshipped, the one to be revered, the one to be esteemed, the one to be respected, the one to be regarded highly, the one to be looked up to, the one to be gazed upon, the one to be admired, the one to be delighted in, the one to be pleased, the one to be satisfied, the one to be fulfilled, the one to be accomplished, the one to be perfected, the one to be completed, the one to be finished, the one to be ended, the one to be concluded, the one to be settled, the one to be determined, the one to be decided, the one to be judged, the one to be considered, the one to be thought of, the one to be remembered, the one to be recalled, the one to be brought to mind, the one to be contemplated, the one to

original: vṛtraṃ yad ugro vy avṛścad ojasāpo bibhrataṃ tamasā parīvṛtam //
analyzed: vṛtram yat ugraḥ vi avṛścat ojasā apaḥ bibhratam tamasā parīvṛtam
translated: When the fierce one cleft Vṛtra with his strength, bearing the waters, encompassed with darkness.

original: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhir yatamānau samīyatuḥ /
analyzed: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhiḥ yatamānau samīyatuḥ
translated: When they, striving with their greatness to perform the first heroic deeds, came together,

original: dhvāntaṃ tamo 'va dadhvase hata indro mahnā pūrvahūtāv apatyata //
analyzed: dhvāntam tamaḥ vaḥ dadhvase hate indraḥ mahnā pūrva hūtau apatyata
translated: The darkness, the gloom, was cast down, slain. Indra, with his greatness, helped the first invoked (gods) to offspring.

original: viśve devāso adha vṛṣṇyāni te 'vardhayan somavatyā vacasyayā /
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ adha vṛṣṇyāni te vardhayan somavatyā vacasyayā
translated: All the gods have bestowed on you those manly powers. They have increased you with a hymn accompanied by Soma.

original: raddhaṃ vṛtram ahim indrasya hanmanāgnir na jambhais tṛṣv annam āvayat //
analyzed: raddham vṛtram ahim indrasya hanmanā agniḥ na jambhaiḥ tṛṣu annam āvayat
translated: The bound Vṛtra, the serpent, Indra's slayer, Agni has crushed with his jaws, as with food in three places.

original: bhūri dakṣebhir vacanebhir ṛkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyāni pra vocata /
analyzed: bhūri dakṣebhiḥ vacanebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyāni pra vocata
translated: With many skilful words, with the Rkv-s, with friends, declare your friendships.

original: indro dhuniṃ ca cumuriṃ ca dambhayañ chraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye //🔽tvam purūṇy ā bharā svaśvyā yebhir maṃsai nivacanāni śaṃsan /
analyzed: indraḥ dhunim ca cumurim ca dambhayam śraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye  tvam purūṇi ā bhara su aśvyā yebhiḥ maṃsai nivacanāni śaṃsan
translated: Indra, confounding Dhuni and Cumarin, listens to the Dābhīti for the sake of faith.🔽Bring hither many rich in good horses, with which, praising, you will utter your words.

original: sugebhir viśvā duritā tarema vido ṣu ṇa urviyā gādham adya //
analyzed: sugebhiḥ viśvā duritā tarema vidaḥ su naḥ urviyā gādham adya
translated: By easy paths may we pass over all difficulties. May we find the ford across the wide expanse today.

original: gharmā samantā trivṛtaṃ vy āpatus tayor juṣṭim mātariśvā jagāma /
analyzed: gharmā samantā trivṛtam vi āpatuḥ tayoḥ juṣṭim mātariśvā jagāma
translated: The three-encircled heat has passed through the whole (universe). The creator has gone to the acceptance of those two.

original: divas payo didhiṣāṇā aveṣan vidur devāḥ sahasāmānam arkam //
analyzed: divaḥ payaḥ didhiṣāṇāḥ aveṣan viduḥ devāḥ sahasāmānam arkam
translated: The waters of heaven have they obtained, seeking for food. The gods have found the hymn that brings prosperity.

original: tisro deṣṭrāya nirṛtīr upāsate dīrghaśruto vi hi jānanti vahnayaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ deṣṭrāya nirṛtīḥ upāsate dīrgha śrutaḥ vi hi jānanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Three Nirrtis do they worship for the seer, for the far-famed priests know them well.

original: tāsāṃ ni cikyuḥ kavayo nidānam pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu //
analyzed: tāsām ni cikyuḥ kavayaḥ nidānam pareṣu yāḥ guhyeṣu vrateṣu
translated: The wise have discovered the cause of these, which are among the secret rites of the others.

original: catuṣkapardā yuvatiḥ supeśā ghṛtapratīkā vayunāni vaste /
analyzed: catur kapardā yuvatiḥ supeśāḥ ghṛta pratīkā vayunāni vaste
translated: The four-breasted maiden, of fair hips, whose appearance is like ghee, puts on her ornaments.

original: tasyāṃ suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni ṣedatur yatra devā dadhire bhāgadheyam //
analyzed: tasyām suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni sedatuḥ yatra devāḥ dadhire bhāgadheyam
translated: On her the two strong birds have sat down, where the gods have placed their portion.

original: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudram ā viveśa sa idaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi caṣṭe /
analyzed: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudram ā viveśa saḥ idam viśvam bhuvanam vi caṣṭe
translated: One strong bird has entered the ocean. He looks around on this whole world.

original: tam pākena manasāpaśyam antitas tam mātā reḷhi sa u reḷhi mātaram //
analyzed: tam pākena manasā apaśyam antitas tam mātā reḍhi saḥ u reḍhi mātaram
translated: I have seen him with my mind purified. He licks his mother, and she licks him.

original: suparṇaṃ viprāḥ kavayo vacobhir ekaṃ santam bahudhā kalpayanti /🔽chandāṃsi ca dadhato adhvareṣu grahān somasya mimate dvādaśa //
analyzed: suparṇam viprāḥ kavayaḥ vacobhiḥ ekam santam bahudhā kalpayanti  chandāṃsi ca dadhataḥ adhvareṣu grahān somasya mimate dvādaśa
translated: The sages, the poets, with their words, make the one strong bird into many.🔽And they arrange the metres and the cups of Soma in the sacrifices, and reckon them as twelve.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśāṃś ca caturaḥ kalpayantaś chandāṃsi ca dadhata ādvādaśam /
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśān ca caturaḥ kalpayantaḥ chandāṃsi ca dadhataḥ ādvādaśam
translated: Arranging the four and the thirty-six, and placing the metres up to twelve,

original: yajñaṃ vimāya kavayo manīṣa ṛksāmābhyām pra rathaṃ vartayanti //
analyzed: yajñam vimāya kavayaḥ manīṣe ṛk sāmābhyām pra ratham vartayanti
translated: Having measured the sacrifice, the wise ones set the chariot in motion with the Ṛc and Sāman.

original: caturdaśānye mahimāno asya taṃ dhīrā vācā pra ṇayanti sapta /
analyzed: caturdaśā anye mahimānaḥ asya tam dhīrāḥ vācā pra nayanti sapta
translated: The fourteen other greatnesses of this, the wise ones lead forward with speech in seven ways.

original: āpnānaṃ tīrthaṃ ka iha pra vocad yena pathā prapibante sutasya //
analyzed: āpnānam tīrtham kaḥ iha pra vocat yena pathā prapibante sutasya
translated: Who here will declare the ford of the attainment, by which path they drink of the pressed (Soma)?

original: sahasradhā pañcadaśāny ukthā yāvad dyāvāpṛthivī tāvad it tat /
analyzed: sahasradhā pañcadaśāni ukthā yāvat dyāvāpṛthivī tāvat id tat
translated: The fifteen hymns are a thousandfold; as great as heaven and earth are, so great is that.

original: sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasraṃ yāvad brahma viṣṭhitaṃ tāvatī vāk //
analyzed: sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasram yāvat brahma viṣṭhitam tāvatī vāc
translated: The thousandfold greatness is a thousandfold; as far as the Brahman extends, so far is speech.

original: kaś chandasāṃ yogam ā veda dhīraḥ ko dhiṣṇyām prati vācam papāda /
analyzed: kaḥ chandasām yogam ā veda dhīraḥ kaḥ dhiṣṇyām prati vācam papāda
translated: What wise man knows the union of the metres? Who has placed the speech in the Dhiṣaṇā?

original: kam ṛtvijām aṣṭamaṃ śūram āhur harī indrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svit //
analyzed: kam ṛtvijām aṣṭamam śūram āhuḥ harī indrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svid
translated: Who do they call the eighth of the priests, the hero? Who has observed the two bay horses of Indra?

original: bhūmyā antam pary eke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāso asthuḥ /
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ antam pari eke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāsaḥ asthuḥ
translated: Some move about to the end of the earth; they are yoked to the pole of the chariot.

original: śramasya dāyaṃ vi bhajanty ebhyo yadā yamo bhavati harmye hitaḥ //
analyzed: śramasya dāyam vi bhajanti ebhyaḥ yadā yamaḥ bhavati harmye hitaḥ
translated: They distribute the reward of toil to them, when Yama is placed in the house as the appointed one.

original: citra ic chiśos taruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāv apyeti dhātave /
analyzed: citraḥ id śiśoḥ taruṇasya vakṣathaḥ na yaḥ mātarau apyeti dhātave
translated: Wonderful is the desire of the young child, who does not yet come to the two mothers to be nourished.

original: anūdhā yadi jījanad adhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyo mahi dūtyaṃ caran //
analyzed: anūdhāḥ yadi jījanat adhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyas mahi dūtyam caran
translated: If she, the unwedded one, gave birth, then indeed she grew, immediately becoming great, while performing her mission.

original: agnir ha nāma dhāyi dann apastamaḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvate bhasmanā datā /
analyzed: agniḥ ha nāma dhāyi dan apastamaḥ sam yaḥ vanā yuvate bhasmanā datā
translated: Agni, indeed, was born, the most purifying, he who burns the woods with his ash-like flame.

original: abhipramurā juhvā svadhvara ino na prothamāno yavase vṛṣā //
analyzed: abhipramurā juhvā su adhvaraḥ inaḥ na prothamānaḥ yavase vṛṣā
translated: He, the most self-controlled, with his tongue, like a bull bellowing in the pasture, rushes forth.

original: taṃ vo viṃ na druṣadaṃ devam andhasa indum prothantam pravapantam arṇavam /🔽āsā vahniṃ na śociṣā virapśinam mahivrataṃ na sarajantam adhvanaḥ //🔽vi yasya te jrayasānasyājara dhakṣor na vātāḥ pari santy acyutāḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ vim na druṣadam devam andhasaḥ indum prothantam pravapantam arṇavam  āsā vahnim na śociṣā virapśinam mahi vratam na sarajantam adhvanaḥ  vi yasya te jrayasānasya ajara dhakṣoḥ na vātāḥ pari santi acyutāḥ
translated: We invoke that God, the juice, the wave, who rushes forth, who pours out the ocean,🔽The carrier, like a fire with its flame, the one who spreads out the great paths.🔽The winds, which are yours, O you who are to be praised, of the imperishable one who burns, do not fail.

original: ā raṇvāso yuyudhayo na satvanaṃ tritaṃ naśanta pra śiṣanta iṣṭaye //
analyzed: ā raṇvāsaḥ yuyudhayaḥ na satvanam tritam naśanta pra śiṣantaḥ iṣṭaye
translated: They lead Trita, who is to be praised, to the battle, as if he were a strong one, in order to help him.

original: sa id agniḥ kaṇvatamaḥ kaṇvasakhāryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ id agniḥ kaṇvatamaḥ kaṇva sakhā āryaḥ parasya antarasya taruṣaḥ
translated: He is indeed Agni, the best of the Kanvas, the friend of the Kanvas, the one to be worshipped in the farthest and nearest woods.

original: agniḥ pātu gṛṇato agniḥ sūrīn agnir dadātu teṣām avo naḥ //🔽vājintamāya sahyase supitrya tṛṣu cyavāno anu jātavedase /
analyzed: agniḥ pātu gṛṇataḥ agniḥ sūrīn agniḥ dadātu teṣām avaḥ naḥ 🔽vājintamāya sahyase su pitrya tṛṣu cyavānaḥ anu jātavedase
