original: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvata ivāvicācaliḥ /🔽indra iveha dhruvas tiṣṭheha rāṣṭram u dhāraya //
analyzed: iha eva edhi mā apa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvataḥ iva avicācaliḥ  indraḥ iva iha dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha iha rāṣṭram u dhāraya
translated: Be right here, do not fall away, like a mountain that does not move.🔽Stand firm here like Indra, here uphold the kingdom.

original: imam indro adīdharad dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā /
analyzed: imam indraḥ adīdharat dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā
translated: Indra has established this one, the firm one, with firm oblation.

original: tasmai somo adhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat tasmai u brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: To him Soma speaks, to him Brahmanaspati.

original: dhruvā dyaur dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime /
analyzed: dhruvā dyauḥ dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatāḥ ime
translated: Firm is the sky, firm is the earth, firm are these mountains.

original: dhruvaṃ viśvam idaṃ jagad dhruvo rājā viśām ayam //
analyzed: dhruvam viśvam idam jagat dhruvaḥ rājā viśām ayam
translated: Firm is this whole world, firm is this king of the people.

original: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: dhruvam te rājā varuṇaḥ dhruvam devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Firm is your king Varuna, firm is the god Brihaspati.

original: dhruvaṃ ta indraś cāgniś ca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam //
analyzed: dhruvam te indraḥ ca agniḥ ca rāṣṭram dhārayatām dhruvam
translated: Firm is your Indra and Agni. May they hold your kingdom firm.

original: dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣābhi somam mṛśāmasi /🔽atho ta indraḥ kevalīr viśo balihṛtas karat //
analyzed: dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā abhi somam mṛśāmasi  atha u te indraḥ kevalīḥ viśaḥ bali hṛtaḥ karat
translated: With firm oblation we touch the Soma, with that which is firm.🔽Then may Indra make your people all your own, and accept your offerings.

original: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte /
analyzed: abhīvartena haviṣā yena indraḥ abhivāvṛte
translated: With the oblation of the Abhivarta, wherewith Indra was strengthened,

original: tenāsmān brahmaṇas pate 'bhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya //
analyzed: tena asmān brahmaṇas pate bhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya
translated: therewith, O Lord of prayer, turn thou to us for the kingdom.

original: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yā no arātayaḥ /
analyzed: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yāḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Having overcome our enemies, and those who hate us,

original: abhi pṛtanyantaṃ tiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati //
analyzed: abhi pṛtanyantam tiṣṭha abhi yaḥ naḥ irasyati
translated: stand thou over against the man who fights against us, over against him who injures us.

original: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat /
analyzed: abhi tvā devaḥ savitā abhi somaḥ avīvṛtat
translated: Thee hath the god Savitar, thee hath Soma strengthened.

original: abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāny abhīvarto yathāsasi //🔽yenendro haviṣā kṛtvy abhavad dyumny uttamaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāni abhīvartaḥ yathā asasi  yena indraḥ haviṣā kṛtvī abhavat dyumnī uttamaḥ
translated: Thee have all beings strengthened, as thou art the Abhivarta.🔽With that oblation wherewith Indra became most glorious,

original: idaṃ tad akri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam //
analyzed: idam tat akri devāḥ asapatnaḥ kila abhuvam
translated: that have the gods performed. I have become free from enemies.

original: asapatnaḥ sapatnahābhirāṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ /
analyzed: asapatnaḥ sapatna hā abhirāṣṭraḥ viṣāsahiḥ
translated: Free from enemies, the slayer of foes, overcoming the people, conquering the poison,

original: yathāham eṣām bhūtānāṃ virājāni janasya ca //🔽pra vo grāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā /
analyzed: yathā aham eṣām bhūtānām virājāni janasya ca  pra vaḥ grāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
translated: As I am the overlord of these beings and of the people.🔽May Savitar the God, with the ordinance, impel your pressing-stones.

original: dhūrṣu yujyadhvaṃ sunuta //
analyzed: dhūrṣu yujyadhvam sunuta
translated: Be harnessed to the poles, press out the juice.

original: grāvāṇo apa ducchunām apa sedhata durmatim /
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ apa ducchunām apa sedhata durmatim
translated: Stones, drive away misfortune, drive away evil thought.

original: usrāḥ kartana bheṣajam //
analyzed: usrāḥ kartana bheṣajam
translated: Let the two Dawns make a remedy.

original: grāvāṇa upareṣv ā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ upareṣu ā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ
translated: The stones are exalted in the lower world, in unison,

original: vṛṣṇe dadhato vṛṣṇyam //
analyzed: vṛṣṇe dadhataḥ vṛṣṇyam
translated: bestowing strength on the strong one.

original: grāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā /
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vaḥ devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
translated: Savitar the God, with the ordinance, may the stones impel you,

original: yajamānāya sunvate //
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate
translated: for the sacrificer who presses out the juice.

original: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇām bṛhan navanta vṛjanā /
analyzed: pra sūnavaḥ ṛbhūṇām bṛhat navanta vṛjanā
translated: The mighty sons of Ṛbhukṣan sing their songs, the singers,

original: kṣāmā ye viśvadhāyaso 'śnan dhenuṃ na mātaram //
analyzed: kṣāmāḥ ye viśva dhāyasaḥ śnan dhenum na mātaram
translated: who are all-supporting, who eat the food like a mother her calf.

original: pra devaṃ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam /
analyzed: pra devam devyā dhiyā bharata jātavedasam
translated: Bring the God with the God's thought, serve Jâtavedas.

original: havyā no vakṣad ānuṣak //
analyzed: havyā naḥ vakṣat ānuṣak
translated: Let him carry our offerings in due time.

original: ayam u ṣya pra devayur hotā yajñāya nīyate /
analyzed: ayam u sya pra devayuḥ hotā yajñāya nīyate
translated: This very Godly Hotar is led forth to the sacrifice,

original: ratho na yor abhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñ cetati tmanā //
analyzed: rathaḥ na yoḥ abhīvṛtaḥ ghṛṇīvān cetati tmanā
translated: like a chariot, well-covered, he thinks in his heart with a roar.

original: ayam agnir uruṣyaty amṛtād iva janmanaḥ /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ uruṣyati amṛtāt iva janmanaḥ
translated: This Agni endures like one from the immortal birth,

original: sahasaś cit sahīyān devo jīvātave kṛtaḥ //
analyzed: sahasaḥ cit sahīyān devaḥ jīvātave kṛtaḥ
translated: more powerful than strength, the God is made for life.

original: pataṅgam aktam asurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasā vipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: pataṅgam aktam asurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasā vipaścitaḥ
translated: The wise, with heart and mind, behold the bird, smeared with the Asura's magic power,

original: samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnām padam icchanti vedhasaḥ //
analyzed: samudre antar kavayaḥ vi cakṣate marīcīnām padam icchanti vedhasaḥ
translated: In the ocean's midst the sages look upon him, the creators seek the place of the rays.

original: pataṅgo vācam manasā bibharti tāṃ gandharvo 'vadad garbhe antaḥ /
analyzed: pataṅgaḥ vācam manasā bibharti tām gandharvaḥ vadat garbhe antar
translated: The bird bears speech in his mind, the Gandharva utters it in the womb.

original: tāṃ dyotamānāṃ svaryam manīṣām ṛtasya pade kavayo ni pānti //
analyzed: tām dyotamānām svaryam manīṣām ṛtasya pade kavayaḥ ni pānti
translated: The wise preserve in the place of truth that shining, heavenly thought.

original: apaśyaṃ gopām anipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiś carantam /
analyzed: apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiḥ carantam
translated: I have seen the guardian, the unborn, moving on the paths that go and come.

original: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīr vasāna ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣv antaḥ //🔽tyam ū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahāvānaṃ tarutāraṃ rathānām /
analyzed: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīḥ vasānaḥ ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣu antar  tyam u su vājinam deva jūtam sahāvānam tarutāram rathānām
translated: He, dwelling in the same place and in different places, moves within the worlds.🔽We will invoke here for our welfare that swift steed, urged by the gods, the conqueror, the swift-crossing of chariots,

original: ariṣṭanemim pṛtanājam āśuṃ svastaye tārkṣyam ihā huvema //
analyzed: ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanājam āśum svastaye tārkṣyam iha ā huvema
translated: The one with unbroken rim, born in battle, the son of Tarkshya, for our welfare.

original: indrasyeva rātim ājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvam ivā ruhema /
analyzed: indrasya iva rātim ājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvam iva ā ruhema
translated: Like those who invoke Indra's bounty, we will ascend like a boat for our welfare.

original: urvī na pṛthvī bahule gabhīre mā vām etau mā paretau riṣāma //
analyzed: urvī na pṛthvī bahule gabhīre mā vām etau mā paretau riṣāma
translated: May we not injure you, O wide, vast, deep earth, as we go over you or come back.

original: sadyaś cid yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna /
analyzed: sadyas cit yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūryaḥ iva jyotiṣā apaḥ tatāna
translated: He who in one day with his might extends over five peoples, as the sun with his light over the waters,

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā asya raṃhir na smā varante yuvatiṃ na śaryām //
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ asya raṃhiḥ na smā varante yuvatim na śaryām
translated: His is the hundredfold, the thousandfold, his is the prize; they do not win the maiden, nor the prize, like a young man.

original: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata ava paśyata indrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam
translated: Rise up and look upon Indra's proper share.

original: yadi śrāto juhotana yady aśrāto mamattana //
analyzed: yadi śrātaḥ juhotana yadi a śrātaḥ mamattana
translated: If it is cooked, offer it; if not cooked, rejoice in it.

original: śrātaṃ havir o ṣv indra pra yāhi jagāma sūro adhvano vimadhyam /
analyzed: śrātam haviḥ ā u su indra pra yāhi jagāma sūraḥ adhvanaḥ vimadhyam
translated: The oblation is cooked; come, O Indra; the sun has gone to the middle of the path.

original: pari tvāsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapā na vrājapatiṃ carantam //
analyzed: pari tvā āsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapāḥ na vrāja patim carantam
translated: Your friends surround you with treasures, like herdsmen their lord who goes on a journey.

original: śrātam manya ūdhani śrātam agnau suśrātam manye tad ṛtaṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: śrātam manye ūdhani śrātam agnau su śrātam manye tat ṛtam navīyaḥ
translated: I think the milk is cooked in the udder, cooked in the fire, I think that truth is well cooked anew.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ pibendra vajrin purukṛj juṣāṇaḥ //
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ piba indra vajrin puru kṛt juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Drink, O Indra, the essence of the midday pressing, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O bountiful one, accepting it.

original: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhas te śuṣma iha rātir astu /
analyzed: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūm jyeṣṭhaḥ te śuṣmaḥ iha rātiḥ astu
translated: You have conquered the enemies, O much-invoked one; let your most mighty strength be here, O giver of gifts.

original: indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patiḥ sindhūnām asi revatīnām //
analyzed: indra ā bhara dakṣiṇena vasūni patiḥ sindhūnām asi revatīnām
translated: O Indra, bring treasures with your right hand; you are the lord of the rivers and of the prosperous ones.

original: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaganthā parasyāḥ /
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagantha parasyāḥ
translated: Like a terrible beast roaming the mountains, come from afar from the farthest distance.

original: sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavim indra tigmaṃ vi śatrūn tāḷhi vi mṛdho nudasva //
analyzed: sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḷhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: Sharpening your sharp point and your thunderbolt, O Indra, crush the enemies, drive away the foes.

original: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojo 'jāyathā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojaḥ jāyathāḥ vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
translated: O Indra, thou hast been born with the lordship, the dear strength, of the people, O bull.

original: apānudo janam amitrayantam uruṃ devebhyo akṛṇor u lokam //
analyzed: apānudaḥ janam amitrayantam urum devebhyaḥ akṛṇoḥ u lokam
translated: Thou hast driven away the people who were hostile, and hast made a wide space for the gods.

original: prathaś ca yasya saprathaś ca nāmānuṣṭubhasya haviṣo havir yat /
analyzed: prathaḥ ca yasya sa prathaḥ ca nāma ānuṣṭubhasya haviṣaḥ haviḥ yat
translated: The first and the second of the oblations of the Anustubh metre, whose names are Prathas and Saprathas,

original: dhātur dyutānāt savituś ca viṣṇo rathantaram ā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ rathantaram ā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Vasishtha has brought forth the Rathantara from the shining Dhatr, Savitar, and Vishnu.

original: avindan te atihitaṃ yad āsīd yajñasya dhāma paramaṃ guhā yat /
analyzed: avindan te atihitam yat āsīt yajñasya dhāma paramam guhā yat
translated: They have found the hidden place of the sacrifice, the highest secret of the sacrifice,

original: dhātur dyutānāt savituś ca viṣṇor bharadvājo bṛhad ā cakre agneḥ //
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ bharadvājaḥ bṛhat ā cakre agneḥ
translated: Bharadvaja has made the Brihat of Agni from the shining Dhatr, Savitar, and Vishnu.

original: te 'vindan manasā dīdhyānā yaju ṣkannam prathamaṃ devayānam /
analyzed: te vindan manasā dīdhyānāḥ yaju ṣkannam prathamam deva yānam
translated: They have found the first Yajuṣ, the way to the gods, which was lost, thinking with their minds.

original: dhātur dyutānāt savituś ca viṣṇor ā sūryād abharan gharmam ete //🔽bṛhaspatir nayatu durgahā tiraḥ punar neṣad aghaśaṃsāya manma /
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ ā sūryāt abharan gharmam ete  bṛhaspatiḥ nayatu durgahā tiras punar neṣat agha śaṃsāya manma
translated: From the sun these have brought the Gharma, from the shining Dhatr, Savitar, and Vishnu.🔽May Brihaspati lead us over the difficult passages, may he again lead the prayer to the evil-wisher.

original: kṣipad aśastim apa durmatiṃ hann athā karad yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han athā karat yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: May he hurl away the curse, may he slay the evil thought, and may he make peace and welfare for the sacrificer.

original: narāśaṃso no 'vatu prayāje śaṃ no astv anuyājo haveṣu /
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ naḥ vatu prayāje śam naḥ astu anuyājaḥ haveṣu
translated: May Narashamsa protect us in the fore-sacrifices, may the after-sacrifices be for our welfare in our invocations.

original: kṣipad aśastim apa durmatiṃ hann athā karad yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han athā karat yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: Casting away the curse, slaying evil thought, then bestowing bliss on the sacrificer.

original: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣaso ye brahmadviṣaḥ śarave hantavā u /
analyzed: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣasaḥ ye brahma dviṣaḥ śarave hantavai u
translated: Let the head of the burning one burn the Rakshasas who hate the Brahman, to be slain by the arrow.

original: kṣipad aśastim apa durmatiṃ hann athā karad yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han athā karat yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: Casting away the curse, slaying evil thought, then bestowing bliss on the sacrificer.

original: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā cekitānaṃ tapaso jātaṃ tapaso vibhūtam /
analyzed: apaśyam tvā manasā cekitānam tapasaḥ jātam tapasaḥ vibhūtam
translated: I have seen thee, O Agni, in my mind, born of penance, manifest in penance.

original: iha prajām iha rayiṃ rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasva prajayā putrakāma //
analyzed: iha prajām iha rayim rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasva prajayā putra kāma
translated: Bestowing offspring here, wealth here, beget offspring, O thou who desirest a son.

original: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā dīdhyānāṃ svāyāṃ tanū ṛtvye nādhamānām /
analyzed: apaśyam tvā manasā dīdhyānām svāyām tanū ṛtvye nādhamānām
translated: I have seen thee, O Agni, in my mind, meditating, in thy own proper body, in the sacrifice.

original: upa mām uccā yuvatir babhūyāḥ pra jāyasva prajayā putrakāme //
analyzed: upa mām uccā yuvatiḥ babhūyāḥ pra jāyasva prajayā putra kāme
translated: May the young woman come to me from above. Beget offspring, O thou who desirest a son.

original: ahaṃ garbham adadhām oṣadhīṣv ahaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣv antaḥ /
analyzed: aham garbham adadhām oṣadhīṣu aham viśveṣu bhuvaneṣu antar
translated: I have placed the embryo in the plants, I am within all the worlds.

original: aham prajā ajanayam pṛthivyām ahaṃ janibhyo aparīṣu putrān //
analyzed: aham prajāḥ ajanayam pṛthivyām aham janibhyaḥ aparīṣu putrān
translated: I have generated offspring on earth, I have generated sons in the wombs of women.

original: viṣṇur yoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yonim kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu
translated: May Vishnu prepare the womb, may Tvashtar fashion the forms.

original: ā siñcatu prajāpatir dhātā garbhaṃ dadhātu te //
analyzed: ā siñcatu prajāpatiḥ dhātā garbham dadhātu te
translated: May Prajapati pour (the seed), may Dhatr place the embryo in thee.

original: garbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli garbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati /
analyzed: garbham dhehi sinīvāli garbham dhehi sarasvati
translated: Place the embryo in me, O Sinivāli, place the embryo in me, O Sarasvatī.

original: garbhaṃ te aśvinau devāv ā dhattām puṣkarasrajā //
analyzed: garbham te aśvinau devau ā dhattām puṣkara srajā
translated: May the two divine Asvins, wearing garlands of lotus flowers, place the embryo in your womb.

original: hiraṇyayī araṇī yaṃ nirmanthato aśvinā /
analyzed: hiraṇyayī araṇī yam nirmanthataḥ aśvinā
translated: The golden kindling sticks with which the Asvins churned him out,

original: taṃ te garbhaṃ havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave //
analyzed: tam te garbham havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave
translated: We invoke that embryo of yours for delivery in the tenth month.

original: mahi trīṇām avo 'stu dyukṣam mitrasyāryamṇaḥ /
analyzed: mahi trīṇām avaḥ stu dyukṣam mitrasya aryamṇaḥ
translated: Great be the heavenly favour of Mitra, Aryaman,

original: durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya //🔽nahi teṣām amā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu /
analyzed: durādharṣam varuṇasya  nahi teṣām amā cana na adhvasu vā araṇeṣu
translated: And the invincible one of Varuna.🔽For they have no rival in the contests,

original: īśe ripur aghaśaṃsaḥ //🔽yasmai putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya /
analyzed: īśe ripuḥ agha śaṃsaḥ  yasmai putrāsaḥ aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya
translated: The enemy, the evil-wisher, has no power over them.🔽To the mortal for whom the sons of Aditi

original: jyotir yacchanty ajasram //
analyzed: jyotiḥ yacchanti ajasram
translated: Grant the imperishable light for life.

original: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde /
analyzed: vātaḥ ā vātu bheṣajam śambhu mayobhu naḥ hṛde
translated: Let the wind blow the medicine, auspicious and life-giving, into our heart,

original: pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat //
analyzed: pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: And let it prolong our lives.

original: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā /
analyzed: uta vāta pitā asi naḥ uta bhrātā uta naḥ sakhā
translated: O wind, you are our father, you are our brother, you are our friend.

original: sa no jīvātave kṛdhi //
analyzed: sa naḥ jīvātave kṛdhi
translated: Make us live.

original: yad ado vāta te gṛhe 'mṛtasya nidhir hitaḥ /
analyzed: yat adaḥ vāta te gṛhe mṛtasya nidhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: What store of immortality is laid up in your house, O wind,

original: tato no dehi jīvase //
analyzed: tatas naḥ dehi jīvase
translated: From that give us to live.

original: prāgnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām /
analyzed: pra agnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: Send forth your voice to Agni, the bull of the earth,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatas tiro dhanvātirocate /
analyzed: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvataḥ tiras dhanva atirocate
translated: He who shines beyond the farthest distance, beyond the desert,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā /
analyzed: yaḥ rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā
translated: He who shakes off the Rakshasas, the bull with his bright flame,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati
translated: He who looks on all the worlds and looks together on them all,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro agnir ajāyata /
analyzed: yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ śukraḥ agniḥ ajāyata
translated: He who was born as bright Agni beyond the world of this (earth),

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: pra nūnaṃ jātavedasam aśvaṃ hinota vājinam /
analyzed: pra nūnam jātavedasam aśvam hinota vājinam
translated: Now yoke the swift steed, O ye men, to the all-knower,

original: idaṃ no barhir āsade //
analyzed: idam naḥ barhiḥ āsade
translated: To sit on this our sacred grass.

original: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḷhuṣaḥ /
analyzed: asya pra jātavedasaḥ vipra vīrasya mīḍhuṣaḥ
translated: To this all-knower, whose hero is the sage, the bountiful,

original: mahīm iyarmi suṣṭutim //
analyzed: mahīm iyarmi suṣṭutim
translated: I offer up a great hymn of praise.

original: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ rucaḥ jātavedasaḥ devatrā havya vāhanīḥ
translated: Those lights of thine, O all-knower, which carry the offering to the gods,

original: tābhir no yajñam invatu //
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ yajñam invatu
translated: With them inspire our sacrifice.

original: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaram puraḥ /
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras
translated: Hither hath come the dappled cow, and sat before her mother,

original: pitaraṃ ca prayan svaḥ //
analyzed: pitaram ca prayan svar
translated: And her sire, winning the light.

original: antaś carati rocanāsya prāṇād apānatī /
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānatī
translated: She moves within the luminous realm, breathing forth from her breath,

original: vy akhyan mahiṣo divam //
analyzed: vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ divam
translated: The mighty bull hath filled the heaven.

original: triṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṅgāya dhīyate /
analyzed: triṃśat dhāma vi rājati vāc pataṅgāya dhīyate
translated: The thirtyfold abode shines forth, speech is set in the bird,

original: prati vastor aha dyubhiḥ //
analyzed: prati vastoḥ aha dyubhiḥ
translated: In front of the light with the bright ones.

original: ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ cābhīddhāt tapaso 'dhy ajāyata /
analyzed: ṛtam ca satyam ca abhīddhāt tapasaḥ dhi ajāyata
translated: From truth and from faith he hath kindled him, he was born from penance,

original: tato rātry ajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ //
analyzed: tatas rātrī ajāyata tatas samudraḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: Then night was born, then the ocean, the reservoir of water.

original: samudrād arṇavād adhi saṃvatsaro ajāyata /
analyzed: samudrāt arṇavāt adhi saṃvatsaraḥ ajāyata
translated: From the ocean, the reservoir of water, the year was born,

original: ahorātrāṇi vidadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī //
analyzed: ahorātrāṇi vidadhat viśvasya miṣataḥ vaśī
translated: Dividing day and night, the powerful one, while all were watching.

original: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayat /
analyzed: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayat
translated: The creator arranged the sun and moon as before,

original: divaṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣam atho svaḥ //🔽saṃsam id yuvase vṛṣann agne viśvāny arya ā /
analyzed: divam ca pṛthivīm ca antarikṣam atha u svar  saṃsam id yuvase vṛṣan agne viśvāni aryaḥ ā
translated: Heaven and earth, the atmosphere, and also the heavenly world.🔽You unite with all, O bull, O Agni, all the riches.

original: iḷas pade sam idhyase sa no vasūny ā bhara //
analyzed: iḷaḥ pade sam idhyase sa naḥ vasūni ā bhara
translated: You are kindled in the abode of the people. Bring us riches.

original: saṃ gacchadhvaṃ saṃ vadadhvaṃ saṃ vo manāṃsi jānatām /
analyzed: sam gacchadhvam sam vadadhvam sam vaḥ manāṃsi jānatām
translated: Come together, speak together, may your minds agree together.

original: devā bhāgaṃ yathā pūrve saṃjānānā upāsate //
analyzed: devāḥ bhāgam yathā pūrve saṃjānānāḥ upāsate
translated: The gods, as in the past, knowing, attend to their share.

original: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam manaḥ saha cittam eṣām /
analyzed: samānaḥ mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam manaḥ saha cittam eṣām
translated: The same is the prayer, the assembly is the same, the same is the mind, the thought of these is united.

original: samānam mantram abhi mantraye vaḥ samānena vo haviṣā juhomi //🔽samānī va ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ /
analyzed: samānam mantram abhi mantraye vaḥ samānena vaḥ haviṣā juhomi  samānī vaḥ ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ
translated: I address you with the same prayer, I offer you with the same oblation.🔽The same is your intention, the same are your hearts.

original: samānam astu vo mano yathā vaḥ susahāsati //
analyzed: samānam astu vaḥ manaḥ yathā vaḥ su sahā asati
translated: May your mind be the same, so that you may rejoice well together.
